description:
I had the lasagna and it was good- but not exceptional.

Maybe I just got spoiled from my previous eggplant parmesan meal at Roma Antica, but the lasagna here was lacking sophistication in execution.  It felt more like mamma's lasagna than a culinary masterpiece. 5-stars for the prices matching the food standards.
author: Ken L.

description:
This place was slammed when we drove by, after doing the touristy Lombard Street pics. You've GOTTA do it if you're in San Francisco! 

Anyways, we assumed after seeing the long line out the door and the 4.5 stars that this place must be 'it' to keep it PG!

I called it in because I did NOT want to wait in line! We ordered a fettuccini type dish (white sauce on noodles), a spaghetti with meatballs and sausage, lasagna, and their 'bread'. 

The fettuccine was dry and terrible tasting. The lasagna was dry too. Even after pouring the extra sauce on top. The bread was so strange for an Italian restaurant. It was like a mix between pita and tortillas. Not at all fitting or good tasting. But the spaghetti was good. That was the only thing that was good. It was very good. Wish we would've ordered only spaghetti. They'd get higher stars, but the review wouldn't be as accurate overall. 

We may be back, but only for the spaghetti next time!
author: Melanie S.

description:
The waiter was so rude. I don't think I have ever been to a place where workers can be so rude. He first said "are you sure, that's not gonnabe a good mix" about my order and I personally have a preference of pasta. Then he pointed his iPad to me and ask me the process if, I pressed the iPad and he's like " oh my god you shouldn't have click it" and start rolling his eyes and pointing fingers at me as if I did something wrong. I had no idea what's going on and he just start complaining. Fuck this place. And your pretentiousness.

Pretty sure your server was racist too. Super obvious different attitude when I tried to order and just making assumptions.
author: William C.

description:
Great casual place to get affordable late-night comfort food.

We got two dishes: 

Gnocchi with cream sauce (2/5) - Gnocchi was ok. It was  quite gummy but I prefer gnocchi to be pillowy/softer. Would absolutely not recommend getting the cream sauce. Its very bland and you have to put a ton of parmesan/salt to give it any flavor.

Lasagna (5/5) - very dense, flavorful, and filling while still being affordable. Would recommend getting this.
author: Danielle C.

description:
My favorite pasta shop in North Beach! The Gnocchi Pasta with Pesto Sauce is to die for and is always my go-to dish! 

Italian Homemade is always the first restaurant that pops up in my mind when I'm craving pasta and carbs. This place is a staple in North Beach and the food really lives up to expectations. It can get crowded here during peak hours and the restaurant doesn't have a lot of seating inside either. Tip - call in advance so you pick up your order, instead of having to wait in the long line! There is also a park nearby, which is a great place to enjoy the SF views while eating your food.

Other noteworthy items to try here are the Meatballs and Bolognese with Papperdelle. So good and comforting!
author: MyTien P.

description:
This is the perfect example of a "mom-and-pop" establishment in SF's Little Italy neighborhood that stays true to their roots. It's a tiny eatery with just a few tables and seating along the window facing the main street. As it approached the dinnertime rush, the line of customers extended out the door and many locals stopped in to pick up takeout orders. 

Their menu is straightforward with no frills and you receive exactly what you would expect. Don't forget to glance at the board on the back wall that lists a couple of the day's specials. Once we ordered, we snagged a table that had a direct view behind the counter. Two cooks were solely focused on pasta and sandwiches, one employee remained at the cash register and one waiter served all the food. Considering the rush of customers constantly in and out, the staff is pretty efficient at preparing orders in a timely manner. For the pasta dishes, they just heat up the sauce, toss in the pasta until it's completely heated, serve on a simple paper plate and top with Parmesan (if you wish). Then it's good to go!  

On the traditional menu, I ordered their House Special Lasagna ($13) and it was humongous!  The layers of pasta were al dente and I enjoyed the hearty bolognese sauce. I was surprised that it didn't seem to have any distinct layers of ricotta cheese, but it must have been mixed in. Nevertheless, the lasagna was delicious and not overly heavy. It tasted very fresh and authentic as if they've been following the same family recipe for years (which very well could be the case)! 

Two others in my group had pasta dishes (tagliatelle and ravioli) with bolognese as well, which they both enjoyed. Both appeared so fresh and portion sizes in general here are huge.  One item that turned out to be a miss was the sausage and pepper flatbread sandwich as the sausage tasted under-seasoned  My advice is to order a pasta dish since that is their main specialty. 

I'd recommend Italian Homemade if looking for a quick and affordable spot to fulfill your pasta cravings!
author: Courtney L.

description: I was hard core craving gnocchi, so for my first visit at the Italian Homemade Company, I got the gnocchi with pesto for about $15. The gnocchi was super soft and fluffy like a pillow! Texture wise, it was perfect. I do wish the pesto sauce was creamier. The employees are very friendly and helpful with the menu. Simply order and pay at the cashier, seat yourself and then they'll come bring your food when it's ready. We got there at 620 on a weekday and by 645 it was packed.
author: Lexi R.

description:
Such a great Italian joint! I've been in Berkeley but wanted to try the SF location as well. 

The food didn't disappoint! The buratta salad was UNREAL. they give you a generous portion of cheese for the salad. I also got the spinach ricotta ravioli which was good! 

The ambience is cozy and intimate. I like how it gives you the feeling of a small Italian shop. 

Definitely get one of the cheese salads during your visit.
author: Liza H.

description: I have been here twice now. Before ever coming in I was really excited to eat here. The food looked great in the pictures. However, for the price and what you get I was not that impressed. The pesto I got seemed watery for some reason and didnt have much flavor. My husband got one of their sandwiches, which was just a few slices of meat, 80% arugula, and flat bread. It didnt taste bad if you are an arugula fan. Overall, the taste is pretty mediocre and it is expensive.
author: Liz M.

description:
Holy cannoli ! This...place...right...here...Can you see my head roll? No? Well It's rollin!    Italian Homemade is every bit as good as the raves reviews have stated. Yes I know I'm late to the party, but I don't live here so I get a pass. 

Let me set the scene. Well there's really no way to set up chaotic. Chaotic in the best way, like a European street market. It's loud, theres music, service staff yelling out order names, melodic Italian words being spoken behind the counter, theres a ginormous line out the door, people are weaving in and out of small creases in search of water, utensils, and the all important empty table. Glorious glorious chaos.

The name is so fitting. I've had Italian food all over, including the mother land, Italy. This is every bit as good and very similar to the homemade taste you'll find in Italy. The lasagna is worth the price of admission. The portion sizes are also quite deceiving.

This is one of those times I wish I were one of those animals with 2 stomachs. Here's an idea...How about we start a petition to have them offer a sampling plate. Where do I sign?!
author: Donald S.

description:
I had to come here three times in one week before writing this review... I told myself it was to try more menu items in order to give a fair review, but honestly, I just really like their pasta.

North Beach has a lot of restaurants that definitely cater to tourists. Nothing wrong with that, but personally I'm not down to pay $25+ for mediocre Italian food. Thankfully, the average amount you'll spend here (after tax and tips) is about $18, so we're off to a good start already. 

The interior is very simple, with not a lot of seating. Most patrons seem to follow the rule of "order first before taking a seat" that the restaurant has taped to the wall, so don't worry too much about not getting a seat unless the line is out the door. 

What can I say? This place exemplifies "less is more", as the dishes are literally just pasta with your choice of a sauce. The fresh pasta has a nice bite to it, and the sauces were all fantastic. My only gripe would be the tagliatelle sometimes sticks together into a clump - it wasn't particularly pleasant to bite into.

If you want comfort food in the form of carbs, come here. It's tasty, unpretentious, and definitely somewhat addictive.
author: Calvin Z.

description:
The food pasta here is very affordable for what you get compared to A LOT of other Italian restaurants.  As soon as you walk into their facility, they ask that you order your food first before sitting down.  The inside is SO charming, and the homey music gives the ambiance such a sweet feel.  Once we ordered the food came out within 7 minutes, so steamy, so fresh.
There's no line around 12:30 Saturday!  We had to try this place out because of all the good things we've heard from it and we were definitely not disappointed!  
I can imagine that during their busier hours though that the lack of space inside could cause a problem with finding seating.  Luckily Washington Square is not too far away and that would make a great place to eat your food :)
We ordered 3 dishes
1. Meatball Platter: This came with their very large and filling, homemade MOUTHWATERING meatballs as well as a kind of italian flatbread.  The bread complimented the meatballs very well.  This dish is smothered in their signature meat sauce and my taste buds were exploding.  I really really enjoyed this dish.
2. Gnocchi with sage and butter:  The gnocchi is so soft and bouncy and plump and just the perfect way gnocchi should taste.  The butter and sage gave it a very herb and floral taste, I personally enjoyed it very much whereas my boyfriend mentioned the flowery taste was a bit too much for him although he loved the texture of the gnocchi.  Will probably get a pesto sauce next time instead of the butter sage.
  
*note* that's the really nice thing about this place is that you can customize your pasta how you want it and put whatever sauce on it.

3. Pappardelle pasta w/bolognese sause: This was probably our favorite dish.  Their homemade pasta was so soft and bouncy and the sauce was very creamy and satisfying to the tast.  I loved how fat and wide pappardelle is and they really perfected the art of their pasta making skills.  

I can't wait to come back and try more of their offerings =)  Will definitely tell others about this place!
author: Tori G.

description: This was a great deli/ quick restaurant for people on the run. My husband and I dropped by here on a walk around fisherman's wharf. The fettuccini pasta was super delicious and a bit spicy with the chili peppers. The mozzarella salad was lovely and the mozarella was soft and fresh.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
I cant rave enough about this place. LOVEEEE IT! So I was visiting San Francisco for 4 days with my cousins. I accidentally smelled this place the first day we arrived, the smell of sauce and basil caught my nose but I kept on walking. The next day I was super hungover and remembered how good the outside of the place smelled so I found it on yelp and was astonished to see the reviews. 

This place lives up to what its worth! Its a very simple concept, choose your pasta, choose your sauce. Its a very generous serving, pasta is served on paper plates (but dont let that fool you). I'd rather eat pasta here then a fine dining restaurant ANY DAY. As I speak Italian I was over listening, seems like a family run business doing things correctly. You can even see the women in the back churning out fresh pasta. 

Can't wait to visit again and definitely come back. Dont skip on this one! 100% recommend!
author: Giovanna P.

description:
Italian Homemade is a staple for me. I order it pretty often on Caviar and even make my way to the restaurant sometimes!

The menu may look boring/unexciting but the simplicity of it is what makes it so delicious and authentic. 

I've enjoyed pretty much everything I've had from here. My favorites are the lasagna, both raviolis, and the gnocchi. Favorite sauces are the pesto and pasticciata. The meatballs are also amazing great, especially with the pasticciata sauce. The burrata never disappoints as an appetizer. 

The quality is always consistent, even when you order for delivery. Once you heat it up a little in the microwave, it's just as good as it is in the restaurant. 

If you see the long lines, they move fast and would be worth it even if they didn't!
author: Jessie K.

description: Its authentic Italian food with great vegetarian options in sandwiches, salads, lasagnas and pastas. The sauces are delicious , rich and creamy. Everything is made in house and you can taste the difference! It's a cute small space, so watch out,  it can get crowded and you may not be able to get a table on a busy day! The service is super quick and staff is extremely efficient so you don't waste time waiting for food at all! It should be in your must try list if you are a fan of Italian food!
author: Premila M.

description:
And then, as I was just walking around on Columbus and letting my appetite do the exploring, I stumbled into Italian Homemade. Even though I had actually started at a bakery for pastries, and then gone for truffles, I was still hungry for real food beyond desserts. It's an unassuming joint and looked quick, so I wandered in to the small space with a few tables, and walked up to the counter to look at the menu board and order.

Over and over again I talk about how I love small, specific spots that fill a very small niche. I know it may not be en vogue to have a small menu, but I'd rather you stay in your wheelhouse and nail it, then have a super wide menu that tries too hard to please everyone.

Pasta is their game, and they stick to it. Pick your homemade noodle, pick your sauce, add a few bells and whistles if you like, but that's about it. Oh and something called a gnocchi roll, which looks intriguing. But they don't go out of control, and that's what I liked.

I ordered tagliatelle with Bolognese sauce and only waited about 10 minutes, which they actually apologized for being too long. They were incredibly kind, especially as I had just wandered in without doing much research and wasn't sure what to expect. They smiled a lot, and made sure I felt comfortable. That goes a long way.

It's not fancy inside; the humble interior and homemade feel of things--even the signage--drives home the point that you are getting passion on the plate and not a pre-fab five course meal.

The pasta came out piping hot. I do love tagliatelle and it's served al dente (which is unexpected for a fresh pasta) but there were a few noodles that didn't get separated from each other and did cause some sticking. I'm not mad, as I like the chew of those stacks, but not everyone does. The Bolognese sauce was meaty enough to convey the carnivorous nature without weighing me down. I didn't feel like it was an overwhelming amount of food, but it's a nice, reasonable lunch.

I sat there for a while as I was eating, at the bar that faces out the window onto Columbus. What a gorgeous street. What a busy, happening place. What a perfect place to slow down, and take it all in. It's so much of what I love about San Francisco--the people, the buzz, the noise, the smells, and most of all, the possibilities. I sat here and imagined coming back to this very block, time and time again. Getting chocolates, then wandering around in an infinite amount of adventures. Trying all the foods, and letting the city take us where it wants. 

I imagined the next time I'll be here--it may not be until next year--but what will that be like? Where will I go? Who will come with me for truffles and pastries and homemade pasta, or where will we decide to go instead? In five years, in ten years, as shops open and close, there are infinite adventures to be had. 

I sat and thought about all of this, and before I knew it, my tagliatelle was gone. I cleared my plate, took a deep breath, and once again opened to door back out to the street and all the opportunities that were about to present themselves once again.
author: Jeffrey S.

description:
This. Place. Is. AMAZING. Now, I'll be honest...I ordered it via UberEats. It was simply too chilly to walk there from where I was staying.

I ordered the Tagliatelle with Bolognese as well as the Gnocchi with Pesto. Both were simply to die for. The tagliatelle was particularly great, with a great texture and bite, and the bolognese was so warm and rich. Definite comfort food.

Getting fresh Pasta delivered sounds like a disaster but it was anything but in this case!

I apologize for the potato quality photos...
author: Meg C.

description:
We got there around 5:15pm on Saturday.  No line and plenty of tables available. The pasta there was just simply amazing. You can definitely tell the diff between fresh pasta and box pasta. I liked the chewiness of the pasta. The portions were generous as well. Here is a list of dishes I tried. Pappardelle was my favorite.
- pappardelle + meatballs
- lasagna 
- gnocchi
author: Rachael C.
Iryna G.

description:
This place was hidden away in a relatively busy San Francisco street in an unassuming grocery store looking front. You order at the front at a cashier and then wait for around 10-20 minutes for your food which is served to you on a paper plate. It's not super clear how good the food is and how fresh it is until you take your first bite.

Food: I got the tagliatelle with meatballs and man it was super tasty  and super rich! I did find some plastic in the food which was a bit of a turn off but the food overall was great. We also got the Burrata cheese salad and it was really really tasty.

Service: the food comes out fast and comes out fresh and you can see the food being prepared for you right in front of you! You don't get too much seating either and it's hard to find a spot.

Overall, would come again! The food is super good and it's a good deal!
author: Jenny X.

description:
Really good lasagna with meat sauce. Less cheesy than what I've had at other places but with the incredible homemade pasta, it wasn't missed. We got a side order of the flat bread -- wow! I could eat that all day long. 
The shop is very small and quite warm. But I thoroughly enjoyed watching the employees in action in the kitchen. I'm not sure if the staff speaking Italian almost exclusively is "part of the atmosphere" or is truly them but either way it made me want to travel to Italy -- what a beautiful language! This has been a highlight of my visit to San Francisco!
author: Jenny P.

description:
Oh I had such high expectations after reading the reviews... 

The food was disappointing. We got the tagliatelle with bolognese and gnocchi with pesto. Both were under-salted and may have been over cooked. 

The tagliatelle had an okay flavor but a lot of the noodles were stuck together... The gnocchi came out lukewarm. Texture-wise, it wasn't tender and didn't melt in my mouth. It was also pretty bland; the pesto didn't add much flavor to the gnocchi. Interestingly, the pesto itself actually had a pretty good texture. 

It seems like an okay place to chill and get a quick bite - they have fun decor and good music. But maybe don't come here expecting to feel like you are in Florence again...
author: Iris H.

description:
3.5 STARS

I've actually been wanting to try The Italian Homemade Company for some time. Not wanting to commit to a meal full of pasta, I never made it a priority to come here. When they popped up as an office lunch option, I decided to go for it. Our delivery order arrived via Caviar on Friday, April 6th a little after 12 noon.

I ended up getting the Tagliatelle with Sauce: Fresh, handmade tagliatelle, cooked al dente and served with your choice of sauce ($10), Pesto: Basil, pinenuts, parmesan, extra virgin olive oil; vegetarian (+$3.50). I adore pesto, so I was excited. The dish is a hefty portion. I actually made about four small meals / snacks out of it. I liked the flavor of the pesto, but I found the noodles a touch too hard. Almost like they were a little under. Not sure if this is true al dente (since I'm not a pasta expert), but I like my pasta a little softer. I do wish they had the option to add a protein to their pastas. This would have been great with some chicken or something similar. I think they only offer meatballs as an added option and I didn't think that would go with this.

Good place to get your pasta on. There are so many options to mix and match in terms of noodles and sauces. I was eyeing the bolognese and meatballs when scanning through the selections. If this spot pops back up again, I may have to try it.
author: Elena N.

description:
My friends and I ALMOST screwed up and didn't eat here the other night. So glad we stayed.

The six of us came on a Sunday evening looking for a good Italian place to eat sans the hour+ wait, con seating. The restaurant was discreet enough compared to other Italian restaurants in North Beach, but as soon as we walked in we saw how busy it was. 

Bodies stood in line and bodies ate at tiny crowded tables all the way to the back counter. There was no divide. Just a sea of hunger and gluttony.

This was an "order and pay at the counter" kind of restaurant. Seating was determined by a draw of luck and hovering. There were two small tables outside, but we weren't sure we'd get them or if they would be enough room.

"Let's look for another place to eat," someone said. We all agreed and pulled out our phones.

"You'll be missing out," an unfamiliar voice said. 

A message from God? The universe? (if you believe in such things)

"You should eat here," the voice continued.

Actually, it was a man standing with his family (presumably) waiting for their order.

"You've been here before?"

The guy laughed like we were idiots. "Of course. I eat here all the time. It's my favorite restaurant in San Francisco."

Peer pressure got us. We got right back in line. I'm so glad we did.

The line went quickly, and two big tables magically opened up inside right when we finished ordering our food. LUCKY. I waited about 10 minutes before my order was called. They serve everything on paper plates but have real silverware. Water is self-serve near the back.

I ate the bomba piadina ($12.50). I have never had a piadina before, but boy oh boy was it incredible. Warm flatbread with porchetta, pecorino cheese, and oven-baked tomatoes. Yessssss. I am soooo ready to visit Italy if it means more of these. (Pasta has never been my favorite. I know I'm weird.)

I ate half of my piadina, and saved the other for later (Tip: reheat your piadina at home the next day on the stove - both sides! - and it's just as good.)

My friend ordered the burrata salad ($13) which comes with arugula, cherry tomatoes, and burrata cheese. She let me try a bite and OMG the creaminess of that cheese. I could eat that salad all day. Now I wish I'd ordered more food just to bring it home with me for the week!

Don't skip this place like we almost did. Listen to the locals and don't be afraid of the cramped space inside. Everything moves quick and the food is soooo worth any inconvenience.
author: Melissa B.

description: Absolutely love this place! So glad I found it! The food is delicious and authentic Italian best I've had since I visited Italy last summer! I had this amazing sandwich called the Cassone with bacon, sausage, mozzarella, and potatoes. My dad had spaghetti and meatball with bolognese sauce! Friendly staff that were Italian and spoke Italian. Also had other Italians and locals who visited so glad I came! Highly recommend!
author: Chiara H.

description:
Italian homemade restaurant does have a great Italian owner and service.
The interior design of this place is cozy and happy.
Food portions are enough for 2 ppl.
It is not a big restaurant, but enough for 10 to 15 ppl at the same time. 
It does have patio with few seats. 
Our order got ready faster than we thought.
Hope you have fun and enjoy the taste of Italy at this restaurant.
author: Atosa T.

description: Great find! Prices nice as well. The line wasn't too long at 6:45 pm. The pasta is homemade and you can watch the guy making it at the counter while standing in line. The ravioli was so tender with the Bolognese sauce.I got the pesto sauce with fettuccine it was fresh and delicious. You order at the counter and find a seat they bring the food to you. It had a nice atmosphere.
author: Ashley M.

description:
Very authentic and super delicious Italian dishes. Cozy but casual atmosphere if you would like to sit down and eat your pasta there. Waiting time for takeout is not super long. 

Cash, credit and debit card are accepted. Unfortunately, they don't serve coffee drinks (no espresso, cappuccino, latte,...). However, if you are a big fan of Italian products like Lavazza Coffee or Rummon Pasta, you can buy these items here.
author: Stefani K.

description:
This place is a gem. It is a small, fast casual type setting. Maybe space enough to sit 25-30 people at most? You order at the counter and can get the food for there or to go. We walked in around 8:30 pm on a Wednesday and were able to order right away. The food came out very quickly, less than 10 minutes. 

I ordered the meat ravioli with the white cream sauce and it was amazing. The pasta is really fresh and the food came out steaming. It would have been nice to have a glass of wine but they do not sell alcohol. Still 5 stars because the food was amazing and it's nice that people filter in and out pretty quickly allowing for new customers to sit, which probably wouldn't happen if they served wine.
author: Taylor F.

description: Man. I've tried to love you, but I think I've made up my mind. Is it just me, or is this location usually stingier with their sauce? Every time I've come or ordered caviar, it's dry. Can't say I recommend this location although the one on union st in marina is still awesome.
author: Sandy K.

description:
Yes. Very original and homestyled cooking. The best way. I ordered the:
Meat Ravioli + Bolognese sauce.
Really delicious and portion is perfect.
I'm very sensitive to garlic making me tired. But this had so little and I didn't even taste it (good for me).

Its so fresh they show you how tgey make the pasta from scratch

Space is limited but its an experience. You can share a table if there's an open seat :)

They also have variety of LaVazza coffee
author: Amin B.

description: Mix and match fresh pasta and sauce combos to create a meal that is unique to you. It's authentic Italian and always delicious. It's a nice casual spot for a weekday dinner. FYI- no alcohol at the North Beach location
author: Sara S.

description: So. Delicious. Omg. I want to eat there again already. I ordered lasagna and it was amazing. The flavors were amazing. The noodles in the lasagna were cooked perfectly and the sauce was full of flavor. The service was great and they answered all questions I had. The inside is small and it was busy, but we were able to find a seat no problem. The food came out quickly.
author: danyle w.

description:
This was incredible. I've never been to Italy before, but I'm now left dreaming about their pesto sauce for hours after my meal. They have such a down-to-earth vibe for an Italian restaurant. You even get your meal on a paper plate, but a couple bites into my meal, I had no doubts I'd want to keep coming back again and again. Here's what I ordered: 

- Ravioli w/ Spinach and Ricotta stuffed inside. 
- Pesto sauce, which is definitely worth a try if you're on the fence. 
- Burrata Salad which I most definitely just ordered for the Burrata. 

The service is fairly efficient, but this isn't your usual Italian sit-down restaurant, so grab your cutleries when you order and wait for someone to call out your name with your food.
author: Gouthaman K.

description:
North Beach a.k.a "little Italy" has too many pasta places to count. Very few of them are the 'real deal' - Italian homemade is the real deal. A great variety of homemade pastas (ravioli, tortellini, linguini), homemade meatballs, and some of the best pesto in the city. The pasta is a great portion and very reasonably priced. Would have loved a house bottle of red wine - but they don't serve beer or wine.

All of the employees looked to be in a good mood and seemed straight from Italy! My girlfriend was worried that we would upset them because we arrived at 8:30 and they close at 9:00 (she worked in the restaurant industry and has PTSD from teenagers showing up 5 minutes before close), but with the timely manner in which you order and they cook the fresh pasta - we walked out before 9:00! Our pasta was cooked to perfection and super tasty, plus my girl loves my meatball breath so it's a win-win for everyone :)

Love it here and will be back very soon.
author: Tyler C.

description:
When we first arrived, there was a line stretching a bit down the block (so clearly it had to be good). 

We didn't have to wait that long either, maybe 1/2 an hour, to get inside. Once inside, we realized that it was a very small location and tables were hard to come by with the high population of customers. This created a bit of a hostile environment, as one of the girls behind us in line got a table before us and then rudely said "you better start a fight, because I'm not giving this up." But we eventually found a table as a couple was leaving. 

We ordered a mozzarella salad and the vegetarian ravioli with marinara sauce to share. Below is a picture of the mozzarella salad. The food itself was very good, I'm just a little disappointed with the amount of space the restaurant has because they seem to be doing well bringing in customers. 

The restaurant also seemed to work with doordash if you'd prefer to order your food out. They also do to-go, and have a very good system for self-clearing the tables to ease the turn-around for tables a bit.
author: Anna W.

description:
One of the best Italian restaurants in town. Just pick your pasta, your sauce, and you get served in less than 5 minutes. 

Only downsides are it sometimes gets really crowded and they raised their prices quite a lot recently.
author: Tony A.

description:
Craving for something italian? something fresh with good quality ingredients? You must come here! This is a great place to grab a quick meal before heading off back to work or home or other festivities you might be having in the city. The pasta dishes they have here are simple and delicious! The ingredients they use are quite inexpensive however the price of the dishes are not the cheapest, and it is most likely due to the high rent in the sf. BUT the quality and good service of this place makes up for it. 

I came here on a cold night and was extremely satisfied with how warm the pastas made me feel. I ordered the pappardelle with bolognese sauce and my boyfriend ordered the gnocchi with pasticciata sauce. We were stuffffed by the end of the meal! 

Make sure you find a seat before you order if it is very busy! People come and go so don't let the line scare you :)
author: Joyce S.

description:
Found this homemade pasta restaurant on Yelp and was impressed. Large servings. Tasty sauces. Everything homemade including the flatbread. Was too full to try the tiramisu.

Small. Very informal. Italian rock playing in the background. Look at the menu. Get in line. Order and pay. Get a cup of water. Sit. Food is brought to you. Try to clean your plate. Toss silverware in the bin and paper plates in the compost.

Cozy atmosphere. Steady stream of customers kept all the tables full, but no wait for tables. The gal cleaning tables (manager?) Struck up a conversayion w me, and unprompted she checked to make sure my gnocci roll had vegetarian sauce. In between customers the guy who took my order caught my eye and made sure everything was good.

Great food. Great atmosphere. Great service. Perfect!
author: Harold L.

description:
I've come back here a couple times and it's still deserving of all 5 stars! Pasta is top quality - super fresh and tasty. The sauce is piping hot and I love that I can watch them make the food right in front of my eyes.

I'm really looking forward to coming back and trying more combinations - especially the butter & sage sauce on the gnocchi.
author: Jenny D.

description:
I've been to Italian Homemade Company a few times and it's still one of my favorites.

It's a small fast-casual place that I go when I can in North Beach.

I usually just stick to the meat lasagna $13.  It's full of fresh pasta, cheese, lots of meat and sauce.  More cheese on top if you want.

The bolognese sauce w/ paappadelle pasta is good too.

Charge it if you want.  One bathroom in the back.
author: Ann L.

description: Amazing Piadina sandwich pitas, and all the pasta is amazing!  Service always a home run !
author: JohnnieD D.

description:
I came across this place while doing some research about places to eat in San Francisco. When in doubt, trust the reviews.

When you first walk into this place, you notice a bunch of tables, people sitting around having conversations and eating food that look amazing.

You can order a different variety of pasta and sauces. We tried the gnocchi with pasticciata, the burrata salad, fettuccine with marinara.

Everything tasted amazing. You can taste the freshness of the pasta. 

I would recommend trying this place if you like homemade pasta.
author: Tania C.

description:
Italian Homemade has solid pasta. I got some pasta with bolognese sauce. Honestly, I couldn't tell the difference between this pasta place and the many other pasta places I've been to. The pasta itself had a bite to it (al-dente). However, there was one thing that ruined my experience (Note: it was no fault of Italian Homemade).

So, unfortunately, I am lactose intolerant. It's absolutely depressing. As a dairy-phile, I have to go everywhere with a utility belt of lactose pills. Many co-workers think I'm some kind of prescription drug addict because of my Lactaid abuse. 

Anyways, I took two Lactaid pills prior to my pasta dish. After finishing the plate, I felt satisfied. 

I took a stroll around the Russian Hill area, walking into Sur La Table & the Casper pop-up.

Slowly, I felt a little gas build up. No worries, just release it into the Casper mattress. Even though it's memory foam, I'm sure it wouldn't be a traumatizing memory. I'm sure the mattress is used to stinky smells.

10 minutes later, I started getting waves of pain. I had to sit down for every wave, fearful I would cause a diarrhetic hot zone. 

"I have to go home" I told my girlfriend. No way I'm going to go to a public bathroom and ruin all other bathroom-goers' day.

As we drove home, I dreaded each wave. My hands were ghostlike because of how forcefully I clenched on the car handle.

Long story short, it was a bad day.

The bad day did not affect my rating, though. I didn't think this place was anything special.
author: Kay C.

description:
I went here with a group of friends for dinner. You walk in (if you can get in the door). When we went the line was outside of the door, but it moved very fast and even if it didn't... it was worth the wait. We all ordered something different (and I made everyone let me try their food). I had the fettuccine with meatballs, I feel like you have to judge the standard dish, and it was definitely better than most. My boyfriend ordered the tortellini with... a sauce a can't pronounce :/ it's the bolognese mixed w cream I believe (and starts with a P). Also super fantastic. Then i tried the sandwich, it wasn't what I expected but had amazing flavor. As well as the tortellini with butter sauce. I'd literally eat every one of those items again. 
For dessert, we split the tiramisu. It was a generous portion and definitely homemade. I can't wait to eat here again!
author: Brittany N.

description:
CARBS!!!! If you got a thing for carbs and starch and fresh homemade goodness, go here ASAP! I could not speak highly enough about this place. They literally make the pasta in front of you and I cried a little when I ate it because it was that good. The only thing I did not like (and this is a personal opinion/fault on my behalf) is that I got the gnocchi and the butter sage sauce. Gnocchi was fantastic, but the sauce was too simple for me. I ended up scraping some of my boyfriend's pesto sauce (he got pesto and veggie raviolis) onto my plate.
We also shared a salad because it was large and full of colorful veggies and mozzarella chunks; a little lacking on the dressing but 'll ask for it on the side next time. I will be back for the lasagna next time!!
author: Anissa R.

description:
My wife and I made a quick and spontaneous trip into the city (from the east bay) for something to do this afternoon.  We decided to grab a quick bite for dinner, and my wifed picked the Italian Homemade Company as our destination.  After a bit of an adventure finding parking (which is typical for SF), we arrived there right before the dinner rush.

I ordered the meat raviolis, and my wife ordered the Pappardelle Pasta with two meat balls.  Both dishes were absolutely delicious! The sauces tasted fresh, and the flavors of the meats were just amazing.  The portions were just the right size for both of us.

There are PLENTY of reviews for this place, so I'm not sure I can add anything more that hasn't already been said. But from where I sit, this place had the great authentic food and the quaint and friendly atmosphere that we love in a family restaurant. I don't know when we will be back in SF, but I would love to go back to IHC to enjoy more of their wonderful food!

--------------------
If spaghetti was to star in an action film, what would it be called?
Mission I'm-pasta-ble.
author: Michael S.

description: Delicious homemade pasta, cooked perfectly al dente.  The bolognese sauce is tasty, and the meatballs have some chew to it, though I like Tony's giant meatballs better.  Generally, though, they keep their pasta and sauces simple and let the flavors and textures speak for themselves.  The burrata with arugula and tomato salad with a balsamic vinaigrette is not bad--the burrata is as creamy as it gets and is a throwback to one of my favorite Neapolitan digs back in Chicago.  Also, the staff here are pretty chill.  I like the low-key, hole-in-the-wall feel of this place--they keep it real and the focus on the food.
author: Yvonne C.

description:
I am in San Francisco waiting for a heart transplant. Let me preface and insert that I am Italian and I have learned never to eat Italian food out because it is so inferior to what my grandmother, mother and now I can prepare at home. In fact I am such a good cook that I rarely eat out. But daughter raves about this restaurant and took me, my sister and brother-in-law here for lunch. I ordered cheese ravioli("Vegetarian Ravioli" on the menu) and it was delicious! Everybody loved what they ordered and we shared bites- and talked about it all afternoon. In fact it was so good that I returned several days later.
I again ordered the cheese ravioli. It was misunderstood as "Meat Ravioli", which the server brought out. The very gracious Tomaso came over and took care of the mistake and immediately replaced it with cheese("Vegetarian ") ravioli. 
You will enjoy this restaurant whether you are alone, in a small group(it is a very small place) or with your family. The atmosphere is congenial and it almost feels as if one is in Italy as the employees use Italian conversing with each other.
I will continue to recommend it to my friends.
author: Carol M.

description:
We did a turnaround trip from Los Angeles to SF for the Band Together benefit concert. Was originally going to eat at another Italian restaurant but settled for Italian Homemade Co instead because it was much more affordable. Very easy. Walk in, order and take a seat. The food is authentic, the pasta is homemade, the sauces are delicious! 

We ordered two pasta plates and a salad and it was plenty of food for two people. I don't remember the names of the pasta plates but I had the fettuccine with the mixed sauce (red and white) which came with homemade meatballs. Also had the burrata salad which was burrata with cherry tomatoes and arugula leaves. 

Look for street metered parking. Credit cards okay. Italian Homemade Co sells homemade pasta by the pound as well. Quick and easy, authentic and delicious pasta!
author: Ticha B.

description: Heard about this place from a friend and it did not disappoint! Fresh pasta that's a little on the al detente side but oh so good! We had the meat lasagna, tagitalle with bolognese, fettuccine with white sauce (my favorite along with my daughter) as well as the large strands of Papparedelle with meatballs! All so delicious!
author: Stephanie G.

description:
Great small hole in the wall place to get Italian food. Wasn't sure what to expect but it was pretty good. Noodles are al dente. Prices are really decent. Really causal place to grab a quick bite. 

They even have noodles to buy and take home to make yourself. All pastas are made fresh!
author: Melissa L.

description:
Pasta is one of my all time favorites and I'm so happy this restaurant allows you to make your own combinations! 

The space isn't too big and luckily we made it right before the dinner time rush and were able to get a table. You order your combo of pasta, sauce, and protein and wait for your number to be called. Portions were pretty decent. My family and I made different creations and we were all able to try various pastas and sauces. 

I understand going green but the plates that the pastas were served on weren't too sturdy so if your pasta had a lot of sauce, you better hold on tight when transferring to your table! The tables also didn't have the best design since there were large slits in between so our silverware (yes, metal forks with paper plates) would fall through the cracks constantly.

But we had a good meal so I would come back again the next time I'm around!
author: VyVy V.

description:
This place is more than I could have wanted from an Italian shop. It has a nice little selection of Italian groceries and they have fresh pasta but it is frozen. 

The people who helped us were great. They answered any questions we had and were extremely friendly. 

The food is the best part of this place. We got the meatballs and flatbread which came with 6 meatballs and plenty of bread. It was sooo good! This plate was the best I have had since my visit to Italy so it is very authentic. 

I strongly recommend this to anyone who wants a simple but yet authentic Italian dish.
author: Ryan O.

description:
Omg, I'm still drooling over that pasta! If you're in San Francisco and have the opportunity to eat here, DO IT!!!

My gf were visiting San Francisco for the weekend and we made the best decision of our lives when we chose this place for dinner! The dreaded question "what do you want to eat?" was asked and I knew I was craving pasta(as usual lol). I was astounded by the amount of positive reviews and delicious looking pasta and just knew this was the place for us and I've been thinking God everyday since. 

It sounds crazy, but this place made me so excited about food again! You can tell the pasta is handmade and all of their dishes are made fresh to order. I don't think I've EVER tasted fresher food than the food my gf and I ordered here! My family used to make homemade pasta all the time when I was young and it reminded me of those times that I cherish so much! There are an abundance of places to eat in San Francisco (Seriously! I heard competition is so stiff out there for restaurants that they only last an average of 6 months because there are so many!!!). Please do not pass this place up! I now tell everyone that they must visit this restaurant when visiting San Francisco, as if it is a historical monument of sorts lol! 

My only regret is not stopping here before the long 7 hour drive back to Southern California to order some pasta to go!
author: Sherita B.

description: I had the meat ravioli and it was really good, the sauce was the best marinara sauce I've had in my life. The gentleman who took my order was very polite and nice its to bad I can't try anything else because I don't eat pork but over all this place rocks
author: Adam L.

description: Initial entry made a very positive impression with pasta machines and formed on the premises.   Choose your pasta and sauce on the board and find a place to sit.  Also nice selection of daily specials to choose from.  The fettuccine was fresh and cooked al dente, but found the bolognese to be bland along with the meat balls.  The same was true with my pasta special with morels.  The salad was one of the highlights. Fresh and generous and loaded with radishes, tomato and balsamic.   Absolutely disgusting filthy bathroom. Food maybe good, but hygiene matters! Also need to do a better job of cleaning tables after patrons leave to get ready for next guests. Sat down to marinara sauce splattered on the table and pasta all over the floor.  The price value relationship to the food and hygiene were disappointing.
author: Roy A.

description: I love the location in the Marina, and while the food itself was still good here, the atmosphere was just SO different. Here we've got flimsy paper plates, a tight space with worn-out tables and bar stools. The menu is slightly cheaper here, but it's not worth dodging elbows of other patrons, being unsure whether your table's ever been cleaned, and being super careful your pasta doesn't soak thru the paper plate. The fast-casual concept is one thing, but there was literally no customer service. TOO casual?
author: Vivian H.

description:
Instantly fell in love with this place when I heard the employees all speaking in Italian. 

This lovely whole in the wall restaurant offers awesome Italian food in all shapes and sizes. I got a sandwich which was served on a yummy warm wrap and was incredible. 

The pasta all looked incredible and I loved the authentic Italian goodies for sale in the back. Definitely a fun place to stop by and eat good food and practice your Italian!!
author: Michael S.

description:
Super authentic Italian food. It's all fresh and smells delicious. There is no wonder why there is always a line almost out the door.

Seating is unfortunately cramp. 
PSA: stand in line and order. By the time you pay, a table should have freed up.

Side note - I don't like that everything is disposable. It's extremely wasteful, but I understand that the business probably doesn't have space for someone to bus and wash dishes as well.

Food = amazing. Always gotta order extra meatballs. They are so big! Whether it's a red cause or white sauce, you can't go wrong, yum!!!
author: Calvin C.

description: This place was good but the pastas did not have an out of this world taste to them. They were okay and worth going one time and trying it out at least! You wait in line to order and then find seating afterwards. The pastas come out within 10 minutes of ordering them so it is fairly quick service! I did like the white sauce pasta the most.
author: Sophia K.

description:
Tldr - maybe I'm a snob but it wasn't good and not correct to what the dish should be 

After a crappy last experience with these guys I decided to order again bc others had told me this location is better. You can find my review of the orgy-level oil drenched meatballs on that locations yelp page.

This time, I ordered cacio e pepe and was thoroughly disappointed. Cacio e pepe is a classic Roman dish consisting of like three ingredients - pasta, cheese (usually a mix of pecarino and Parm) and pepper. Legit one of the TWO WORDS in the name is pepe which means pepper. Which doesn't explain the fact that there's like probably two turns of a tiny pepper shaker on top of the dish. The trademark flavor of cacio e pepe is the abundance of pepper pockmarked through the entre. 

That's excuseable I guess - I could use some random pepper at the office to get a moderate punch (it's much better professionally done bc they fresh grind it to extract oils and put it through a seive). 

BUT one of the trademarks of Roman pastas similar to this (AL arrabiata, aglio e oilo, etc) is that there exists an emulsification between the starches added through the pasta water and the fats in the sauce, usually oil or cheese. This leads to a creamy/flowy sauce that clings to the noodles without concealing. 

Unfortunately, the pasta I got was not emulsified properly. There were just stringy bits of cheese all over the dish and it wasn't even consistent. When I dug my fork in and listen the entire block of pasta came up as one whole. I'm willing to give the benefit of the doubt  and say it split during delivery.... But it said that cacio e pepe was a caviar secret menu item. Why would you make the exclusive to a delivery menu something that is prone to splitting?

Do yourself a favor and go elsewhere. I've heard their lasagna is good tho so try that out lol
author: Samraaj B.

description:
This is my favorite go to place for fresh pasta! I got the pappardelle pasta with the bolognese sauce and the hubby got the lasagna and both were amazing. The meat, cheese and sauce were savory and flavorful. I love the ambiance as well, right on little Italy. There's also outdoor seating if you wish to enjoy the scenery. 

I had to bump up my experience up to 5 stars because James Franco was sitting right behind me while I was eating so yes that was the kick off to a great day. So the food must be that amazing right? ;) LOL.
author: Joselyne T.

description:
Really wanted to love this place but my pasta was undercooked): I'm still giving this place 4 stars though because the sauce and meatball I had were AMAZING. My other friends also had perfectly al dente pasta, so I know that my meal was probably just a random fluke. 

The atmosphere here is interesting. It looks like a small mom & pop shop, but is blasting cool house music. The playlist great and I really wanted to ask for it haha. You see them waking around with tubs of their freshly made pasta, it's pretty cool.

I tried a bite of my friends pesto gnocchi and it was sooooo good. I'd recommend that if you're looking for something different!  

Overall, really solid Italian place. Even though they messed up on my meal, I'd still come back.
author: Courtney N.

description:
This place deserves more than 5 starts in my eyes. Living in North Beach .. I'm surrounded by Italian food everywhere and this is one of the most quality places out there. From the outside it doesn't look like much. There are a few chairs and tables outside to eat. I often passed by and saw people eating out of disposable white plastic plates and thought it was a bit weird. I decided to try it out after hearing so much about it and boy was I happy. I had the gnocchi with marinara and it was the freshest meal I've had in a while. Usually after eating pasta I feel heavy and bloated but this wasn't like that at all. DELICIOUS AND CLEARLY QUALITY.

The inside of the place is super cozy. There are fun little knick knacks and Italian things all around.

I will be back to try another pasta with a different sauce very soon!
author: Inci A.

description:
This is a little hole-in-the-wall place that produces amazing, authentic food!  While there aren't many places to sit, there is a nearby park that's perfect for a picnic.

I had the tagliatelle with marinara sauce and it was just delicious, simple, food that was worth every bite.  My husband got the lasagna and loved it!  I've also tried the pesto there, and it was great, as well.

I would definitely recommend!
author: Kathryn M.

description:
This was one of the first places I've bookmarked since moving to SF. I can't believe it's taken me nearly 3 years later to come in and try it out! 

The place is really small with limited amount of seats. As popular as the place it, I'd say to just come in either when they open or be prepared to wait and aggressive enough to snatch the next table when it becomes available. The menu is displayed by the counter. You go up, order, get a number and they bring the food to you. Fortunately for me, I had a few drinks before coming so I ordered a bunch of food to try for the first time: 

-Burrata salad with arugula, cherry tomatoes and olive oil for $12. WOW, the burrata was sooooo creamy and everything went well together. I couldn't stop with this salad! Highly recommend this!

-Gnocchi pasta for $10, added in the butter and sage sauce for an extra $1.50. They sprinkled a ton of parmesan cheese on top and overall a good dish. The gnocchi was light and went well with the butter sauce. 

-Pappardelle pasta for $9, added in bolognese (beef and pork meat sauce) for an extra $2. OH-EM-GEE! This was amazing! So fresh, the bolognese sauce was super meaty and flavorful and I LOVED LOVED LOVED the pappardelle. You NEED to try this combo for sure!!

-I made the mistake (or not) to order the meatballs as well. They gave a plate with like 4-5 baseball sized meatballs, topped with the bolognese sauce. I couldn't even eat one of them. Great for leftovers though. On second though, no matter what you get as your main entree, you should really get this as well on the side. You're welcome. 

WOW, this place is amazing. I'm so glad I finally came in to try it out. This will be one of my recommendations to friends and family in the future. SO worth going to North Beach for! Come check them out.
author: Rockne H.

description:
We tried their food for the first time on a Wednesday evening. We arrived right before prime dinner time, so it was slow, but showily after, there was literally a line outside the door.... and all for good reasons. 

This place is totally worth the wait. 

The establishment is fairly small, seems family owned and operated. However, they all seem to love what they do and it shows in their food. 

The food is definitely authentic Italian cuisine !!! The pastas were all made well fresh made. It was so refreshing to have fresh made pasta. There it definitely a huge difference. 

We tried to lasagna and I was in lovvveeeeeee. One two three four five six ... maybe seven layers. It was beautiful. The portion was so huge, I was only able to eat half and saved half for lunch the next day. 
We also had the fettuccine with meat sauce. Also very good. 
Also, try their meatballs - super soft and literally melts in your mouth. 
And their tiramisu is also made fresh to order. Sooooo gooooddddd. I felt like I was eating pieces of clouds. 

I wish they served alcohol, perhaps a glass of wine with our pasta would make it better!! But overall we enjoyed our first time experience and will definitely be going back.

1. Street parking is tough, get there early. 
2. Bathroom is clean.
author: Kaily V.

description:
Pretty good, but not too notch. For quick, fast food with fresh pasta, it's great. But the venue is VERY small and one cannot even hear themselves think with how loud it is. They're listed as "Italian food and grocery"--except there's no grocery. The sauce was really good but had room for improvement in terms of spices. 

Large portions, decent taste, great pasta. I definitely recommend it if you're in the area for a quick bite. But if you're looking for "blow your mind" Italian, there are better opportunities out there.
author: Christiana B.

description: A bit pricey for the atmosphere.  Paper plates and smaller portions. A bit dirty.   Pasta was good. ..very fresh,  well made but so desperately in need of huge amounts of salt!  Had the grouper crab pasta. Kinda a waste.  Couldn't taste grouper or crab.  Better off with marina. Didn't know it would be maserated in the sauce.  A little gross.   Meatballs good but heavy.  If I went again is stick with simple pasta and sauce and ask for extra sauce.
author: Debbie M.

description: This place is good. Came here for lunch on a Sunday afternoon. When I walk in first thing I noticed is how small the place is. Seating is really limited here, that why there's a sign saying get a table 1st then order. The Food I order was the pappardelle with Bolognese and meat balls. This was my first time eating thin wide pasta like this and it was really good. The sauce was good and the meat balls where really good. I will be back here to try the green sauce I seen on someone else's plate,  I like to look on peoples plates  to see what looks good :).. I give this place 4 stars for food and service and minus a star for the limited seating.
author: Dennis T.

description: I ordered the Tagliatelle with Bolognese sauce on Thursday 9/27 from UberEats and got food poisoning.
author: Emily W.

description: I have only one thing to say about Italian Homemade Company: BOLOGNESE SAUCE.
author: Daffny V.

description:
Oh My God

When I come to San Francisco I'm happy to have great Italian while i'm there


Italian Homemade company MORE than hit the spot for the need for Italian.  

The place is perfectly quaint and speaks of fast casual.    You come into a busy room (the place always is full. . though we didn't wait for a table).  You order near a register (with a frustratingly bad view of the menu).  Make sure you check the far wall for their specials menu


For the table, I got Fetticuni and Meatball sauce - Gnocchi and green pesto -  lasagna - and a burrata salad.

All of which were better than ANY Italian food I've had in Denver these 5 years.

I would have happily come back to Italian Homemade company everynight- it was that good.

my only caveat is that if you aren't in the mood for pasta (and a few salads) you are out of luck.   That isn't enough of a caveat to impact the five star rating.
author: Christopher G.

description: Italian Homemade Company is a casual spot that offers simple but delicious Italian food. You can choose from various salad, sandwich, and pasta/sauce options. You order at the counter and a server will deliver your food to you. (The food is served on a paper plate, which I thought was slightly odd.) The restaurant can get busy during popular meal times and it can be challenging to find a table because there aren't many. The food is delicious and the portions are large for the pastas.
author: Ceecee Y.

description:
Never in my life have I craved pasta. So if I saw the Italian Homemade Company I probably would have just walked right by and not given it a second thought. But one thing I do crave are..meatballs! And I'll say right off the bat that they have the BEST meatballs I've ever tasted. 

The Italian Homemade Company is a cute little pasta shop where you order first and then sit down. They have a wide variety of different pasta, pasta sauces, sandwiches and even salads. My boyfriend loves pasta, so he ordered the tagliatelle pasta with the bolognese sauce. The pasta itself is ~$9 and the sauce was another ~$2. I ordered the meatball platter which came with 6 (giant) meatballs and Piadina flatbread ($12). After you order you can watch them make everything for you on the stove right behind the cashier. In the back you can even see them making fresh pasta! The portions are generous, my boyfriend and I ended up sharing the pasta and the meatballs which was the perfect meal! Even though I don't know much about pasta or eat it that often, I know that this was definitely the freshest pasta I've ever had and perfectly al dente! 

But OMG, don't even get me started on the meatballs. 6 meatballs might not seem like a lot, but given how big these meatballs are, it's more than enough! I had to cut it up into six pieces and eat it that way. It comes with sauce and cheese on top as well as the flatbread drizzled with olive oil on the side. The Piadina flatbread was unlike anything I've ever had and my stomach is growling right now just thinking about dipping the flatbread into the meatball sauce. It was super thin and tasted dough-y - I know that sounds strange but trust me, it's good. 

Service was fantastic and paired with the food, 5 stars all around! Me craving pasta might be a thing now ever since I discovered the Italian Homemade Company. 10/10 recommend!!
author: Cecille W.

description:
Cute casual Italian restaurant. The menu is simple, pick your pasta and sauce.

My bf and I strolled in late on a Sunday afternoon and there wasn't much of a wait. We placed our order with the friendly cashier and our food came out quick.

I ordered the meat ravioli with bolognese sauce. IT WAS DELICIOUS.  The ravioli was cooked to perfection and the sauce was flavorful. You can taste the freshness in every bite! The ravioli melted in my mouth and I wasn't overly stuffed when I finished my plate. My bf ordered the tagliatelle with bologna's sauce and enjoyed it as well.

If you're looking for a place for simple and authentic pasta, look no more! Italian Homemade Company is my go to place. Definitely will be back.
author: Sophia N.

description: The best pasta I've ever had in California, served on paper plates in a very modest setting.
author: Mark S.

description: Polpetta was a wonderful cheesy and meaty meal.  Meatballs are some of the best I've ever tried.  Self seating is only drawback.
author: Mike P.

description: This place is amazing! Italian food is my absolute favorite (in particular pasta) and we stumbled along this restaurant while in little Italy. It was packed with people so we decided to go in. You order the type of noodle you want and then the type of sauce so your dish is pretty customized. The noodles I'm pretty sure are being freshly made there and were cooked aldante. I don't usually love meatballs but these were exceptionally good. The portions are huge and I'm glad I split one meal. But I would definitely want to go back to try the other dishes. Everything looked so yummy.
author: Liana T.

description:
I LOVE this place. With the rows of Italian restaurants lining North Beach, Italian Homemade doesn't look like much, but it is a true gem (not really hidden, because I think it's pretty popular?) 

You select a fresh, homemade pasta, and then a sauce to go with it. I love the tagliatelle with bolognese or pesto, but the lasagna is also stupidly good. Everything is so simple and classic, but truly well made. Worth EVERY. SINGLE. CARB.
author: Denise L.

description: This very non assuming restaurant is a diamond in the city!! Excellent customer service, amazing food, hot and delish!! Homemade lasagna was my favorite along with a Salad with fresh mozzarella mmm!! We sat there contemplating and scheming when we'd return. Amore in the the food that's for sure!! Thank you thank you thank you!!! OMG to think we almost went to the stuffy rude place on the corner!! You guys are amazing!!!
author: Becky I.

description:
I would call this the Chipotle of pasta, but that would be an insult because this place is way more authentic than Chipotle. But in concept, convenience, affordability, and deliciousness, there's a comparison.

Italian Homemade Company features a variety of options of homemade noodles (hence the name), paired with your choice of sauces and sides. 

For sauce, I recommend the Bolognese with meatballs or pesto. For noodles, pappardelle and gnocchi are both awesome.

You order and pay at the counter, find yourself a seat, and a few minutes later are served a plate of piping hot pasta on a (compostable) paper plate. Nothing fancy, just a plate of very solid pasta. Prices are in the $10-15 range, which is cheaper than most of the fancy North Beach places nearby (where you're basically paying extra for presentation).

Great option for a fast casual pasta dinner with friends, when you aren't trying to impress and care more about quality of food than ambience.
author: Brittany C.

description: This place is ridiculously good. The pasta is just beyond. I especially love the tortellini in the cream sauce. I could eat that all day!
author: Amy M.

description:
Oh no! What a disappointment. After reading the rave reviews I thought for sure it would be our new Italian go to. Maybe I've been spoiled from living in Chicago the last few years... maybe we ordered poorly... maybe they were having a bad night... who knows...

We got delivery... Ordered gnocchi in the butter sage sauce and pappardelle with pesto. Also got some flatbread and tiramisu. The only thing we enjoyed was the pappardelle. The butter sage sauce was bland and the gnocchi was rubbery. Flatbread was dry. Tiramisu was mostly cream... taste was okay.

Sadly, we won't be ordering from here again...
author: Opal G.

description: Very good food, tasty and clean. The place is small but comfortable. I little overcharging but maybe because of the location SF. They have sandwiches and pastas plus the yummy tiramisu:)
author: Carol I.

description: This is my 3rd time eating lunch here this week and I will certainly be coming back again! The pasta and gnocchi are fresh and delicious, full of flavor, and great price. 100% recommended.
author: Enric B.

description:
Very solid Italian food in a no-frills restaurant. Noodles are great, sauces are above average, cute ambiance and fast service. For an inexpensive but tasty Italian meal this is your spot.

Would come back
author: Spencer H.

description:
Delicious. Asked what they recommended? Gnocchi and browned butter. Very good, simple, unpretentious! A small side salad would have been nice.

No big line, good vibe. Happy I came here!
author: Joshua F.

description:
Omg this is basically like the Pasta Sisters of SF except maybe better... cute space with Italian employees (like Pasta Sisters) and a similar menu where you choose the pasta type and a sauce type. 

I had the pappardelle with pesto and holy shit... it was very literally the best pesto I'd ever had. I didn't know pesto could taste like that. Such sharp flavors, the parmesan they used really stood out, the pine nuts stood out, so fresh, I couldn't get over it. And the pappardelle was beautiful, cooked perfectly and you could tell how fresh it was. Next chance I get, coming back to try everything.
author: Jenn L.

description: We really enjoyed this place! Don't let the long line discourage you, they are efficient and quick serving you with fresh food! We had the lasagna, spaghetti and gnocchi - all very good. It's a small space and its very crowded inside but worth so worth it!
author: Emma A.

description: Loved my experience here! This place was small and homey, and the pasta was sooooo fresh. I got the rose sauce with fettuccine, and the group I was with also tried the pesto sauce and the white sauce. We all really loved our pasta! The gnocchi also tasted really fresh which is always great. The feel of the place was also really cute, with nice decor inside. I was visiting from out of town and multiple people told me to check this place out, I'm so glad I did!
author: Malvika T.

description:
The pasta is so delicious here. All freshly made in the restaurant and served to you within minutes. It's such a small and cute little cafe, but the flavors are mighty. 

We had the white sauce over fettuccine, and then the pappadelle with bolognese sauce. Everything is so tasty and fresh. I hope that everyone discovers it walking down the street and goes in for a huge plate of food.
author: Betty Y.

description:
An experience not to be missed!
While very quaint, small with very limited sitting. This is a place Well Worth the wait. The pasta is made fresh! The sauce was the very best! while I enjoyed the lasagna the noodles melted In my mouth the sauce, beef, pork were so so good! My husband had the vegetarian lasagna and his was equally fantastic. My only regret was I could not have started over!! When in San Francisco you should really try this place. It is kid Friendly. The people are nice. They do not have wine. But honestly as much as I do enjoy a glass with Italian food I did not miss it. It was just that good. I wish I could enjoy everything they have in the menu! 
Give it a Go! You will not regret it
Cynthia
author: Cynthia N.

description: The best food and customer service!Specials are usually worth getting and tomato/meat sauces better than white/pesto sauces.
author: Ariadne R.

description:
The Italian Homemade company is a true North Beach gem. The pasta is some of the best in the area, and it's fantastically priced. This little and unassuming restaurant is worth going out of your way to enjoy -- simply spectacular.

The GF and I shared two pasta dishes with meatballs. She got the gnocci and I got the papardelle. Both were fantastic. Food is served on paper plates in huge portions, and the service is no frills. Compared to the overpriced and more touristy places in the area, this is a very solid restaurant. Only downside I can think of is that they don't serve beer or wine.
author: Chris S.

description:
Came at 5pm on a Wednesday and had no problems getting a seat. 

Tiny restaurant.  Didn't see an Italian chef in the kitchen at all.  

Ordered the following:

Burratta Salad - I liked the flavor of this.  Tomatoes were extra sweet and baby arugula was not bitter.  Hubs didn't like the texture of the burratta itself.  He didn't like the casing on the outside. 

Lasagna - Honestly I tried to love it, but it tastes exactly like the fresh lasagna from Safeway.  Nothing stood out and the noodles itself were pretty mushy.  

The calzone thing with potatoes and sausages inside.  The dough just wasn't that great.  We took 2 bites and left the rest.

They don't serve wine or beer and don't let you bring in your own.  Italian food with no wine?  Exactly.  

Maybe their togo pasta is good, or maybe one of the other dishes, but what we had, we wouldn't go back.  Not sure how the reviews are so high!
author: Vi Y.

description: Great housemade pasta, but the sauce started seeping through the paper plate. The crowd is a little rude - had an interaction with a very rude child whose parents could care less about his behavior. Wonderful staff at the counter made up for it; however, not a place I'd recommend eating in at unless you're able to snag a table outside. Very crowded and a bit uncomfortable. Takeout is recommended.
author: Veda R.

description:
Probably our "ubteenth" time here and it's been just as good as before. We've tried the lasagna, tagliotelli (sp?), Gnocchi, and and meatballs. All are great. Fresh as always. A side note to be made is that the red sauce, bolognase can be on the salty side. The white sauce is perfect each and every friggin time I don't know why I try other ones. They have a 50/50 mix of the red and white that you can order worth your pasta dish and it's as equally good. I'd spring for that one over just red or white. My all time go to is the gnocchi. So good and fresh. Doughy and not shaped like an oval? Yeah it's not but that doesn't take away from the goodness. It's unique I guess but I don't know if that's unique to Italy? Whatever the case, it's good, hands down.

Side note: the lasagna can be a bit salty because of the red sauce.
author: Jay V.

description: This place was AMAZING!!!!!  The food was fresh and oh so tasty!  I ordered the lasagna and I don't have words that could explain how spectacular it was. The sauce was Perfectly seasoned and the lasagna was meaty and cheesy. The Owner and employees provided authentic Italian food The impeccable service and care we received was excellent. The staff was friendly and wanted to give us the best they had to offer. I can't wait to go back!!  Amazing food. I wish I could give 10 stars.
author: Susan H.

description:
Great little spot for some really good food on paper plates.  A no frills setting, to grab a seat, eat & go. Some of the best lasagna I have ever had, and my girl really enjoyed the vegetarian raviolis.
Was perfect place to get a quick bite, before heading to Cobbs Comedy Club.
Definitely will revisit when back in rhe area.
author: Craig O.

description:
Located in the heart of Little Italy, this restaurant is small and quaint with outdoor seating (light aluminum chairs).  All pasta, sauces, and proteins are made fresh every day.

The choices of sauces and pastas gives you a wide selection of variety to make your own plate.  The lasagna is to die for, GREAT tasting and a good portion.  Matter of fact, ALL the dishes are served as large portions almost falling OFF the plate.

My favorite was the meat sauce with meat balls over fettuccini.  It was simply family style served pasta that tasted good.  Staff are very friendly. Service is quick.

Highly recommend visiting.  Sit outside and ppl watch while you have lunch or dinner.  It was a great experience.
author: Randy L.

description:
Oh. My. Lord! The food here is amazing! Had the spinach, potato and mozzarella cassoni and it was freaking delicious! The mixture of the Spinach, potato and mozzarella was well done, no one ingredient too overpowering. The cassoni dough reminded me of fresh flour tortillas but a little thicker and chewy (in a good way)!  My friends ordered lasagna and the portions were huge and it was delicious as well! I love the "hole in the wall" vibe and the recycling efforts! Place gets busy and was packed so parking can be difficult but I'm sure it's how SF is in general.

As a visitor in SF, I would definitely return on my next visit!
author: Monique A.

description:
This place is amazing. The pesto pasta was amazing, the lasagne was so good the vegetarian one. The Alfredo sauce was so fresh everything is homemade and there desert is authentic. The seating is a little uncomfortable but it does the job. For vegetarians and meat lovers this is the place to try if your a first timer in San Francisco. The line is long but its so worth it. The whole flatbreads were amazing to eat with the pasta. Wish they had beers but it's amazing it's all fresh and they have a pasta lab.
There Mariana sauce was so good. I give it a 5 star not a lot of salt in the food it's just perfect.
author: Sahil M.

description: Italian Homemade is definitely one of my favourite Italian restaurants in SF, with friendly staff, tasty food, and a convenient location that's easy walking/transit distance from familiar neighbourhoods. I've been to this location as well as the one in Marina. Personally speaking, I prefer this one since it feels more cozy and homey with high tables and stools by the windows that are perfect for people-watching. Food-wise, it's the same as the Union St one - that is to say, amazinggg. I'm particularly inclined to the lasagna and the tortellini (with ragu or with parmigiano). I love the panna cotta here as well. It's perfect for a sweet finish and comes with different toppings - caramel, strawberry, blueberry, to name a few. Needless to say, I'll be back soon, hungry for more.
author: Bianca C.

description:
Best place to get a quick salad in North Beach, hands down. 

The burrata salad in particular. It's simple, reasonably priced, and the ingredients are impeccable. 

Most importantly, there's a giant f*cking burrata dollop on top. 

Plus you gotta respect all the PYTs slaving over the stove, pumping out plate after plate of meatballs and pappardelle and anything else your little heart desires.
author: Lauren L.

description: In one word: "amazing". If you want to eat real homemade pasta, then that's the best spot in SF for you. I'll be back
author: Salah C.

description: High recommend the lasagna and their Bolognese sauce (choose whatever pasta base you want). Would definitely come back to try the Gnocchi. If there's a line don't worry it goes really quickly! Seats were relatively easy to find.
author: Rene C.

description: Love little "hole in the wall" places and this is one of the best in SF.  The pasta is fresh and amazing.  The sauces are all simple yet have so much flavor.  The staff is so friendly and helpful if you are not sure what to order.   Definitely on the list of places to return and second and third and fourth time.
author: PJ L.

description:
For the price and the flavor, this spot cannot be beat! Honestly, the best thing to do is to order takeout and get it delivered ASAP on Postmates, since it sometimes gets really busy and packed. It's even better if you have Postmates Unlimited. I really can't tell you where else in the city you get this much food for less than $15, but at Italian Homemade, you can. 

Definitely order the Lasagna, it was one of the best I've ever had. I also tried the fettuccine, the noodles are made extremely well and cooked slightly al dente the way I like it. If you're ever in the area, it's definitely worth making a stop over at the restaurant. Otherwise, if you live a bit farther from North Beach like me, you can get delivery to satisfy your pasta cravings!
author: Alice Z.

description:
Visited this place many a times and I will definitely have to say I have no complaints and this is one of the best places to get your pasta fix. From their lasagna to their gnocchi, you cannot go wrong. All of their pastas and items are made in house and from scratch. It is also cooked to order and cooked a perfect al dente. You get your choice of pasta and sauce. Last time I visited here for a work time lunch I got the meat ravioli with Bolognese sauce and it was amazing. I would highly recommend their lasagna if you're feeling something a little heartier. You can also request a rose sauce which is a mixture of their Bolognese and Alfredo sauce. It goes really well with their pappardelle. Don't forget about their giant meatballs.

Always a great pick and one of my favorite places to stop in for a quick bite. Just be mindful that sometimes they may have a line out the door but don't let that discourage you since most of the items take very little time to cook.
author: Camera P.

description:
This is such a wonderful spot get no frills pasta. Choose your sauce, choose your pasta, and eat off of a paper plate. Done. This place gets busy, so be prepared to order and find a spot. People don't necessarily linger very long after eating their plate, so it's not hard to find a spot. 

The pasta is cooked to a perfect al dente, and the sauce coats it perfectly. The only disappointment is that they ran out of meatballs!!!! Have to go back and just try those babies. Until next time!
author: Vanessa K.

description: Definitely the best homemade pasta I've had! You can see them in the back rolling it out! No kid menu but definitely large enough portions for two kids to share one serving. Really tiny place so not much seating, but worth the wait if you have to wait for a table to open up. Highly recommend the pesto sauce (of course I love basil); my husband loved the red meat sauce. If we ever go back to San Fran, definitely will go out of my way to war there again!
author: Ivy T.

description: Italian Homemade Company has been on my yelp list for the longest time! I recently went here on a Saturday for lunch and it was a little busy.
