We ordered 2 pastas, pappardelle in bolognese with meatballs and tagliatelle with bolognese + white sauce. Unfortunately, both of the plates came with pappardelle but I was too hungry to complain. Both sauces were pretty similar. The homemade pasta was sooooo good! Nothing can beat that. The meatballs were soft and flavorful. The sauces were also salty but very tasty. We spent $30 for 2 people for 2 pasta dishes and an order of flatbread. It was more than enough food and we had leftovers. There's only metered parking but we found a space pretty easily. I'll definitely be back to try other dishes!
author: Regina W.

description:
I got the tagliatelle pasta with pasticcata sauce (blend of bolognese and béchamel). It was a very comforting plate of pasta, and the sauce was great. However, my pasta stuck to each other and made it harder to eat. 

Verdit: It's great comfort food and I'd definitely come back. But, this won't be my goto joint.
author: Cynthia T.

description:
My favorite Italian spot for take out in North Beach! Call ahead to order for pickup as there will always be a line. My favorites are the lasagna and gnocchi with meatballs, but their sausage cassoni is also fantastic.

In the last 2 years since opening, their prices have steadily been increasing (most likely due to overwhelming demand) so this is not an inexpensive spot. To my stomach's disappointment, they also went down from 3 meatballs per order to only 2. Dinner for 2 typically runs $25-$30.
author: Katrina G.

description:
This was the first meal I had upon arrival to San Francisco. Exhausted after a roughly seven hour flight which included a 1 hour layover, I decided to order in instead upon checking into my room. 
My meal consisted of the Parpadelle with Bolognese and meatballs and a  salad.

The salad which was more like a meal in itself, hence regular, was fresh, full of robust, plum tomatoes and carrots and all that good stuff. The dressing, an olive oil vinaigrette of sorts, I didn't too much care for, especially when I specifically requested Caesar dressing. I have tacky, unrefined tastebuds, I suppose. But, hey, I like what I like.

The pasta dish was good, but not exemplary. Nothing stood out about the the sauce. I've had the same and better elsewhere. I did, however enjoy the meatballs, themselves; they are huge, so you only need one or two. The restaurant's a bit pricey. But, one thing for sure is they do give you a nice portion for the money. I just wish the person who completed my order would've adhered to my requests. Caesar dressing, cheese packets and utensils.
author: Kyle B.

description: Love, love, love Italian Homemade! Best pasta & service. It's a go-to spot for us. Keep it up!
author: Aisha V.

description: Everything looks and smells amazing, but..... Béchamel sauce INSTEAD OF ricotta in a lasagna is not very tasty! Béchamel is a FRENCH sauce, not  Italian, which makes you go "hmmmm," just sayin'. Overall, the lasagna is lacking flavor.  The Bolognese it's made with is missing the celery, onion and carrots. All 3 are an absolute MUST in Bolognese. I get that those 3 necessary ingredients cook down some, but the flavors were completely absent from the sauce so I believe they were actually omitted from their recipe.
author: Cheryl H.

description: This place was great. It seems like a little hole in the wall joint but while we were there they were cooking up a storm and boxing to go orders one after another. The seating isn't the most comfortable but the food is good. Don't expect fancy plates and utensils. You get your food on a paper plate with basic silverware. I got the meat ball plate, it was full of meat balls, sauce and flat bread. It was a large meal and hit the spot after a long day of hiking around the city. Everything is homemade and they even have the pasta lab sign for the homemade pasta room. The choc ganache was very good as well. I would certainly go back here and recommend this place.
author: Jeffrey G.

description: Had the lasagna it was ok... Had a weird white cheesy sauce on it I've never had before. Cashier was a bit rude too... Meatball was good though. Might go back and try a regular pasta dish or the meatball meal
author: J D.

description: This place is a gem . Came here 5 different times in two weeks. Authentic amazing homemade Italian food. I tried the gnocchi with half pesto and half alfredo sauce , the ravioli , the fettuccini , the meatballs . You can't go wrong with anything but that gnocchi with pesto sauce/ alfredo  was one of the best I've ever tried . Service is great , prices are amazing and food is amazing .
author: Jacqueline G.

description:
We came hungry and ate happy. I Def suggest the lasagna - never had such melt in my mouth 
 pasta before. Meatballs were delicious. It's small, was busy but not too loud. Chill spot, very enjoyable meal.
author: Jake G.

description:
I had the pappadelle with pasticciata sauce (bolognese sauce with bechamel cream). The pasta was cooked to al dente and the sauce was very simple but tasted amazing. 

My boyfriend got the tortellini with white sauce (bechemal cream and butter). The tortellini was the best I've ever had. Cooked to al dente, of course. The filling was delicious! Most tortellini I've had was just filled with cheese, but this one had three different types of meat. The sauce again was very simple which really helped me enjoy the taste of the tortellini itself. I'm thinking about the tortellini as I'm writing this review and wishing I can have some right now.
author: Michelle T.

description:
Food so delicious,taste totally homemade 
But the place is so small , and only have meatball (meat) no clams or another seafood which usually on all Italian menu . I try lasagna , it's good ,normal , not spectacular. It's for casual dinner not fancy or find dinning . Dress casual (of course) .
author: Rachel B.

description:
My oh my, do I absolutely love this place. Walked in after a trek of a day, 22,000 steps or about 11 miles. I guess that is what happens when you're a New Yorker in a new city and refuse to take Uber or Lyft everrrywhere.

Anywho, immediately the vibe was super cozy. Red stools, Italian products filling the wall, and the amazing to watch pasta making machine! Plus, the chefs and their wicked wrist action in cooking up fresh pasta. I haven't been to Italy, but I wonder if this is the vibe they'd have at a hometown pasta restaurant there. 

With an eclectic selection of euro music playing, a few friends and I went with the Vegetable Ravioli in Alfredo Sauce ^2, Pappardelle in Pastiaccata Sauce, & a $1.79 Meatball. I also was going to order the $1 half flatbread but alas forgotten in my excitement. 

Pappardelle in Pastiaccata Sauce (~$13)
- These noodles were some of the freshest I've tried, cooked perfectly al dente. Some a little stuck together, but alas I don't know if I minded so much because the flavor of the sauce and the texture of the noodles themselves was fantastic. 
- The Pastiacatta Sauce, or I ignorantly would call "Pink Sauce" is delicous, especially for someone who loves tasting multiple flavors I appreciate this option because you get the kick of tomato sauce with the creamy bechamel coming through

Vegetable Ravioli in Alfredo Sauce (~$12)
- Such soft texture and a unique flavor
- This is definitely a crowd favorite worth trying
- I personally didn't order this because I wanted something a little more filling and I think I went with the right choice with the pappardelle as the quantity of it is much larger

Meatball ($1.79)
- Interestingly enough, the tomato sauce which came like a moat around the singular meatball in a small paper bowl was the MOST delicious of all the sauces.
- As mentioned previously, I LOVE pink sauce (mixing tomato and Alfredo sauce), strangely enough the mixing of this sauce with the Alfredo was far superior to the Pastiacatta sauce, which already was fabulous

TIPS: 
- The meatball is enormous, so if you're a tiny-ish human you can very well be full off of 1. (I was almost too greedy and ordered another but glad I didn't!) 
- Mix the tomato sauce + Alfredo sauce, brilliant flavors :)
- If you're super hungry, go with the noodle options as opposed to the ravioli

TL;DR
Service (3/5) - prompt & friendly, not too much if you know what I mean
Food (4/5) - the food is the star 
Ambiance (4/5) - paper plates, eclectic music, & warm vibes
Value (5/5) - Great value for the quality of food, love
author: Sara S.

description:
Had the meat lasagna and gnocchi with white sauce. Thought it tasted alright. Honestly expected it to taste amazing because of the high reviews on here. Had better lasagna. And the gnocchi was basic and bland. Didn't finish it and took it home. Excited to add salmon and veggies to it for it to taste more complete.

Do appreciate the large portions and decent price. Pasta is fresh and small setting has a nice ambience.
author: Jennifer S.

description:
Finally got to try this place after hearing so many good things. You definitely can't beat the price point of ~$12 per pasta dish where you choose a noodle type and sauce. We ordered the pappardelle w/ bolognese with meatball and tagliatelle w/ pesto sauce. 

Our orders came out pretty quickly and with filling portion sizes. The sauces were good and I enjoyed the meatballs.

However, I was disappointed that the pasta was not very chewy. Instead, the texture was fairly thin. Maybe this is just another style of pasta that I wasn't aware of and it just wasn't my thing. I also wish they gave more sauce. I felt that the noodles didn't absorb the flavoring very well.

Overall I'd probably come back due to the price but theres definitely tastier Italian spots in the city.
author: Sophia H.

description: Pick one of seven types of pasta, then your choice of seven types of sauce. Fresh and easy. Salads, sandwiches and specialties are here too! Yum.
author: Gaya G.

description:
I was excited about coming here after having seen the food on tables when passing by and the reviews here plus TripAdvisor. 

The food is fantastic, fresh, and flavorful. The staff is friendly and welcoming. The space is small and food is served on paper plates, but do not let this distract you from a mouth watering reward. 

I enjoyed the burrata salad - simple, clean, and light. I watched someone else eat the bresaola salad and pretty sure I will order that next. The stack of meat had me salivating. Another guest had a lasagna, a slice that could easily feed two. 

I give an absolute 5 for the food, a 4 for the space. It's not fine dining, closer to a divey authentic bodega. Understanding/expecting this (the guests next to me were surprised in it's lack of fine dining but raved of the food), you will be beyond satisfied.
author: Mark H.

description:
I should preface to say I lived in Italy, so my tastes are a bit bias. 

The good: quick, easy, affordable Italian food you'll ever find in North Beach. You're looking to spend $20+ on a pasta dish around here. But this place is reasonably priced, especially for fresh pasta. This is also a great place for kids cause the meals come out in under 10 minutes depending on how busy they are. The portion sizes are also huge!

The bad: if you're looking for a meal like a nonna this is not the place to go. It's adequate, but definitely very American. There also is very little seating and it's seat yourself on a first come first serve basis. If you have small kids and you want to eat in it may be tricky since most of their tables are high tops.

Overall it is a good restaurant, but certainly not enough to write home about.
author: Eileen J.

description:
Been here twice and I love the atmosphere and it's a great place for fresh pasta!
+ friendly service
+ quick and easy to order (at the counter) and it doesn't take too long 
+ can customize pasta type and sauce
+ GNOCCHI (nee-yo-key) is really good here
+ can easily have vegetarian option

- they only do pork and beef meatballs no chicken :/
- got the tagliatelle w marinara and it didn't hit the spot and I really wanted italian too..
- seating can fill up and it is small / not the best seating options (not the most comfy etc)

Overall, 3 star food (depending on what you get) since it didn't hit the spot but friendly staff and cute ambience (they played wonderful beatles songs) made me give it 4 stars
author: Mahima D.

description: We come here for the great food. The homemade pasta (I chose the pappardelle) and meatballs dish is so good! Prepare to be quite cozy while you eat because the place is very popular and therefore, often packed full of people. There are a few outdoor tables but we prefer inside even if we sit at the window counter.  I noticed several delivery people picking up take-out.
author: Kim B.

description:
I would rank the food a 3 and the uniqueness of the restaurant more of a 4. I came here on a rainy Friday evening with my friend and the place was packed. There were hardly any space to move or sit and there wasn't really a designated place to wait for the food. Moreover, it felt kind of awkward just waiting there while the place got more and more crowded. 

I ordered the fettuccine with the cream sauce and it was kind of disappointing. It seemed kind of plain and it felt like something I could have actually made myself. There could at least been some green onion or some garnish at the top to make it look less plain. My friend got the vegetarian lasagna and it also tasted OK, not amazing.  

Lastly, it would help to have the menu closer to the door. It was kind of hard to see the menu while I was in line. Perhaps have a bunch of lamenated paper menus by the door. Overall, I'd try this place again because I felt like it should be better than what I experienced.
author: Victor L.

description: Real Italian food! I passed by in SF and was craving Italian food. This is the best Italian food I had in America yet and I've been here for 2 years! I got tortellini and the taste literally remind me of my Italian grandma kitchen and made me homesick! I tasted the lasagne, the tagliatelle and the piadina and everything was delicious! Everybody in the staff was Italian and spoke Italian! If you're craving real Italian food you must come here! Complimenti!
author: Giulia P.

description:
This is the place I love to visit. If you want Italian food this is the place. Fresh, delicious, kind ...
I ordered pasta and ravioli and lasagna. Veggie option is available. Not a huge restaurant to sit in and chat, but you may enjoy the food. Apple Pay is available. I will visit again.
author: Don S.

description:
Visiting San Francisco again and I was really craving some authentic Italian food. Found this place and it's a gem! Low cost and great quality! Food is served pretty quickly and the taste is fantastic. The spot itself is small and cute. Seating is a bit uncomfortable but it's definitely cozy. I'd make it a 5 star if they used more fresh herbs in their recipes. Definitely a spot to try! 

I had the pesto ravioli and the meat lasagna with an italian soda to chase it down. Both dishes were great but I wish they had a larger selection of Italian soda!
author: Omid H.

description: Only downside is they don't serve wine. Oh man the food was so good.... I don't know what I've been eating my whole life but it wasn't real italian food. Game changers like this place have brought me back! Fresh pasta and such good sauce. Food came quick and the line moved fast.
author: Teresa D.

description:
Genuinely friendly service. 
Short wait times.

Best Italian food (lasangna) in North Beach so far.... and yes I live in N. Beach.
author: Richard L.

description: Food was tasty. I had the Tortellini and Meatballs, and it was pretty much what I expected. I honestly wouldn't say that this is the best Italian food that I've tried, but it was good. Only thing is that I feel they don't give you enough sauce for the amount of pasta they serve. Dishes are a good size. You can definitely share with another person and have enough to eat. The place was small and it makes it difficult to move around, as it's usually pretty busy. Cool little place, but its a 7 or 8 out of 10 for me.
author: Ben C.

description: Amazing fresh pasta with great sauces and great customer service! Also the tiramisu is perfect (not pictured) so light and fluffy also the lady fingers were perfectly soaked and still kept their structural integrity! Really great value for great tasting pasta! This is a must try!
author: Alexander C.

description:
A "effin" plus

This place is a quaint little Italian restaurant tucked away into the depth of the city. You can drive past it and not realize that you missed what maybe the best Italian restaurant in SF. 

What may a tad bit of a wait, this place is definitely worth it. Plus they serve drinks while you wait, if you're into that.

I ordered the lasagna on the recommendation of my date, according to whom, this place is only good for that.

The first bite and I was left speechless, the sauce was hearty with flavor. Each bite had the right amount of zest and seasoning, with tang simply oozing. The cheese was perfectly melted in layers. Frankly, I'm salivating simply thinking about it as I write this review.

Definitely going to revisit this place for the lasagna again. And I highly recommend anyone deciding to get Italian food on the west coast, to give this place a shot.
author: Faruque K.

description:
Believe the hype! Awesome food and everything was so fresh. We tried the papardelle with bolognaise, fettuccine with butter,
huge meatballs and sausage special with cream sauce. I say that the simple food is the test of a good restaurant. Making amazing food with simplicity. Yum. 

Lines can be long but order ahead and you can walk out in a reasonable amount of time. Love the cardboard takeout boxes and compostable cutlery. 

They can tailor your order and the authentic Italian speaking owners/staff make this a true gem. Grazie!!
author: Clarence E.

description:
Small place with food served on paper plates but best pasta I've had and sauce and meatballs also righteous!  Plus not expensive- esp for SF
A must place to check out in North Beach
author: Joseph H.

description:
Unfortunately, the bolognese sauce did not live up to the hype. Very watery and hardly any flavor. The large batches of suace probably need a bit more quality control. I have had many better bolognese sauces both in restaurants and home cooked. Meatballs were similarly underseasoned.
The parpadelle was cooked well, but the fettuccine was on the hard side of al dente.
Wait was minimal when I came on Sunday around 1pm.
author: Kevin W.

description:
Cute Italian restaurant with custom order pasta (choose the type and the sauce). Very friendly service and my order was ready quickly.
Pasta was great and I'd gladly eat here again!
author: Mandy M.

description:
Found the location through Yelp and was extremely satisfied. 

The setting is very homey and the lasagna with meatballs was great (they also have vegetarian options). Part of the kitchen is visible and the attention from the workers was on point. 

I would advise to call in advance if you don't feel like waiting. Since the place is small there is usually a line. But there are tables for sitting outside and inside.
author: Marcia C.

description: Simply amazing.  We ate here for lunch before going to Beach Blanket Babylon's Sunday matinee.  And didn't hesitate to come back for an early dinner!  Nuts right?!  But it was simply that good.  We had the parppadelle, tagliatelle, and rigatoni - all tasting fabulously fresh.  The simple marinara sauce is just delicious - simple and clean.  Meatballs were a hit too.  The caramel panna cotta was out of this world.  And the tiramisu didn't disappoint.  Would come back in a heart beat.
author: FoodJunkie S.

description: Wow this food is so full of flavor and life! I'm so excited that I've now found a new favorite spot here in San Francisco!
author: Paul E. G.

description: Basic Italian food but well made.  Like this place
author: Emi C.

description:
Great food. Nice and cozy restaurant.
I enjoyed eating Italian pasta at this restaurant.
author: Alireza E.

description:
I was really looking forward to trying the food out after reading all of the glowing reviews. Unfortunately, I can't say that I can agree with the rave reviews. I ordered food to-go for a party of 20 people. We had a bunch of other food ordered from different restaurants to have variety and I'm so glad we didn't put all our chips in this basket.

I ordered the lasagna, tagliatelle pasta with pasticiatta sauce, meatballs, ravioli with white sauce and pesto. It was unanimous from all the guests, that with the exception of the ravioli in pesto sauce, everything was mediocre at best. It was so disappointing that all of the pasta was extremely mushy, nowhere near al dente. The ratio of pasticiatta sauce relative to the amount of pasta was off, not enough sauce - such that everyone just felt like they were eating bland pasta. The lasagna, which I was hoping to be the star, was a huge bust. The noodles barely held their form and the flavor was really bland. 

I was hugely disappointed, as we paid the most money for this food, and it was the least favored by everyone at the party and had the most leftover. When we went to pick up the food, I was looking around at the dishes people were eating and they looked really good and was excited, but upon opening our trays, we didn't see the same thing and probably didn't taste the same things. Perhaps I will give this place another shot, if I just visit the establishment to have lunch to experience what other patrons have, as I really want to like it. I suppose I just had a one-off disappointing experience. :(
author: April B.

description: So sad we didn't get to try the pasta! But we got there right when it opened and had just had dim sum so we just got a classica piadina and veggie casone. They were both big enough for two people. They didn't skimp on the cheese or anything else for that matter! everything was good and fresh! We also had a nutella bombolini and again, they were NOT stingy with the nutella. I KNOW I'll be back to try the pasta!
author: R G.

description: I heard about this place from my Italian friend and was really expecting what I thought would be an authentic experience.  I ordered delivery from Postmates, which may have made a difference in the taste of the food.  I ordered the mozzarella salad, gnocchi rolls with marinara sauce, and the pappardelle with the Pasticciata sauce.  Portions were pretty generous - I was able to split this between two meals.  The mozzarella salad was really good and came with very tasty pieces of flat bread - it was my favorite part of the meal! The gnocchi rolls left a lot to be desired...while I know that gnocchi is made out of potato, these literally tasted like mashed potatoes, not like any gnocchi I have ever had.  The pappardelle was okay, but extremely overcooked, so much so that the it was hard to separate the individual noodles from one another.  The pasticciata sauce though was really good and full of flavor.  All in all, I was sort of disappointed with this, only because of my extremely high expectations, but will go back and dine in to see if the pasta in-house is better.
author: Arthi N.

description:
Italian Homemade Company popped up as the first restaurant when searching for Italian food in Russian Hill. It seemed to have good reviews and had an online ordering app on Yelp so I decided to give it a try. The menu is your standard Italian fare with salads, sandwiches, pasta, lasagna etc. I generally avoid getting pasta to-go as it gets soggy and lumpy by the time you get home, so after going through the menu I decided to get the Meatballs with Piadina Flatbread ($11). I honestly did not know what "Piadina" was, but went with it keeping an open mind.

I reached the restaurant (It's on Columbus just ahead of Washington Square) 20 minutes after ordering to find that my food was ready so I was on my way. I got a heavy container with the meatballs along with the flatbread that was neatly wrapped in a silver foil. There were 6 huge meatballs. I mean these were gigantic. Unfortunately they were frozen solid. The plastic fork broke into pieces without even making a dent in these. The meatballs had to have been taken out of a freezer and used without thawing them out first. I am not sure what these folks were thinking when they gave me frozen meatballs. Would I not notice? Would they thaw out on the way home? Well, No & No. I let them stand for an hour hoping that they would thaw out. What these needed was about 3-4 minutes in a microwave, as I did not have one, I could not do much except to safely confine them in the trash. The flatbread was thin with a light dusting of raw flour. It was not built to soak up the sauce that came with the meatballs but could be used like a spoon to scoop up the sauce to quench my hunger.
 
Price wise this dish was cheap for the location. Most of the pastas on the menu are around the $15 mark which is also a little less when compared to other Italian places in the area. There are a ton of Italian restaurants to try in the area so I have no intention of returning here after this experience.
author: Ahmad J.

description:
OFFICIALLY THE BEST PASTA I HAVE EVER HAD.

No fancy Italian spot could possibly beat this place. The ambiance is casual & chill but the food speaks for itself. So far I've tried the meat ravioli w/ marinara, pesto gnocchi, and the gnocchi roll w/ marinara and they were all equally amazing in their own way. 

I love the freshness of the pasta & the fact that it's cooked perfectly al dente. The texture could not be more amazeballs. The sauces are all perfectly seasoned and not too heavy, which is great b/c Italian food usually gives me major food coma. Not to mention, the portions are pretty generous and for about $10, you get an amazing plate of comfort food. I have found my new favorite Italian restaurant and I cannot wait to come back. The only downside is the parking situation since it is North Beach, but when there's a will, theres a way.
author: Marny N.

description: Great flavor and homey feel but a little pricey for what I felt was small portions.  As vegetarians, our options were more limited and less flavorful but I would recommend the vegetable lasagna.
author: Liqa M.

description:
I have been here three times in the last month. The first two where amazing the gnocchi is really what stood out to me. I loved it........ It was so light and fluffy and really delicious with the pesto and the butter sage sauce. 

But of coure everything comes to an end. I brought my family who was visiting from out of town this last Monday here and it was a total disappointment. The tortellini was not very good at all the meat inside of it had a really weird flavor. My family member's ordered gnocchi's but this time they came out and where super gummy. The sauce was also not very good. The butter sage sauce only tasted like butter. Maybe the cooks where having an off day but after spending $80 here we expected much better quality food.
author: Michael W.

description: Delicious Fresh pasta... The way it should be.  Without all the fuss.  Once you choose you pasta and sauce they make it fresh.  You can watch them make the fresh pasta while you eat.  The food is in front of you in about 5-7 minutes.  Molto bene!
author: Randi G.

description:
One of my favorite pasta places I've tried. It's consistently good and portions are generous. It can get crowded though so expect to wait during peak hours. 
I would recommend this place for small groups- so you can grab seats when people leave.
My favorite is the linguine with the meatballs.
author: Kelly T.

description: Some of the best italian food in town. Small quaint spot in little italy where you choose a style of fresh made pasta and a sauce. I had the daily special of gnocchi with calamari amd tomatoes and loved it. All super fresh and tasty and loads of tender squid. Service was casual style but friendly and family ran. I was gonna try the gnocchi roll specialty but it was out of stock so ill have to come back. My friend really liked his lasagna as well.
author: Sean G.

description: if you want fresh made pasta, this is it! The daily special was great, and my two-year-old daughter destroyed the lasagna! My wife, the pickiest of the three wasn't thoroughly impressed, but to impress her and takes an awful lot. She did eat all the raviolis leaving only one on her plate. That's a lot to say for my wife.
author: Jose R.

description:
I love the (kind of) new location at College ave, Berkeley. I've been to the other ones and it doesn't disappoint. 
Everything on the menu is delicious and believe me, I've tried them all. Being pregnant and craving for pasta, I was eating there almost every week. Friendly staff, really good food and also, really good gelato.
author: Andréia C.

description: WE LOVE THIS PLACE!!! Thank you to the staff who helped us order and serve 16 girls for my daughters 16th birthday! You guys were awesome and your food tastes like Italy, the BEST! Thank you!
author: Erica D.

description: Great pasta! I'm upset I was only able to visit here once on our trip. Not anything fancy but just good food!
author: Megan B.

description: Paper plates? I don't care as long they keep serving the best Italian food in North Beach. The yelp ratings and reviews explain it all, this is the best Italian restaurant around here. It might get a bit crowded here during lunch hours but it's worth the wait.
author: Philip M.

description: This is one of the best Italian restaurants I have ever been to. All of their pasta is homemade, reasonably priced and absolutely delicious
author: Laura D.

description: Came here for lunch with a friend. Had the lasagna and two meatballs.  The meatballs were not very good.  The lasagna was a large portion and was very filling. It was tasty, but not loaded with meat or sauce.  Service was good.  Location is convenient when visiting North Beach.
author: Paul W.

description:
Simply amazing! Came here on our trip from L.A. and found this place on yelp. Honestly the work I seen go into the food and the quality is just second to none. Will def. be coming to this restaurant every trip to San Francisco! 

I highly recommend the lasagna and bolognese. This is a true Italian experience when it comes to the food.
author: Doug V.

description: Great carb loaded home made pasta. The pasta is nice and firm if you like it that way. You order and bring it to your own table.
author: Thomas C.

description: Had the caprese (I think they could have used a better mozzarella) salad , lasagna and the veggie ravioli with sage and brown butter. Overall the meal was pretty good but didn't change my life. For SF, the price point was reasonable and the portion sizes were were large. It was a pretty decent meal overall and a great cheap comfort food find, but wouldn't be my number one choice for Italian.
author: Rachel V.

description: This restaurant was recommended by the ferry personal.  She recommended the lasagna.   We ran across it on our way to Chinatown.  This is a very unassuming place.  It is not fancy.  At all.  You order, then find a seat.  Paper plates.  Not very much seating at all.  We waited and a couple of seats came over.  We had the lasagna and the burrata salad.  It was all delicious.   The lasagna was a generous portion.  I shared both the lasagna and salad with a friend.  More than enough food for the both of us to share.
author: Rachal R.

description:
Lovely fresh pasta with generous portions! 
I wish they had a less salty, veg tortellini option.
author: Mayumi K.

description:
Oh. Maaaa. Gawd. 

Even if you've eaten your way through San Fran, you have to stop here and try the gnocchi. It's AMAZE-BALLS!!! Loved everything about this little restaurant. Authentic and the customer service was perfect-o.

There was so much I wanted to try here but we were sampling all the places in Little Italy. 

If you're in the area, stop here! It's spectacular, low key and the feel of familia in the food is evident. Food made with love.
author: Jenifer R.

description: First time here and so impressed with this place! Everything tasted authentic and delish and the customer service was outstanding! 5 stars and definitely coming back again!
author: Daria D.

description: The absolute best Italian food. Homemade & Great customer service. You'll love it! I recommend checking it out if you love Italian Food! The 'Piadina Classica' & 'Cassoni-Italian sausage, pepper, onion, mozz' was so delicious!
author: Gabby G.

description: Oh. My. Italy.  This is the most exceptional food ever! Don't hesitate coming here, the owners/managers and staff are Italian.  Even the customers are Italian! We were extremely impressed!  We had the meat ravioli with marinera, gnocchi roll, and lasagna.  Every option incredible!
author: Emilee H.

description:
Check out talian Homemade Company for a satisfying, FILLING meal. I visited on Saturday evening with a group of four and there was a line out the door. It was packed inside and luckily a spot cleared by the time we ordered so we could sit down. We ordered the burrata salad for the table and everyone enjoyed it. I got the lasagna which was huge and delicious. Everyone else in my party was satisfied by their meals as well. 

They did seem to be out of quite a few things at only 6:30. We wanted to get a gnocchi roll for the table but unfortunately once we got to the cash register to order they told us they were out of it. I heard the person in front of me in line try to order gnocchi and their pesto sauce, but they were out of that too. Kind of disappointing for those people who waited in line for 20 minutes only to have to frantically change their order at the cash register. We wanted to order wine for the table, but they don't serve alcohol. The things they did have were wonderful, so I'll be back when I'm craving Italian.
author: Cameron R.

description: Quite possibly the worst lasagna that I have ever had. The cheese tasted gross and tasted like low quality. It almost tasted like they mixed sour cream with the cheese. The red sauce was nothing special and no better than something you find out of a can. Half of the lasagna was burned which is not ok. The size was decent and more than a person should eat but because it wasn't good at all, I only ended up eat about a third of it. Was extremely dissatisfied and will not be ordering from here again. Really sucks because the place didn't have bad reviews and I was expecting so much more. Try at your own risk.
author: Anne R.

description: Delicious, homemade, delicious, ahh I've been to this place 3 times and I'm absolutely addicted!! Best place to eat well priced fresh pasta!!!
author: Lana S.

description:
This place is awesome. Their food is delicious, they are beyond friendly and their flat bread is amazing. It's cheap and quick, not a fancy place but exactly what I was looking for. 

Matilda is so friendly and shows all her guests a huge smile. Matilda and her co-workers contributed to our amazing experience. 

Only downside is they don't serve alcohol. 

If your looking for amazing food in a no frills restaurant, stop on by!
author: Jarrett B.

description: Simple, in a good way. We tried the lasagna (on the suggestion of the worker in the front) and the ravioli in white sauce. Both were delicious. Lasagna was a large portion (probably a serving for 2 people) so I'd recommend it for sharing. The ravioli was good but the real winner was the white sauce, I think I would have eaten anything with this sauce and I usually don't care for white sauces. Would come back but only when they first open and there is no line. I've passed by previously when the lines were out the door and I don't think I would have wanted to wait (even after visiting and trying it for the first time)
author: Breck O.

description: This was by far the best meal we had on our vacation to San Francisco! The staff was amazing and you walk in to a small and straight to the point interior. Tables, chairs and an open kitchen. I am Italian and am very critical of Italian food and this was a home run. From the scratch made pasta, to the perfectly cooked meatballs and the sauce that you need to slap your mom for. My kids even finished their adult sized portions!! Please check this place out!!!
author: Joe O.

description:
Excellent pasta! Devoured the gnocchi with bolognese sauce and meatballs. Gnocchi were soft pillows. I will never eat the stuff from the grocery store again. Had the special smoked burrata salad (all burrata should be smoked!) with a vinaigrette dressing. Normally, not a huge fan of the tart vinaigrette, so happy to discover its sweet cousin. Finished it all off with the salted caramel pana cotta. 

Nipped a bite of my friend's pesto gnocchi and felt The bolognese was the better choice. 

Food came fast on a busy Monday evening.  Only constructive thing was they serve the pasta on a paper plate, which looked like it was going to fall apart if you move it too much.
author: Jennifer C.

description: This was amazing home made pasta. Huge portions I couldn't even begin to finish but kept wanting to eat because it was so good. You choose your pasta then your sauce then you can add meatballs or sausages.
author: Stacey R.

description:
So glad I found this place in San Fran! My family and I were looking for a casual place with great food, because we had been traveling all day and were super tired. This place was PERFECT. 
We are very Italian and are particular with our pasta dishes, and Italian Homemade Co was amazingly authentic and fresh. Really felt like we were back in Italy. My mom and I had tagliatelle marina and my dad had tagliatelle bolognese. We also got two salads which were quite tasty. The dressing was perfect. 
The pasta is freshly made right there in the kitchen, you can see it being made. The service is so so quick, perfect for a relaxing night all about good food. We were in and out of there in under 30 mins! 
We are definitely going back soon. Maybe tomorrow night.
author: Ally C.

description: Grew up in North Beach, and I can't believe this was my first time here. Definitely recommend the meatballs and flatbread. I love meatballs, and I usually order spaghetti and meatballs if it's available on the menu because it's such a classic dish. THESE MEATBALLS ARE AMAZING!! And their sauces are so fresh!! We also got tortellini with pasticciati sauce. Tortellini was cooked just right and the sauce got me again. It's simple, yet so satisfying. It was kind of cold so we sat inside, but on a good day, sitting outside with a plate of their pasta would take me to a relaxing vacation daze.
author: Tatiana T.

description: We've been looking for something delicious but low key. This was amazing and fit the bill. I can't say enough good things. It was simple - they do pasta, and they do it right.
author: Liz B.

description:
As a pasta/italian food addict I was beyond stoked to try this place after I sampled some of my coworkers leftovers. To think this pasta was still amazing even cold, I had to get it myself. 

I ordered the pappardelle with the bolognese and bechamel sauce. They pasta was delicious and tasted oh so fresh. After studying abroad in Europe you can believe how full my heart felt after having legit pasta at such an affordable price.  I couldn't decide between the two sauces on their own so I just combined them and I was so glad I did. It paired so well together. Smother it on their pasta and it was heaven during lunch time. 

They have delivery on caviar now so if you don't have time to head over to the place definitely use this option so you can get this great food in the comfort of your own office/home.
author: Keizzel C.

description: Simply, WOW! Pasta tastes amazing. I ordered the gnocchi with pesto. Price is a little too much since they have small portions, the location is nothing fancy and plates are disposable. But great for a quick lunch and authentic Italian food.
author: Inés R.

description: This was by far the best pasta I have had in ages. It's authentic red sauce sauce and meatballs were next level. The staff were friendly and the service was great
author: Lisa R.

description: Incredible homemade pasta. The burrata cheese is to die for!
author: Emily S.

description: This is a popular spot in North Beach for pasta. We walked in around 6pm on a Saturday and it was packed. You order your food and then wait to stake out a table. The restaurant is very small and it was extremely stressful searching for a table before our food came out. The food itself was average, just basic pasta with your choice of sauce. The price point is also extremely high and totally outrageous, my ravioli on a paper plate was $17. The pesto was really good and the gnocchi was very soft. I got the vegetarian ravioli which seemed undercooked. Overall, I don't get the hype and this is just mediocre Italian food from a crowded hole in the wall. It would probably be better for take out. This is not a good place for a leisurely drawn out meal.
author: Shilpa Y.

description:
What I ordered: 
-Lasagna 

Review of the Lasagna: 
Lasagna was okay, wait time was about 15 minutes. The Lasagna was really salty but the Lasagna slice was pretty big. Made me full for the lunch hour but it is really salty. They burned the bottom of my Lasagna but other than that, this Lasagna is pretty authentic and quite expensive.

Overall, the Lasagna was great. But would be better if it was less salty and burnt.
author: Jonathan Z.

description: Great service and authentic, flavorful, Italian food. It's a bit pricey but you leave feeling very full. Wish we lived in the area so we could eat there more often.
author: Christina S.

description:
I spent a few days in SF and ate my way though a good portion of China town and little Italy. This was the single meal that really disappointed me. I asked for a recommendation from the guy at the register and he said the flatbread sandwich. The thing was so dry it was using all the saliva in my mouth just to chew it. I asked for marinara on the side and thank God he brought it to hydrate my meal. My wife's pesto pasta was okay but not great.

Your seating choices are:
-wait 20 minutes for the family at the sit down table
-sit in uncomfortable high chairs at a table that's about one square foot
-bake outside in the hot sun after competing for one table

I was so jazzed about this place because of the high reviews and maybe I just missed "the dish". I've been asking the person at the front for recommendations everywhere I go and I've NEVER been misled or had a bad meal until now. I was not impressed, and I wish I would have ordered and been recommended something a bit more worthwhile. Sad.
author: Jake A.

description:
This little restaurant is really cute! I love the fact that it's a low maintenance and seat yourself kind of restaurant.

The idea is you wait in line, pick your pasta, pick your sauce, and pick any sides. Sit yourself down and then wait for them to bring your your plate. I had high expectations for this place because my friends had hyped it up so much. I like the idea that you can mix and match and they also make the food right in front of you and you can watch. Also the pastas are handmade which adds an extra layer of authenticity and excitement. 

I opted for the tagliatelle pasta with the pastiacciata sauce which is basically a bolognese sauce with a hint of cream in it to make it creamier. The first plate that was presented to me was completely inedible! The pasta was SO tough, and severely undercooked. I wish they would test the noodles first before plating so as to avoid crushing expectations.  I normally never complain about food or have to return my plate and have them remake it but this time around it was just inedible. 

I asked them to remake it again. TAKE TWO. This time it was much better! The pasta was more cooked and al dente and the sauce was delicious with just the perfect amount of tomato to cream to meat.

All in all,  I love that everything truly is "homemade" here and also the fact that you wait on yourself. It's a great place to kick it with italian food for a chill low key vibe. I'd pay another visit  just to try their other menu options!
author: Connie M.

description: The Italian Homemade Company is a small restaurant with a big heart. My friends introduced this restaurant to me and I am so thankful for it. You can pick your pasta and sauce when you order your food and they will bring it out to you. All of the pasta and sauces are homemade and they are fabulous! I cannot wait to get back to San Francisco and to this restaurant! I can imagine when they are busy it's hard to find a seat because there are not many tables, but they do also have outdoor seating.  I'd guess the best times to visit are for lunch during the week when you have time to sit and relax and enjoy the greatness that is made here.  I don't feel like I have tried enough to make suggestions on specific food items, but I will say the meatballs are delicious and the pappardelle pasta (wide noodles) with Bolognese sauce was also delicious.  I would most definitely recommend this restaurant!
author: Kate D.

description:
THIS IS THE MOST DELICIOUS PASTA I HAVE EVER HAD! My husband and I were in SF for a few days and found ourselves exploring around the Italian district. We had coffee at a shop down the street an decided to look up reviews on restaurants nearby. I found this restaurant here, on Yelp and read unanimously positive reviews. They were right! I had the special of the day, ricotta and spinach stuffed gnocchi (roll?) topped with bolognese sauce and I added a side of meat balls with it as well. My husband got a warm Italian style sandwich that was stuffed with sausage, spinach, and cheese. Both meals were sooo tasty! I could really only describe it as Italian comfort food, it just feeds the soul. 

The atmosphere sort of feels like an Italian deli. You order at the counter and pay before you seat yourself. The staff was very friendly, but didn't speak the best English. We didn't mind though, because they were eager to try to answer any questions we had and it is part of the authentic feel the restaurant has. No complaints here, I would definitely revisit and highly recommend this little gem!
author: Lexi A.

description: I loved this place. Delicious, authentic Italian. Small space for seating but if you can snag a seat outside it makes the dining experience that much better.
author: Maleah O.

description:
At first, I couldn't justify forking over nearly $20 for pasta that came on a paper plate but...
The gnocchi is really good! Not chewy or hard, but gives a nice pillowy bite. Ordered a duck gnocchi plate for lunch and yes, it was hearty but so delicious. If you were to eat pasta on a cloud, this may be it. The texture is perfect, fresh and heavenly. 
For the amount you pay per plate, there wasn't a ton of duck in the dish. But ugh, the gnocchi was so fresh. So yes, this makes it to my "things I will crave" list. I will be back for that delicious gnocchi.
author: Amy L.

description:
INCREDIBLE and authentic Italian pasta in SF!
would go here again and again if I lived in the area.
I had the bolognese and the parpadelle and was not the least bit disappointed. Still dreaming.
author: Lynn G.

description: Excellent pasta and bolognese sauce. This place is really small and doesn't serve alcohol.  Food is served on paper plates. Perfect to grab a good Italian pasta but more of a small deli than a restaurant.
author: Kris L.

description: It's solid Italian food- fresh, rich, and tasty.  The salad was good.  The ravioli was tasty and lasagna is fantastic.  I wish I had the appetite to try more dishes- ie: pesto anything.  The only problem is the kitchen isn't heating the food enough and both our dishes had cold centers.  I like that there's free water and a good vibe all around.
author: Scott H.

description: The only improvement I dare suggest: double the salt in the cooking water. Otherwise, an absolutely perfect pasta place: hole-in-the-wall style, unfussy, no-tablecloth. And they have Chinotto in the fridge.
author: Meng Weng W.

description: Delish delish delish! Food that makes me want to just slow down and Enjoy Along with a little tear in my eye!
author: Raykell F.

description: Excellent lasagna,  great tortellini...all homemade and yummy!  Service was great,  very friendly and helpful with the menu.   Would be really great if they had alcohol.
author: Lori P.

description:
Great pasta. Their menu is pretty cool as it offers a customizable selection of pasta paired with your choice of sauce.

My girlfriend had the Butter & Sage gnocchi and I had the meatball bolognese. Both were very good and pretty good portions. I don't think I could eat the Butter & Sage by itself without the switch of some bites of red sauce dish and/or bread, but it was still very good. Not to mention perfectly soft gnocchi!
author: Aaron M.

description: The quality of the pasta is super evident and the salad is SO good. I really would love to come again and try everything else.
author: Natashia S.

description:
Italian Homemade has the best pasta in the City - at any price! I'm a big fan of all of their pasta dishes, especially the meat lasagne, which is super stacked with at least 8 (count them!) layers, and their meat tortellini with pesto sauce. Their meatballs are excellent too - very tender, juicy, and meaty.

I've also tried their gnocchi roll and Piadina sandwiches - they're fine, but they don't really compare to their pasta, which is not only handmade but also hand cut! 

Although their sauces are excellent, I often buy their fresh pasta to cook at home with my own sauce. Although it is pricey at about $12/lb, it's totally worth it, and is noticeably superior to any other fresh store bought pasta.
author: Allen T.

description: Amazing lasagne, best meal we've had in San Francisco. And the place is made up so well, a very cute and cosy eatery.
author: Andrea T.

description: For the price, this is probably the freshest and tastiest pasta you'll get in San Francisco. I had the tortellini with pastiacciata sauce -- a great combo! I think what I like the most about this place is that it serves great Italian food without the arrogance of a lot of different Italian restaurants seem to have. If you want good Italian food without the whole sit-down restaurant rigmarole, this is probably the place for you.
author: Stephen S.

description: Our family of 6 went for dinner. The place was packed. While waiting I noticed a couple had just about licked their plates clean. All good signs in my book. We all ordered pasta. We received generous portions and yummy sauces. We split a plate between my younger girls and they weren't able to eat it all. Big helpings.
author: Maren B.

description:
Absolutely love this place for some comfort, hardy Italian food. I vow to try something new everytime and go back to my meat lasagna each time. For being such a heavy dish they make it actually feel pretty light, non greasy and like a sweet grandma spent hours making this for me!

Will keep coming back to this charming place and maybe someday eat something apart from the lasagna!
author: Rachel N.

description:
Ordered the vegetarian lasagna with sauce so the total was about $11 - it was ok but I still thought it was dry considering that the veg lasagna unlike the regular doesn't have any sauce within the layers to start with. Nothing special- but at least its large enough for two. 

If I was to order anything else, I would try the pesto pappardelle. Place is cute but round tables inside are flimsy and seats are stools so not the most comfortable.

Overall I would try again if I'm in the city; however customer service isn't the greatest either...
author: Xochi R.

description:
For the overall environment and pasta, this place is worth checking out! The taste of the actual pasta (for both my friend and I) wasn't too flavorful but certainly not bland. So if you're looking for really flavorful pasta, maybe this isn't the place for your taste buds but it's definitely worth giving a try nonetheless!

Do be wary this isn't a big restaurant and customers will be coming and going and possibly bumping into you, especially if you sit at the tables near the cash register.
author: Christie C.

description:
I ordered dinner here via Amazon Restaurants and did not have a great experience. 

First, the order came over half an hour late. My scheduled delivery was by 8:47PM. Around that time, the deliver person called to say he's running 15 minutes late. It turns out he was more than 30 minutes late. Moreover, he had the audacity to mark my food as "Delivered" prior to even calling me about being late! 

I ordered the pappardelle with meat and bechamel sauce. As you can see from my picture, my pasta had nearly no visible sauce (and was stuck together and hardened because the delivery took so long). There was some sauce, but it was all stuck towards the bottom. The taste was pretty good, so I'm giving them the benefit of the doubt that had the delivery not been messed up, or had I eaten in the restaurant, the food might've been pretty decent. 

I do like the price. The pappardelle + meat sauce was maybe $12, which is very affordable! Similar caliber restaurants in SF charge almost double that price for this dish. As such, I would be willing to give this place another try.
author: Jennifer W.

description: THIS PLACE IS A SOLID FLAG CARRIER OF ITALIAN CUISINE. Feeling freshness on every bite. I got the meat ravioli w pesto and was terrific. I also tried the fettuccine w shrimps special that was so good as well. Loved it definitely recommended for everyone who craves for italian.
author: Zeynep D.

description: I love The Italian Homemade Co. Our meal was better than good. I had the gnocchi with butter and sage, truly enjoyed the combo.  You can buy fresh pasta noodles here as well. The quality of the food exceeded the price point. A casual dining experience.  Just wish I could order a glass of wine with my pasta.
author: Rebecca R.

description: For the first time today I walked into this lovely and simple little space. I'm in love. I was in heaven hearing people speak Italian. The chef helped me selected some pasta and sauce to go with the burrata I bought. He offered a few tips for preparation and I was off. The gnocchi is perfect and the marinara amazing in its simple and clean flavor balance. So happy!
author: Jennifer G.

description: Incredible fresh pasta! The bolognese, the pesto, the marinara all great! Great for take out as a delicious last minute dinner.
author: paul k.

description: The food was amazing, we shared the lasagna, parradelle, and cossini. Great sauce and meatballs.
author: Robert K.

description: This place has the BEST PASTA! 100/10 recommend coming here. It was cute, small, and very casual. The pasta is handmade and fresh and you pick the type of noodles and sauce.
author: Taylor R.

description: Excellent pasta. You can taste the quality because it tastes unlike any pasta you've ever had before. Friendly cashier. Great location, right off Columbus in North Beach. I had the gnocchi with bolognese and white sauce. Phenomenal. I only wish they had more seating and served wine!
author: Elizabeth G.

description:
I was in the area and was looking to grab a quick dinner with friends, so I decided to give Italian Homemade Company another shot. The first time I came, it was just so so, but I figured it was because I ordered the wrong things. 

I was originally eyeing the vegetarian cassoni, but unfortunately they were out =( so I decided on the gnocchi with pesto. My friend ordered the cassoni with sausage, bacon, potatoes and mozzarella. 

Our orders came out quick and this was much better than before! GET THE GNOCCHI AND NOT THE GNOCCHI ROLL!! These are pillows of heaven, so soft! And the pesto is yum. I tried a bite of my friend's dish and it delicious as well! I wish it came with some sort of sauce; it's on the drier side, so we were dipping it in my pesto sauce. But flavor wise it was on point! 

Great place for an affordable, quick dinner in North Beach.
author: Noelle H.

description:
One of the most authentic and tasty Italian restaurants I have ever been in the US. Since my family is Italian and I visit the country often, I can say that this restaurant's food, environment, and staff made me feel in Italy (mostly the male Italian owner who was absolute cordial).

I didn't even get the chance to take pictures of the food since we devoured it, but trust me, it was all great. My friends and I tried and LOVED the lasagna, the tagliatelle al pesto, the vegetarian ravioli with marinara, gnocchi with white sauce, and the tarta di nutella.
However, some other friends got the sausage, bacon, potato, mozzarella Cassoni and the tiramisu and didn't love it as much.
author: Maria Q.

description:
Visited this place for dinner on a Friday night. 

Order- gnocchi with pesto sauce and vegetarian ravioli with white sauce. 

Ambience- simple, no frills homely atmosphere. Reminded me of restaurant&grocery shop in Italy indeed! 

Taste- gnocchi with pesto was a bomb. Pasta and the sauce tasted fresh and homemade. Loved the flavor of parmigiano reggiano (not Parmesan cheese).

Vegetarian ravioli was a meh. The ravioli was not cooked completely- the edges were hard. However the white sauce tasted great. 

Service- quick and friendly. we opted the sit out option. I had to order the food and wait for about 10 minutes for my order to be delivered. 

Cost - ~$25 for two. 

Will I return in future- Pastas and the sauces are made fresh in-house with authentic parmigiano reggiano which I loved. So i will be definitely returning back just for gnocchi with pesto!
author: Dee S.

description: Simple and fantastic. The staff is extremely warm and very helpful. The food.. oh my goodness the gnocchi is to die for. We'll be back. Thank you
author: Christie W.

description:
The food equivalent of drinking Veuve from a plastic cup.

Perfection, is perfection, no matter the vessel. 

Italian homemade is for the those with champagne pallets with soda budgets. This place basically gives pasta luxury to everyone.

Each dish is handcrafted, made fresh with authentic Italian ingredients and served up up fast on a paper plate. Classy as f*ck. It's italian perfection without all the fanfare. No white tablecloth and fancy silverware, just perfect italian food, made fresh. And when the days batch of Lasagna is gone - it's gone. (And yes, it happens often).

So if you are truly craving some good food without the fuss, raise that plastic fork and get some!
author: Sara Ann S.

description: Best pasta I've ever had. Hands down. Unbelievable. It's so fresh and their sauce is amazing. Nothing else to say.
author: Evan H.

description: One of the most authentic Italian places in SF! Even the atmosphere. So fulfilling and it's not even expensive! It's just like what you get in Italy.
author: Leonardo Sean Y.

description:
Had the lasagna. Home made deliciousness. Love the no frills atmosphere. Just order your food at the counter and sit down. Food was cheap for San Francisco.

Only minus, I wish they offered wine. A Chianti would have been great with the red sauce.
author: Andrew W.

description: This was sooooo disgusting that I couldn't even finish my meal. I felt like I had ordered a drink because there was so much oil. There was more oil than food! The pasta itself is fine, nothing more. I don't understand the hype. Honestly, I felt like I needed a lifeguard so I wouldn't drown in all that oil! Abominable.
author: Brandon M.

description: From service to food to location all 5 stars. The Gnoco roll was delicious and the pesto we had on our tortellini tasted as if the herbs were picked fresh the very same day. Loved every bit of it!
author: Nicole K.

description:
This restaurant is located in North Beach, which is this cute little Italian area within the city. We sat there, while it rained, by the window eating. It was very relaxing. The service was great, the employees were all nice and one guy was funny. I wish I got his name! 

I had the fettuccine with butter and rosemary. It was SO good, hit the spot perfectly. I don't remember which pasta my boyfriend had, but he was in heaven. I also had the Tiramisu, who'd is to die for! I would definitely go back for more!
author: Star A.

description:
Pasta, pasta!

Have been meaning to eat in this little place in my neighborhood for a while and finally got to do it this weekend. The two dishes we tried, Gnocchi with Pesto Sauce and Lasagne with Bolognese Sauce, were both tasty and good. If I had to pick on something, it would be that I like the pasta a bit al dente and these were soft. With that said, I loved the sauces, especially the bolognese sauce. The place is tiny, but they sure serve many people. As we were having our meal, people were just streaming in and out of there. Good food!
author: Afshin A.

description:
Everything about this restaurant was great!!! The pasta was delicious mouth watering delicious and the service was impeccable.  I will be dreaming about this pasta for awhile it literally melted in your mouth. YES, YES, YES! 


Gnocchi, antipasto plate, grilled shrimp with feta, spinach ravioli, meat ravioli, chicken Alfredo every bite was excellent!  You can tell everyone here takes pride in the food served everything was fresh!
 
We loved our waitress my daughter had  a stomachache and our waitress over heard our conversation and she suggested some soda water which she brought out to her, we appreciated truly every detail of this restaurant!!! We will definitely be back!!! 

Thank you for a great experience!!!
author: Susie M.

description: We made our way up to Italian Homemade Company last night.  It was a great little spot filled with locals and tourists. Most of the staff was very courteous and the restaurant was clean.  We thoroughly enjoyed the fresh pasta.  The sauces were great but not amazing.  This would have been a five star review if it were not for the horrible excuse for tiramisu we ordered for dessert.
author: F C.

description:
I would not recommend eating here.  I lived in Italy for 12 years and this was nothing that resembles Italian cuisine.   No flavor in the food, small portions, food served on paper plates, and bread wasn't even severed.  The serving size, quality of service, and atmosphere did not warrant the price paid.  

There are several other choices for Italian Restaurants in the area.  If you're looking for a dit down meal try them first.   In consideration for this establishment, the service was fast.
author: Michael Scott P.

description:
I yelped Italian food and this place came up close to my aunt's house and had good reviews.  We walked in and immediately saw the man making pasta which was pretty cool, however the sign that said order further down was turned around and when we asked the man making pasta he didn't even acknowledge us standing there.

So that was fun, we walked to the next counter and ordered our food and sat down.  Our pasta came quickly and was delicious.  Then our salad came and though we asked for dressing on the side it came on top and nobody ever visited our table while we were eating to ask us if everything was all right so we got up to ask them to fix it.

We got a salad that was correct and it tasted fine.  Overall, I would say the service (and lack of signs) was subpar but the food was exceptional.  This place should have been slammed with the quality of food, but I would guess the service being lackluster has hurt the business.  Overall I loved the food and would go back again but I wouldn't hold my breath for any service.
author: Jill B.

description:
My friend, Josh, was visiting me from Texas and kept raving about this place which he stumbled across because it was so close to the hotel he was staying at.  So the day before he left, he took me to it.  Oh boy, was it good!  

The pasta noodles are made in house which made a huge difference in taste.  Prices are cheap and portions ranged from just right to humungous!  The lasagna, which was only $12, is cut to a size that would feed two in most other restaurants.  This place was so good that I started raving about it to my boyfriend.  

The place looks like a cheap donut shop so I wouldn't recommend taking a date here but I saw a  few men picking up food to go.  One guy walked in with a paper bag that had flowers and a bottle of wine sticking out of it.  Smart man.  I plan to copy him and pick up dinner here for a candlelit dinner the next time my boyfriend comes over for supper after work. 

Awesome food.  Low prices.  If you want to impress someone, do not eat here but, instead, pick up the food to go.  Highly recommend!
author: Linda H.

description: The lasagna here is amazing! They serve a huge portion that's more than enough for two. Very friendly staff and delicious food! The vibe isn't exactly Italian but the food sure is!
author: Mina T.

description:
I know that it's a difficult task to find great food for a great price, but in this case I will say they have exceeded my expectations. 
I had ñoquis with Bolognese sauce and my wife had lasagna. The ñoquis were melting in my mouth faster that my brain was able to process all its flavors. 
It is a very small venue that made a big impression on us. Authentic Italian food made from scratch with natural ingredients. I will say that the only thing missing was a glass of red wine, since they don't serve alcohol. 
PS: Save some room for Tiramisu
author: Marcelo B.

description: Not a lot of parking around. They make there own pasta noodles fresh everyday. Lots of options, lots of people. I liked the pesto ravioli I ordered.
author: Lala B.

description:
We were in SF for a week vacation and I made sure to hit up all the hot spots based on Yelp. Coming here was so worth it.  If you're an out of towner...it might feel a bit intimidating at first and that's a good and bad thing.

Good, because you feel like you just walked into someones moms kitchen...hustle and bustle in the kitchen, its a pretty small space inside but not uncomfortable. It felt very home...then again the bad in that could be you feel out of place if you're not a local. All in all, the ambience alone made it feel super homey and delightful.

Onto the food! I can't imagine anywhere that has pasta that tastes as good as this place...probably the closest thing to Italy you're gonna get in SF. We tried lasagna, 
Tagliatelle Pasta with meatballs, Fettuccine with white sauce.  It can be a little pricey, but worth every damn penny! There's a bit of a process when ordering but someone lovely and helpful is always there to walk you through or guide you :-) Lovely people, good vibes, amazing amazing FOOD!

AAA+++
author: Ed A.

description:
As a tourist in SF, I would never have found this place had it not been for Yelp - so, thank you, fellow Yelpers. 

I made my way over on my last day in San Francisco (for coffee lovers, look across the street for some really incredible beans - no brews, mind you - just beans), and left with a heaping helping of their lasagna - two meatballs added. It was outstanding - so great that I fashioned my own little icebox and brought the leftovers back to Denver with me. It traveled well, and was just as good reheated as it has been on the first day. 

Tip for travelers - ask for some plastic ware if you're staying in a hotel... I forgot to do so, and was too lazy to go back down to the lobby. Ended up eating mine with leftover chopsticks, which wasn't the best way to dig in. :)
author: Stacy P.

description:
Came by today around 12:30 and though the tables were full there was no line waiting to order inside.

Pro Tip: take your food to Washington Square just a block away

I got the veggie lasagne + 2 meatballs to go. They were kind enough to pack it in a tupperware I brought with me. Unfortunately I didn't get a chance to try it since I got it for my sister. The two meatballs for $1.70 weren't much larger than normal meatballs so I'm not sure I would get those again. Of course if sis raves about them I might change my mind.

For myself I got the sausage, bacon, potato cheesy cassone. It's a pretty full sandwich so I was able to split with hubby in nearby Washington Square. It was a little salty due to the sausage and bacon but also really good and filling. Ooey gooey with a nutmeggy bechamel sauce which we poured inside as we ate. Very different than any other sandwich in town and very good.

We also got a side order of piadina which was my favorite part of the whole meal. It was like a Chinese green onion pancake except without the green onions. Fried up, flakey and chewy I was quite happy to eat them plain when they were hot off the skillet.
author: Jean K.

description: If Heaven was one earth I found it!  The bolognese and homemade pasta is amazing. It's tight inside, but people seem to move along fairly quickly. Love from Vegas!
author: Kendra A.

description:
Walking around north beach we did a quick Yelp check to see which restuarants got high marks, so we popped in here

Split a meatball plate with fettuccine noodles. It was very good

I also had the panna  cotta with a caramel sauce and it was de-lish
author: Foodlover B.

description: Hands down the best pasta I have ever had! Good portions , very friendly staff and it feels like I'm at somebodies house.
author: Rick O.

description:
AS of right now they get a 1 star...

I'd LIKE to be able to try their food but... they cancelled an order I've placed Friday at ~4:30pm for Monday at 12pm. The best part is, they cancelled it less than an hour before my lunch meeting where 20 hungry people are waiting for this food from THIS restaurant.

1. If you have to cancel the order, cancel it in advance, not less than an hour before.
2. If you are going to cancel the order, have a better excuse than "we're out of lasagna" on a Monday morning at 12pm when you've just opened for business an hour before. Especially when I've placed the order on Friday, you've had more than 2 days notice to make the lasagna.
3. At least offer other options than to just "cancel" my order altogether, without even asking for my opinion. We don't HAVE TO HAVE your lasagna if you're out of it.
4. WHAT ARE YOU SELLING if YOU'RE OUT OF FOOD ON A MONDAY MORNING?!?!????

I'm just in so much disbelief right now. Maybe one day I'll actually get the chance to taste your food, but for now, this is just so unbelievable.
author: Kimberly W.

description: Casual ambience with good pasta. Their pasta taste so fresh! Loved the pesto gnocchi and mushroom special (see pictures, can't recall the name but the sauce was so delicious). Would definitely go back to try other specials.
author: Joyce C.

description:
Oh my goodness, the pasta here is so good! I need to keep coming back to try all of the combinations! The menu is pretty simple - you choose the cut of pasta you want and the sauce to go with it. There are prices for both the pasta and the sauce, which is a little weird, but I guess it makes sense. There are also a couple of other specialties, such as meatballs, lasagna... and the gnocchi roll! I had to get this because I was so intrigued. It's essentially three thick slices of gnocchi dough stuffed with spinach and ricotta, and then smothered in marinara sauce. It was fantastic! My friends got more traditional pastas, and they looked very good as well. It was so fun to watch the cooks make the orders while waiting in line, and the fact that they were all talking to each other in Italian made me know this place was legit before I even took a bite of their food.

I'd love someone who is better at math to tell me how many pasta/sauce combinations there are on the menu...
author: Dylan C.

description: Found this Gem yesterday after getting off an Alcatraz tour. Don't be fooled by it's small space & paper plates. The food was amazing! So glad we found it! Fresh homemade pasta, delicious fresh sauces. I had the parpardelle & bolognese sauce. Arugula salad with Burrata! Simply delicious. All the staff were so friendly & personable. Really a great experience. Would definitely go back!
author: Kristina P R.

description: It's the freshest pasta I've had in a long time. The staff was friendly and the service was quick. I'm definitely coming here again the next time I'm in SF.
author: Ryan L.

description: I live in North Beach, which is full of Italian restaurants, and this is by far my favorite. Super authentic and fresh food in a casual setting. I bring all of my guests here when they come to town. My fav is the gnocchi with pesto!
author: Samantha H.

description: THIS PLACE..... This place is damn good! I am giving 4 stars instead of 5 because sometimes the workers make you feel stupid for not pronouncing some of the pastas/or sauces correctly (they shouldn't make people feel like that) also the bathroom always smells like sh*t, I know it's a bathroom but geesh.... THE FOOD though... ugh it is SO delicious!! I love the pappadelle (didn't spell that right) and the gnocchi (probably didnt spell that right either) both are so delicious. The meat sauce is to die for, the pesto is fresh tasting and so yummy, and the white sauce is good, it could use a tiny bit more flavor, but overall amazing italian pasta!
author: Anjelica E.

description: I've got to say, this place has some pretty solid food. If you're looking for something cheap and good, this might not be the place for you since minimum 11 dollars for a plate of pasta isn't exactly cheap. However, for the Bay Area, this is pretty damn good. My only gripe besides the price is that the meat raviolis seemed to be a bit underdone on the sides of the ravioli, leaving it a big tough to bite into. But besides that, would recommend coming in and getting anything on the menu. It won't disappoint!
author: Andrew P.

description:
It was quite busy on a Sunday. You wait in line to order and there is limited space. While waiting in line, I caught on how efficient this place was - very impressive. One gal on cashier, one was a runner, and another packed to go food for those who took takeout or delivery services. 

You can look into the kitchen and see fresh pasta being made and each dish made to order (minus lasagna of course) and the sauce. All dishes came out super piping hot though!

You can choose the type of pasta noodle you want and the sauce. There are also paninis and sandwiches. I chose tagliatelle and meatballs- pretty darn good!

I will have to come back and try the pesto next.
author: Neville B.

description: One of the best pasta values in North Beach.  The pasta is fresh and slightly under cooked for that special chewiness.  Sauce and meatballs are amazing as well.
author: Alfred C.

description:
Super tasty and fun hole in the wall (literally) Italian restaurant! It is SMALL so be prepared to take your food to go if you come at a busy time. The atmosphere was so fun though and it was clear nobody minded the line, crowd, or small space! 

You order at the front and then find your seat (which is nice because then people in line can't steal open seats out from under people who have ordered and/or have food)! My fiancé ordered the lasagna and it was a great portion for him (he eats A LOT) and I ordered the gnocchi special -- basically one enormous gnocchi stuffed with spinach and covered with sauce. Taste wise the gnocchi was better, portion wise the lasagna was bigger!

The menu options looked awesome and it seemed hard to make a wrong choice! Definitely recommend. Would definitely come back!
author: Chelsea R.

description:
This place is the real deal. A line almost always. They need to take over the empty space next to them for seating!
The lasagne is the best! All fresh and delicious pastas with terrific sauces. Great spot!
author: Michael S.

description: The BEST Italian food everrrrrrr. I will miss you oh so much. We had the lasagna, the meatballs pasta and sausage sandwich.
author: Kimberly T.

description: Omg just go, eat, and repeat!!! So delicious! The food may be served on paper plates but has the quality and taste of food I've had in Rome.
author: Holly T.

description: From scratch Italian that is the bomb. Loved the homemade pappardelle with bolognese.
author: Maren B.

description: I came by here after they first opened. I've heard great things and wanted to try it for myself. I had the ravioli and it was pretty good. Nothing exceptional, it was a little bland. It could've just been an off day for them. I would come back and try a new dish without a doubt.
author: Brittany B.

description:
I think I would have given this 4-5 stars but it's always so hit or miss depending on the day - the consistency of the taste is really random. Don't get me wrong, MOST of the time it's a hit, but there have been quite a few misses that I need to ding it a couple of stars. And this is just because I live near here and so it's a regular spot for me...
If you haven't been here before, I would say it's worth coming though.

I always have the same thing, I always have tagliatelle with meatballs. Sometimes it's just amazing. If it was like this ALWAYS without a doubt I'd give this place 5 stars. But sometimes it's bland, the pasta's not cooked exactly al dente, the meatball's taste is hit or miss (too overspiced or too bland)....

This is a go-to when Im hungry and can't think of anywhere to eat or crave pasta, but it only get 3 stars.
author: E B.

description:
This order-at-the-counter Italian place in North Beach is, (in my opinion) one of the most authentic Italian places in the city. The meat sauce is OUTSTANDING. Thick, meaty, and perfectly seasoned, I could have eaten an entire meal of just sauce. 

The pasta is made Italian-style and a bit chewier than what we would maybe expect in the US.--But that's the way I like it! 

The restaurant is small and parking is sparse, but it's well worth the trek. I would highly recommend if in the North Beach (Or Marina!) areas and craving for some Italian food the way your grandma would make it.
author: Liz S.

description: Homemade noodles - what's not to love about this place? Yes, it's a small hole in the wall, but the pasta is fantastic.  Flew to SF from LAX to watch Game 4 of Warriors-Rockets playoff series and my daughter and I wanted a place near our hotel to walk to, grab a delicious bite then head back to bed. My daughter, a very experienced traveler who's been to Italy more times than me, loved it too. I ordered the tagliatelle with pesto and she, the pappardelle with the marinara sauce.  The strawberry panna cotta was very good too. If you love pasta, this is one of the places you must go, when in SF.
author: Liza F.

description: This place is amazing! Maybe the best lasagna I've ever had. And the gnocchi, holy moly. Go here
author: Joshua N.

description:
This place is a hidden gem ,  fresh made pasta served in a timely manner. Let me say that I'm very picky with my Italian food especially since I grew up in italy. It's hard to find an Italian place where I feel it's worth going to, however, this place delivers fresh made pasta at a reasonable price.

We ended up getting pappardelle al pasticcio, and gnocchi al pasticcio.  This place is truly perfection, they cooked the pappardelle al dente, and the gnocchi melt in your mouth.  The pasta wasn't drowning in sauce as it should be.
