Concept wise it's genius,  pick your pasta, pick your sauce and voila!  They serve on recycled plates which is great for a fast bite and makes their business run smooth.  I would recommend this place over 90% of Italian places in little italy, this place it's the real deal but don't expect anything fancy.
author: Josh Giosue D.

description: We tried a few items in shop. The gnocchi with pesto. Softest, pillowy gnocchi ever. It was served in a creamy pesto. I prefer non-creamy pesto. My only critique. The meatballs and other pastas we tried were all good. You can taste the difference with home made. Shop is small with little seating. Very friendly staff. Quality food.
author: Carri M.

description:
HOLY CRAP THIS PLACE IS AMAZING!!! My boyfriend was craving pasta so we found this place  and It was GREAT!!! The pasta taste so fresh and cooked to perfection. The bolognese sauce had a rich flavor that made me want to order another. The meat lasagna was the best I've ever had. 
The flatbread is just okay but it was good with salt and olive oil. 
The meatball was delicious!!!! I will definitely be coming back!!
author: Emily G.

description:
Currently, I'm at The Italian Home Made Restaurant. I am starving and I am craving for Lasagna. 

I was welcomed by the nice person in front of the register asking me what I want to order. I told the nice person I wanted Lasagna with extra cheese on top. 

After 10 mins, they finished cooking my Lasagna. Upon digging into the Lasagna, the inside was still cold. They said they will make me another one. Eating the Lasagna right now and it's the best lunch ever that I've had. It's big, the texture is about right and the warmth is perfect.
author: Anthony T.

description:
I walked by this on my way down Columbus Ave. and decided to check it out on Yelp.  I kind of went overboard, getting a salad and pasta and a huge San Pellegrino.  Even with everything I had, the bill was very reasonable.  Seating was a little difficult to find, so I took a seat at the window.  They brought my salad and my tagliatelle to me, which saved me from going through the crowd.

So my opinion of the food: salad was generous and excellent, with grape tomatoes, those fancy kinds of lettuce and a light dressing.  The pasta was very fresh; you can taste the homemade even though the tagliatelle is a little chewier.  Their sauce actually reminded me of the sauces I had experienced in Italy.  A little less paste and a little less in general.  I like a little more sauce so next time I will order some extra.

Service - you place your order at the counter - and feel free to order in Italian, I think they will appreciate it.  Good recycling effort - I appreciate that.
author: Keith S.

description:
Ordered the papardelle, combo bechemel. Pasta texture was good. Sauce... not like my grandma's (is restaurant Italian ever as good as a real nonna's? ha! Rarely if ever, IMHO.) So, it was passable for 'restaurant Italian,' if you're having a craving. Don't expect over the moon, as I was, thanks to all the other 5-star reviews. Scratching my head about the over-the-top raves. 

Environment: plastic chairs, paper plates, bustling deli-type atmosphere. Not one in which you are encouraged to linger. I think they aim for you to take-out.

I'm always hoping to find that eyes-roll-back-in-your-head red sauce/Sunday gravy/marinara/ as-good-as-I-grew-up-with. It's an endless search, with no luck yet. Wondering if I should start a biz, bottling my Nonna's recipe...
author: Carolyn F.

description: Ehhhh. I expected a lot more from fresh pasta and the reviews. I've gone to the pasta factory which is owned by the same people and it was slightly better. I got the burrata salad and fettuccine with bolognese sauce. You choose your pasta and you choose your pasta sauce. The have pretty simple sauces (marinara, bolognese, white). The portions are good, but the pasta isn't great. The pasta was all stuck together, making a bunch of it not saucy since it wasn't mixed with the bolognese sauce. The temperature was almost kind of cold on the sides and sauce but a lot hotter where the fettuccine was clumped together. It's very mediocre for the price. The place is also small and crowded. It's not somewhere I will go back to or crave. I think I can make pasta like that at home by mixing ragu and ground beef and make it taste better by not using their fresh pasta.
author: Olivia C.

description: We were on the way to Lombard street when we passed by this Italian restaurant. You can smell the deliciousness from across the street. We ordered the lasagne and garlic bread and they were both great. We didn't have to wait that long before we ordered the food. Make sure to outside for a great view of busy San Francisco. I'm glad we stopped by randomly to try this place out.
author: Andrea T.

description:
This is the place that I've been waiting for.  A legit, fast casual pasta restaurant that is actually really good.  You pick what kind of pasta and what kind of sauce you want and everything is reasonably priced.  The pasta was fresh and perfectly al dente with a great texture.  Seriously, I've had pasta at other restaurants that aren't as good but costs twice as much.  We also tried the meatball cassoni, which was really cheesy and delicious as well.  The bread on the outside is also housemade and delicious.

They also have sauces and housemade pasta for purchase.  So glad that there's a good, affordable, homemade pasta place around now.  Wish I lived closer!
author: Tiffany C.

description: Pretty good food for a great price! They do not have wine or beer which is a bummer...I would have had the tiramisu if I had a nice glass of wine. This place gets packed, but people get in and out quickly. Avoid tables near the order counter, you will get bumped into constantly by the staff delivering food....
author: Audrey L.

description:
By far the worst pasta possible. Heard all the best reviews of this place; fresh pasta, made to order, good stuff really. Prices were reasonable for a tourist trap, place had a good vibe, cozy family feel to it.

Friend got the lasagna with marinara sauce. I got the tagitelle with meatballs and Bolognese.

Lasagna was tough and bland. "The marinara sauce was the best thing on the plate"

Tagitelle was tough, parts were stuck together and cold in those pieces. Meatballs were like little sponges. Obviously frozen and badly put together. Overall bland.

Stopped friend from finishing his lasagna because I cannot abide shit food touted as 'fresh and homemade'. Threw the lot away and got us to a cafe up around the corner for a quick pick me up.

Friend felt queasy soon after and had some strong ginger tea to calm his stomach down.

This place had a great reputation and was recomended by a few friends of mine, but what they experienced was obviously not what I or my friend did.

Don't go to this place. Definitely not real italian values here.
author: Ivan J.

description: Such a great little place! Fresh made everything. I had the Gnocchi with Pesto and I was some of the best gnocchi I've ever had! It's a small place and if you blink you'll miss it, but those are usually the best places in my opinion. The people are very nice and their menu is simple and easy to u understand, you pick a pasta, then pick a sauce. Seating is limited, but they do take out also. I'll defenantly return here if I'm in North Beach again.
author: Gade M.

description: omg sooo good! Got the bolognesse with meat balls on tagliatelle. Everything is fresh and made from scratch. Why would you ever go to any of the fancy/over priced restaurants in North Beach when you have the best pasta place serving fresh home made italian food for half the price. Luckily I don't live in SF otherwise I'd get fat from eating this every week.
author: Kevin S.

description: I went to this place for the first time this week and it was amazing. The lasagna is really delicious. I'm definitely going to go back next week after work. It has a great location and really friendly staff. I wish they had a bike share station nearby so it was easier to get to. Definitely check this place out next time you're in the area.
author: Patrick T.

description:
I ordered a typical dish (pappardelle with bolognese and meatballs) but I don't understand the good reviews. I've been making pasta since high school, and I'm very familiar with the texture of al dente. To my surprise, the pasta was a strange hard doughy texture I had never tasted before, without the chew/bite of pappardelle I've had elsewhere. The sauce was very bland as well, I kept having to add salt. The tomato sauce tasted, well, very tomatoe-y...low on herb flavor (with large chunks of herbs that I had to spit out). Lastly, the paper plates soaked up a lot of the sauce and gave it a cardboard-y flavor. This place may be a staple of North Beach, but I just can't fathom what other people are tasting to warrant the almost-5 star rating.

Service was wonderful, it's a very happening location, but honestly, I could not go back for the food. Just to give you a sense of my taste for pappardelle - some of my favorites are Delarosa, Bestia in DTLA, and Mama Di's Italian Kitchen in Manhattan Beach.
author: Fiona Y.

description:
This is an awesome Italian place. I think it's the best one actually. It's always pretty packed and busy. But that only tells about the high quality of the food they are serving. 

Honestly love it. I'm really lucky to find it.
author: Iryna S.

description: Simple but delicious.  Pastas were freshly made and the sauces were great.  We had the parpadelle with bolognese, brown sage butter, and their white sauce.  I had the spaghetti cacio pepe (today's special)and I loved it.  Tiramisu is a must order.  I would definitely come back here on my next visit.
author: Carmella P.

description:
I don't even know where to begin with this review. I read up on this place prior to vacationing in San Francisco and it was one of the "must visit" locations on my list.

The place is small-and nestled in the "Little Italy" section of San Francisco. So many small mom and pop restaurants surrounded the area and the aroma of amazing food was everywhere-but I had my Target.

When we arrived it was packed. In time we would learn it was with good reason. We ordered our meal, grabbed our beverages and found an open table-and were met with someone there to clean it for us.

The meal arrived not much longer than us sitting down and it was beyond what I anticipated.

I ordered the gnocchi roll stuffed with spinach and ricotta with a layer of their bolognese on top. The taste is indescribable. I would eat it again in a heartbeat. The gnocchi was perfect cooked and the spinach and ricotta were layered throughout. The bolognese was very flavorful and the Parmesan was obviously quality.

If I lived here-this would be a weekly visit.
author: Ashley M.

description: I like that this place is easygoing and no-fuss. You can pop in for a quick pasta plate, mix and match sauces + carbs to make it yours, plus ask for recommendations from staff who'll happily provide. The gnocchi could be more "pillowy," but will satisfy most cravings. Some worse-quality pasta is definitely being served in more formal atmospheres, perfectly-plated yet soggy. I can appreciate this simple, homemade approach--it feels like a come one, come all type of spot. Arrive knowing no tomatoes can top Italy. ;) Leave full belly & happy.
author: Jackie G.

description: I love love love Italian food and was so excited to discover this place since they make fresh pasta here. The place is quite small inside so you may have trouble finding a place to sit but it's worth the slight inconvenience. There are also a few tables outside too. The service was top notch. When you enter, you first go up to the counter to place your order, then you just find a seat wherever you can. When your food is ready, they bring it over to you. I ordered the meat ravioli with white sauce (not Alfredo - they said it's similar to Alfredo sauce except there's no Parmesan cheese in it, but they'll put some on top). At first it didn't look like much food but there was raviolis hidden underneath and it turned out to be more food than I could finish. Great flavor but if you're looking for ravioli that is filled with a lot of meat, you're not going to get that. It was very lightly filled with meat and ricotta which was fine with me because if I wanted a lot of meat, I would've had a burger instead. Once you're done eating, you clean up your own table/dishes. There's nothing about this place I didn't love.
author: Kathleen L.

description: The best gnocchi I have ever had and you have several different sauces to choose from. Highly recommend the pesto. Tasted so fresh and definitely was homemade. This is a cute little restaurant and feels like a mom and pop shop. Will definitely be back!
author: Crystal T.

description:
Yum! There's a ton of pasta options in Little Italy, but I really wanted to try this place because their pasta is handmade and you get to customize the sauce to toss it in.  Authentic and freshly rolled pasta with your choices of sauce for less than $15! I had the tagliatelle with meatballs and bolognese sauce. So it was double meat! The meatballs were huge and flavorful. I ended up eating half and packing the other half for dinner. 

I seriously couldn't decide between all of different pastas like gnocchi, ravioli, squid ink and tortellini. And then you have to choose a delicious sauce too. It all looked so good and your pasta is made fresh to order. You order at the counter and grab a seat. 

I definitely will be back to try their sandwiches and salads too.
author: Linda H.

description: Went here for the first time last night. Ordered the meat ravioli with the combo sauce of bolognese and bechamel. ....excellent! Simple delicious. Will definitely come back. Not the best place if you are looking to dine for hours but great for take out or a quick bite.
author: Marwin D.

description: When I visited here, I had high expectations because I had gone to their other location on Union St. before and had a wonderful experience. However, the pasta here came out overcooked and the pasta itself was inconsistent in shape and size. Definitely disappointed with the pasta, and the sauce itself was not as flavorful as the bolognese at the other location. Their mixed berry panna cotta was delicious though. I would recommend others to go to their other location on Union St. instead!
author: Miki O.

description:
This is my favorite place to eat in my neighborhood. The most wonderful Italian meals I've had in America since living in Florence come from Italian Homemade, and everyone who works there humors my rusty Italian. 
The best meal to order there is simple: choose a pasta, choose a sauce. Just plain marinara on fettuccini is mind-blowingly flavorful. I ordered gnocchi with pesto so many times that I think I've permanently ruined pesto from all other Italian restaurants for myself.
author: Marissa B.

description: We were looking for a local restaurant while in San Francisco a few weeks ago. Saw the reviews on Yelp, and was very worthwhile to find this place!  Everything so authentic, food quality and choices, the staff was very friendly, and I loved the Italian folk tunes they had playing- same thing plays on my phone!  You can see they are very enthused about serving you a great meal, and making you feel welcome.  Keep up the great work guys!
author: L T.

description:
Affordable, and delicious. Homemade pastas with the perfect al dente texture, for a fraction of the cost of the fancy Italian restaurants around SF. The meatball cassoni, an almost pita-like bread filled with cheese and meatballs with a delicious sauce on the side, really hit the spot as well. I think this is comparable to some of the best pastas we had in Italy.

It's fast casual so you order at the counter, but the staff at the register were extremely nice and helpful during our order.

SF needs more affordable-but-delicious food options like this place!
author: Kazu O.

description: OMFG delicious.  Freshest pasta ever and perfectly sauced.  Real Italians doing it right -- even add a lil bit of the starchy water to the sauce.  My relatives are 90 miles south of Roma so I know good pasta.  Be prepRed to get it to go if no seating.  Excellent. Busy.  Worth it !!
author: James M.

description:
This place is exactly what it should be...Superb!

Yelp is pretty reliable when it comes to dining suggestions. Based on the numerous positive comments we chose to eat at "Italian Homemade Company" for "linner". 

The wife ordered Tagliatelle with meat sauce and you could taste how fresh the pasta was. Really nice...but, if you want to taste something that is life changingly good, GET THE LASAGNA!!! It also had the fresh pasta layered within and once you took a bite, you were rewarded. Fresh ingredients made what is typically a heavy dish and made it not so heavy. The loveliness continues with a bit of mozzarella at the end of your bite to chew and savor. So good. The portion was pretty big...I'd say about 2/3rds the size of a common everyday brick. It's more than enough for you plus enough for someone to taste and regret ordering whatever they got (idiots). 

The place is situated in an area that had surprisingly ample parking, but I coulda just been lucky. Inside, you grab a menu and pretend to look things over, step up and order your food (lasagna) and find a place to sit. There is clearly one "best spot" to sit and then a bunch of wobbly high tops with stools with comparable wobble build in. If you're lucky enough to get "the spot", enjoy the photo of the Trojan sitting on a scooter...awesomeness! 

Food comes out quick, you clean up after yourself and go home happy. Super simple and super yummy. 

I WILL RETURN!
author: Sterling S.

description: My husband and I had the best pasta ever during our trip in San Francisco. All we were craving one night was pasta and came across this cute little restaurant. We enjoyed two different pastas and they were SO DELICIOUS. I don't remember the pasta names but everything on their menu sounds perfect. I would give this place 10 stars if I could.
author: Jessica T.

description: This is probably one of the best Italian restaurants ever!! The food is ready within 5 minutes and it comes out fresh. Everything on the menu is homemade and the service is great. Not to mention the great taste of music.  Best meal I've had in a long time!
author: Reitsma F.

description:
One of my favorite Italian restaurants! It has such an authentic feel and the food is simple yet amazing. The service was really nice too. It's a casual restaurant - you order at the counter and pick a spot inside or outside to sit at. The place wasn't too big and it was really crowded already at on off hour so probably not best for large groups.

I ordered the tagliatelle pasta with meatballs sauce (Bolognese sauce and 2 meatballs) for $12. It came with cheese on top and was served piping hot on a paper plate. The serving size was large and well worth the price! The meatballs were insanely good and the pasta tasted so fresh. I'm a huge fan and will definitely be back to try the other pasta and sauce combos.
author: Linda X.

description:
OMG! now this is authentic food. forget about italian, food. i bet the owner is like george costanza when he did the opposite. all the flavors in the food are the complete opposite of all flavors included in all 'italian' restaurants in town. not that many places use these types of ingredients that make every bite special. the meatballs are out of this world and the pasta is just great. kudos to u for opening this place, whoever u are. can't wait to go there again!
ps: our food tasted great, even though we took it home raw and cooked it there.
author: Willie Y.

description: This place looked good because of the reviews; however, the pasta was super salty. If u want to keep a good diet and u don't like salty I recommend to not come here
author: Katelyn N.

description:
Molto Bene! Lasagna grande... what a fantastic find, to be clear this is a hole in the wall with maybe 5 tables in the whole place. 

Food- would give it 6 stars easy, better than any Italian restaurant at home. Wife had the Lasagna and it was fantastic and enough for two, my daughter had some outstanding meat ravioli and she literally linked the plate, I had the gnocchi with two meatballs...BAM! 

We are going back tonight, that's right a whole city to explore and we are saying to heck with it... back to Italian Homemade!

You will not be disappointed
author: Mike B.

description: This would be a 5 star but they serve on paper plates. Fresh pasta on paper plates is just wrong. The Bolognese was right on. Big portions, so big the wife and I said next time we'll split a pasta and split a salad. The Burrata salad looked fantastic. It all looked fantastic, Lasagna, Cassoni everything.
author: Jimmy T.

description:
Very nice, homey restaurant featuring house made pastas including delicious gnocchi, tortellini, lasagna and ready-made pastas you can cook at home.

The atmosphere is very casual (dining in, they serve your meal on heavy duty paper plates). 

Given its close quarters and less-than-comfortable seating, I think it's more set-up as a to-go business.  I noticed that most people who came in were picking up meals or pasta to cook at home.

There are 3-4 high cafe tables and about 8 window-facing seats but to be honest, all the seating was less-than-ideal. The high cafe table was very wobbly and the window seats we eventually moved to for stability are tightly arranged with small stools that you need to carefully balance on.

I had the gnocchi and asked the woman at the register (they all appear to be family or at least good friends) which sauce she'd recommend. She said "the pesto." It was terrific. 

My little boy wanted the tortellini and the small bite I had, enveloped in delicious homemade Bolognese sauce, was fantastic. 

I forgot about the meatballs and ordered them after we began eating. I had a bite, letting my little boy finish the rest and left the second one for him to take for lunch the next day with dinner leftovers. 

The meatball was delicious. You can tell they use a mix of beef, pork and likely veal to make a very savory meatball - which is a deal at $1.70 each!

Dinner for two with two bottles of water and a 20% tip was about $44. It's not inexpensive nor should it be for that quality.

The Italian Homemade Company offers authentic, delicious house made pastas and sauces. I look forward to picking up some pasta to take home and enjoy.
author: Jennifer O.

description: I ordered to go from this place. They stacked the pasta on top of the tiramisu. So by the time I found that out, the cake is all melted. They should have put those in two separate bags. Also they didn't provide any utensils.
author: Michael C.

description:
Ordered the pappardelle with bolognese and bechamel sauce. I wouldn't say this was "mindblowing" pasta as I've been told by someone who ate all over Italy and still claimed this was better. Hm... I think I'd have to disagree. Yes, the pasta is all handmade but it was too al dente for my taste. The sauce is decent but holistically it's not worth the $11 for the entire dish. 

What I liked about this venue is that it has an authentic Italian mom-and-pop sort of feel. Expect it to be packed at night and seats fill up fast. Rather quick service. 

Worth trying once but I hate to say that I think at a value standpoint, I'd forgo the handmade pasta and just get it from a box and buy vodka sauce.
author: Cindy W.

description: the pasta is . so. S A L T Y ..... maybe I should've got a salad. it didn't take that long to get the food , and I was starving but I would pay cheaper for this street food.
author: Christine L.

description:
Was craving fresh pasta so picked up their Papparadelle pasta with pesto and it hit the spot! 

There was a huge line and tables were packed. Glad I ordered for pick up because I got to skip to the front of the line. The wait staff were sweet despite how busy it was. Will come back for sure!
author: May N.

description: Often a line or a wait for tables. The food is pretty good. Portions are generous and have always been enough for two people or two meals.
author: Isabella R.

description: Everything here is so good and authentic! You can see the freshly made piles of noodles in the fridge.  I had the gnocchi with bolognese sauce and it was amazing. The entire experience was wonderful. Go here, you won't regret it!
author: Jerngav D.

description: Unbelievable meatball cassoni, fettuccine bolognese and lots of gluten-free pasta options. This place makes you feel like you're in a small Italian town, warm smiles and friendly service.
author: Steven D.

description:
It is what it says: homemade pasta! Everything is made in house and it tastes great! I ordered the paparadelle with bolognaise. Generous portions, and lots of meat in the bolognaise! My husband had the meatball casolli and that was so good! Next time I'm getting that! I feel like everything is a winner at this restaurant! Parking can be hard to find but if you go around the corner you might find parking.
    Inside is cozy and a majority of the seating is bar stools so if you have little kids, keep a close eye on them. Also they do deliver through postmates so that can save you the hassle.
author: Mia S.

description: This place is amazing and delicious. Pasta is fresh and cooked perfectly! The sauces were mouth watering. Definitely will be my go to Italian spot when I'm visiting from Sacramento.
author: krystle p.

description: First off, FOOD WAS SO GOOD. Made me a little Sade because it made me miss Rome. Staff was so friendly. The only downside to this place is it's small & the stools are a little uncomfortable but they make do with what they got. They make the pasta fresh & you can even buy some by the lbs.
author: Samantha B.

description:
For the record I try very hard to not give 5 star reviews.

This was excellent and I'll be back soon. 

We came in at 12:01 on a Sunday and were not their first customers. There is limited seating inside and a few tables outside as well. We took a table outside because it was a very rare summer day. Wow, it was nice.

She had the Meat Ravioli and it was perfect. It was just tender enough but not chewy. The meat sauce was insane. The kind where as soon as the flavor hits your taste buds you drift away from the world around you and realize how beautiful it is to be alive and living in one of the greatest cities in the world kind of good. So, yeah get the ravioli.

i had the Classica sandwich. Wow! I'll get this again. It was one of the best sandwiches in San Francisco. 

Dog friendly as well. There are tables outside so we will definitely bring the puppy next time.
author: Justin S.

description: This little place is fantastic! Food is so delicious. We ordered the meatballs, lasagna and tortellini. My favorite was the tortellini but all the other dishes were so good too! Very casual place, seating is tight so to-go may be a better option for a large group.
author: Ruby G.

description: This dinner was edible but didn't want to finish the dish. I had gnocchi with white sauce my boyfriend had meat ravioli with meat sauce. The gnocchi was doughy and very dense  while white sauce had no flavor. the meat sauce was very oily. Was very disappointed there is no garlic bread but have plain flat bread as substitute.
author: Gina B.

description:
This place is a gem. No frills menu. They made their own fresh pasta. First bite was so comforting. Friendly staff. The place is small with some outdoor tables. Dog friendly 

If you're looking for a genuine "touch of Italy" . . thus is the real deal.

Caio
author: Uma P.

description: Today I had tortellini Alfredo but everything I've tried previously has been delicious. Courteous quick service, good vibe. Will return
author: Jeff K.

description: This bustling little restaurant was such a wonderful find. Plus you get a good amount of food for a great price. Next time I'll check this place again.
author: Winter B.

description:
Everyone's on some sort of diet nowadays: South Beach diet, Atkins diet, Paleo, Macrobiotic, and more. The one I really don't understand is the No Carb Diet. Like, honestly, how does one completely cut out bread, rice, and pasta!? Good thing Gary H. is not on any sort of diet because that meant he could try out The Italian Homemade Company with me!

The storefront is pretty small, with about six tables and some window seating inside. If you want to dine outside, there are about three tables. The seating area is pretty compact, so your chair will probably be touching your neighbor's chair. (No hooks underneath the tables to hang your bag!)

They offer sandwiches, cassonis, pastas, salads, and more. All of their dishes are around $9-13, which is pretty standard. The portions do look on the smaller side, but don't worry, you'll be stuffed!

- Meat Ravioli ($11): perfect ratio of meat and pasta, and that sauce gave it the awesome flavor. 
- Lasagna with beef and pork bolognese sauce ($12): melt-in-your-mouth deliciousness! Every bite was foodgasmic.
- Meatballs ($1.70/each): moist and flavorful. I'm not a huge fan of meatballs because they're usually dry, but split this baby in half here, and you'll see how juicy it is! 

My only regret was not having a bigger stomach to eat more. And you bet I food coma-ed after overloading on carbs!
author: Christine S.

description: Fresh, inexpensive, delicious pasta. I love how simple the menu is and I like being able to mix and match different pasta/sauce combinations. I ordered tagliatelle with marinara sauce while my friend ordered gnocchi with meatballs. The tagliatelle was pretty much perfect and the marinara sauce was very well seasoned. Italian Homemade Company makes some of the best gnocchi I've ever eaten. They're so soft, they practically melt in your mouth. I look forward to coming back!
author: Helen P.

description: Some of the best pasta I've ever had. I think I finally have tasted actual al dente. Quick service and easy to get to. Plus, if all the seats are taken, it's close enough to Washington Square that you can grab your food to go and head down there. Would def return.
author: Mary R.

description:
Really good and authentic homemade pasta! The papardelle with meatballs is to die for.  It was so good we got some of their sauce and the uncooked pasta to try and make it at home. 
People here are really nice and helpful, with that friendly italian accent. We had plans to walk around the city for the rest of the day, but really wanted to take home some of their pasta and sauce. They offered to hold on to our order until the night when we would pick it up and avoid a long wait due to the dinner rush.
I recommend anybody who likes italian food to stop by and try their pasta!
author: Jeferson N.

description: I loved the place. We went for a quick dinner on a Monday 30 minutes before closing and it was packed. Their gnocci al pesto is a must!
author: Katia A.

description: This place used to be good. The servings used to be big with lots of sauce. Not sure what's going on now, smaller servings and quite bland. Where's the sauce??
author: Torres F.

description: I'm a huge pasta person, and this place 100% satisfies that homemade pasta craving. I got the gnocchi with white sauce and my boyfriend and family got the lasagna. Holy moly it was all delicious! I'd recommend this place to anyone who needs that Italian mom cooking feel. Perfect serving sizes and friendly owner! LOVED IT.
author: Kailey S.

description: Great homemade pasta! Their lasagna is popular and damn delicious. They also sell just their homemade pasta!
author: Hemant J.

description: Wow! Cool environment, but the food was outstanding. When they hand it to you on a paper plate you question your decision until the moment you take your first bite!
author: Joel R.

description: Great homey food every time! The restaurant is warm and inviting every time and the food is simple yet delicious.
author: Alex H.

description:
Brava! Absolutely delicious take-out or casual drop in spot.

Note: This is a tiny location and can get a bit crowded: I'd advise ordering over the phone for take out
author: Better Not Bitter 1.

description: Food is always amazing! Saw ten kick out some jerk trying to steal stuff from the back. You can tell the people who work here are passionate and hard working. Keep being awesome!
author: Cameron K.

description: Yuck! We went in the late afternoon on a Tuesday, maybe we just caught them at an off time? It was terrible! I would liken my sandwich/ calzone to cafeteria style fare. Maybe at a college dorm heavily salted lukewarm goo is considered a delicacy. The salad we ordered had an entire block of mozzarella sliced and piled in the middle instead of nicely portioned and mixed in so every bite had a little bit of all the flavors. Not to mention that there wes maybe one ounce of arugula in total. Everything was served on paper plates which just drove home the cafeteria aesthetic. All in all, total bust! Nowhere in the city is there room for this kind of crap but especially not in North Beach where Italian food lives.
author: Kellen M.

description:
This place is not a restaurant with sit down service, but I did enjoy the coziness/mom & pop shop feel here. Their counter is set up deli style with a few already made dishes like their well known lasagna cold cut meats, cheese and some desserts, but in the fridge is where you'll find the freshly homemade pasta to choose from. After picking out your noodles, you pick a sauce which their choices vary from marinara, Bolognese, meatball, white cream sauce, etc.

I went with the tagliatelle with Bolognese sauce and my bf got fettuccini with the Bolognese/meatball sauce. After placing your order, you find a table and they bring out the food to you. The seating area are high tables with stools, a few seats along the window and a couple of outdoor seating right in front. It does feel a little cramped and I couldn't help but look at what my neighbors ordered...everything looked fresh and delicious!

They do serve the pasta on compostable/recyclable paper plates, which I honestly didn't mind too much. The only problem I see with that is that it absorbs so much of the sauce that it almost tears through, but luckily that didn't happen with either of us. Anyway, our food came out piping hot within 10-15 minutes. The pasta was perfectly cooked al dente and the serving was very generous. The sauce is a little tangier than I'm used to and not as creamy, but I still enjoyed it very much! The Bolognese/meatball only came with 2 small sized meatballs, but my bf was also pleased with his dish.

For 2 pasta plates and a can of pelligrino soda, our order came out to about $28. I don't mind that it wasn't a sit down restaurant, it's great for when you're craving good quality pasta but don't want to spend too much time at a restaurant. I definitely wanna come back and try the gnocchi, lasagna and all the combos possible!
author: Georgina G.

description: Found this place by accident but I was quite pleased that I did!! The food was so yummy and I really like the casual vibe of the place. It's a small little place and not the best for a big group. The people there were so kind and helpful. The price was a fair fit for the amazing quality of food. Very filling and super delicious!!
author: Lauren S.

description: Really delicious authentic Italian food. Homemade pasta. Staff spoke Italian. The real deal. Order at the counter and they bring it to your table. Paper plates. Super casual. But just what we were looking for. Would recommend!
author: Michelle C.

description: Great place for quick homemade pasta. The marinara is really good and pasta is fresh.
author: Desi P.

description:
This was a smaller, family owned operation located near the wharf. We stopped in based on high reviews on Yelp, as we were craving some Italian food. We ordered the lasagna and gnocchi roll and let me say, some of the best Italian I've ever had. The pasta was as fresh as it gets and the homemade sauces were spot on. I've had authentic Italian food all over Italy during my 4 months of study abroad travel and this was one of the places that actually brought your flavor profiles back. Thank you for a delicious experience -

Best,
Charlie
author: Charlie K.

description: This place was amazing. Came in on the fly with two hungry kiddos. A little pricey but expected considering it's in the city. Too many stand up tables but I guess that's the new trend. We made it work with an 8 and 4 year old. Had the pesto veggie ravioli and fettucini and white sauce. Many it was delicious. Came out al dente and so fresh and tasty I felt it was the best pasta I've ever had. When I decide to eat meat again I will try their meatballs. Delicious!
author: Ryan E.

description: Two friends and I stumbled upon this place by accident. So glad we did! By far the best lasagna I've ever had hands down. The chef was friendly and we sat and watched the staff (open kitchen) and it all ran like a well-oiled machine. It was Memorial Day lunchtime and pretty busy, but we got a table right away. Had there been a line I wouldn't have waited, but knowing what I know now, I would!
author: Brian K.

description: Great food at a great price. We tried meet ravioli, gnocchi, and fettuccine with bolognese sauce with meatballs. As a desert we got Tiramisu and it was delicious as well. Everything under $60.
author: Marie R.

description:
The food was amazing , we ordered meat balls and lasagna wasnmelting in sauce and cheese and Gnocchi was melting and the pesto sauce was real home made.

I will b coming back.
author: Katerina M.

description: Amazing pasta and sauces! Once I called in and placed my ordered and they ended up not having it so I got a free side of yummy tiramisu.  Their raviolis (both veggie and regular) are amazing. The gnocchi with pesto is also great. The portion of lasagna is massive!
author: Alexandra L.

description: I walked by several times in the last time I was in SF.  and what caught my eye was that they serve the dishes on paper plates, but yet the place was packed each time I walked by. Well I finally stopped in and. I Had the mozzarella salad followed up with a gnocchi with the meatball sauce. Just phenomenal. It is small and I don't believe they serve wine but this is still a must.
author: Scott S.

description: Fresh made pasta. The fettuccine here is unbelievably good. The owner was so helpful and just plain nice. We would definitely come back again!
author: Ainoki T.

description:
This is a place where you could find Anthony Borudain. The food is astonishingly good, service staff is very friendly and helpful. Seating situation is...well, could be better. Just not digging the tall tables, probably because it's no use when you have a toddler or two in tow. Air conditioning would be a welcome addition as well. 

But, I digress. Some reviews are about experience, some about location...this one is about food. Homemade pasta and marinara are mind-blowingly good and I sincerely recommend his little Italian gem to all you pasta-craving mongrels. The garden salad is also straight-up amazing and I will definitely be back here.
author: Matija A.

description: One great example of the traditional Italian food as the name correctly suggest! The veggie lasagna and the meatball fettuccini were excellent. Quick and easy, not fancy at all (but that can be a good thing of course)
author: Roberto V.

description: Simply delicious authentic Italian food!!!! Can't go wrong. The wines are also very good!!!
author: Eden N.

description:
I had noticed how this generically named place bolted up to the top of the Best of Yelp list almost immediately after it opened last year. I initially poo-poohed it since I made the faulty presumption that a new Italian deli couldn't possibly have anything new to add to North Beach. Besides which, anytime Jamie W. and I walked by on weekends, it was filled with hipsters who weren't looking to give up their turf. Well, we finally made it in this past Saturday when we found ourselves on the peckish side in the late afternoon around 4PM, a good time to come in and have a more relaxing meal here without the self-entitled stares of impatient tourists hovering relentlessly for tables. Now we could actually browse the grocery area, peruse the menu selections and speak with owner Mattia Cosmi.

He and his wife, co-owner Alice Romagnoli, come from Rimini on the edge of the Emilia-Romagna region of Italy. As a result, the hearty-looking dishes reflect a more northern Italian influence with their specialty the piadine, a quesadilla-like flatbread sandwich which we will need to try on a future visit. But for us, we were magnetized by the fresh pasta selections in the warming tray. I was immediately drawn to the $11 Pappardelle with Pasticciata Sauce, an abundant plate of thick, velvety noodles prepared al dente as only Italians seem to know how to do. The pasticciata is a creamier version of a meaty Bolognese sauce with the addition of bechamel (photo: http://bit.ly/1JqBbpX). Mamma mia. Jamie went for the $12 Lasagna, another house specialty with a  similar combination of beef and pork Bolognese and bechamel sauces (photo: http://bit.ly/1STupdO).

It was quite a large slice, no complaints there, but you could tell it was from the warming tray because it didn't have quite that fresh-from-the-oven flavor we were hoping to experience. Alas, that isn't really a criticism since it wouldn't have been reasonable to expect individual portions prepared the same way the pasta was. As a chaser, we ordered a couple of the $1.70 Meatballs, savory spheres of carnivorous bliss indeed (photo: http://bit.ly/1ICiJ87). We'd definitely like to come back and try more of their home-style dishes, maybe take them to go to eat on a bench at Washington Square Park and close our eyes with thoughts of returning to Bologna where we had a wonderful food tour courtesy of our pal Alessandro. Look at me, quite the globetrotter, ain't I?

FOOD - 4 stars...pasta done right with other Emilia-Romagna specialties to try
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...informal space, crowded most of the time but worth the wait for the quality
SERVICE - 4 stars...friendly and informative
TOTAL - 4 stars...them Yelpers steered me right this time...abbondanza!
author: Ed U.

description: This place is GREAT! Fresh food, accommodating staff. Pasta, salads,  daily specials, reasonably priced. Nice spot for lunch. Highly recommend!
author: Rachel C.

description:
I'll be honest. I resisted coming here for a while. Having spent a substantial amount of time in Italy eating piadine across Emilia-Romagna (the region in which the flatbread sandwich was invented), it's hard for me to pay San Francisco prices for it.

I'm glad I finally gave in, because Italian Homemade Company prepares a piadina that's as good as the best I've had in Italy. Now I'm a huge fan and I can't wait to come back to try everything else on the menu.

Service is friendly and the shop is a joy to dine in, whether you're alone or with friends. It's also a locally owned shop, so you're supporting an independent business by coming here.

Grazie mille! Torno subito!
author: Keane L.

description: Whoa, this place is crazy good!!  You are able to pick what type of pasta (gnocchi, tortellini, etc) and sauce (bolognese, pesto, white) you'd like.  Its homemade so its super fresh and delicious.  What a genius idea!  Didn't really care for the side of flat bread we got, but that doesn't matter.  A real authentic Italian joint.  This place is super busy.  Will definitely be coming back (probably soon)!
author: Joe L.

description: This place is great. I ordered both time for pickup and they delivered with the best food! 100% place
author: John F.

description:
My family of 8 finally found the place after walking for what seemed like forever. This was June 12, we were in the Northbeach area after our tour of Alcatraz island. Our children had this  Italian resto in mind for late lunch and seemed determined to go only to that place. 

I am glad we did. My meat ravioli with pasticciata sauce was sooo delicious and satisfying. I found myself biting into pasta so al dente, and which burst with every bite into a savory creamy fusion of meat and cheese so satisfying I forgot I should have stopped midway to stay on diet, until only a few pieces of ravioli were left. Hahaha. Then I justified finishing off the rest by thinking of the thousands of steps I had taken during our island tour earlier and in order to get to that place. I also forgot that I had grunted under my breath upon arrival there and seeing the hard wooden stools we had to sit on around a long wooden table with sacks of what looked like flour underneath. 

The layout of the place is the reason for the lack of a 5th star. It lent a homey unpretentious air to the place but at that time I felt it was a bit too lacking in comfort for my tired muscles.

The authentic feel to this place was heightened by the fact that the people behind the counter (we could see our meal being prepared) seemed too busy preparing our meals to exhibit much Italian warmth, but they were helpful and courteous enough. Polite but busy and earnestly working to give the packed room what it went there for. 

Overall a satisfying experience. A must try, indeed.
author: Ting D.

description: My husband and I were not too impressed. My husband got tortilini with white sauce, it had no flavor and the meat tasted kind of funny. I got the pappardelle with meatball Bolognese. It was okay, the meatball didn't have much flavor. The red sauce was just ok, could be better.
author: Shontel O.

description:
We came by on a Sunday late afternoon, but there was still a pretty long line of customers waiting to order -- because the food is pretty darn good. Italian homemade is what it sounds like: good homemade Italian food, like out of a traditional Italian family kitchen. 

We had a dog with us, so we sat outside at one of their outdoor tables (the are about 4 two-tops). If you're sitting outside, make sure to bring a jacket and expect your food to get cold, since there aren't any heat lamps.

We got the pesto gnocchi, meat lasagna, panna cotta, and a donut (tip: make sure you get the donut as soon as you pay, or else they may sell the flavor you wanted -- that happened to us!). Everything we ordered was very flavorful, well-executed, and in a large portion. I would personally skip the donut, but my eating partners wanted to try it. Overall, solid home style Italian food at reasonable prices -- I hope to return again soon!
author: Julia N.

description:
Saw other reviews about this place and expected it to be good. To say the least, we were amazed at how awesome this place is! 

Great food, friendly staff and cozy atmosphere. 

The dishes were a gnocchi with pesto and a tagliatelle pasta with a bolognese sauce. Simply stunning. Fresh, aromatic and pasta that was cooked to perfection. 

We would definitely go back again the next time we visit and we will surely recommend this place to others!
author: Cortney T.

description: We happened upon this place as we were waiting for a show at Cobbs. Why have I never heard of this place? A casual & super friendly environment - plus, delicious, freshly made pasta and sauces! Kids would love this place.
author: Merrill S.

description: This place will absolutely fulfill your pasta cravings. I know it did for me! I came here right before attending a SF Giants game and was conflicted between the meat ravioli with pesto sauce and lasagna. I had asked for the recommendation from the nice gal helping and she recommended the lasagna. I'm sure glad she did because the lasagna portion was huge and worth every bite. The shop itself is quite small but has some seating in and outdoors. I did get to try a bite of the tortellini with pasticciata (which is bolognese sauce and béchamel cream) and it was just ok. Based on how good the lasagna was, I'll definitely be back the next time I have a craving for pasta in the city!
author: Annette T.

description:
This place way just as AMAZING as I was told it would be! Finally got to go this past weekend with my boyfriend who has been raving about it since moving to SF! And boy am I glad he has cause I had high hopes and they were met! I had the ravioli with meat (1st not second ravioli) and the red sauce with pasticciata! OH MY GOODNESS amazing! Perfect sauce and perfect pasta! Exactly what homemade pasta should taste like, pretty much like straight from Italy  And let me tell you this place is authentic, they all speak Italian and are hard working and caring about this place and all the food that they serve! My boyfriend had the meat lasagna with a side of the meatballs! (AHHH SO GOOOD!) and it all was great! I also ordered tiramisu for dessert! Everything hear tastes like it came straight out of an Italian Grandmas homemade kitchen! 
I will DEFINITELY be heading back here many times AND will be brining my family and friends here too!
author: Mary W.

description: WOW! great staff and the place oozes the smell of deliciousness! the pappardelle with meatballs in bolognese sauce was one of the best meals i've had in a long time, and the gnocchi with pesto sauce also did not disappoint! Oh and we got extra sauce and ordered bread, however the "bread" served were like pita bread wraps cut into triangles, which was disappointing (especially because they didn't clarify) - hence the 4 star. Other than that, everything else was fabulous!! LOVE LOVE LOVE!
author: Jenny Z.

description:
Excellent Italian food, tried pasta, it is really homemade! Very casual, though, you eat in carton plates! 
Tiramisu: perfect!!!
author: Alex G.

description:
Food is good.  Italian food like my mom would make. You walk in and the place is small no it's not the small you are thinking its smaller than that.  You walk in and the sauce and meatballs are sitting in front of you.  It reminded me of the school cafeteria or those pizza places are the mall-   I wanted to leave but I trusted the Yelp reviews.  So I ordered the meat sauce and meatballs and it was good again like something my mom would make-  the noodles were cooked perfectly the sauce was good the meatballs were kind of bland-  i would have liked some more garlic and herbs in them.

I didn't order a salad but they looked great the only problem was there is no time between getting your salad and your meal arriving because everything is premade except for finishing off the pasta.

You order at the counter and they bring it to you on a paper plate.

I left feeling like I wanted more maybe a piece of garlic bread with the meal?  I'm not sure.  It felt like I was eating some really good left overs from the night before-  really good but leaving you unsatisfied.  Pasta meatballs bottle of water like 18.00 bucks.
author: Ryan P.

description: generous portions but with few options for those who don't eat pork. tasty gourmet chef boyardee style. this is not meant as an insult. great pasta with simple sauces.
author: Igotgoodtaste P.

description: Best Ever!!!  The place is not much to look at first.  Don't let that deter you.  Hands Down the place to be at for Amazing Food.
author: Kitty S.

description: Italian Homemade Company was recommended by someone we met on a Lyft ride.  I am so grateful to her!  I ordered fettuccine with bolognese sauce and meatballs and my man ordered ravioli w bolognese and meatballs.  WOW!  It all tasted so amazing.  Big helpings for a good price.  We had leftovers for about 2 hours.  We just finished it off.  Employees were really sweet and helpful. Nice short walk from Fishermans Wharf.  And to top it off?  Italian hip hop music.  GO THERE NOW.
author: Sharon D.

description:
Had the special spaghetti cacio pepe and it was the most amazing dish of all time. 

If you are in the area- you have to eat here!!
author: Samantha I.

description:
OMG this place is incredible!! I ordered the gnocchi with Gorgonzola and arugula, which was a special. I came in planning to get the pesto but the special looked tempting. I wasn't that hungry but I ended up eating the whole thing because it was that good. I went to Italy last year and this was as good as the best pasta I had on my entire trip. My friend got the tiramisu which was so good especially if your favorite part of the tiramisu is the cream. 

The restaurant itself is extremely casual and had a counter where you walk up and order. Like the food comes on paper plates casual. There are several types of pasta and several types of sauce to chose from that you can combine. You can buy pasta by the pound to bring home if that's what you're about. There are about 6 2 person tables inside and a long table along the window with about 8 stools. When I got there, every spot was taken but the turnaround is pretty quick here. The food comes on paper plates. The people who worked there were nice and were speaking Italian, which I appreciated. It wasn't cheap (my pasta was $14) but I have no complaints because it was seriously amazing! 

Ugh I wish I didn't live on the East coast so I could come here all of the time!!
author: Hanna K.

description: The food was sooooo good. I have eaten a lot of Italian food, but nothing as authentic as this place. The gnocchi is to die for, and the pesto is delicious. I will definitely be coming back to try more. If you love italian food, this place is a must.
author: Michelle B.

description:
B-U-O-N-I-S-S-I-M-O

We had pappardelle, fettuccine and gnocchi. 
Best gnocchi ever. Sauces excellent.
Gnocchi with pesto. Meat sauce with pappardelle. Meatballs with fettuccine. 
Super fresh pasta. 
Don't know how I've never eaten here before. 
Not a fancy place and you'd have to get lucky with seating if you're a large group. 
This will be my fave!
author: Emanuelle O.

description:
Had planned on coming here for lunch during the Moon Festival parade. Unfortunately when I walked in the place was not kid friendly. There are only stools inside and 2 tables outside that has a place for a high chair.  

Wasn't planning on sitting in the street and kid couldn't sit on a stool. So ended up going across the street instead.
author: M C.

description: My Italian friend comes here whenever he's home sick. I think that says something
author: Wayne S.

description: Best pasta in North Beach and possibly the entire city. Skip the tourist traps and come here.
author: Jeska D.

description: Visited this restaurant about a week ago while we were in San Francisco. I found it on yelp luckily and best decision we made. My husband and I are in love with this little restaurant. The food is delicious I had the Fettuccine with white sauce and my husband the lasagna and both were amazing! It is very affordable I think for the quality the best you will find in San Francisco. The thing we loved most about it was the customer service incredible! Everyone was so welcoming, they bring the food to your table when its ready. You can really get a little taste of Italy here. We loved it so much that we went back the second day! Definitely worth the visit!
author: Gretel P.

description: Everything I've tried here, and at their other location has been amazing. Particularly the cassone, lasagna, and various specials. Latest one was the lobster salad, locally sourced and delicious.
author: A K.

description: This place is a little further down from the main North Beach (Italian) neighborhood. And selfishly, I don't mind because it's really easy to come in and grab a quick (and cheap) delicious meal. Simple menu, pick your pasta and pick your sauce. Wait about 5-10 minutes and you've got the best pasta in NB in front of you. It's not pretentious, just hearty and tastes great. All fresh, handmade pasta, you can even grab some to go and cook up later with your own sauce at home. Very good.
author: Francesca N.

description: First we just stopped outside the place and don't wanted to go in. But it was our best decision to try it. One of the best Italian home-made restaurant I ever been . And loved the feeling . Loved that they have veggie food! I would totally recommend this place. Real Italian tastes!
author: Adam A.

description:
I am a fan!
What's not to like.  An Italian restaurant/grocery store in North Beach?!
Sadly, there has been little innovation and change in the neighborhood with the renown Italian community that is the staple of this area.  Many of the old time places like U.S. Restaurant, New Pisa Restaurant, Panelli Brothers, and Washington Square Bar and Grill are long gone.  There is a smattering of similar old time places (North Beach Restaurant, Fior D'Italia, Molinari's), but nothing quite sexy or eye opening.  Tony's Pizza is probably the exception for this cuisine.  Then along came this place.
After reading Cherlynn's sexy review (https://www.yelp.com/user_details?userid=eKUGKQRE-Ywi5dY55_zChg), I immediately bookmarked this place, but hadn't found time to try it.... until now.  While heading back to my office, I stopped here, scoring rock star parking right in front on a recent weekday afternoon.  About half of the tables were filled, mostly high top tables and stools. The hostess kindly directed me to the menu board.  
My order was for my lunch and a future dinner so here's what I tried:

Lunch
Classica Piadiana (https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=RTWf2FN6_tuRV07NFVaGdg&userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q) - Served cold, this Italian sandwich which crosses between a wrap and a quesadilla comprised of prosciutto di parma, Strachinno cheese, and arugula.  I heated up some soup in the office and devoured half of this (the photo shows half portion).  Nice change from eating a traditional sandwich.

Future dinner
Lasagna add two meatballs (https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=yNrv9KEFEb6RYPhh9TqNFg&userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q) - Flavorful and meaty good, especially with the addition of those two meatballs for $1.70 each.  Wish there a bit more noodle to balance out the dish as the meat sauce and cheese dominated here.

While watching them put dishes together, I couldn't help but admire how the chefs were precise in apportioning and preparing the foods.  Hoping to return to try their build-your-own pasta menu portion, especially their namesake raviolis.  There are salads, flatbread, and hot sandwiches besides what I tried.  
The only thing missing was someone from Italy walking up and saying, "Just like mama used to make!"
author: Mike C.

description:
I ordered the lasagna. Beautiful. Amazing. I Loved it. This is how I would imagine lasagna to be if I had an Italian grandmother. The pasta, the sauce OH it was  an operatic experience.

I love the fact that it didn't come with cheese stuffed to the brims. It was just layers and layers of beautiful pasta and meat sauce. 

Perfection.

Will be back soon!
author: Anchovy G.

description:
After a long day at Crissy Fields, I was craving some pasta. This location came up at the top of this list. Based on the ratings and a few comments we decided this would be a nice place to try. 

My son had fettuccine with meatballs, my bf had meat ravioli with bolognese, I had tagliatelle with white sauce, and we all shared a caprese sandwich. Everything was delicious, perfect seasoning, and the noodles were al dente. 

The power was off in the restaurant when we visited so it was really hot inside so we sat outside and enjoyed the beautiful SF weather. The service was quick and the employees were all smiles and very helpful. 

Next time I'm in the area, I will definitely visit again.
author: Sharon L.

description:
Sooooo we have been wanting to try this place forever and unfortunately we were very disappointed.  This is more of a service problem than food. The food was decent and priced right.  The problem was when we placed our order. You go up to the counter to do this. My fiancé and I both went up and ordered a dish each. The girl wrote down our orders.  15 minutes later my dish comes out but my fiancés is nowhere to be seen.  Just thinking it was just taking longer we waited a little longer. Finally he went up to ask where his food was and they pulled up the ticket she entered into the computer and she only put my meal in.  They never apologized or anything and made us feel like it was our fault!! So by the time his food came out mine was pretty much finished. 

Tip to staff: If there are two people together they are probably each getting a dish.  Please use your head and apologize for your mistake and make them feel like they would want to return even if there was a mistake.  You should have not charged us for the meal we had to wait for, insane!!
author: Tina T.

description: Their pasta is to die for!!! Especially GNOCHI... so soft, fluffy and tasty! I tried it with pesto and white sauce. So worth it! Prices vary from 12 to 18, but it's a must!
author: Giedre P.

description: The sauce is so good that I can't deny that it is better than my own homemade sauces!  They knock it out of the park for my family! Eccellente!
author: Lisa P.

description: Ugh this place is so good I'm craving this pasta just looking at these photos. You get the choice of type of pasta and sauce so I opted for the pappardelle with bolognese. The pasta was so chewy and the sauce was the type that makes you want to lick your plate it's so rich. It's a no frills place that sells sauce and pasta to go with limited seating. Great prices for SF.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Love the homemade pasta.  Went 2 times in the last month.  Usually get the tagliatelle.

The white sauce is a little too land for my kids so sometimes we like to mix it with the red which they sell.

They also sell the pasta to cook at home, which we have done as well.  

Line can get a little long if you come at prime time.
author: Jeff N.

description: Good location and cute shop with a casual atmosphere. The food was nothing to write home about. I had high hopes because of all the great reviews. I had Alfredo with pappardelle noodles and it didn't have much flavor. However they did have S. Pellegrino Aranciata so that was a plus.
author: Nikki R.

description: The best concept, affordable authentic and delicious italian food at a counter service restaurant, to eat there or take away. The veggie raviolis with the cream sauce is to die for, as well as the lasagna, highly recommend!!
author: Melissa R.

description:
I came as a pair on a Saturday evening and the place was quite crowded. Waiting in line to order and then waiting for the food took around 20 minutes. There are only a few small tables indoor that are cluttered near the window, but I was lucky enough to snatch one right before I got my food.

Wow, the Spinach, Potatoes, and Mozzarella Cassoni was delicious! The spinach seemed like it was from a frozen package, but it nonetheless tasted great since the flatbread was perfectly soft yet had a bit of an outer crunch. Sometimes they might run out of certain items on the menu because their pasta is freshly made. Within the 45 minutes that I was in the shop, the ravioli went from being unavailable to available again, so it really just depends on the time you order!
author: Winnie Y.

description: This restaurant is the textbook definition of a local hole-in-the-wall joint. If you are looking for a place the locals will go, this is it. Food served on paper plates adds to the hole-in-the-wall feel. All dough and pasta is made from scratch in house, and you can completely taste it. I had the meat ravioli, and it was beyond compare. I highly recommend this fine restaurant to anyone who likes Italian food, and enjoys those local joints.
author: Mark E.

description:
Was hyped to try this place based on recommendations. Ordered a couple items for take-out, including pappardelle with bolognese and tagliatelle with pasticciata. Both were well under sauced, though I recognize that may be a matter of preference. Texture was fine for fresh pasta.

Overall, decent. Bummed I didn't like it more. Let me know if you have fresh pasta recs!
author: Trevor M.

description:
Skip it.

The food is fine, but the service leaves a lot to be desired. I ordered pick-up, 10 minutes after I placed my order I got a missed called from an unknown number-no message. I called back twice immediately, no answer. When I arrived to pick up my order, they told me they had run out of the pasta I ordered and had cancelled my order. I choose a new pasta and asked for difference in cost. They told me it was the same cost - I had the menu in front of me - they were not the same price. Finally, the begrudgingly gave me back the difference. Never an apology. Never an attempt to make it right. But a whole lot of attitude. 

After a few visits here, the attitude from the staff is the only consistent. There is too much good pasta in North Beach to put up with how rude they are. 

Try instead:
-Ideale
-Sotto Mare
-Il Pollaio
-Sodini's
All equally (or often much better) food and fantastic service.
author: Kelly S.

description:
Like many other places in SF, this restaurant was tucked away and unsuspecting. Once inside, it was beautifully decorated, the people (customers and workers) were friendly, and most importantly--it smelled delicious. Chefs were visible in the back making the pasta dough that they craft daily by hand.
I ordered the meat lasagna; it was honestly enough for two people. It held together really well (you know how lasagna tends to slip and slide around) and the flavor was really robust. Definitely a very hearty meal. A glass Coke topped it all off :)
Be sure to get there early for dinner. Once they run out, that's it! I wanted the veggie lasagna, but they had sold out.
author: Ashley H.

description:
While searching North Beach for something delicious for lunch we spied this amazing place.  It looked good and had outdoor seating and there were quite a few people enjoying their lunch.  The menu has quite a variety including some great looking desserts.

TRIPLE D needs to come here, swine call Guy Fieri please!

There were several tables with stools and seating at the window as well.  While eating our lunch we noticed a lot of people getting take out.  So we decided to come back after our walk for some pasta to go.

So for lunch I had the Classic and my wife had the Santa Maria, all I can say is WOW !!!  Great Italian meats every thing made on site.

Loved the Pasta Room you can watch them making it fresh And bringing it straight to the chef's.

After walking North Beach and Chinatown we stopped by and got some Lasagna to go.  We just finished dinner and It is without a doubt the best I've ever had including my one and a half years living in Italy!

You really have to try this place
author: Russ V.

description:
I think the Italian Homemade Company might be one of my new favorite go-to spots for delicious Italian food.

Not much of a sit-down restaurant, as they only have a few tables and stool seating. It has a quaint, casual deli vibe and the service was friendly. Choose your pasta and order at the counter. They also have canned sauces, fresh pasta, and doughnuts for sale.

FOOD:
* Pesto Gnocchi - My boyfriend is a huge gnocchi fiend, so he ordered the pesto gnocchi. This was probably the best gnocchi I've EVER had. I had to restrain myself from eating too much of his dish. The gnocchi was super fluffy and perfectly chewy, and covered with a delicious pesto cream sauce. So flavorful and tender!

* Lasagna with Meatball - I ordered the lasagna with one meatball, and was also pleasantly surprised. One of the best lasagnas I've had. The pasta and cheese practically melts in your mouth, and the sauce was super tasty. The meatball was good, but I felt a little dry in the center.

The portions were really big, for a great price. Enough to split between two people (if you're not starving). My only gripe is that they used paper plates. I felt like I was scraping parts of the plate as I ate. I wished they had real plates and silverware for their dine-in customers - it's also more environmentally friendly!

Other than that, the food was near perfection and very reasonably priced, and service was great. I would definitely make the trek to North Beach to come back!
author: Vivian H.

description: STILL GREAT!! They're consistent in delivering top quality homemade pastas and sauces. The portions are still large. If you can't finish it, ask for a to-go box and eat it for your next meal. It'll be just as tasty! The service was great and they checked on us a few times to make sure that we were happy customers.
author: Aimee I.

description:
The Italian Homemade Company is as charming as it sounds. It's one of my favorite places in San Francisco due to its simplicity and focus on quality pasta. 

The Italian Homemade Company's pastas and sauces are housemade. They have a wide assortment of pastas. They even have pappardelle! That's really all you need to know. I know Yelp is saying "You're rolling now - got any more to add?" which means I'm supposed to write more but in the spirit of this restaurant, I want to keep this review  focused on the food and keep it as simple just like The Italian Homemade Company.
author: Charles L.

description: OMG this place is to die for! Every time we go to the Bay we make sure we stop on by and get our fix. Made to order, home cooked Italian food is Devine and leaves you feeling like you just left your grandma's house!
author: Raquel H.

description: By far my FAVORITE restaurant in San Francisco! The tortellini, pesto pasta and lasagna are TO DIE FOR! Amazing customer service! Highly recommend this spot. You must try the lasagna!
author: Celeste R.

description: Don't let the cardboard plates fool you. This is amazing food. Pappardelle and Bolognese is yummy.
author: Franklin R.

description: Truly like visiting Italy in a small SF Alley. Loved the creamy pesto, pillowy soft gnocci and flavorful vegeterian ravioli. Tiramisu is an added bonus. Italy on a plate!
author: Mallem T.

description: Amazing homemade pasta & flatbread! The prices are excellent, you can get a large plate of pasta for around $9. I highly recommend the spinach and cheese ravioli in white sauce. I only wish the seating was a little more comfortable and that you could get a glass of wine to enjoy with your meal, but the pasta is so good those things are easily overlooked.
author: Miranda P.

description:
If you're looking for fresh authentic Italian food this is the place! Once you walk in you immediately feel the authenticity in the ambience. The restaurant itself is small with a few outside seating and a few inside. 

I ordered the lasagna with a meatball. The lasagna was to die for! I wasn't expecting much from it but wow the first bite literally exploded in my mouth. The meat and cheese ratio was spot on. The layers were made perfectly and each bite was the same. I highly highly highly recommend getting the meatball with it because it's a meatball duh! Not only that but you can tell it was homemade just like the lasagna. The meatball was so simply made but the flavors packed a powerful punch. It wasn't over seasoned or overcooked, it was perfect. 

My boyfriend got the pesto gnocchi and oh my goodness... It was GREAT! The gnocchi itself tasted like a cloud. I was literally biting into a little cloud. It was so soft and it just melted in my mouth. I've never tried a gnocchi this well made before. It just had everything I expected from a gnocchi. However the pesto sauce was ok. Wasn't feeling it at all. I would have rather got a red sauce or a cream sauce with this. The pesto was just bland in my opinion. But the quality of gnocchi saves the sauce definitely. 

We also ordered the flat bread, it was alright. Reminded me of a quesadilla without the cheese just the tortilla. However this bread would make a killer quesadilla!

Love love love this place, I will be coming back for sure!! 

Only thing I would recommend is to dine in and eat everything there because it's fresher they way. When I took my leftovers home it didn't taste as good and the sauce evaporated quite a bit when I microwaved it. Still good but not as great as eating it there.
author: Quinn V.

description:
Delicious fresh pasta! Never had fresh pasta before I tried this place and it has a lovely texture, bite, and taste.

It's a cute "Italian market" looking place with some Italian snacks and a couple tables for seating. They also have frozen pasta and gnocchi that you can buy by the pound.

I'll usually go here for their cooked food though- everything that we've tried is tasty. Having a pasta-lover boyfriend, you can imagine that we've frequented this place multiple times after trying it. They have a wide variety of pasta types (fettuccini, pappardelle, etc) as well as gnocchi, tortellini , and ravioli. My favorite is the meat ravioli (filled with various meat and ricotta) with their pasticciata sauce (bolaganese sauce with cream). The pasta ranges from 9-13 then around 1-2$ for sauce. Portions are not huge, but definitely a good size and will get you full. 

The boyfriend's fave is the pappardelle (it's kind of like fettuccini but wider) with meatballs. 

We've tried the tortellini (filled with various meats and cheese), gnocchi, fettuccini... they're all good. white sauce is good too but if it's your first time I'd say go for the pasticciata or bologanese sauce because they are classic :)

They also have salad, lasagna, and rolls which I haven't tried because I love the pasta so much
author: Kathleen Y.

description:
I have never had pasta this good in my entire life -- it was amazing! We had pappardelle with pesto and with marinara sauce, veggie ravioli and vegetarian lasagna. (Our group was a mix of vegans and vegetarians). The lasagna was very good but didn't approach the incredible level of the pastas + sauces, which were each better than any we've ever had! I want to only eat here forever!!

PS amazing dessert up the street at Victoria's pastry!!
author: Dana S.

description:
OMG!  The aromas stemming from this kitchen are so amazing.  You feel as though you just walked right into nonna's kitchen!  Like a fashionista embraced in a cashmere wrap, once you enter you are completely enveloped in homemade Italian goodness.  It's intoxicating & blissfully overwhelming.  

The staff speaks fluent Italian.  My man (who is 100% Italian) also speaks fluent Italian.  I asked him to ask them what the difference between the piadina & the cassone was, then he explained it to me.  Of course the staff also speaks English, but I let my man take this opportunity to indulge in the language that he grew up speaking.

The piadina is a flatbread sandwich.  The cassone is a piadina that has been grilled.  

We ordered everything to go.  
The sausage cassone, the special gnocchi entree, & meatballs w flatbread.  

The cassone is a cleaner & modified version of a calzone.  And much better imo.  Delish.

The special gnocchi.  Asparagus & speck in a delicious white sauce.  The gnocchi were divine, pillowy perfection.  Dreamy.    

The meatballs were rich & full of flavor; but the star was the red sauce.  Thick & zesty, we sopped it all up w the flatbread...a perfect marriage.

Seriously, their red sauce & that white gnocchi sauce could turn stale bread into straight up lusciousness on a plate.  

We enjoyed our dinner w a couple of glasses of red wine.  It was the perfect meal.

Uber homey & casual, w an array of outstanding Italian dishes.  Fresh pastas to take home & cook.  Various hot prepared items.  And those fab piadinas & cassones!  Lasagna & the gnocchi roll are next on my list.  

It's impressively apparent that TIHC is a product of love & passion.  It manifests in everything they prepare.  

TIHC could not be more authentic, warm, or positive.  North Beach has gained an extraordinary addition to the neighborhood.  Mangia mangia!

5 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description: Great place, the pasta is so fresh and the sauces are delish! Priced well, $9-11 although it is ala carte. It would be great to haave some wonderful bread. I wasn't a huge fan of the high bar stools. Some outside seating. Service was fairly friendly. Bathroom was spotless.
author: Deb P.

description:
In the city for our sons 4th grade mission project and got hungry, being in the mood for Italian food, we Yelped it. As the first restaurant on the list to come up it's inexpensive and highly rated, it made our decision easy. This place is everything and more! My husband ordered what felt like one of everything, we could have used a cot when we were done. Every single bite was delicious, earning every star. We will be coming back. 

Thank you for the wonderful experience. Even the staff was terrific.
author: Leslie M.

description: Purchased two orders of the vegetarian ravioli with marinara sauce as a delivery. I am highly disappointed and unfortunately will never order from this restaurant again. For what I paid (just a bit over $35 for the two portions), the portions are tiny, and had hardly any sauce. The sauce did not taste good and was very watery. The ravioli was mediocre and had hardly any filling, which also didn't taste good (like cheap pizza place parmesan cheese). It also didn't make sense to me that you pay one price for the entree but then have to pay an additional few dollars for any sort of sauce, even basic marinara. Very disappointed.
author: Jessica C.

description:
I live in the neighborhood, so it is always a good place to have lunch or dinner near home :)    Being a huge fan of Italian food I can definitely recommend this place. Food is delicious and stuff is super friendly. 

       However, if you are looking for a cozy and quiet place, it is no the one. But they have an excellent pick up service.
author: Mariya O.

description: Over rated Italian cafe ! If you are looking for cheap Italian food that tastes mediocre with terrible service then this is the spot for you . They also add a surcharge for service so I wouldn't recommend you to get tricked by the cashier who twists an iPad with generic restaurant software your ways for you to choose 20% tip at a cafe ! If you feel sorry for them put a couple dollars in their tip jar .
author: Moose A.

description: Oh. My. Damn. Had their tagliatelle pasta with meatballs and bolognese sauce and it was BOMB. Great flavor. The texture of the meatball was unique too (dont know if in a good or bad way) but I liked the overall taste. Although it is on the pricier side.
author: Danny F.

description: Went for the first time yesterday.  Ate there and brought some home for dinner.  Flippin outstanding food.  So thankful I tried it.  Will go back every chance I get.
author: Tina B.

description:
Simple and fresh.
All pasta is homemade and delicious!

We recommend lasagna and any dish with pesto sauce!
author: Andre D.

description:
glutenpalooza! we came here for the homemade (tagliatelle, gnocchi) pasta and it didn't disappoint. it was dense and chewy like all great egg based pastas should. the sauces were good from the slightly sweet marinara, the creamy sage butter and their must have homemade ragu but the stars of the dish for us was their pasta. the wife was like "we're ordering a few to try but if we don't finish it don't worry", didn't worry cause our plates were empty when we left. 

we need more places like I.H.C., fresh, simple, great tasting unpretentious italian. hopefully they can eventually make their way to socal.
author: NYSD G.
