description: Best quick, cheap italian in the city. I vist everytime I'm around!
author: Ali M.

description: Good, fast pasta. Caprese, mountain of lasagna, pesto pappardelle, and meatball bolognese. Delicious lunch.
author: Michael B.

description:
Walking into this restaurant you get a wonderfully authentic vibe! The decor is quintessential old school Italian restaurant. There is upbeat and happy music playing and just a great environment. 

For the food, they have a good selection of pastas, sandwiches, and salads to choose from and customize. The prices range a little over $10 for the most part. I ordered the parpadelle pasta with the meatballs in bolognese sauce, the pasta came out al dente, which i really like, and the meatballs were hard and don't fall apart (again, a good thing). My dish was just amazing. My friend ordered the vegetarian ravioli with marinara sauce and meatball side and he describes it as "simply fabulous". We both got parmesan cheese on it and it was a good amount.

The service was just as amazing as the food. The gentleman that helped us was very easygoing and pleasant. He brought us our food and replaced the crushed red pepper that we had for a new one. He also checked up on us to make sure everything was good. I noticed that he went out and cleaned up the outside seating area. Its a clean establishment.

They offer plenty of homemade sauces and goods to take home with you. Also, free Wifi!! Overall a great experience! 5/5 would come again!!
author: Steven P.

description:
You can't beat homemade pasta! My husband and I shared the tortellini with the bolognese sauce and it was amazing. The serving was large as well and was enough for the both of us. Perfectly cooked and had the "al-dente" bite to it. We also got some of their flatbread which was also amazing. 
The staff was friendly and the bathroom and restaurant was clean. I highly recommend coming here if you're in the area!
author: Shelby J.

description: Incredible lunch place with HOMEMADE everything. Pastry dough on the cassone delicious baked sandwich was almost pasta-like and their sauces!!! Hard to describe, so simple, like eating real tomatoes but with perfect additions of herb, garlic & olive oil. Famous for their lasagna, we took a piece home to have w/ dinner!
author: Bridget B.

description: Wow. This place was amazing.  I ordered fettuccine with pesto and the meal was incredible. The flavor of the pesto is very authentic. The noodle was so fresh. And the price is so reasonable compared to other places. It's a must try.
author: Patrick W.

description:
Since finding parking in North Beach can be like finding a needle in a haystack, we decided to head over early on a foggy Sunday morning.  We arrived a little after 10:30 and was warmly greeted by Alesandro.  Although I had my heart set on the gnocchi roll, we did ask for a recommendation for the piadine and went with his favorite, the classico.  

Gnocchi Roll - Gnocchi is usually not the item I would normally order at an Italian restaurant but knowing that it was freshly made gnocchi dough surrounding spinach and ricotta and sliced so you can make sure you have some of the sweet and tangy tomato sauce in each bite had me sold.  Like Rachael Ray, one of my pet peeves is having a small blob of sauce on top of naked pasta.  Every bite deserves to be enrobed in flavorful sauce.  

Classico Piadine - You cannot go wrong with prosciutto and arugula. The flatbread is thinner than pizza crust so is therefore crunchy but strong enough to hold the ingredients even wrapped like a sandwich.  

Prices run about $10-$12 each I believe for the gnocchi roll and piadine. 

They also had pannetone, sweets including the Spelari nougot, and sauces straight from Italy.  We went with the fresh made pasta (squid ink fettucine and tagliatelle) that you can take to go which averages about $15 per lb with two servings of the ones we got coming in at about 1/2 a lb.  If you want more than a lb I am assuming of each, they do recommend  you calling it in.  Since fresh made pastas have egg in it, make sure you get it right before heading home and in a cooler as it is best kept frozen to avoid sticking.  Once home, put it directly in the freezer and cook within 10-12 days.

Check out my final product with the fresh Squid Ink Pasta - http://www.cookwithzee.blogspot.com/2015/01/squid-ink-fettucine.html

Final product with the fresh Tagliatelle - http://www.cookwithzee.blogspot.com/2015/02/sicilian-eggplant-and-pepper-ragu.html
author: Joyce Z.

description: This is the most amazing pasta place I've ever eaten at. We were walking by on our way to eat in Chinatown but saw the pasta and couldn't pass it by. We had the fettuccine  with pesto which fed two people. All the people inside are so friendly and accommodating. Whenever we are in SF we will definitely be back!
author: Emily W.

description: Delicious and exactly what I like when getting Italian food. Homemade made with love and none of that extra fancy stuff. I love the ravioli with pesto sauce. Amaaazinggggg. Never disappointed when I come here.
author: Lisa C.

description:
My partner and I came to SF for a day trip and thought we would also visit a friend while there. Said friend is an eater. I am talking "I am a tall man with much hunger, whole pizza is a snack" friend lol. Any who, my partner is a chef and he was really impressed by the quality and deliciousness of this pasta. So much so that we had this sneaky conversation about our leftovers

Him: We can't tell Erik we hold the secret
Me: Do you mean the secret to his stomach?
Him: No. The secret to happiness

Yes my friends, this pasta is so good,  you hoard leftovers. My leftovers didn't even make it back to San Jose. It is also walking distance to Lombard St so you can walk that guilt off right away. Seriously, those hill leading up there are steeper than you think.  

The place itself is very quaint. Right at the cusp of little Italy and on Russian Hill, it is a small shop that also sells deli items. Do yourself a huge favor and buy some of their deli items so you don't anxiously plan your next trip. They have a lot of options and combos to choose from. I went with the butter and sage gnocchi. Sage always makes me feel bouigy haha. My dish was 10/10 fantastic. I was convinced the butter and sage was a cream sauce they concocted. But alas, it was just plain 'ol butter and sage. Yes, I know, I can hear my thunder thighs ripping through my jeans now. The gnocchi was among the best I have had yet if not the best. They were light and airy but still doughy without being too dense. My partner ordered fettucini with bolognese sauce and two meatballs. We were so drawn by the plates walking by this shop that we essentially forced ourselves to eat. It was definitely worth it to be potbellied after finding this place! Our plates were only $10-15 each which is a price that can't be beat even by Olive Garden. You know since this place actually makes their pasta in house.

On our second visit, it was really crowded. The line went out the door but they took the  business with grace and you didn't wait longer than 20 minutes to get your order in and have it in front of you.  The shop itself is small so it doesn't take much to get full. Don't let the long lines deceive you! They have sold out of gnocchi since my first visit which breaks my heart but other items are still a good alternative.  I like their young cashier. She is always really friendly and helpful which you can say about most of their employees. 

One of the best highlights of this shop is that they have female cooks. Lots of them! SO you know these ladies got that sensational Italian cooking pizzazz  that makes your food taste like rainbows are flowing through you. Definitely recommend this spot. Indoor seating as well as outdoor. This place is good for casual dates. It might just seal the deal for some ;D

Parking is tough but you knew that already. Its SF lol.
author: Maria M.

description: This is the best pasta I have ever had. I ordered the tagliatelle with bolognese sauce and a side of meatballs. The pasta is made freshly in house and is perfectly cooked. It is firm to the bite and packed with flavor from the sauce. The meatballs are big and very tasty. If you love pasta then you should come here and get a plate of delicious homemade pasta. I will definitely come back here again.
author: Ismael P.

description: I chose this place because I was in the mood for good wholesome homemade handmade pasta. I trusted the reviews and figured I'd give it a try. Although usually weary of mix and match  choose your pasta and choose your sauce ordering, I was immediately put at ease when I walked in. Sure, there's a little show in the front with with a woman hand rolling pasta, but don't be deterred, this is not a tourist section of Pac Heights. Order and pay at the counter, find a table and your dinner is brought to you. I chose the tortellini (one of my personal favs) with the recommended crema di parmigana sauce. WOWSA! it was delicious! Perfectly cooked, al dente, and the right sized portion. My only thought was that I wished it came with bread to sop up what was left of the sauce. I only wish there was one of these near me.
author: Roger G.

description:
They know how to make PASTA!!!

This little north beach gem is full of Italian love. In fact that was the special of the day ;-)

It's a simple menu and they will help you out. For pasta just choose the kind of pasta you want and the sauce you want. For specialties, you just order that (eg lasagna or gnocchi roll). They also have panini type sandwiches and these big ravioli looking sandwich type things. 

Super fresh pasta and perfectly cooked. 

The sauces are good but it could use a little more oomph. The pesto needed a little more salt and garlic for my taste. 

The lasagna is perfect. Even if it looks like it's been sitting in that pan for a little while, as long as it's fresh you should get it.  The lasagna. The lasagna. The lasagna. I don't think I can eat lasagna anywhere else anymore. 

I can't wait to go back!

Small sitting areas inside and a few outdoor tables too 

Takes credit card via square. 

Not sure if there's a bathroom.
author: Traci H.

description:
Just so good. Staff is very nice. Meatballs, lasangna, gnocchi all amazing. The prices are low, but the quality is very high. Had worse at stuffy Italian restaraunts three times as expensive.

Plus, all the workers are cute and feature actual Italian accents. They seem like they have fun working there (but still give them a raise, boss).

Oh, tiramisu and panna cotta are almost hallucinogenic. Don't sweet and drive.
author: Jesse A.

description: Love the food here !! Vegetarian lasagna- big shout-out !! It's a cute little fast food kinda place. Veggie fettuccine with pesto so yummy !!
author: Chetana K.

description: This place is delicious! I highly recommend the burrata salad, it was amazing. I also loved the meatballs and homemade pasta, but don't get too many meatballs, they're huge!
author: Melissa C.

description:
The most perfect little Italian bistro that is not in Italy.  

When my family arrived, the store was quite crowded and every table occupied, which had me slightly worried.  But by the time our food arrived we could find seating at the window bar and have great views of the street; perfect timing!

The red and white interior theme is very noticeable, and the restaurant has a very comfortable feel to it.  The cooks banter to each other in Italian and the open kitchen space allows full view of your meal being cooked.

The menu is very straightforward, and the cashier is always willing to give recommendations, which is a plus.  Everybody decided to try something from a different category, ordering lasagna, ravioli, piadina, and cassoni (this was mine).

I had very little idea what a cassoni would be, which turned out to be tomatoes, tomato sauce and mozzarella wrapped up in pastry crust.  You might think of it as a giant over-glorified hot pocket (as I did when I first saw it), but the flavors that hit my mouth with the first bite made me speechless.  It was rich and savory, striking the perfect balance between tang of tomato and thick cheese.  It warmed me up like nothing else on that cold winters day.
I tried half of a vegetarian piadina.  Taste was alright, with lots of eggplant and onion inside, but definitely plainer than my food.  

Needless to say, we all walked away hugely impressed with the Italian Homemade company.
author: Emily Y.

description: I highly recommend this restaurant if you are ever in North Beach. The pasta is simply delicious. It can stand by itself. The seating area is small. Hard to find a group seating if its crowded.
author: Michelle S.

description:
For a few days I 'v been craved for Italian foods something like Pasta, or Gnocchi. I chose to stop here for lunch for two reasons: the word "homemade" and the 4.5 stars on Yelp. I had  the Pappardelle with the Bolognese Sause and 2 Meatballs ($9 for the pasta and $3 for the sauce and the meatball). The pasta came out quickly. The Pappardelle were chewy and the meatball, huge and tasty! 
Everything was perfect! So fresh, so yummy, and the most important is AUTHENTIC homemade!
But.... I hate to say this" but"! That would be great, if I could have some vegetable soup or other kinds of soup!
author: Jenny B.

description: Definitely a great place to check out & great food w/ nice staff & good atmosphere. I had the prosciutto sandwich which was great & the cheese that they used for it was great. Was in Italy last year & it reminded me of it. Great place.
author: Johnny S.

description:
I wish I was hungrier for one of their pasta dishes!  They looked so good, but I love burrata so I got their burrata salad instead.  It's arugula, tomatoes, and a huge piece of burrata right in the middle!  The burrata was light and went well with the bitterness of the arugula.  It also came with pieces of flat bread.

My friend got one of their sandwiches.  He told me the meat he ordered was not the meat he got.  But he liked it.

This mom-and-pop shop focuses on the food.  It has a diner atmosphere with awesome Italian pop songs in the background.  The employees are really helpful and welcoming.  I liked hearing them speak Italian (being the typical American girl that falls for any European accent).  I wish I kept up with the language.

Anyway, I'm definitely coming back for the pasta next time!
author: Vira P.

description: Meatballs were wonderful!  I wish we would have had time to try the pasta too!  Instead, we were getting food to go, so got the two vegetarian sandwiches. They were woefully under seasoned :/
author: Emma T.

description: With fresh pasta, it's a bit more tricky to get it al dente.  That was the problem with our pesto gnocchi.  Portion size and presentation were great, but the pasta could've used a bit more bite.  The pesto needed more salt, too.  A touch pricey at $14.  Still, it was pretty promising and I'd return to try more menu items.
author: Lan N.

description: Had fettuccine with pasticcia sauce (spelling might be wrong, but it's the one that's a bolognese and béchamel mix.  DH had a piece of meat lasagna and green salad.  I loved the al sentence texture of the pasta, and the sauce was very tasty.  The lasagna was excellent- a huge piece, lots of meat and good flavor.  My only wish was that my pasta was hot (it was lukewarm) when served.  Otherwise, this was a great spot for quick Italian fare at a reasonable price.  Service was friendly and quick, too.  Looking forward to trying some other dishes!
author: Amelia S.

description:
My co-worker who is Italian brought me here for lunch.  He described the place as small, not fancy, laid back, the food is truly what stands out for this small cafe like restaurant.  The pasta was FRESH and delicious!   I ordered the tagliolini pasta with bolognese sauce with one meat ball.  He ordered gnocchi pasta with bolognese sauce w/a meat ball.  We split a fresh mixed salad.  

 I loved my plate!  Delicious meatball & pasta that melts in your mouth.   I will be going there again!  Highly recommend it.   Of course, don't expect it to be like grandma's home cooking as my co-worker stated; however, for restaurant business this is one of the better ones in this area for a reasonable price.  

Also, they accidentally added cheese to mines but quickly realized their error and gave me a fresh new plate. They asked if we wanted to take the wrong order home for someone else w/o charge.   My co-worker gladly accepted it to go.
author: East B.

description:
If you're looking for fine dining experience without the fancy schmancy protocol of most restaurants this is the place. It's great and to the point. You get there, pick your favorite pasta, your fav sauce, pay and take a table. Then enjoy some
of the best fresh pastas in town while listening to the soothing sounds of Italian being spoken in the counter and back in the kitchen. This is probably the fairest priced place we've eaten at in San Francisco and one of the yummiest. The portions are good, the flavor are perfect and the wait is not so crazy as at some of the neighborhood's restaurants. Will definitely go back.
author: Amelia R.

description: Food is just OK...I do not like it the paper plate and there is no room to sit at all. To go if u can. The most important and the reason I give the lowest star is because I order a tiramisu but they did not bring it?!! It's around $5+ and I paid for nothing! I would definitely like a refund!
author: Ming X.

description: The best Italian food I've ever had!!!! I had randomly stumbled across this place walking through North Beach and the food is amazing. The prices are very affordable for high quality, authentic food. As a vegetarian it was nice to not struggle to find food on the menu, I had the spinach & ricotta ravioli's with white sauce (which was delicious). I highly recommend this place!
author: Alaina A.

description: Used Yelp to find this place.  We LOVED it.  Had the Pappardelle with Bolognese sauce and it was delicious.  So was the burrata.  Service was very friendly.  Would go back again.
author: Debbie K.

description: OH. MY. GOD!!   This was some of the best food I have ever had.  I had a cassoni sandwich with meatballs, ricotta and mozzarella.  Absolutely amazing.  Counting the days until I can get back to try some of that beautiful pasta.  Great service.  Felt like I was back in Italy.
author: Dar V.

description: I came into this place for lasagna. The price was around $14 per slice. The wait time was around 30 minutes. I was not happy about that but the lasagna was not comparable to all the places I've been to. This place is really good especially the size of the lasagna.
author: Andy L.

description:
We were starving by the time we stumbled upon the Italian Homemade Company. We parked a few blocks away and walked over which. Because we came in evening parking was plentiful and free since the meters didn't require $$. We ordered a potato something calzone and waited approximately 10 minutes or so for it. I saw most people ordering pasta but we've been on a calzone kick lately and figured we'd get something authentic here. 

The calzone was $10 and for it's size we weren't much impressed. The taste was not unbearable but it did taste undercooked and doughy. If we're in the area, I might give this place a second try for pasta but I wouldn't go out of my way. Steer clear of the calzones as it was no bueno!
author: Stephanie G.

description:
Feels like you stepped into Italy. Everyone that works here is Italian. There is also a steady flow of Italian tourist. 

Lasagna is the best or at lease my favorite. Their sauces and meatballs are really good. 

Everything is fresh! They do have gluten free items however they won't be fresh.
author: Jason f.

description: What an exceptional San Francisco experience. It was fast, fresh, fab pasta served up Italian style. The place is tiny and crowded.  The seating encourages a quick meal, so this is not a luxurious or romantic place to linger. But still, we absolutely loved it for a bite to eat.  I brought kids and recommend the playground right down the street for  burning off some of that inexhaustible energy they seem to have. They had several interesting and unusual play structures. The combination of pasta and playground was a highlight of our day in the city!
author: Heidi T.

description: We ordered take-out and loved the food.   Only problem was that there is only one register and a super long line to pay.   It was worth it though!
author: Christy M.

description: Great service out of this world food. It's been a while since I've heard the native language spoken by customers - a true mark of a great establishment.
author: Val A.

description: A beautiful space to have dinner or buy groceries. The bar has seats that are all a bit different and you are surrounded by beauty as you walk in. Behind the glass on the right there might be somebody making dough depending on the time of day. Tiramisu is authentic and not too sweet. The people working there are quality people.  Late nights on a Friday it can get busy so have patience.
author: Stefan T.

description:
I woke up on a Sunday morning craving pasta like crazy, after dreaming with Rome and pasta and gelato, so I had to get some. 

We were initially going to a different restaurant in the North Beach area. With no reservations, that other really famous but tourist-attracting place was full and we were hungry, so decided to find an alternative instead. Nailed it.

This shop has a few tables inside and outside in the street, but we decided to buy something to go and eat picnic style at the less than 5 minute walk away Washington Park. Don't expect anything fancy, just some of the best pasta in town (heard the caprese salad is good too, but I had dreamt with pasta and salad wasn't an option for me that day).

I ordered the vegetarian ravioli (only because they were filled with ricotta, and I can never say no to ricotta) and spinach, and added cheese sauce and what some would consider too much parmesan. We also got meat ravioli with bolognese sauce, they were also great, but honestly not as good as the ricotta ones.

The pasta was perfectly cooked, you can tell these are homemade and fresh, or at least fresher than what you would find in most other places.

Quantities were good too. Almost went back to get the lasagna to take away after we saw someone else order it. But I will be back.
author: Marta V.

description:
The white sauce, red sauce, and pesto sauce is on point.

The music is on point.

The workers are on point.

Super good place to have a quick bite and to succumb to a wonderful food coma. I came and ordered the lasagna and it was worth it. I also got an order of pesto gnocchi and it was also worth getting because the sauce tasted so fresh of basil.

10/10
author: Sterling S.

description: Super delish! Reasonable prices, yummy food, friendly service and the place has lots of character. My fav is the burrata salad and Cassini w side of marinera.
author: Andrea L.

description: North Beach local sending love to one of my favorite spots for Italian food. Best pasta in North Beach.
author: Maisyn D.

description: This place is ridiculously overpriced- $80 for 4 pasta plates and 2 tiramisu, all served on small paper plates. Only one dish had a tiny bit of meat (beef ravioli), the rest were just pasta and sauce. So much carbs, and hardly any protein on the menu (no chicken or seafood). Totally not worth it, even though we liked their fresh pasta especially the Tagliatelle w/ Bechemel or Pesto. Also, the place is so small and seating is very limited. It's really cramped and the stools aren't very comfortable. When people pass by, you need to scoot while eating, to give them room and make sure nothing touches your food. For our family of 4 (2 kids, 2 adults) we had a nice seafood dinner in a much better set up for this much $ (yes, in SF). Never going back!
author: Fari H.

description:
Delicious fresh made pastas. Great for a quick casual dinner, make sure you get there early as they close by 9pm. Got here around 8pm on a Saturday night and tables were filled up, but by the time we have our orders and paid, we found a seat.

Had the fettuccine with the pasticciata sauce (bolognese with bechamel) and a cassoni, which is a hot flatbread sandwich cooked on the grill, and a yummy creamy tiramisu to finish off the meal.
author: Anna B.

description: My pappardelle with meatballs were...onolicious (delicious in hawaiian). Gotta say this is in my top 10 list of pasta places.  The challenge is not ordering  everything on the menu. I'll be back...
author: John P.

description: Great fast casual meal - about $27 for two. Delicious homemade pasta, can't go wrong.
author: Marcel C.

description: This place used to be my favorite 5-star Italian for a very long time until something changed. I don't know if it's the recipe, chef, or ingredients but I got the lasagna last night and I got really disappointed. Had to toss half of it and slept with a stomach pain all through the night.
author: Omid A.

description:
It's a deli-style pasta place where you can order fresh pasta to eat in (cooked to order), or you can buy fresh pasta uncooked to prepare at home.

We ordered fettuccine with marinara, and vegetarian ravioli with marinara as well to eat in. The fettuccine was great, cooked perfectly. Unfortunately, with the ravioli we actually got meat ravioli, but didn't realize until we'd taken a bite. They changed it for us when we brought it to their attention.

The vegetarian ravioli wasn't great, it was spinach and ricotta but something was missing.

I would definitely go back, but I'd avoid the vegetarian ravioli. I'd like to try the gnocchi and have more fettuccine - I'd probably try cook at home rather than eat in-house.

Sidenote: the tiramisu looked incredible, I'll be trying that next time as well.
author: Taylor S.

description: This place has the most mind blowing assortments of pastas and Italian cooking on display. Each dish feels like it was made with love. I'm hooked
author: Arjun M.

description: The food is pricey but it tastes so so so good. They do their pasta and sauces so well. Take me back! Can I get a discount? Buy 10 plates get one free?
author: Nani B.

description:
Alright people, this place is without a shadow of a doubt INCREDIBLE. 

1) The people behind the counter speak italian
2) Everything is SO fresh
3) The mozzarella on my salad actually blew my mind. It was so incredibly soft like a pillow of joy
4) The gnocchi roll I ordered BLEW MY MIND TWICE. I haven't had gnocchi that soft, that puffy, that fresh in YEARS (since I was in Italy, and even then was it this good?)

If you are questioning coming in...do notttt because it is SO SO worth it.
author: Irena L.

description:
What a great place to get a great Italian meal.  The people are so nice and make you feel at home like you walked into your grandmothers kitchen.  The food was delicious, we had the Gnocchi Roll gnocchi dough filled with spinach and ricotta. and the Cassoni with Italian Sausage, Bacon, Potatoes And Mozzarella Sandwich  both were delicious.  Generous portion size, we did not leave hungry.   Wish we could have come back again during our visit.
The have interior and outside seating, nice place for lunch or dinner.
author: Marcia M.

description: The vibe here just feels authentic. They'll be happy to give you recommendations and tell you what's best. Friendly workers and some legit Italian food with a "made from scratch/home" type of energy.
author: Jason L.

description:
So glad we came by. We came for lunch right when it opened at 11am on a weekday. My husband and I shared a lasagna and gnocci with meatballs sauce. 

The lasagna was AMAZING. So delicious. I'm salivating as I am thinking about it. Just order it. So good. The gnocci...was so so. I think I'm just not a gnocci person. My husband liked it. Meatballs were yummy.

Eat here.
author: M L.

description:
My coworkers and I came here for our company lunch. This place is more like a deli so there's only a corner with limited seating, not a full service restaurant. 

Most of us had the gnocchi with meatballs which was extremely fresh and good. I love the texture of the gnocchi and the freshness of the meatball. The portion was rather generous and I was very full by the end of my rather heavy pasta. 

I also tried the cassone with cheese, prosciutto and arugula which was delicious, and I heard, rather authentic. 

The place is run by a couple who are extremely warm and friendly. Even though we were a rather large group, we didn't have to wait too long for our food despite only having two of them running the place. 

Kudos!
author: Christina N.

description:
Amazing food! Fresh pasta and the lightest and delicious tiramisu! 
The service was great very attentive and polite young men. You order and pay first then sit. Had the pesto fettuccine, burrata salad and tiramisu
author: Michelle F.

description: I decided to go in here after reading all the great reviews but I was unfortunately disappointed, the food was bland and taste less and there wasn't anywhere to sit without waiting, I was hoping that the food would be worth the wait but it was not :/ I have tried many other Italian places with much better food with much better value. This place was overrated and overpriced in my personal opinion
author: Jhonnathan R.

description:
We travel to italy with each plate.
The guy in the front desk recommended each plate and very kindly.

taste and service unique.

Recommended 110%.
author: Jose H.

description:
They aren't lying! This place is HOMEMADE ITALIAN PERFECTION! Came to SF to visit a few friends and they said that if we're getting Italian, it has to be from this place! We called ahead to place our order for take out. It's a good thing we did considering how busy it was! 

The food was absolute incredible! I ordered the tagliatelle with meatballs. The meatballs were the perfect consistency. I hate when the ground meat is easily separated and there are little pieces of bone in it. These meatballs were so delicious! You have to get these!!! 

If I were in town a little longer, I'd definitely want to go back here. The gnocchi and lasagne looked delicious and I wished I could've eaten it all!
author: Courtney O.

description:
The food here is really good. Nothing too fancy on the menu. I'm in town for work and was adamant about finding a good Italian restaurant to eat it. I passed SEVERAL and knew this was THE ONE! It's a small and quaint little spot that was bustling with people...the line was almost out the door. 

I had the pappardelle with meat balls. I don't usually order red sauce but couldn't resist after looking at everyone else's plates while standing in line. It was seasoned to perfection and the pasta is homemade! Homemade pasta ya'll!!! For dessert I had the tiramisu and have been slowly savoring it as I'm dreading the last bite. The only down side was the flat bread. It was a little salty and I could have done without. The pasta dish was definitely filling so I would have been just fine.

This restaurant is a MUST try if you're in the area. I will definitely be back during my next visit!
author: Shayla C.

description: Great food. A little over crowded inside. Hard to find seats.   We ordered the lasagna and it was delish.  However we also ordered the flat bread and never received it.  We finished eating our dinner and the flat bread never came. I went inside to ask for it and they kept telling us to wait that it'll be right out and it never came.  It finally came out after we were done eating.  Flatbread was kind of sucky but the pasta was amazing !!
author: Erroll C.

description:
Best Italian place in town!! And not just the pasta is awesome!! Piadina and cassone is delicious as well! Italian Home Made make fresh pasta every day and I can feel the real ITALIAN taste of every single disch.. Their also are very friendly and gently!
So absolutely a place to go if u want to enjoy your lunch or dinner! 
I'm Italian and this is really autenentico !!!
author: Alice C.

description: Had the Shrimp pasta special based on the order taker's advice.  It was excellent.  Cream based sauce that was light with a touch of lime.  Nothing fancy - paper plates, no reservations, and a constant line of locals.  Worth the walk.  Will definitely be back.
author: Michael L.

description: This place is probably the most authentic Italian restaurant I visited in North Beach at a very reasonable price. I ragazzi parlano italiano. Soprattutto it is delicious! The location is a quaint space with a limited, but again delicious, selection of pasta dishes. I recommend this spot for a casual lunch or dinner.
author: Mariana R.

description: Vegetarian lasagna is amazing. The staff is super nice and beautiful :). Inexpensive. Quick and easy for take out too.
author: David S.

description: Amazing. We had vegetable ravioli with pesto, tagliatelle with bechamel and bolognes and the special, tagliatelle with sausage and truffles. I inhaled my plate (the special) and we also had 2 tiramisu that were to die for.
author: Aisha R.

description: You can't go wrong ordering anything on the menu. My hunny and I shared meatballs and some beef ravioli. Both were very good, but definitely loved the ravioli the best!! The restaurant was cramped, but it seems that is everywhere in S.F., so patience is needed in that area when speaking of this city. It was nice hearing Italian music and the staff was singing along, so it was a very happy atmosphere. I will definitely be making the trip back.
author: Cindy B.

description:
Step 1 - pick a pasta
Step 2 - pick a sauce
Step 3 - enjoy!

The pasta is on point, the food is cooked to order, the staff are friendly and the prices are reasonable. Italian Homemade Company is a simple, fast casual spot that constantly pleases - there's not too much more to be said. Highly recommended. 

Avoid the peak hours to not only avoid the lines but to get a seat. There are a handful of tables inside and outside, but not too many. If there are no tables available, just get the food to go and enjoy it at the park next door.
author: Bernard H.

description: Decided to try this place based on all of the great reviews around lunch time. The service was great and the food came out very quickly. I ordered the fettuccine with the meatballs and it was a bit bland for my taste. Based on all of the great reviews I kind of expected more flavor but it tasted like the sauce just came from a jar. Would recommend if you're in the area and just want some pasta but would maybe recommend trying something besides the meatball sauce
author: Vanessa R.

description:
Delicious, authentic, fresh Italian food with reasonable prices.  Nothing fancy about the ambience, but it's all about fresh, delicious food here.  So good!

And, love the Pasta lab idea.
author: Dana C.

description:
A hot mess of authenticity!

It felt like I got to peek into an Italian family's kitchen, without being a creep. Carb-loading was the mission. Yelp was the driver. 

We found this little nook of authentic Italian food, where two streets meet in the strangest acute angle. Parking looked sheepish, so I hopped out to snag a table while J parked the car, solid game plan!

Little did I know what I was in for. When I called to see how long the wait was, they said less than 20 minutes. Thus, leaving the impression it was a full on restaurant. However, when you walk in, you immediately realize this is more like a deli. You get whatever seat(s) you can, hold onto them for dear life, then figure out how to order and not loose your seat.

30 minutes later, J found a parking spot and he finally met me inside. I'd had plenty of time to give up my seat once and switch tables twice. I also had time to peruse the menu and peep all the food that everyone around me was eating. It is not fancy, by any means of the imagination. However, the food looked (because it was) fresh and homemade. Right above where the food is prepared and sitting, there are chalkboards as their menu. The kitchen is bustling with (I'm assuming) family members, screaming in a non-threatening (re: loving) Italian manner at one another. It really gives off a homey vibe.

Since it was later in the evening, they had already run out of the pappardelle noddles. So I went with the tagliatelle with meat sauce and meat balls. J went with the meat ravioli with bolognese sauce. Although I applaud them for being green and using recycled styled paper plates, they weren't the sturdiest for their large servings. By the end of the meal, they were almost completely soaked through, but not quite enough to tear. The flavors of these dishes are what I'd expect to taste in Italy. The insanely fresh, al dente noodles. Sauce that's been brewing and simmering all day - mixed in spices and curating the amazing taste of their sauce. Their meatballs, huge in size, flavor, and quality of meat. The ravioli's were easily recognizable as homemade. Their little pockets of meat stuffed into their hand made outer shell, scalloped at the edges, were exactly what I'd imagine I'd be served at a little café.

Although the setting did not transcend me to Italy, the flavors and dishes did. That and all the Italian being strewn about the kitchen. After I got over the actuality of the location, I loved it. You have to know what you're doing and getting yourself into here, but the food is well worth it.

We didn't order dessert, sadly. Or their piadine's, which have put them on the map in SF. I was stuck on carbs via noodles, so I stuck with what I love and know! We also enjoyed my beloved fruit San Pelligrino's as our beverages of choice, they had about five options to choose from. They have a serve yourself water jug, which we partook in as well. They also sell various Italian things, mostly food related, in their little shop. If I were to ever live in SF, which is never, I'd come grab take out before every race (or all the time). In all, it was delicious, light, and comforting as Italian food should be.

Carb loading like a true San Franciscan!
author: Steph G.

description:
Yup. Everyone's right. I fought my gf on this one, came and she was right. Best lasagna I've ever had and The peperdelli was very good too. The lasagna was just SO good that it overshadowed he already spectacular second dish. 

Sit outside at lunch. It faces the sun and was the perfect pianissimo ending to our vacation. Doesn't look like much on the outside but wow. Go here. :)
author: David N.

description: Pasta perfect.  Pasta and gnocchi texture was excellent.  Pasta and gnocchi is made fresh
author: L W.

description: Couldn't wait to try this place! Came in from LA and our first stop was here for some Italian food. After searching YELP this was one of the best places for homemade pasta. We arrived just before noon on a Sunday. They did not have two of the items made, which is what we came here for. Meatballs and Lasagna. Boo! My husband wanted to leave. Instead of leaving we decided to get one meal and split it..just so we could taste it.  Gnocchi was delicious. I personally did not care for the sauce. Ordered the meat sauce w/ béchamel. (Can't recall the name). The tiramisu some of the best I've had though. 3 stars for not being better prepared with items that were on the menu when we arrived early enough in the day.
author: Danielle L.

description: Absolutely nothing that great here.  All the reviews on Yelp say it's the greatest place ever.  Not true.   The thin bread was like a hard tortilla.  There were 4 of us and none of us were thrilled with our meals.   Seating is by far the worst and the cardboard plates soak up the sauce.   The sauce is not spooned over the top, but mixed in.  You lose a lot of the flavor that way.  Gnocchi was too large.
author: Beverly V.

description:
This place is absolutely delicious! My partner and I started with the buffala salad, which is made with mozzarella from buffalo milk. It's with arugula, tomatoes and balsamic vinegar. Yum!

I ordered the lasagna, which as some yelpers said, is completely melt in your mouth. The lasagna noodles aren't thick, which makes it taste light. I would order this again.

My partner ordered the tortellini with meat sauce. It's a little heavier, and the meat sauce is super delicious.

The place is small with only a few indoor tables and a couple outdoor tables. But people eat pretty quickly so the tables open up fairly quickly.
author: Joselito L.

description:
Don't want to rewrite everything, so just copied from our blog:  https://www.facebook.com/43Feetand4Paws/

Our grueling climb to the top of telegraph hill and Coit Tower helped us work up quite an appetite.  We checked Yelp for recommendations in the area (North Beach/Little Italy) and found a teeny, tiny little family market that serves up some wonderful stuff! 

The place offered a selection of homemade, fresh pasta, deli meats, sauces, and desserts for carry-out or dine-in.  There was also a very nice selection of other items imported from Italy at extremely reasonable prices.  I picked up several packages of Black Trumpet and Chanterelle mushrooms, and both varieties were less than $10 per package.  The mushrooms were one of the few things not imported from Italy, but were locally sourced from the Bay Area.  I also purchased several large chocolate bars flavored with orange zest (imported)...yum!  

Lacking decorations, the tiny restaurant area was unassuming and sparse.  Five or six high-top tables littered the store front for those who chose to dine-in.  Menu items were hand written on three chalk boards, hung over the kitchen area, and you placed your order before grabbing one of the few available tables.  A short time later, your completed dish is served up piping hot in a disposable, cardboard container.

I ordered pappardelle with bolognese sauce and an additional meatball.  The house-made pasta was cooked to a perfect al dente, and had a wonderful chew.  The rich, savory sauce was filled with tender meat, and the slightly acidic tomatoes were tamed with just a touch of cream.  But the meatball...incredible!!  Literally the best meatball I've ever tasted! 

If you're looking for a nicely decorated, sit-down place where servers take your order and deliver your food, keep walking!  But if you're looking for an authentic, family-run, no-frills, made-from- scratch Italian eatery, you're in the right place!  Don't miss this little gem next time you're in North Beach!
author: Christy W.

description:
Service is phenomenal. Food is very fresh and authentic. This is definitely my favorite Italian place in the city. 

Get the lasagne as it will melt in your mouth.
author: Bahram A.

description:
Cool in concept, wonderful staff, but probably something better to just take home and do yourself.

I was taking my friends through Chinatown and North Beach/Little Italy and towards the end of the day, we wanted some Italian. Unfortunately most of the places I wanted to try are closed on Sunday, and while we all wanted to try Tony's, we didn't realize we should have put our name down 2 hours in advance. Our bad.

So now we were on the hunt for an Italian place with good reviews. Up came The Italian Homemade Company. We were a bit confused, but between the lowering temperatures and the rising temperament of the baby, we needed to get food then and there. While a market that makes its own pasta, they also do make some dishes in store - pasta with sauce, specialty pastas, and cassionis. 

I went with fettuccine with the pasticciata sauce. The pasta could have been a bit more tender, and next time I'll stick with just the bolognese sauce. A friend got one of the cassionis and that was really good.

The staff was really nice and helpful, the place has a nice charm, but for me, I would have taken the pasta to go (I'm a fan of homemade pink sauces and vodka sauces).

That said, when I got there, they were taking out a fresh lasagna from the oven. It took considerable willpower (and probably the heat of the pan) to not steal it.
author: Michael C.

description: Well, we chose this restaurant based on previous reviews.  We were disappointed.  I was hoping for first rate Italian.  It didn't have that bright, light Italian taste we were looking for.  There are around 10 small counter height tables.  Plates are paper and you clean your own table.  No wine.  This maybe good for lunch but not dinner.  Staff was really nice.
author: Jane H.

description: Unbelievably amazingly good pasta. Reason behind saying this is that I ordered through UberEats and unfortunately after the driver was a block away he realized 2 items were missing when the restaurant called him. He traveled back the 20 minutes to get items and then delivered and this means the order was sitting in containers for almost an hour and 15 minutes at least. I ordered everything with the sauce on the side and this means the pasta was separate and it would have been a lump of glutenous mess had it not been the excellent pasta it is. Amazing . Vegetable Lasagna out of this world along with real Tirmisu, not a block of pudding. Cannot rave enough about this place. Best Marinara sauce as well, perfect. Will order over and over again.
author: Valentina S.

description: This restaurant is the real deal. Their pasta is made fresh on the premises. The people cooking and running the place are from Italy. It is refreshing to get genuine food without any fuss. I got the fettuccine with pesto. It was so delicious I went back before leaving San Francisco and bought some of each (uncooked pasta and pesto in a container) which they sold me by weight and I took it home.
author: Italiano 5.

description: My first few visits to this location of Italian Homemade Company (North Beach) were absolutely amazing. I raved about this place to my friends. However, over the past few months, the food both at the restaurant and ordered for delivery was consistently subpar and disappointing overall. The flavors and textures seem to have changed. Not sure what happened, and I'm hoping the restaurant figures out how to get back to how it used to be, but I have been going to the Marina location on Union St instead to get my fix.
author: Michelle H.

description:
Real Italian authentic food and sooo good. The people are happy make you feel like you're on a quick trip to Italy. 

We had the veggie lasagna and the gnocchi roll.  Bot were incredible. Two can share one dish if you're not that hungry. 

Would definitely come back as soon as I can. Loved this place
author: Etai M.

description: Best pasta ever! The noodles are home made and so delicious. The meatballs are home made and so delicious. I feel like I would be doing this restaurant and the people in San Francisco a disservice if I didn't leave a 5 star review.
author: Kayla C.

description:
One time Mr. NSS' bff told me when he was over at his house, Mr. NSS brought out a plate of fried chicken. He ate it ALL by himself...as his friends watched. "We were so hungry and was drooling, and he didn't even offer any", he further stated. 

Mr. NSS completely denied it.

Last week during a 4th of July gathering, his other bff said:

"Dude, remember that one time when we were at his house, he brought out a plate of fried chicken, and he ate the entire thing as we sat there watching him?"

Mr. NSS was mid rib at this point with bbq smeared on the side of his face and gave the nonchalant "so what" look.

Great, not only am I dating a messy eater but a selfish, fried chicken hog.

Ok, I'll get to the point...

This came in handy because when we were eating at The Italian Homemade Company, 20 people stared on. Here he is annihilating his food upon arrival without a care in the world while I'm all self-conscious, making sure I take small bites and wiping the corners of my mouth afterwards. You know, pretending like I had manners. 

If you come on the weekends, be prepared for North Beach food tour goers that frequent The Italian Homemade Company. They will watch as you savor every orgasmic bite.     

Thanks to Albertino M. for this awesome find. In the sea of North Beach overpriced, tourist traps is gem called The Italian Homemade Company that serves authentic, homestyle Italian cuisine. Even though there's seating, it's seemed more like a to-go place as food is served on paper plates. There's dog-friendly outdoor seating but there's too much commotion in the area that I wouldn't bring Tater Tot. On the menu are fresh, housemade pastas, piadas (Italian flatbread), and cassones (Italian sandwich). Pick your pasta (pappardelle, fettuccine, gnocchi, tagliatelle, squid ink, ravioli, etc.) and then your sauce (bolognese, pasticciata, meatballs, pesto, marinara, white, butter & sage). They also have a gnocchi roll, meat and vegetarian lasagna, imported meats, and cheeses. Everything is about $9-$13, and portions are massive. Order at the counter and one of the friendly staff will bring your order to you. Cc's accepted.

We shared the Meat Lasagna ($12) and added two meatballs ($1.70 each): http://bit.ly/1LeSZDs. Now this is what I call some good 'ol rustic Italian cuisine. The lasagna had multiple melt in yo mouth layers filled with meaty bolognese sauce that had a wonderful depth of flavor. I prefer my noodles a little more al-dente but there's no denying this was one hearty, comforting dish. The meatballs were deliciously plump, tender, and very flavorful. All we needed was some bread to slop up some of that sauce. 

I wish all firsts can be as good as I sunk my teeth into my very first Cassone ($10): http://bit.ly/1JfAmuE. This unassuming Italian sandwich, hot pocket, or whatever you call it was amazing! A large piece of flatbread is filled with mashed potatoes, sausage, cheese, AND bacon, folded in half, and griddled until both sides are golden brown. It's served with a side of béchamel sauce. If a quesadilla knocked up a pierogi, this would be it. Super crunchy on the outside, and warm and oozy in the center. They don't skimp on the sausage and bacon either. I get all warm and fuzzy just thinking about that cassone.

As we were finishing up lunch, another North Beach food tour group arrived and this little kid in the group gave me the stank eye.

Mr. NSS: "Uhhh, I think you need to take a look in the mirror."
Me: "Why?"

Mr. NSS: "You have white sauce smeared on the side of your face and there's a piece of cheese hanging at the corner of your mouth."

So yeah, leave your manners at home (or whatever manners you're pretending to have) because the food is THAT good at The Italian Homemade Company!
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
I only give one star if there are bugs in my food. There were no bugs in my food. 

Bland food. Burnt lasagna. Congested. Overpriced. Loud 70's punk music. Indifferent cashier. Not worth writing complete sentences.
author: Tammy F.

description:
At first glance this place seems like it could be a great local mom and pop place to go in North Beach for freshly made pastas, sauces, and Italian goods. It probably is but after my experience here I don't think there will be a second chance. 
We got their pasta which was good and the salad we got is unacceptable.  Arugula was brown, yellow, and wilting.  If they were out of arugula then they should not be selling it.  
Overpriced and overrated.  Plenty of other North Beach institutions to spend your money on.
author: Naty D.

description: I know this place is highly recommend but I did not really understand why. Don't get me wrong it is very good but it's very basic pasta, I feel like you could make just as good at home. Perhaps I just ordered wrong? Did not seem worth a 30 min wait in line and 20 min wait for food...
author: Emily C.

description:
Love this place!!!!

Cozy little Italian restaurant that makes the most amazing food with such warm hospitality and great service.  Everyone speaks Italian which only makes it that much better..

I had the gnocchi roll and meatballs and they were absolutely delectable...  Seeing people eat other pastas/dishes and hearing them ooh and ahh reaffirms my suspicion that everything these guys serve is amazing and sooooo authentic.

Incredible place.  Highly recommended.
author: Michael B.

description: This place is awesome!!! Quick friendly service and all the pasta is super fresh!! Gnocchi with pesto sauce was amazing!
author: Alison C.

description: Came here because of the yelp reviews and was no disappointed. Definitely cooked by italian and very fresh. I had stuffed ravioli and meatballs. Just cutting into the meatballs you could tell how fresh they were and light as well. Food was excellent. There is not much seating if it starts to get full so get your seat fast. Order at the counter and they bring you your food. Would definitely come back.
author: Jesse V.

description:
Staff is very nice and friendly. But the food was average and quite frankly priced kinda high for a place which serves you average food on paper plates with plastic silverware.
Went in a group of 4 and got 2 veggie ravioli with pesto sauce, this was pretty good, 1 lasagna with meat sauce, very average and gave me heartburn, 1 daily special red sauce pasta without prosciutto 
Space was tight and I kept bumping into
people while having to go refill my water cup. Lunch for 4 was around $70 without drinks!
Maybe it's a not so cheap student joint?
author: Vik K.

description:
Truly Italian and truly delicious 

Cool spot in a nice part of town. Owner is very Italian and very hospitable. 

Ordered one lasagna for my girl and I. It was perfect for the both of us. It was also really good. 

They sell fresh pasta that you can take with you which is cool. Casual environment yields a great experience overall with good food.
author: Andy B.

description: I was looking for a place to eat close to my house and came across this place on yelp and after seeing some of their pictures I was sold. After coming here I can definitely say the good is as good as it looks in the reviews. I got the meatball speciality which was to die for!
author: Courtney H.

description:
This restuarant is one of my favorite places to go for fresh, perfectly cooked pasta! I'll just get straight to the point. 

My favorite dish: the meat ravioli with sage and butter sauce. The ravioli has this nice chewy texture, which really is why this place gets 5 stars from me! Every time I go to Italian restaurants, the pasta is subpar because it all dissolves or tastes like people bought it from a generic brand and boiled it. The meat inside is blended so that it's almost this fine paste. The sage is a nice contrast to the meat by adding an earthy flavor. I would like to have more but they usually just give a couple of leaves. 

This time I got the meat ravioli with a red sauce (the one also mixed with the white sauce), and I think I prefer the sage and butter sauce. My brother got the tagliatelle with the same sauce. I just can't believe how good his dish (the pasta in particular) was! He took a bite and was stunned by how amazing the texture was, especially in contrast to the warm, freshly made sauce. 

Next time, I plan on buying some pasta so that I can make it at home and maybe experiment with my own sauces! (Costs around $13 to $18 a pound depending on what you're interested in)
author: Sophie D.

description:
this place is simply amazing. they have the most delicious lasagna i have ever had, i don't know how they do it

this place is really small inside but it gives it a nice everybody knows everybody vibe if that makes sense. it's very welcoming too. they tend to never have the veggie lasagna and the tortellini when i go in. maybe they only have it on the weekends? they make the pasta themselves and it's cooked so perfectly al dente with just the slightest crunch in ever bite. i absolutely love it. their bolognese is the only sauce i've had on the veggie ravioli and on tagliatelle. i should probably try the sandwiches but idk if i ever will because pasta hello! 

anyways just go. get the lasagna. and flatbread.
author: Lily M.

description:
I really enjoy this place--truly tastes homemade! The gnocchi roll is a must-try, but really everything is incredibly delicious and comforting.

Wheelchair accessibility notes: The entrance is flat. Most tables (which are quite close together inside) are at bar-height but a really nice waitress went out of her way to find us a normal-height table when it was super crowded and brought us our food when it was ready. Haven't used the bathrooms. Street parking (which is hard to come by) only.
author: Tricia R.

description:
Wonderful authentic Italian place!

It is nice to see this kind of place, full with people of all ages and backgrounds. A nice niche where you can see how pasta is made while enjoying the simplicity of a authentic Italian menu. 

I got the Tagliatelles with pasticciata (think of it as the delicious sauce that if left in the pasticcio bold once you've taken a few pieces). Go for it!

Grazzie mille!
author: Daniel P.

description: 3.75 stars.  Garfield would be quite at home at this tiny pasta shop located in San Francisco's Little Italy.  While there are plenty of pasta selections, and I'd love to try them all, my eyes were fixated on a hefty slice of lasagna coupled with meatballs.  The pasta itself was tasty if not a touch firm.  I certainly did not have any complaints about portion size and overall taste.  I did think it was a bit weird that a water cost about half as much as the lasagna, but you aren't here for anything other than the pastas anyhow.  Someone needs to transport this little shop back to Texas; it was a joy to eat here.
author: Yelper N.

description: Best italian comfort food in SF! As an Italian living in the city, I was so happy to find this place! They have piadine, a typical flatbread from my region, and DELICIOUS pastas.  My favorite pasta sauce is Pesto, it reminds me of the one my nonna made. Also the lasagna is very good and authentic. Highly recommend if you want to try real italian food!
author: Elettra F.

description:
AMAZING!
My husband ordered the lasagna & I ordered the fettuccine with bolognese sauce. 
Homemade pasta, mouth watering sauce. It melts in your mouth!
author: Sarah L.

description:
We tried this restaurant after checking yelp, as it has a lot of favorable reviews. The food was fantastic, the portion sizes were very generous and you could taste that everything was homemade. My husband had the meat lasagna and I had the tagliatelle with meat sauce. Both entrées were good, but his lasagna was some of the best lasagna I've ever tasted! 

I was not excited that there was no beer and/or wine and was slso expecting more of a restaurant. This spot has counter service only and you only get the entree (salad, sandwich or pasta) you pay for - nothing more (like bread) and nothing less. You bus your own tables, and the food is served on paper plates. There's nothing wrong with any of the foregoing, it's just not what I expected. 

Despite all of that, we will definitely return here for the great food, and isn't that really what it's all about?
author: Teresa O.

description:
This place was great for what they offer!

Very authentic Italian food and you can tell all the pasta is hand made and the sauces very well made. Very friendly service and cafe style atmosphere. 

My gf and I were hungry when we came in so we ordered three things on the menu.

We split the Pinta sandwich It was a flatbread style sandwich with salami, arugula and stracchino cheese. Super delicious and well balanced flavors. 

For our main course, I got the lasagna and gf got the tortellini with a bolognase cream sauce (as recommended by the chef). 

Both dishes very flavorful and great portion size. The lasagna kind of melts away in your mouth but nothing over done. The pasta had perfect texture and the sauce and cheese didn't overtake the dish. Very pleased. 

The tortellini's Filled with prosciutto di Parms, mortadella and Parmesan.  Very tasty. Probably the best tortellini's I've had and the gf agreed!  

A hint to the owner, the experience would have been great to have been accompanied by some red wine. : ).   Not sure if it's possible for your establishment but a decent table wine would compliment your food very well. 

Friendly, happy service!  

I will def be back and would recommend this place for a casual dining experience with authentic Italian cuisine.
author: Bob P.

description:
Great pasta, especially the pesto with fettuccini . 
Piadina with sausage is the best for apps. 
Gelato was fabulous, Sorbet has real fruit and the pistachio is really creamy and has full pistachio flavor.
author: phil b.

description: If you are looking for a fancy Italian restaurant, this is not for you. BUT, if what you are looking for is fresh, delicious homemade pasta and sauces, this is the place! Made it in time for fresh gnocchi, and the bolognese sauce made me want to lick the plate! Grab one of the few tables and enjoy!
author: Lori T.

description: Nice concept regarding fresh pasta. However the flavors were a bit bland. I ordered the gnocchi with pesto sauce ( $14) and although the gnocchi were good the sauce was very bland. I had to order extra parmesan cheese and even then I had to add salt to it. Also I noticed inconsistency on the serving portions as mine was a lot smaller than one someone was getting next to me. I am afraid I will not return.
author: Victor S.

description:
While walking past The Italian Homemade Company, I was enticed to stop by with the scent that lingered outside the deli like restaurant.  It smelled so good and I was curious to know why there was a small crowd inside.  

Once you enter, the space is very clean and casual.  It's half grocery store half deli.  Everything inside was very organized.  You could clearly see the cashier behind the counter and cooks speaking italian and making ordered food.  I noticed that the majority of their customers were Italian and they would speak to one another in Italian which was promising.  I assume Italians from Italy go to places with authentic Italian food right?  

I decided to order the gnocchi with a creamy mushroom white sauce which came out to be about $15. The dish came piping hot and freshly made (just the way I like it).  Each peice of gnocchi was the perfect consistency.  Not over or under cooked and tossed in a creamy white sauce with bits of mushrooms.  Delish!  

I'm not a huge fan of Italian because pasta is way too heavy for me, but I would definitely return for a casual meal when in the area.
author: Christine D.

description:
This is by far the best Italian food in the Bay Area. Authentic and delicious. You will not leave disappointed or hungry. 

Even if you are not in the area this is the place to go.
author: Travis P.

description:
Absolutely the best Italian Cafe in San Francisco 
The owners of this small but mighty in taste operation hail from Parma Italy. Where else in a major tourist town  can you get deletable hand made pasta like Pappardelle and Tagliatelle for $9 bucks ?!
The meatballs were rich and delicious and the Bolognese meat sauce was stellar. The simple Mozzarella salad with cherry tomatoes is a must have as well as Fettuccine with Pesto. Don't leave San Francisco without stopping by this little pasta & sandwich cafe or you'll miss out on one of my favorite city's hidden gems.
author: Patrick S.

description:
Several months ago B and I came here in search of something to eat. It was super enticing but we ended up across the street at that sushi place because he did not feel Italian that day. Ever since I learned that he lived, for the most part, at his other place on 7th and Clement, and had a whole other life that I was not aware of, I had declared that 7th and Clement and it's immediate vicinity to be my no-fly zone. Alas, rules like such were made to be bend. From time to time, I continue to hover there, as T lived there too, and we were often out and about, doing our usual official food business. 

But I prefer North Beach more. Yet that day, I was not here with B.  I was here to meet with a girlfriend of mine. And she's going to bring her new boyfriend. As I waited, I ordered the mozzarella and prosciutto sandwich based on the waitstaff's recommendation. The sandwich was served on a thin flat bread. Super delicious. Mouth watering. And the prosciutto was fresh. 

I told the waitstaff that I'm sure that my friends who are coming to meet here, would order something here too. You see, she was super sweet. She served my sandwich warm. Already cut up, half in a to-go box and half on a plate. A fast food with superb service. So considerate.

The girlfriend arrived with her new beau in tow. He was very intrigued about everything that was being served around us. A man arrived later than they, had gone up to the counter to order a gnocchi roll. I recall the waitstaff telling me that was good too but it sounded so unusual at the time. We watched the gnocchi roll being served to that man who ordered it.  The gnocchi roll looked like lasagna. But the pasta was made of potato starch. The sauce was rich and flavorful. You could smell the aroma from a few tables down. The girlfriend's beau went to the counter and ordered a gnocchi roll as well.  For a mostly to-go food place the food was all made to order. Thus patience is required. While waiting, I learned that my girlfriend had moved into her beau's house in Inner Richmond, and they were settling down. I happen to be eating out there a lot so I offered them my opinion on the different Burmese places that were around their hood, and how Burmese food has its regional varieties given the influence from neighboring countries. They seemed impressed with my in-depth analysis of a series of Burmese restaurants in their hood, or they were just  extremely polite. Just then the food arrived. 

I eyed their food jealously. Then I went to the counter and ordered one to go. It really could feed a family of four. Tried and true. Totally worth the wait.

Time to head out. Hugs all around. I liked my girlfriend's new beau. As we waved goodbyes,  the beau turned around and said to me, "You really should come to visit us. We MUST go out to eat. Or grab coffee. You can always find me at Village Market." He added.   

"Sure!" "Where do you guys live?" I came to immediately regret my follow up question. 

"7th and Clement." He cheerfully replied.
author: Victoria E.

description: We started here during a food tour and tried the spinach stuffed gnocchi smothered in bolognese sauce. Oh yummy!!!!! Will have to come back to get that sauce to take home!
author: Sambath T.

description: Amazing meatballs and deliciously fresh, chewy pasta! They ran out of gnocchi/meat ravioli/tortellini when we stopped by in mid-afternoon so get there earlier. A little bummed out, but seriously...the meatballs made up for it. Meatballs. Get the meatballs. (Meatballs.)
author: June L.

description:
Been here twice. Hands down the best Italian food over ever had. 

The marinara sauce is simple and tasty. Veggie lasagna with white sauce is amazing. I could write forever about this place.
author: Raymond R.

description: I stumbled onto this place while walking around while visiting from New York. It is kind of a hole in the wall, no frills, take a number and seat yourself kind of place. Pick your pasta, and then pick your sauce. The guys working here are a few young Italians, and they have their pasta game dialed in--some of the best pasta I have ever had, trips to Italy included. I could not recommend this place more.
author: Kevin P.

description: Handmade food that tastes as good as it looks! Had the veggie raviolis with the meat sauce and a salad. Damn good!
author: Dan W.

description: We found this place on a culinary tour of Little Italy. We went back for dinner. Standing room only. Well worth the wait for fresh pasta and home made sauces. The meatballs were awesome. Very reasonably priced.
author: Dean A.

description:
I was a tad disappointed with Italian homemade. They have their marinara sauce on point to the tee. Their lasagna is probably one of the best I've ever had. But their meatball was dry and lacking taste. My boyfriend and I had also ordered their gnocchi which was surprisingly underwhelming. It lacked taste, it felt like I was pointlessly consuming carbs. We also ordered the Cassoni with bacon, sausage, and potatoes. When reading the description of the Cassoni, it sounded interesting, flavorful, and hearty. It was the opposite of what I had imagined..and they served it burnt :( it lacks taste, and has a very dough-y texture. The sauce on the side also has no taste. 

We may have ordered the wrong things (besides the lasagna). However, I would still come back here to try their pappardelle with marinara sauce.
author: Tracey K.

description:
The food was not only exceptional, but perfectly authentic!  The pasta is delicious and the sauces were perfection. The tiramisu' was awesome and the portion was huge! Definitely enough for two.  Service was quick and courteous.
We'll be back every day while we are in San Francisco.  The only place we ate this kind of Italian food was during the 10 years we lived in Italy!
author: Maria S.

description: Fantastic homemade Italian. Had the meat ravioli with Bolognese and a meatball cassone. Both were scrumptious! Family owned with a friendly atmosphere. We sat outside and enjoyed a rare clear blue sky!
author: Tammy R.

description:
Yummy and cute! Run by real Italian guys with sweet accents and a real Italian mama making pasta, this place is a real gem in North Beach.

1. Pick your pasta.
2. Pick your sauce.

Or pick from their specials like lasagna or the daily specials board of pasta. 

The first time I came I found myself underwhelmed by the ravioli, but I tried their lasagna and gnocchi the following week and loved it! Super fresh, chewy, pasta, and not terribly al dente, which I prefer. 

I don't even like gnocchi that much but loved the quattro formaggio gnocchi! Their lasagna is quite soft and melts together perfectly. I also love that you can buy their fresh pasta to take home and cook. Prices will run you around $14 for most, and quantity is large. I couldn't quite finish my lasagna as a lunch portion and left feeling very satisfied, you know, in the way that only carbs can.

My one critique would be to serve food on real plates! They only have paper plates and I think it would upgrade the quality of service (and be more environmentally friendly) if they had real plates for the sit-down crowd. 

If you find yourself near Washington Square Park, it's definitely worth a visit.
author: Kate M.

description:
Absolutely delicious homemade pasta and sauces.

Nothing fancy, pasta is served on paper plates.

Definitely a true taste of Italy in North Beach, one of the most authentic Italian places I've been in SF.
author: Eric B.

description: Excellent food served quickly for a reasonable price. Seriously delicious. Saved my life :)
author: Miza M.

description: Delicious handmade pasta! Meatballs with pappardelle = classic dish with great flavor. My husband had the tagliatelle special with porcini mushrooms and Italian sausage. I could eat that meal every day! Thank you, Italian Homemade!
author: Addison C.

description: This is by far the best hole in the wall real  Italian restaurant in the San Francisco.  Their pasta dishes absolutely delicious and authentic as if you're eating your pasta somewhere in Italy.  Their pastas are made fresh at the restaurant, you can even buy them per pound and cook it at home. Don't forget the salads, the salads are absolutely refreshing and delicious.  I love that their sauces are not too runny and it's not too garlicky. They have very friendly and helpful staff.
author: Jean E.

description: Authentic Italian pasta and sauces by Italians that even the locals love! The softest pillowy gnocchi with fresh pesto will melt in your mouth! Next we tried meat and cheese tortellini with marinara. The tortellini had a mild meat flavor yet the simple quality ingredients of the marinara shined. We will be back next trip!
author: Stacy N.

description: Okay. Nothing special. Pappardelle pasta itself was well made but the Bolognese sauce was only okay. Carpaccio was pretty tough. The space itself was active but unnecessary loud because of the piped in music. You could do a lot worse but there are better alternatives out there. Won't be back.
author: Ron C.

description: Great experience! this place is awesome! Can't wait to go back... had the fettuccini with white sauce and the meatball, and this small little flatbread that was to die for.  Very casual, friendly, fast service. Update: please please try the lasagna here! It is awesome! Their gnocchi is also awesome! Their lasagna was to die for! Decent size slice for a good price. Highly recommend.
author: Rose M.

description: I am a fan only because of the prices. The pasta is definitely nothing fancy - expect to feel like you are eating at home. We tried a couple of different pastas - a ravioli and a gnocchi, the former with marinara and the latter with pesto. Both were ok.
author: Sharanya A.

description:
Some of the best pasta I have ever had & certainly one of my favorite spots to eat in the city! Great food for a very reasonable price. 

The pasta is filling and hearty & the sauces are creamy and flavorful! The only knock on this place is that when it's busy, it can be extremely obnoxious to find a seat. However, it probably wouldn't stop me from ever going.
author: Kayla S.

description: This place was "meh" in my opinion, not bad but not great. I was really hoping for amazing, fresh flavors, but I didn't get them with my meat ravioli and meatballs.
author: Cameron H.

description:
Ahhh they recognize me here! Well, that won't stop me from coming here more! The owners here are super sweet, always smiling and eager to help you out when you're indecisive.

I'm a pretty big fan of their homemade fresh Ravioli. Tasted absolutely amazing! They have a variety of homemade food and sauces to choose from, and every single of them taste super fresh and super delicious. Rich and flavorful, good portions, amazing service!!

The restaurant itself is very homey and down-to-earth. It has so much character that you sometimes forget you're in SF. Wooden shelves with jars of sauces scattered around, lovely music playing in the background, people speaking Italian and you have no idea what they mean but you want to learn.

Overall, great food, great people, great ambience and great atmosphere. What's not to love about this place?
author: Xin W.

description: The food was absolutely delicious. Wasn't the most comfortable environment, but I'll be back for yummie cuisine anyway
author: Kendra B.

description:
Delicious food and fast service!

We tried two of the pasta dishes and a salad. The salad came with tons of fresh mozzarella and ripe tomato, and it was brought out within a couple minutes of us ordering. As for the pastas, the papardelle with a bolognese and bechamel was excellent and I wish I could have taken a jar of the sauce to go!

For a fast casual place, you can't beat this spot. 

(However, their dessert options could be improved. I ordered a Nutella pastry and it tasted like it had been sitting out for a week. Stick to the pasta and main dishes.)
author: Laura D.

description: Meat ravioli with da meatballs. Very casual, parked in a public garage across the street for $10. Fast, friendly. Paper plates. Ravioli had the italian not too soft texture. Ricotta was very fresh. Meat sauce good. Meatballs a-ok good size, texture, kinda bland, not salty. Paper plates. Don't do a vodka mixed sauce I got sick but it may have been from another meal that day.
author: Jody S.

description: This place is amazing. A small, no-frills pasta place tucked in North Beach (parking may be a bitch but we lucked out with the spot right out front!) The atmosphere was very relaxed, and the menu short and simple, but it was still difficult to decide which kind pasta to pair with a sauce. We arrived an hour before they closed and so many people walked in to grab takeout. I had the meat ravioli with pesto, and my girlfriend ordered gnocchi with meatballs. Both were amazing -- the pasta perfectly cooked, the sauces so simple and good and hearty. The food was served on paper plates but that didn't bother us, we enjoyed it all so much that we instantly decided IHC would be our impromptu date night eatery in the future.
author: Katherine W.

description: 3.5. Bolognese sauce more oily than tomato-y. The other location seemed better. Still need to try sandwiches.
author: Alison D.

description: This place is great! The food was incredible and the place is very relaxed and has a really good vibe. I had the tortellini, which was stuffed with prosciutto, and pesto sauce. It was delicious and I'll definitely going back for more!
author: Felicia D.

description: Absolutely delicious homemade pasta! The sauces are great but not outstanding, however the fresh pasta is so to die for that it doesn't really matter.
author: Sarah R.

description:
Fresh and delicious!! Our table ordered Bufala, pesto gnocchi and vegetarian ravioli---bet your money, you can't go wrong. The plates and cups are environment friendly, so go ahead & compost/recycle those. 
Con: its tad bit on expensive side!
author: Alex P.

description:
The place looks really nice! It's a quaint deli with amazing staff, who you can hear conversing in smooth Italian as the scent of tomatoes wafts from the kitchen. It's pick your own pasta and sauce, but I didn't have enough confidence that I would ace the combination first try. Instead, I played it safe with the lasagna, topping it off with a meatball. 

The portion size is HUGE- for someone like me who could eat lasagne all day, it was very sizeable and I couldn't even finish! Pasta was soft and would not have been heavy if not for the meat sauce. In the end, the bolognese sauce on the lasagna proved to be rather salty for my taste and had me reaching for multiple cups of water before I was done. 

Kudos to the folks who made the pasta, though! It was very well cooked and didn't feel like a brick in your stomach, unlike other lasagne I've tasted. However, the real highlight of my lunch here was the meatball.

It was an absolutely divine meatball. The texture was amazing, and the meat itself was delicious and flavorful. I would recommend these meatballs to anyone; spending $1.70 on one of this place's spheres of meaty goodness is well worth it!

I will return for more helpings of meatballs, if not to try my hand at "build-your-own-pasta".
author: Chanun O.

description:
The food was just amazing!  Real fresh pasta, fresh ingredients and made fresh in front of you. 
My kids are swimming the Alcatraz Challenge in the morning and we walked in at 8:58PM on a Saturday evening.  It's closes at 9PM but the place was still busy. 
We were graciously welcomed but the door was shut after us and another party walked in. 
My family ordered Fetuccini with Sage and Butter sauce, Fetuccini with Bolognese sauce and meatballs, Pappardelle with Bolognese, classic Piadini and tiramisu.  Our friends' family ordered fettuccine with white sauce and Piadini with meatballs. 
Everything was delicious and on point. Same level of freshness, quality and taste as many high end Italian restaurants in the area. 
We took our food to go and headed back to the Marriott and ate at the lobby.
