They had great quality disposable forks, knives and napkins. 
We will definitely be back. This is now going to be part of our SF North Beach tradition.
author: Maria G.

description:
Very good homemade fresh pasta! The shop itself is really cute, with a few italian guys working there (all talking in italian to each other). It has a menu to eat-in. For to-go fresh pasta for cooking, you need to tell the counter how much you want for each kind and they'll grab it for you. 

I got the pasta (not cooked) to go: squid ink pasta, gnocci, and veggie ravioli. They are very fresh and tasty. They recommend freezing the pasta even if you're going to eat it in a day or two. I had it 3 days after and it tasted very fresh and al dente. 

I saw them cooking there - it looked very good, but the sauces seem to be on the heavier side. But I didn't eat there so can't really comment on the food. 

I went in around 7:30 when they were winding down to close at 8. It was a good time to go since it was quieter. I would definitely go back again!
author: Wendy K.

description: The pasta was really good.If you are looking for a really nice place to eat then this is not for you,  but if you want some tasty food you should visit here.
author: Alaine D.

description: We are so happy to have discovered this little gem.  We recently moved back to the Bay Area and were craving Italian food.  From the service to the food were all superb.  Highly recommend, We will definitely come back to try other dishes.
author: Eddie H.

description:
We walked in with only the knowledge that our Yelp app had armed us with. A nearly 5-star rating in a historically Italian neighborhood? I'm sold. 

I started getting excited as soon as we walked in the door. Adorable decor that makes you feel like you may just be in Italy, an incredibly nice cook that explained all the new dishes to us, and the SMELL. I felt like I had made a good choice.

We ordered cassones, which are basically stuffed sandwiches that resemble calzones. Mine had meatballs and mozzarella, with bolognese sauce on top. It's the best Italian thing I've ever eaten. My fiance's was a breakfast version, which was also top-notch. I saw that lasagna out of the corner of my eye and was tempted to just start ordering everything and think of the consequences later.

While we were eating at the counter, we noticed the restaurant was suddenly a part of a food tour. Nice. That was the last step in realizing we had stumbled into somewhere pretty special. 

The Italian Homemade Company seems too cute and perfect to also have the best food ever. I bet if you think you've had the best lasagna/pasta/whatever Italian food you like best, they could convert you. Usually, you can't win them all, but Italian Homemade Company does.
author: Lesley W.

description: Hands down my favorite delivery lasagna in the city!  It's a great portion size and everything about it is delicious! Lots of layers of yummy pasta with a good ratio of meat and sauce, plus the price is hard to beat.  I would highly recommend getting takeout from The Italian Homemade Company!
author: Katie T.

description:
Always wanted to try - and finally did this past week.  Got the Veg Ravioli with "pink sauce" for the gf, and I got the Tagliatelle (sp?) with Meatballs + sauce.

Took it to go for dinner and could only finish half the box.  I did "doctor" it with some ricotta dollups on re-heating and only made it better.

Had the rest for breakfast, and full for most of the day.  The gf scarfed her dish though the night before - and she never does that.  

Glad I finally tried this place, and can't wait to go back.
author: EJ K.

description:
The pasta is great warm. Come here hungry, don't wait too long when the food comes, and you will enjoy the food. 

I thought the meatball was a little tough. I like meatballs that are easily cut with a fork. Meatballs here had some resistance. Nevertheless, the taste was good.

Service was nice. A nice local told my friend and indirectly me through eavesdropping that the owner (or chef?) is from Bologna, the food capital of Italy. Whoever it is, there is someone important working here who knows how good Italian food should be.
author: Judge F.

description: The lasagna is hearty and so good! Tiramisu is a must try - the best I've ever had. Great spot for lunch with 1-3 people. The service here is very friendly and the store smells amazing. Definitely worth it!
author: Suzy T.

description: We were planning on going to a popular Italian place right down the street from here but as we walked by the wonderful smells and inviting atmosphere pulled us right in. We had gnocchi and pappardelle with marinara sauce and bolognese with meatballs. The people working here recently opened up this place and it's been a huge success, because the food is all handmade following family recipes and they make everyone feel at home. Fresh, delicious, fun environment, everyone should go here.  Our only regret is we didn't have more of our friends and family with us, but we will be back to try more of their offerings.
author: Ian R.

description:
Incredibly good food, great overall experience. Fresh homemade pasta "just like momma used to make" and reasonably priced

I had the gnocchi roll which was excellent and unusual. Wish I could have sampled everything on the menu!

The people who worked there were awesome, Italian accents and great service.

Definitely check it out!!
author: Michelle S.

description:
Some of the best pasta I've ever had! They make their fresh pasta on site. I like that their menu is no fuss and something that any pasta lover could appreciate. They have a variety of pasta you can choose from as well as sauce, so you could have your pasta exactly how you want it. They also serve wine by the glass and bottle.

Prices are reasonable ranging from $10-20 per dish. I had the Vegetable Lasagna (YUM!) with a glass of wine for a total of $20.
author: Jellie S.

description:
Loved this place! Bright and warm on a cold eve, we loved the vegetarian lasagna, and fettuccine bolognese, past all house made, tagliatelle marinara ( that  particular sauce  a bit too plain, needed some spices) , and a 1/2 carafe of Barbera. 
The staff was friendly, and Italian!!
author: Alisa R.

description:
I went on a day date with my husband. He recommended this place. He works in SF around that area and had it for lunch before. He said he had to bring me there. Had the ravioli special for that day and also a caprese salad. We sat outside since it was a picture perfect day in the city.
Great authentic Italian food. I will definitely go back again. Yummy!
author: A C.

description:
This is definitely my favorite place in North Beach, maybe even my favorite place in San Francisco. The food is incredible, and there is no line (which I find hard to come by in this city).

It's very casual. Order at the front by choosing a pasta and a sauce. You can sit at one of the outdoor tables as you wait. Your food, served on paper plates, will be brought to you.

The gnocchi and panna cotta are amazing! The tiramisu is delicious too. Next time I come back, I want to try the gnocchi roll and squid ink pasta.
author: Victoria C.

description: Pappardelle w/ bolognese, tortellini w/ cream sauce, and the buratta arugula salad. Molto buono! We'll be back soon!
author: Matt C.

description: One of the best Italian pasta places in SF. Cheap, fresh, and cooked to order food.   Pick your pasta then pick your sauce.  Even though the food is served on paper plates, it still impressed every time we go there.  Very friendly staff too.
author: Robert L.

description:
Put your phones down!

I know it's tempting to hop onto yelp to check out what other people have eaten, but trust in the staff, they'll tell you what's good!  Upon the recommendations from the friendly man behind the counter, we ordered the gnocchi roll, lasagna, veggie ravioli, pappardelle with pesto and a salad.  THE LASAGNA.  That first bite and my eyes rolled back and I went to heaven.  I seriously think you can do no wrong ordering here, but get the lasagna!  It was melt-in-your-mouth super delicious.  Everything is made fresh and you can taste it.

Tips and Tricks
-Don't go too late, they can run out of their specials around or after lunch.
-The pace looks small, but there's a lot of seating at the counter.
-My friend was craving garlic bread, but I guess it's not very "authentic Italian"
author: Jessica L.

description: I've never been to Italy, but this place makes me feel like I have been. The ambience is amazing, Italian music playing lightly, the employees speaking Italian... oh yeah, the food is amazing as well! I had the wild mushroom gnocchi with sausage, it was the special for the day. My girlfriend had a pasta with red sauce, I forget which one. That was so good too. On our way home we stopped and got lasagna and a Piadina to go, both were a great choice and we had no complaints. Definitely try this place if you're in the area, or even just come to visit this place.
author: Brittany B.

description: This place is so cute and quaint! My friend and I came to try what the Hype was all about. We ordered the gnocchi and the beef ravioli! The marinara/bechamel sauce on the gnocchi was amazing!! I don't even really love red sauces and this was amazing, it had a very smooth sweet flavor! Some marinaras are so tart. We also ordered the flat bread (only $2) and salad! It was all really good, I want to come back to get the gnocchi again !!! The pesto on the raviolis was extremely fresh, all of it was so good! The chef is in the back visibly rolling out the fresh pasta (so good to see your food being made right before you). My only complaint was the music was extremely loud so don't expect to visit much when eating there!!! We Will be coming back !!!!!
author: Britt D.

description: SO this concept is cool, but execution is half assed. Sauces SUCK noodles would be good if you bought them to prepare at home. I wouldn't buy into this idea. The burrata was the only thing I enjoyed. Oh well my dog enjoyed the over packed meatballs. Wish is was more thought out and given attention wouldn't be back but don't hate it either just not worth it!
author: Lacey S.

description:
Oh my God, I wanna now learn to make my own pasta from now on. In this cute little store, there is a chef that sits and hand rolls the pasta. You then order in front of a counter your choice of pasta and a sauce. Gnocchi with sage and butter....AHHHHHHH so good! 

I must come back to try their other fresh made pastas and sauces.
author: Bahar A.

description: So happy I found this place!  One of the best lasagnas I've ever eaten!  I may be biased because their bolognese sauce reminds me so much of my grandparents' recipe!  The spaghetti and meatballs are very good as well!  Serving sizes are large & reasonably priced in my opinion!  Going to miss this little gem!
author: Erica B.

description:
If I could order their food and have it delivered all the way to Chicago regularly I would!!

The pasta was delicious! I would recommend this place to anyone looking for a great Italian food place that has a casual homey authentic feel.  The staff were extremely helpful and friendly explaining all the different kinds of pastas they had available for you to pick from. 

When I visit a new pasta place, I generally order a traditional spaghetti and meatballs as a marker of well they prepare and make that dish compared to all the other ones I've had before.  Dare I say those were the best ones I've ever had?? I would say so!  I also tried my friend's Gnocchi dish, and I must say it was excellent! Now I've only had it once or twice before, but this one definitely was the best I've tried.  The Gnocchi felt so smooth and tasty.  A must have!!!

Bottom line: If you're in San Fran... check this place out!
author: Randolph V.

description:
Amazing homemade pasta (not noodles)! With great sauces - I had the tagliatelle with the meatball sauce- Muite Bene! So good, so fresh! My friend ordered the lasagna and that too was amazing. Some of the best pasta I've had, EVER!

It's only open till 10p so get there early enough to pick the pasta, pick the sauce, and eat! 

Owned by a honest Italian family you can feel the love in the room. 

A few seats line the room, but if there's nowhere to sit inside, get it to go and hop across the street for a seat at the park. 

Enjoy!
author: Kevin P.

description:
Based on YELP reviews, we wanted to give this a try. I was looking forward to the meatball sandwich, but it had already sold out. So, I went for the meatballs and sauce with flatbread. They were large, plentiful, and delicious. The price was very reasonable as one order was enough to share with my wife.
The kitchen was in the open, so you could watch the food being prepared. Now I want to return and try something different!
author: Cap'n L.

description: I had the fettuccine with meatballs and bolognese sauce and my wife had the gnocchi roll.  We were both very impressed with this food!  The pasta was awesome and cooked perfectly, and the meatballs and bolognese sauce were great!  The gnocchi roll was absolutely amazing as well!  They ran out of the meat lasagne, so I will definitely be back to try it out soon!  Wonderful little restaurant with very friendly staff.  Not a whole lot of seating though.
author: Matt E.

description:
I came here with my family for lunch, we all ordered different things, the piadina, the gnocchi, pappardelle, and the raviolis. The pasta is fresh made and handmade every hour or so, the cheese is just amaizing Italian and so is the meats. My dad even got some piadinas and fresh papardelles to take back to the apartment.

Everything was AMAIZING, seriously very authentic and just delicious, the place opened not long ago so the seating arrangement it's still in the works but who cares when the food is awesome at a great price!

I for sure will be recommending all my friends to come try it out when they're in town.
author: Maria Jose H.

description:
If you ever want cheap yet italian handmade noodles, this is the place to go. 

However, for me, the pasta dish was too simple and I didn't enjoy the handmade pasta as much as I was expected.
author: Tianyi L.

description:
This is the place to get that taste of home away from home (not that your family likely makes pasta this good lol).

Found Italian Homemade on Yelp after realizing just how hungry we were. The photos online were only second to the great smells once we walked in. 

Ordering was a breeze. You could tell that the friendly lady behind the register with the Italian accent was super helpful. Our dishes were out in just a few minutes, piping hot and super tasty. The meat sauce was rich and flavorful. The meatballs were tender and two were plenty. 

There isn't a ton of seating but the patrons seemed strangely cordial and helped ensure we had seats. When there is a line it moves fast.

If you're in the neighborhood and craving great pasta and sauce be sure to check this place out. It should definitely be on your go-to list.
author: Jake P.

description: Very fresh and flavorful food. We have tried 6 restaurants in North beach and so far this was the best one.
author: Linda D.

description:
Very solid homemade Italian food. I love when you can tell that the pasta is fresh - think rich and thick noodles!

The interior is super cute. It is part-market, part-eating area. After ordering my food, I had to wait about 10 minutes until it was brought out. During that time I looked at all the different (yummy-looking) ingredients they sell. It's also fun to look in the freezers at the fresh pasta that is for sale.

Since I live so close, I'll definitely be ordering dishes to-go more often. Any of the dishes will last me at least two meals.
author: Emmy Q.

description:
Amazing Italian fare... 
 Had the Gorgonzola gnocchi (daily special) and it was perfect. 10/10. Hubby had the lasagna and a side of meatballs. Lasagna was an 8/10 but the meatballs were a 10/10.

Will be heading back for dessert later tonight...
author: Kenlyn J.

description:
The Best of Italian Homemade in the city!
Especially:
Cassone w/ Sausage, potato, bacon, & cheese 
Gnocchi with Meatballs Ever!
Gnocchi Roll with bolognese sauce!
Pesto was so fresh and tasty
Lasagna !
Meat Ravioli with pink sauce!

The Best, I mean it.
Italian Homemade.
I still think they should have Italian sandwich roll though.
author: Nobu K.

description: Tiny deli selling excellent pasta. Gets pretty rough during peak hours, especially if you're taking out, because it has very little seating, but it's worth every hassle.
author: Karla L.

description: Couldn't even ask a question in this place. There's workers that ram into you without apologizing. Rude service disgusting people.
author: Alex-Andre M.

description: Coolest Italian place! So authentic. When we went for lunch there was modern Italian music playing and all the workers are from Italy therefor they were all speaking Italian to each other. The food was incredible. Very simple but nothing more needed. So simply amazing. The sauces are delicious and the homemade pasta is perfect!
author: Kaylin C.

description:
This is one of the best Italian food I've eaten my entire life. It's so fresh, the pasta melts in your mouth. The burrata is to die for, so is the lasagna and everything else I tried, really! 
The place is a hole in the wall, which makes it even better. They serve the food in paper plates, and you can eat standing up or sitting down. I can't wait to go back to SF so I can go back to this restaurant!
author: Andressa W.

description: Really good pasta, it's fresh and the lasagna was my favorite! Small restaurant if you're trying to dine here but they offer takeout and delivery through yelp so it's a great delivery option!
author: Avani S.

description: We went here for lunch based on reviews.  We were not disappointed.  Great food and friendly service!!!Come hungry - huge portions. Reasonable prices too.  We shared the tortellini and meatballs and the piadina classica.
author: Bonnie J.

description:
Amazing food. The best ravioli I ever had. The cheese in the ravioli melts in your mouth.  The sage butter sauce great with it. The spinach and also the cheese calzones were excellent especially with the tomato sauce. 
Service friendly and prompt. The seating area is limited but very cozy as you can see the past making in the back from your seat.
author: Abdul E.

description:
Hands down our favorite place in SF for homemade pasta.  On sunny days, there's nothing better than sitting at one of their outside tables, people watching and enjoying a symphony of tastes.  Trust me on this.  Growing up on the East Coast, I know great Italian food!

We always, always get a homemade pasta dish.  My husband loves the meatballs - also homemade.  Last time, I ventured into the unknown.  I tried their roasted veggie sandwich.  I'm not exaggerating when I write that it was the best *&^% sandwich I've ever had. 

The service is friendly.  The establishment is very clean.  Everyone that works there has a beautiful Italian accent.  The location is perfect for strolling down to Xox Truffles for dessert.

Work up a solid appetite and get your belly to The Italian Homemade Company.
author: Elizabeth B.

description: I finally got to The Italian Homemade Company today for lunch and was quite pleased.  I had tortolini with pesto.  Pasta was cooked perfectly and you could taste the filling nicely.  The place is not fancy at all, but food is first rate.  Everything cooked to your specs.  I'll be back for sure!
author: Dennis M.

description:
Authentic, fresh and tasty place that is relatively new to north beach area.

It's like a deli/mini grocery.  The pappardelle was delish, meatballs yummy and the lasagne was good.

Got a bag of their magic star cookies.  Nom nom nom.


Can't wait to come back and try more of their dishes.

Super friendly and casual setting.
author: Dorothy L.

description: I have to say, this place rocks. The food is amazing and the environment is low key. Here's a pic enjoy.
author: Araceli A.

description: Some of the best pasta I have eaten. Any noodle with the bolognese meat sauce and you won't go wrong. We also had a couple meatballs and those were delicious as well!
author: Benjamin A.

description: This place was great. I had lasagna. Meaty sauce, but not too heavy. Loved it. Wife had fresh pasta with pesto, and it was excellent. The cafe is small, but we ate outside, and it was great. Lovely people. Very nice and helpful. Not fancy, but very good. Highly recommended.
author: Brad W.

description: This place has gone downhill. Earlier, the owners, and actual Italians were in the kitchen, cooking.  And boy, did they whip up some outstanding pasta!  Now, it has gone the way of economizing. My ravioli was cold and the cheese ravioli suffered from too much salt, as well as a poorly executed, over abundance of bad tasting cheese.  Upon politely complaining to the cashier and after tipping 20% earlier, he explained to me that there was no possibility of the pasta being cold, citing the fry pans behind him as proof.  There are many other superior pasta locations in the City.  This one started out wonderfully and unfortunately, with inexperienced help in the kitchen, has suffered the way of fast food.  Definitely a tragedy.  I feel genuinely ripped off. The butter sage sauce cheese ravioli I was forced to promptly discard in the trash after exiting the restaurant.  What a precipitous decline.
author: Jonathan R.

description: The food, the people, the ambiance-- all amazing. The food is really beyond words it's so delicious. Homemade, fresh, made with love and authentic Italian. Nothing on that menu will disappoint it is all good. Love this place and the chef! They know me by now and I feel like I've just been transported to Italy. One of my favorite secret gems in SF!
author: Sophia L.

description:
You have to love freshly made pasta. It just tastes better. 
The pasta was really well cooked, not too long of a wait, and charming place. Authentic and adorable. :)
author: Skyler C.

description: I almost chickened out after seeing the place busting at the seams with people, but a huge group left and we managed to sneak in without waiting in line and snagged a couple seats at the window.  Gnocchi was SUPERB.  Food here is legit!
author: CT C.

description: Vegetarian lasagna is excellent and pesto sauce is to die for. Wish the place have more seatings
author: rose c.

description:
The Italian Homemade Company is a relatively new restaurant in North Beach (they've been open for about 2 months since the writing of this review) but I hope they stay for a long time. There's a lot of pastas and sauces to choose from and, like the name would imply, they are all homemade. The Italian Homemade Company was started by a bunch of Italian friends who just wanted to open a delicious Italian restaurant and the love and care shows. All the pasta noodles are delicious and the restaurant itself has a very homey feel to it, with all the floating shelves and jars of sauces scattered about. The italian music adds a nice vibe to the whole place as well.

I've been there twice now and have tasted firsthand the linguini noodles with meatball sauce. DELICIOUS. My friend got the linguini noodles too, but with pesto sauce. The pesto was a bit bland but the noodles made up for it. Another one of my friends got elk ravioli. How cool is that?! She took it to-go for lunch so I don't know how she found it but I'm sure it was delicious. 

Stop by this place, help yourselves to some pasta, and welcome these guys to the North Beach's restaurant world!
author: Philip W.

description: Awesome little spot! I got the burrata salad which was AH-MAZ-ING. Is there any food more luxurious that burrata? So creamy and delicious. The arugula and tomatoes made me feel like it was healthy to eat a gigantic ball of burrata. I also got tagliatelle with bolognese which I liked a lot but wasn't sup-er crazy about. Lots of nice products for sale and service was quick. I would go back.
author: Emily V.

description:
The pastas are ok.  We had the gnocchi and tortellini which were very doughy and lacked a good serving of sauce on top.
The lasagna was the best dish I had from here.
There is also very little space to eat so be weary of bringing  large groups.
author: Stephen Z.

description: Went here because it was listed as the no. 1 Italian restaurant in all of San Francisco. I have to say that I had the best marinara ever over fresh papardelle noodles! Also had the burrata,tiramisu and Nutella donut!  Unbelievable!!! It's a little restaurant so best to take out.
author: Bernie H.

description:
Excellent! Very authentic. Went in for the veggie ravioli but they were out so I had the veggie lasagna. Excellent sauce and pasta. She asked if I wanted cheese and I said 'a little' perfect. I love cheese so I'll try it again with more cheese I was just afraid they'd over do it like so many places , but the sheer fact that the flavor came through is a testament (often cheese is a way of  enhancing flavor to a bland pasta) not here-excellent it was excellent and the portion size is perfect. I had a salad too-the green salad. Perfect compliment and size!
I'm visiting and it will be my go to place again tomorrow!  Service was very good too. Very busy but efficient and friendly-helpful too. They know how to do a business. Nice job!!
author: Laura C.

description: I don't understand how this place has so many good reviews. We ordered a combination of 4 dishes which included vegetable lasagna, gnocchi, burfala salad, and a stuffed veggie pasta roll (couldn't remember name of dish). The only delicious dish was the burfala salad. We were a party of 4 and we love pasta but none of us liked any of the pasta dishes. We came here thinking we were going to get authentic homemade but didn't didn't like the taste of the pasta at all. We should have just ate at home using barilla pasta which would have tasted much better. I have had authentic homemade pastas at other restaurants which tasted absolutely delicious so I thought we would give this place a try. Also the cashier was very rude. One member of our party has certain food allergies when we questioned if the ingredient he's allergic to is in our dishes the cashier had an attitude and responded very rudely. As far as the environment, it is a very small claustrophobic place. I don't recommend dining in at all this place is only go for takeout.
author: Yelper510 A.

description:
Fantastic joint! Phenomenal food run by even more amazing people. It's like showing up at your best friend's (who happens to be a 5-star cook) house. You sit down, you're served some great food, have a nice little conversation...

Definitely a great place to stop in for a bite to eat.
author: Jimmy S.

description:
Love their homemade tagliatelle in butter and sage! I can't wait to come back and try all the different pastas and sauces. It was served on a paper plate with silverware. 

Cute interior, but not a whole lot of space. 

Friendly staff. The young man who took my order has a great smile :D
author: S B.

description:
Most dishes at this restaurant were amazing. With the exception of the ravioli, I would highly recommend this restautant. We ordered two pasta dishes with the bolognese sauce that were delicious. However, we also ordered the ravioli and it came back undercooked with something funky going on with the meat. The meat was mushy and sour and the pasta was strangely chewy compared to our other pastas. 

The establishment was very defensive about the ravioli so maybe it could be our taste buds?  Either way, something was very off with that dish.

I highly recommend this establishment, but AVOID the ravioli at all costs.
author: Mary S.

description: Usually I love Italian homemade and am an avid customer. However, last night I ordered fettuccine pesto. I had the most awful food poisoning and it kept me up all night. Although the food is delicious, I won't be back and tempt getting sick again.
author: Jess M.

description:
I thoroughly enjoyed the food and atmosphere of this place. It's definitely not 'fancy' with regard to the tables and ambiance. However, the amazing food and friendly nature of the workers makes it a place you'll want to visit over and over again. 

We were told by our concierge that this place was a favorite place for locals. It definitely did not disappoint us and you should try it! We'll definitely go back next time we visit San Francisco.
author: Kevin J.

description: We came to San Francisco looking for a new place too eat . Of course the first thing I did was check Yelp . Me and my significant other were craving some good Italian food . We decided to stop here. The food was super delicious ,good portion we had to take some to go . Really recommend it really liked how the guy helping us mentioned the specials . You won't be disappointed.
author: Marisol G.

description: Italian food that makes you wonder if you've ever made pasta right, some of the best lasagna, gnocchi, and tiramisu you could ask for and affordable prices to boot! My go-to spot when I'm looking for a casual dinner with friends.
author: Tania E.

description:
I am italian born and raised. In San Francisco it is hard to find real authentic Italian food. Most of the italian places in the city serve americanized italian food that is very heavy and hard to digest. At Italian Homemade Company you can find the same ravioli you find on the streets of Rome or Venice. The Owners are from northern Italy and very kind.

I love this place!
author: Carlo L.

description: Good pasta with fast service. Good homemade taste. The pumpkin gnocchi was delicious - the bacon bits on top were great!
author: Jane Z.

description:
Fresh
Delicious
Pretty fast for homemade
Gnocchi with sage butter is to die for
Gnocchi roll is delicious too but wouldn't order again 
Pappardelle with meat sauce was fabulous.
Meatballs are fresh and juicy
Will definitely be back
author: X M.

description: WOW. I can not put into words how amazing this place was. We had three different kinds of pastas and sauces as well as the flatbread with sauce. We literally scraped our plates clean. Even our picky six year old left nothing behind. We can not wait to come back!!!! ( We are from OC and believe me when I say we will be back! )
author: Polly P.

description:
Incredibly authentic and delicious homemade pasta. We were welcomed with great hospitality and service.

We tried the cheese, spinach and cheese, and elk sausage ravioli with pesto, bolognese, and bolognese and cream homemade pasta and sauces. They were all incredibly savory and memorable. Our absolute favorite was the pesto sauce!

Highly recommend to all travelers for a quick  and casual meal.
author: Elizabeth S.

description: The pasta is fresh and made on the premises (which I love).  We enjoyed the fettucine with white sauce.  It was a light cream sauce (not quite thick alfredo I'm use to in NYC) but still delish.  Service is fast and the food hot!
author: Leiana R.

description: Very authentic Italian food at reasonable prices. The atmosphere is nice (though the tables are a bit shaky), but overall a nice place for a quick lunch.
author: Stefan H.

description: Not sure why people are rating this place so high, as there's a pretty limited menu of ala carte items, not full meals, and our meals were very bland. Very casual, and counter service where you eat on a stool. Definitely is not what we expected, and would not recommend if you want a good Italian meal!
author: D T.

description:
I have worked in the neighborhood for a few years now and have exhausted most of the lunch options. The first time I went here I tried the lasagna. Hands down the BEST lasagna I have ever had! Perfectly cooked, and the fresh made in house pasta was phenomenal! 

Second time I had to try a cassone, an Italian sandwich made with fresh flat bread. I am still eating it as I type this, but I'm already planning to get it again! I am also looking forward to picking up some of their fresh pasta next time I make a fancy dinner.

If you have ever enjoyed Italian food, or even if you hate it, I strongly suggest you come here. You will not be disappointed.
author: Nelson S.

description: After reading up for so long on The Italian Homemade Company, I decided to carbo load for the evening and made a trip out here with a few friends for a chillaxed dinner - one that comprised of wearing shorts, flip flops, and admiring the SF "summer" weather that was going on.  True to form, everything here looks like it's been made by someone's Italian grandmother, but the real gem is that it actually TASTES like someone's Italian grandmother made it too.  Ordering here is pretty straightforward but surprisingly almost overwhelming to me: Pick your pasta type, pick your sauce, say yes or no to cheese on top, sit and wait for food.  Easy right? There's no pretentiousness here either - everything is served on disposable plates and are accompanied with equally unpretentious plastic (but shiny) silverware. I had the tagliatelle with bolognese, and had the opportunity to try the lasagna and pesto sauce.  We also had an appetizer of burrata and that was seriously incredible. I will absolutely be back here and will be making every effort to try EVERYTHING on their menu!
author: Lisa I.

description:
Lovely! I got the meat sauce (don't remember the name) but it was delicious! I loved seeing the fresh pasta be made in store. Delicious and well priced!
Oh, I suggest sitting at the counter and conversing with the cute waiters
author: Kayla P.

description: It was authentic homemade Italian food alright! So good, I love the homemade pasta!! The only thing that I would say I wasn't too crazy about was the gnocchi roll, which was good... Just not crazy about it.
author: Lana H.

description:
This place has some really great items on their menu! One of the best lasagna's in North beach. My only grip with them is the wait times whether to go or eating in house takes quite a while this is probably due to the small space they occupy. 

All in all I'd still come here for a quick bite of some delicious pastas! My tip is try to beat to the after work rush around 6pm.
author: Linda W.

description: The gnocchi roll is heaven on a plate. Seriously. Try it. Did I mention you should try the gnocchi roll?
author: Ananya M.

description: Oh my..What a nice surprise to find delicious fresh Italian on our first night in San Francisco!  We both had lasagna, mine veggie and my daughter's was 3 meat both were outstanding.  This is a no fuss restaurant, very convenient to take out!  Tiamissu for dessert.  Go early ...The restaurant fills up quick!
author: Leslie N.

description: OMGoodness this place ...this place ! I'm in love and I can't stop thinking about the burrata salad and the delicious pappardelle pasta soooo freaking good. Went by happenstance more like happystance!
author: michelle r.

description: The 4 of us spent the day in San Francisco. We all wanted good Italian food in North Beach. We saw this place on yelp and thought to give it a try.....OMG....the quality of food is that of the best, most expensive places in Italy or any other place for that matter. They have 2 locations. This place is the very casual location if wanting more upscale go to the other local. Ok.....yea they serve on paper plates but real silverware. You order at the counter and it's a small place but has out door dining. The food is amazing. REALLY AMAZING! The pasta is homemade, cooked to perfection. The Gnocci roll is wonderful with a tomato cream sauce. We had 2 types of pasta and 2 types of ravioli's topped with marinara, pesto, meat sauce and butter sage all amazing. You can see the chef making pasta in the back, it is very cool. A very cool added fun part of this place is everyone who was working speaks Italian. This place has some of the best prices for an excellent meal you can get in SF. If you are looking for quality food, good price in a very casual yet feels like you Italian grandmothers house try Italian Homemade Company. You will not be disappointed!!!
author: Steve F.

description:
I love having this place near my house. Staff is always super friendly, food is delicious, quick and it's always "good busy", i.e. lively but never crazy. 

Highly recommended for a casual dine-in or carry out
author: Matt V.

description: Went there the other day with my girlfriend and her daughter it was an interesting place. I ordered parpadelle pasta with bolognaise sauce and two meatballs. Again, I felt like the flavors were lacking. We also ordered their flat bread wasn't impressed with that either. I probably wouldn't go back although the customers gnocchi and pesto sauce looked really nice, lol glad I got the chance to go there. I like the concept of making your own pasta, would I go back? I highly doubt it it was quite expensive and I really didn't care for their meatballs. I hope to find an Italian restaurant that can live up to my expectations before I leave back to Ohio.
author: Mary G.

description:
I'll start by saying, the food here is delicious. I have zero complaints about the actual meal, it was honestly very good. I've been to the other location in the Marina and had a delightful experience, so the experience I had this evening was quite surprising and disappointing. 

We ordered two orders of "gnocchi and red sauce with meatballs," - perhaps I used the wrong verbiage to describe what I wanted? Fair. But what ensued is by most standards pretty unacceptable in terms of food service/customer service/being a polite human being. 

About 30 mins after ordering, our food arrived, but with no meatballs. When we told the chef who had served our food that we ordered meatballs, she argued with us! Mind you, we weren't being rude or dismissive. She scrutinized our ticket and continued to tell us that we didn't order meatballs (customer service tip: if the customer says "I ordered x," say "no problem" and adjust accordingly... Don't argue with or disparage a customer). 

Several more minutes go by while they remake our order (would've been quite happy with just a side of meatballs, but whatever) - the cashier who took the order initially comes out with the plates, and we enthusiastically thanked him. 

He began to say, "by the way, I remember you," and I assumed he would've said "I remember you ordered meatballs." I didn't expect nor want an apology, I assumed it was a simple mistake. Not a big deal at ALL. But he, too, argued and proceeded to tell me off for ordering incorrectly... And I was really just so uncomfortable and awkward because the rudeness caught me off guard and I hate confrontation. It was so bizarre (customer service tip 2: don't disparage a customer twice in a row at their table). 

Btw, I had left approximately a $6 tip (over 20%) on the order, which is pretty hefty for a fast-casual restaurant, AND I think I was pretty darn kind in all my interactions - extra friendly, if you will. 

TL;DR - food is wonderful but had an alarmingly rude and unfriendly customer service experience. Will not be returning to this location (try the one in the Marina!)
author: Dominique A.

description:
14.00.00     Visited in the past

Had the lasagna and ravioli.

Can't get any fresher than raw flour and egg.

There were only 3 person
     2 owners ... husband and wife
     1 assistant

Very rustic place ...
    main room patry goods and kitchen/fridge
    "lab" where he produces his delicacy

I was rushing so I will give more details on my next visit.

Tasty homemade products like some of the 
     bygone delis in North Beach.

Simple review and advice
    Very good solid food ... don't go by words
        YOU gotta try it for yourself
        Solid homemade old school food
author: S.K. Y.

description: I'm conflicted. I normally go here once a month and when I used to go when it first happened opened it was so good that I would recommend it to all my friends. It's my go to spot for fast food italian pasta but lately I feel like the quality of pasta/taste has gone down. I ordered a fettuccine bolognese Saturday night and there was so much sauce and it was so watered down that the pasta didn't have much flavor. I hope they shape up and the last two times was just a fluke bc this is just sad. Disappointed.
author: Tina W.

description: We ordered fettuccine with marinara sauce, meat ravioli with a meat sauce, and a cassoni with sausage and peppers.  The cassoni came with a sauce (alfredo maybe).  My favorite was the cassoni. My son loved the fettuccine. We probably wouldn't order the ravioli again. The place is small, but you can order to go and eat in the park up the street. All in all it was a great meal and we loved the atmosphere.
author: Colleen M.

description: My favorite place in North Beach. If you're looking for that experience where the Italian waiters treat you like a tourist, then mock you for being an ignorant American that wouldn't know good pasta from Chef Boyardee, don't come here. It's only just great food.
author: Bib G.

description: Very fast service. Great homemade pasta and sauce. Friendly and funny (seems like family) staff. A must if you're looking for great Italian!!
author: David K.

description: This place blew me away for such a cheap price. The taste of the sauce was perfect and the pasta was cooked perfectly. I highly recommend their bolognese sauce. I will definitely be back to try more of their menu.
author: Selina G.

description:
Really enjoyed this little place... Had a group of 9 with 5 of those being little kids. The dining area isn't huge but they did accommodate us. 

Got the tortellini and was pretty good, albeit a little dry. Wife's lasagna was great. Kids fettuccine with white sauce and meatball was good too. Also tried to pappardelle with bolognese and that was probably the best of the lot.

Reasonably priced quick casual Italian place with good food
author: Brennon T.

description:
I REALY wanted to like this place after all these yelp reviews but no matter how much salt/pepper I put on my dishes (yes more than one) I am sorry but I have to give this a 2. I came to SF to run the Nike marathon this weekend and needed a good, hardy, heavy pasta dish to hold me down for my run last night and came here (after all the greta yelp reviews this place had). I had the gnocchi in sage butter brown sauce, gnocchi in the vodka cream sauce, 2 meatballs, and pesto linguini. Here we go..

Gnocchi in sage butter - My favorite of the ones I ordered but a small serving and still had to put a lot of pepper and salt to make it 'good'.. Personally it was missing garlic. 

Gnocchi in the vodka cream sauce -  Tasted like Chef Boyardee. Seriously guys it was like it was straight from the can. Don't waste your time. Gnocchi pasta itself was cooked well but it died in the sauce.

Meatballs - bland. Salty. No. 

Pesto Linguini - Tasted very fresh.. But was missing the pine nut and parmigiano reggiano taste one would taste when eating 'fresh' presto.

I know this restaurant is new and working through things and probably busy due to the marathon weekend but I just can't give it more than 2 stars. I would leave one, but I feel bad because I really wanted to like this place. The environment is great and you get cute little mason jars for water but; no. Maybe next time I am in town I will come back but unlikely.
author: Ashley O.

description: Cute little mom and pop shop. Nothing fancy but the food was good. Thought it was going to be like any other Italian restaurant where you sit down and have a waiter...instead it was more cafe style. You order at the counter and find your own seat. Not what I usually like when I go for some good Italian dishes but if you like small cozy hole in the wall places then this is your joint. I recommend the gnocchi with pesto sauce.
author: Cede G.

description: "Give a word to describe this restaurant," PERECTION! I LOVE food and for me, this has to be one of the best meals I have ever eaten. After one bite, I got sucked into a day dream where I was enjoying my meal not in a seat, but in Italy! Such great flavors and quality in the pappardelle, sauce, meatballs, EVERYTHING. Each bite delivered more gratification than the previous. The freshly made pappardelle mixed perfectly with the pesto sauce, and the meatballs cassoni was simply delicious. If you are looking for a fancy Italian restaurant go else where, if you are looking for something to remember because the food strikes your taste buds so strong, go here. Simply the best Italian food in all of San Fran. Bon Appetit!
author: Michael C.

description: With the help of The Italian Homemade Company, we became those airplane neighbors everyone envied/side-eyed with the delicious but kind of smelly food. Surviving a long security line and a sprint to the other side of the airport terminal, the pasta was still warm and delicious halfway into our flight. I had the tagliatelle with meatballs and it was great even after 6-8 hours sitting in a paper box. I imagine if we ate it right away, it would have been amazing.
author: Nina C.

description:
Love it! Super authentic and love the squid ink pasta. 
It is super casual and great quick bite if you are hitting the Cobb's comedy later. 

Also u can get fresh made paste to go  I love it
author: Sisi W.

description: Ordered from here on Postmates and the place delivered just as yelped promised - authentic Italian food (well I am not Italian, but this is how I imagine it tasting like). I got the stuffed gnocchi with a meatball and they both tasted incredibly homemade. I tried the gnocchi and lasagna that my friends ordered, and they really all tasted good. I will have to go to the restaurant directly and try some more things out.
author: Nikita K.

description:
Their FOOD is so AMAZING that I signed up on YELP to give them props and to help support them as a small business establishment in SF. I walked in the first day they opened and have been a regular since. I am not a native Italian, BUT my husband is. I told him after trying it the first time, "HEY let's try The Italian Homemade and he looked at me, like "NOT AGAIN", thinking it was going to be another sub-par place claiming to serve something Italian but doesn't. When it comes to pasta, panini (sandwiches), polpette (meatballs) he is never satisfied and extremely hard to PLEASE  because he has only encountered the americanized Italian food you might be thinking about, UNTIL The Italian Homemade opened their doors. 

Mattia, Alice and staff are great. They have a fun, friendly vibe and the food is authentic. Try ordering in Italian, there are plenty of natives to practice your Italian with. :-)

I have had the piadina, cassone, lasagne (white and spinach versions), gnocco ripeno (this is my absolute favorite and it was the first time I ever had it). Pesto gnocchi used to be my favorite dish in the world but THIS dish from Alice STOLE the top spot and it is truly to die for. It's sooooooooooooooooooooo good. If you have a chance to get it, TRUST me ,order it.

The ambiance of the shop is super welcoming and arranged very stylishly. They have added chairs and tables so 8-10 people can eat their goods there. There is Italian music playing and it's just awesome.

Everything is top notch quality. So impressed. If you have never traveled to Italy and tasted authentic Italian food, NOW is your chance!!!!!! 
It's finally arrived in San Francisco in North Beach!  

For all those people that don't live close by and are thinking, hmmmmmmmmmm....is it worth the drive or commute or whatever. YES YES YES. It is a destination spot!!

BUONISSIMISSIMO!!!!!!!
author: Laura M.

description:
We originally thought this was a cupcake shop until you we searched the address and realized it was the pasta shop. 

The pasta was freshly made, something you can watch right as you walk in.

I got the pappardelle with meatball sauce, which is basically just bolognese sauce with meat balls.  It was good, but I've had better in NYC. 

The pricing was average, but it made sense since the ambiance is very casual. I would not come here for a fancy dinner date. It was more of a quick bite.
author: sandy a.

description:
I come here every time I visit my friend in North Beach. So damn good every time. My friend and I always split the pappardelle with meatballs and fettucine with pesto. 

We recently got the gnocchi roll with bolognese and it was perfection. The lasagna is also fantastic and freakin huge. I've also gotten the burrata salad and as much as I love cheese, it was a bit too much burrata for my liking. If you don't eat all of it in one sitting, you can save it for another salad though. I've also tried the ravioli, and it was still really good, just not my favorite. 

I will be back again and again!!!
author: Sam L.

description:
First thing I noticed was every one working her was speaking Italian or English with Italian accent
The server was nice and patiently answered my question about options and repeated them for me.
Plates are pure paper and combustible, green and environmental friendly
They had few tables inside and outside to sit
You can see most of the kitchen it looked clean to me
And most important the food tastes really like a homemade food !
Has no decoration and may not be fancy place but
 really good place to eat your self or share a meal with a loved one
author: Arash R.

description:
OM NOM NOM. This place is great. It's a no-nonsense quasi-supermarket/deli/restaurant where you can buy delicious, fresh-cooked, homemade Italian food. Other key features: it's low-key, reasonably priced, and super friendly. 

So far I've only tried the bolognese and pesto sauces, but I've tried the gnocchi (INCREDIBLE), and the tagliatelle. It's all spectacular. 

I think it's important to note that this is not totally a date spot, or even a spot to bring kids... It's a place to pick up food and picnic elsewhere or take home and eat amazing food. There are a few tall tables, and people do eat there, but it's definitely not the norm.

If you're looking for Italian takeout or a meal cooked for you in under 5 minutes THIS IS WHERE YOU GOTTA GO.
author: Andrea D.

description: We had the meatballs, meat ravioli, lasagna, and sausage/pasta special of the night. The food was delicious. I highly recommend this place. It was a perfect place for dinner after walking around and exploring SF all day.
author: Lexie B.

description: The best thing on the menu - "homemade lasagna," you will not be disappointed! Lots of food, great taste, you devour it all, no kidding ........ Great atmosphere, fast service!
author: Chad M.

description:
Absolutely love this place! It's a little slice of Italy right in SF. 

Go enough times to try all the pastas. Everything is fresh an me delicious. If you still have room, get the tiramisu. 

They also sell their pasta to take home and cook yourself.
author: Skye L.

description:
Ordered takeout and have to write about my experience.  I don't like to write negative reviews, but this was pretty bad.  First of all, be prepared to wait in the same line as everyone else who is ordering their food.  There was only one register and other workers milling about chit chatting while the person manning the register is busting her butt.  When I asked if I had to wait in line, even though my food is ready, they said yes.  

  I ordered lasagna with extra meatballs, mozzarella salad, and gnocci roll.  The gnocci roll and salad were delicious, which is why I give this 2 stars.  Now the bad part - They forgot to include the meatballs that I ordered.  I asked to get them delivered, but all they could do was credit me back the difference.  That doesn't help me as I'm still hungry.  The lasagna would have been delicious as well, if it wasn't so salty.  It was salty to the point of being inedible.  I asked for them to deliver a new one.  They refused to do anything to help me because this dish is their "best seller".   Essentially, they didn't believe that the chef over salted the dish and wouldn't do anything about it.  

This place would have been a winner, except for the horrible service.  The search for my favorite Italian place continues!
author: WINNIE B.

description:
I tried the Gnocchi with mushroom sauce. It was the best Gnocchi I've had.. It melted in my mouth and was not chewy at all. Just the way it should be. The owners of the restaurant are also very nice and struck up a conversation with us. 

They also have handmade pastas that looked really good, although I did not pick it up this time.
author: Hruthika C.

description:
When I go to North Beach, 7/10 times I go here. You get the true Italian home cooking experience. I personally love their pesto, and my little cousin says there's no better spaghetti and meatballs. 

Tip: around dinner times it can be hard to find seating.
author: Liz F.

description: Better than your Italian grandma could make. Hole in the wall place. Walk down the street to corner liquor store, buy a bottle of wine for your dinner and enjoy on the sidewalk. Not fancy just delicious food!
author: Bridgett H.

description: Perfecto!!! The best Italian food I have had since eating Italian in Italy! We have searched far and wide to find a Italian restaurant that would fill that craving for REAL tasting Italian food and this is the only place to succeed at doing so. All of the cooks are from Italy and bring their knowledge and love for the art of a true Italian meal. Not only is the food worth any sort of wait but the people that cool the food are amazing! Shouts out to Laura and her amazing team! We will be back any time we are in San Fransisco and suggest everyone should stop here too!!!
author: Kenny G.

description:
Actually went to eat at mamas on washington up because the line didnt move after waiting 30min we opted to come here.
Its pretty much a small mom and pops shop setup. They have 3 tables outside and a few more indoors. Defintely a bad place for large groups. Youll never find seating or will have a tough time sitting together. Everything appears to be made in house.
Honestly the food was just ok with me. I had noodles with the meat saucedl and ordered a sandwich, salad and a few meat balls. I didnt like the meatball to much it has a few "earthy" taste and almost seems "dry" to me. The sandwich actually wasnt too bad and a salad is a salad. The pasta with meat sauce didnt do much in impressing me or anything.

In terms of price id say the min is about 11+. They charge you for the noddles and the sauce separately.
author: George B.

description:
Unbelievably delicious homemade pasta and sauces!

Great place for a quick dinner before Cobbs or Bimbos.
author: Lauren L.

description: Went surprisingly today, not a major pasta eater, but rather I need to say hands down one of the best veggie raviolis I ever had! I needed the veggie lasagna however it was sold out, notwithstanding I wasn't disillusioned. So freaking yummy I can hardly wait to backpedal!!
author: Sharon H.

description: Phenomenal. Should just leave it at that but I will elaborate. Cheap (by SF proper standards), unpretentious, friendly and delicious. I had the Tagliatelle with Bolognese and a meatball on the side. Pasta al dente, and homemade. Sauce a perfect consistency and the meatball tender and delicious. Overall, I see this place as a must if in the area and looking for good Italian food. Enjoy!!
author: Jesse P.

description:
let just say this:
If this place was in Italy it would only cater to the tourist crowd. If the wanted to sell their stuff to Italians, they would go out of business.
Their pasta is a nightmare: it not well "tirata", that is not well pulled. 
It is alway terribly cooked.
The sauces, seriously?... the meat sauce is too tangy, borderline sour, other too creamy (not italian 100%).
The piadine, sorry to say, are an offence to the piadina emiliana. Terrible.

I give them that the ambiance is reminiscent of a take-away italian establishment, but... as is said this days "fake news"...

This place gets a 2 out of 10....
author: C B.

description:
This place is glorious in every single way. I've had both the tagliatelle with meat sauce and the lasagna with meatballs. Both glorious. A man (who I believe is one of the owners) is super friendly and always walks around smiling and asking how everything is. So sweet.

I also just love that you can get a no-frills Italian, hefty-serving meal in North Beach for less than $15. I think we could probaby all agree that this is incredible. I certainly don't expect it these days, but wow, when it happens, it feels so right.
author: Allison L.

description:
Really good down-home Italian food. Tiny place - half market, half restaurant. The lasagna was to die for. Lasagna is my favorite Italian dish and it was so good! The pasta sheets were so smooth and well-cooked!

The seating though...just high tables with stools. No "real" seating area. As a tourist, not knowing what to expect, it was a little off-putting, but the food makes up for it tremendously. Reasonably priced Italian fare with (2) female chefs making the food!  The (2) chefs were both Italian and the cashier sounded Italian also. One of the chefs came out to ask how the food was, which was really nice. 

Overall great food, but the seating was lacking. Seems more like a "to go" place.
author: Michelle R.

description: Completely overrated. Order lasagna and pappardelle with meatballs. The lasagna was just okay. But the meatballs in sauce were so bad. I had a few bites and couldn't finish it. I put extra Parmesan cheese, but nothing was gonna make this taste any better
author: Christine S.

description: Yum yum. Super fresh pasta with great sauces. Very busy. Paper plates are stupid when they get soggy. Small.  But worth all that. Very good pasta !!!
author: kevin e.

description:
Excellent handmade fresh pasta and pesto sauce. 
I've had the squid ink pasta which was delicious and the pappardelle which was good. 
The pesto was bright and fresh and we could not get enough of it. 
Great place to get fresh pasta for dinner parties, albeit a little pricey
author: Jocelyn L.

description:
Italian Homemade Company completely transports you from North Beach to a little shop in Italy. The fragrances and the atmosphere are so Italian, and the charming chefs are singing and speaking in their native language. Not only do they have freshly prepared food, they also have handmade pasta you can take home to make yourself.

Based on a friend's recommendation, I tried the clasico piadino. A piadina is basically a flatbread sandwich, and they make their yeast-free flatbread fresh daily. I literally watch them grill my flatbread from raw dough into a chewy bread and then layer it inside with mozzarella, arugula and prosciutto. It was so simple, but so perfectly executed with the freshest of ingredients and preparation. My boyfriend had the lasagna, which had just the right ratios of pasta to sauce to meat. I've never been that into lasagna, but this one was amazing. We decided at the end to try one of their bombolinis, which is an Italian filled donut. It was honestly one of the best fried donuts I've had, with an extremely aromatic dough and the best chewiness. There wasn't an overload of jam- it was just enough to satisfy a sweet tooth. Such genuine and authentic Italian food is hard to come by in SF, so I will without a doubt be back for more!
author: Ashley T.

description: Another great find. We have been here twice now. Worth going back every time we return to San Fransisco. Plan on sharing. The servings are huge. I can't decide what to order, because everything is so good. All homemade pasta and sauces. The Tiramisu is the best. You have to get your own on this one. Do Jit share this. You will want your own. I loved every little bite of my dinner here.
author: Rebecca Larson G.

description:
I'm afraid I'm going to go against the tide here with my review of The Italian Homemade Company. This is less a restaurant, in the traditional sense, as it is a self-service eatery. There are about 4-5 high-tops with chairs scattered about where you eat. You order at the register and the food is brought to your "table" on paper plates. I was hoping for the sausage and peppers, but they were sold out, so I had the fettuccine with bolognese sauce and two meatballs. My wife had the same but with marinara sauce.

The pasta is freshly made, but a bit doughy for my taste. I wish it had been rolled a bit thinner. There were also clumps of pasta stuck together in my plate that usually indicate that the dough was too moist when it went through the rollers on the pasta maker.

The sauce was tasty but not complex. It required a bit of salt and red pepper flakes to really make the flavor pop. The meatballs were good but far from the best I've ever tasted.

The service was friendly and helpful and the staff was clearly out to please their customers.

I might consider this restaurant if I were a local, but I wouldn't go out of my way to visit it again. The existing reviews made it seem like a more traditional restaurant, so be warned that this isn't what The Italian Homemake Company is about. I'll take the blame for that, but when all is said and done, the food here is good, not great.
author: Ron L.

description:
I had a bad day at work. Like so bad that I didn't really want to do much else except sleep and watch some TV.  Therefore when I got home, I just wanted something cheesy and delicious. I've noticed that the Italian Homemade Company has always been at the top of the list on here so I decided to get it delivered. Postmates to the rescue!!!

I ended up ordering the gnocchi with cheese and meatballs. The gnocchi was the correct texture and the meatballs were delicious as well with the sauce.  I'll definitely come back and try some other dishes!
author: Nina Y.

description:
I think given the high reviews I was expecting a bit more from this place in Little Italy. 

Food: We ordered the Tagliatelle with pesto and the vegetarian lasagna. Both were a bit undersalted and seasoning was just ok. The marinara on the lasagna was just ok. I will give them credit that the food was fresh and the pasta was cooked perfectly al dente. However, I just did not think that the flavor was that good. Also portions were a generous size.

Ambiance: The place is definitely a hole in the wall frequented by youngsters, and you order first, seat second, and food comes to you. You throw away your own stuff/cutlery in a dirty bin.
author: Sara A.

description: Yelp led my family to the Italian Homemade Company on our trip to SF and we will for sure be back every time we are in the city.  The lasagna melted in our mouth.  Sooo yummy.  We also had the pesto over fettuccine, and the bolognese sauce mixed with béchamel sauce over  pappardelle.  Such a treat to have homemade pasta at such reasonable prices.  The location in Russian Hill is small, without a lot of seating, but we hit it at a great time around 5:00ish and there was room and we found it cozy. If we lived in the city, we'd order delivery all the time.  This place is a find!
author: Corie G.

description:
Oh my god. So good. Worth far more.
Edit:  we have gone back a second time in the same day for dinner. We had lunch earlier. Absolutely astounding food. Fresh as it can be. Legit Italian. Could not recommend more highly.
author: Norman W.

description: We stopped there while driving through San Francisco and it was DELICIOUS food and great service I recommend it. The food was cooked fresh! I'm back home now and drooling over the thought of that place.
author: Mel B.

description: Amazing fast casual pasta if you're not in the mood for a typical sit down meal!  I ordered take out for myself and three others and the quality of the pasta and sauces was great, so I can imagine dining in would be a little better.  My favorite pasta was the pappardelle and sauce was the bolognese.  Although, I also tried the meat ravioli w/ meat sauce, tortellini w/ pesto, and gnocchi w/ lemon sage, which were all good.
author: Kevin N.

description:
We just got done with our amazing meal here.  My wife and I shared the meatball cassone and a salad.

The salad was simple and excellent.  Olive oil, lettuce and the best mozzarella I have tasted in a long time!

The cassone was also fantastic.  The meatball was very flavorful, a good amount of cheese and the bread all made for a very tasty sandwich.

I would highly recommend this place.  First time here for us, but we will definitely be back.

Seating is limited.
author: Michael L.

description: Italian Homemade Co is my favorite spot in Little Italy for homemade pasta. My go-to is their gnocchi with the meatball sauce. Their lasagna is bomb too! Their staff is welcoming and treats you like family, which is a plus.
author: Stephanie G.

description: This place is great. I am visiting San Francisco and over where I live, there isn't Italian food anywhere near this fantastic. I had the Gnocchi with Pasticciata sauce with parmesan. It was amazing. Downside? No wine to finish it lol. But no complaints there. Good stuff!
author: Tong C.

description: The Italian Homemade Company is a casual joint serving Italian comfort food.  Pasta dishes are $10-12, or you can buy fresh pasta to cook at home.  We had to circle around for 20+ minutes looking for parking on a late Sunday afternoon, but thankfully our meal was worth it.  I ordered the ever popular spinach and ricotta gnocchi roll with bolognese sauce ($12) and everything was well-executed.  Surprisingly it was super filling even though the portion size didn't appear that hefty!  I definitely suffered from food coma the rest of the evening...  I also tried my friend's meatballs and they were super tender and flavorful.  The flatbread was also nicely chewy despite being so thin - next time totally want to try a flatbread sandwich!
author: Beatrice W.

description:
This place makes heavenly pappardelle pasta. Never in my life have I had such perfectly cooked pasta. For $12, $9 for the pasta and $2-$3.50 for the meat sauce, this is the best value for homemade pasta and homemade sauces. Portions were decent. 5 out of 5.

P.S. If you guys didn't know, this place is rated #9 out of 4,788 restaurants in San Francisco on Tripadvisor
author: Anthony L.

description: It was indeed homemade pasta. I have had better but it was still tasty. It was cooked a little too al dente but better than it being too soft. The meatball was the best thing we had. Staff was friendly. It isn't fancy at all and you eat at high tops with bar stools but prices were fair.
author: Jenny R.

description: Al dente pasta!!!! So fresh and delicious. There are 2 locations to which we visited both, one right after the other thinking that they are own by different owners. The first location we went to was a little hidden in the middle of a neighborhood, so there were less people. Maybe just the locals that eat here. The second one was in the heart of little Italy. Lots of tourists here. Both experience was fun!
author: Yiv N.

description: Great experience.Its a friendly real Italian food, made fresh every morning . From the pastas to the sauces you can taste the  passion and love of food. The cook came by our table after talking awhile ,we discovered they emigrated from Italy bringing their family recipes. Loved the lasagna, tiramisu ..just can't wait to try more.I want to try it all !!
author: Dorothy C.

description:
Having eaten my way through Rome and Florence a few months ago I was in the mood for some good Italian. This place did not disappoint. Pasta was really fresh, prepared perfectly al dente, the sauce was fresh and not salty and stuck to the pasta. The portions were a nice size. We also ordered a meatball Piadina which had an awesome béchamel on top. I would highly recommend. Over all I would definitely make the trip back. 

Small warning - as mentioned by others, seating is at a premium, so be prepared to take out or be patient for a small table.
author: S K.

description: Pasta as it should be: al dente, good ingredients, made fresh. You sit on a barstool, but the quality is there. Enjoy a view of Columbus Street, too. It's busy, and that's no coincidence.
author: Kevin C.

description: Their meat ravioli can be described in three words: YUM-YUM-YUM!! I love this restaurant and have tried many of their meals, but my definite favorite is the ravioli - the perfect amount of sauce with perfect flavor. I love this place, it's so homey and the smell as you walk by makes you hungry, even if you just ate!! Love it -please keep up the great work and the quality of your meals.
author: Ruben M.

description: Love this casual restaurant. Homemade pasta at such a reasonable price for San Francisco.  Good food does not need to cost a lot. Limited seating, so go with the open mind of getting it to go & eating  it somewhere else.  It is worth it.  Our family will absolutely come back when ever we are in town.  So Good.
author: V D.

description: SOOOOO GOOD. Everything. Lasagna here is on another level. Always a line but it goes quick. We generally do pasta special and lasagna (always get the lasagna!) the portion is massive and the sauce is amazing. People that work there are also super nice.
author: Taylor P.

description: Lasagña was amazing. Bery good and clean italian food. Local feel, good prices and portions. Loved it!
author: Luis R.

description: Delicious pasta and even more amazing sauces. Very low-key and non pretentious. I recommend the Gnocchi Roll but you basically can't go wrong no matter what you get. Yum yum
author: Amir M.

description: I ate here while on vacation in SF a few months ago. When you're on vacation you usually try and find as many delicious local food places as you can, but this place was so good I ate here twice during my three day stay! This place is unbelievably good. The pasta is homemade and fresh. The sauce is delectable. Everything tastes authentic. I had the ravioli and the lasagna and both were the best meals I've ever eaten before. Every time I crave Italian food I think of this place and wish I wasn't hundreds of miles away in San Diego. Seriously, go to this place! It's worth it. I'd come to SF right now to eat it if I could. It's just that good!
author: Erica H.

description: Such a great mom and pop eatery. The pasta was extremely fresh and had a great table out on the sidewalk.
author: Taylor M.

description:
Authentic small Italian business serving up fresh made pasta in open kitchen. You can even watch then make the pasta in the back kitchen. Very friendly service and nice ambiance of hustle and bustle.
 
We had Fettuccine with Cheese & Meatballs and  Tortellini with Pasticciato sauce & flatbread.

Tasted fresh and very enjoyable. Well deserved 5*
author: Greg B.

description: By far the best meal I've had in the city. The lasagna is to die for and the meatballs are amazing. I'd also recommend the tiramisu, it's simple but absolutely perfect.
author: Nicole T.

description: This place is so good.  Quaint atmosphere, small business owner, and EXCELLENT homemade food.  The meatballs are to die for, but be warned don't let your stomach rule how many you get.  They are giant meatballs.
author: Laurie L.

description: Picked this place for my birthday lunch and it was amazing! Perfect homemade pasta and great sauce too. Certainly will be coming back.
author: Kat S.

description: Friendly service. Italian staff speaking Italian makes for a nice Italian feel. Meat lasagna was amazing!! My wife loved her plate as well called pumpkin ravioli. Kids weren't crazy about their spaghetti. Saw some amazing looking deserts but they didn't serve coffee!!! So went for desert elsewhere.
author: Albert A.

description: Never got the food I paid for! I ordered a pasta dish via Yelp today for pick up, paid for with my CC and when I went to pick it up I was told by the employee they don't take Yelp orders. I showed her my receipt and confirmation from Yelp saying the Italian homemade company has revived my order...she just told me there's nothing she could do. I order on Yelp all the time from all different restaurants in the city and this has never happened before, why would they have the option On Yelp to order pick up or delivery if they don't take Yelp orders...??? Very confusing and not cool, now I wasted $15 on food I never got to eat! Also I have eaten here many times before and the food has always been just so so.
author: Ladywolf M.

description: The bolognese sauce made me go back to my grandmother's house. It is an authentic Italian food outside Italy. Nothing around the area is as good in terms of quality of food as this place. It brought me back to Brazil sitting around the table with my Italian grandmother. Amazing!!!
author: Natasha S.

description:
Honestly, go here.

Some of the best Italian food I have ever had in my life. From the Cassone, to the Piadina, to the fresh pasta that is made daily (that I take home on my walk to work and cook) it is all amazing.

The staff is extremely friendly and fun to watch cook! 

Although it is not the nicest looking place, you will leave a very happy claim.

Recommendations:

Either the Bacon, Sausage, Cheese, Potato Cassone or the Meatball one. Both Amazing.

If you have the time, take home some of their fresh made pasta and cook it at home. It will be like you adopted an Italian Grandmother and are making her cook you pasta.

Delightful in all aspects of the word.
author: Chris K.

description: Visiting from Orange County. Line was long but moved very fast . We ordered the lasagna and spaghetti ! Delicious! We received our food very quick. Great service! If back in town will be coming again and recommending to others .
author: Apryl L.

description: Absolutely the BEST Italian food we've had since eating in Little Italy, NY.  I had the pappardelle with meatballs and my bf had the ravioli with meat sauce and pesto. We both shared a cassone. It had Italian sausage, bacon, potatoes and cheese. Coke in a bottle to drink. I highly recommend this "hole in the wall" when you're in the Bay Area. The service was excellent!! They were very helpful and friendly!
author: D R.

description: Friendly people and fresh pasta made to order!! It's amazing and best of all, they are real Italians!! So much fun and delicious.
author: Miyuki I.

description: Went here with two friends. I loved it. But wished they gave us more pasta. I had a lot of left over sauce.
author: Sharon H.

description:
Came here with two girlfriends on a Saturday night for dinner. We arrived around 6:30 and am glad we did because by 7pm, there was a line forming (closes at 8pm). 

Big menu but pretty simple items. We ordered:
1. Gnocchi roll - you MUST get this! Such a unique and delicious dish. Basically like a gnocchi filling wrapper inside this soft bread roll, with marinara sauce. So so good and big service sizes!
2. Fettuccine pasta with pesto - simple and probably my least favorite out of the three things we got, but only because we didn't see the crushed red pepper / condiments table so it tasted a little bland. But the fettuccine tasted extremely fresh and I liked that the pesto wasn't too oily.
3. Burrata salad - Definitely recommend this one. The burrata serving is generous and comes with balsamic vinegar, grape tomatoes and salad. Good healthy addition to an otherwise rich / heavy meal. 

Tips / Comments:
+Arrive early to snag seats at dinner
+Sit inside and explore - cute trinkets, sauces, baguettes and they even sell boxed pasta! 
+Get the gnocchi, but also explore some of their other pastas (which I wish I did in hindsight), like the fresh ravioli or the sandwiches! 
+Amazing staff - we got checked on twice and the staff was extremely friendly / helpful
+Great music (no background, boring music) - lots of 90s / rock, loved it
author: Anu P.

description: Delicious Italian! Friendly staff! Fresh ingredients! Must stop! Large meatballs with pita great for sharing. Cheese imported from Italy on salad was delightful!
author: Michelle F.

description: Half the menu is sold out, food came frozen and had almost no taste. Very impatient hostess and awkward seating. I would not dine here again.
author: Adam B.

description: Delicious homemade pasta and sauces at a fair San Francisco tab. Very small 20 seats inside and about 3 outside tables. I enjoyed vegetarian ravioli in a tasty tomato sauce.
author: Alan F.

description: This was the best pasta, period. Love that it's basically a counter where you order, they make your pasta fresh any way you like it, then find a spot to eat. A real hidden gem. I'd make the trip to SF just for this place. Ravioli was amazing!
author: Matt W.

description: Food is definitely a 5. The lasagna was light, if you can imagine that. So flavorful. Also had their version of a calzone, filled with sausage and peppers. Crispy crust with delicious filling. The mozzarella salad was fresh, perfect amount of dressing, and the balsamic was incredible. Only drawbacks were uncomfortable seating and no wine.
author: Dee P.

description: Don't let the fast food environment fool you, this food is awesome. We had to try the gnocchi roll, which I recommend to anyone who hasn't tried it. We topped with meat sauce and additional meatballs for a completely delicious and filling meal. I think we will stop by here each time were in town.
author: Rhonda L.

description: Wow, there were definitely several things unsuspecting about this place. It might be easy to miss since it's a bit north of center in Little Italy, and its interior consists of an open kitchen and several small bar seats and tables. The portions look small at first, served on an ordinary paper plate, but a plateful of pasta and a meatball was definitely filling. We got Tagliatelle and Pappardelle with Bolognese sauce, and the pasta texture was very on point and al dente. It was also the hottest pasta I have ever had, and it maintained that temperature throughout the meal by means of which I can't explain, since most pastas go cold relatively quickly. Their bolognese sauce actually has large chunks of good meat mixed in already, not the usual bits and pieces you'd find elsewhere. Even as a casual restaurant, the waiters kept tabs on everyone to make sure everything was fine, which was definitely a nice touch to an excellent meal!
author: Justin F.

description: This place has GREAT food, but it's definitely not a fancy experience. They have limited seating and the seating is almost all bar stools. It's best for a quick casual lunch or take out. But the food is so good that the ambience really doesn't matter. I will definitely be back when I'm in the area.
author: Diana G.

description: I legitimately cannot believe that this place is real. It is literally gods gift to the planet. I have never had a better lasagne in my ENTIRE EXISTENCE. It was absolutely to die for. The papardelle bolognese with meatballs also blew my mind. Yes I ate both. Don't judge-when you put in your mouth you will be capable of the same outrageous feat
author: Maddie O.

description: Whoops accidentally reviewed the wrong place! Still looking forward to going here :)
author: Zaviera R.

description: A couple girlfriends and I had spent a sunny afternoon drinking wine and listening to jazz in North Beach. On our way back towards the wharf, we walked past the Italian Homemade co. A waitress was bringing out two heaping plates of lasagna and we had to stop. It is a cute and small little shop and not the typical place I would eat in, but we had to try this lasagna!
