We split a single serving between the three of us and it was amazing! The homemade pasta, rich meaty sauce, and delicious melted cheese made for an excellent snack. I will be back for the lasagna and meatballs in the future! So yummy!
author: Lisa H.

description: The food is is great and feels so homey. I had the burrata salad and squid ink pasta with bottarga. For a very casual place it was very tasty as if your own grandmother made it. Sat outside on a warm Saturday afternoon and the service was friendly.
author: Marie r.

description: Amazing!!! Design of the place is beautiful, food is authentic and delicious, staff is so kind. Feels like you're in Italy!
author: Sabrina C.

description: amazing food have not had Italian food that great since Italy. do not miss it you cannot go wrong with anything that you order , had a little pasta with meatballs and a meat sauce, wife had a calzone both items were great. price is right and large portions of you miss this place while visiting then you truly missed a great Italian meal. parking meters near by small place only a handful of tables.
author: Dave M.

description: Lasagna was super delicious. We couldn't find parking and drove around for a bit, but it was totally worth it! Great experience, great service!
author: Jackie R.

description: Do not leave san francisco without eating here! Best food we've had since we got here. Reasonable prices and nicest employees. They dance and look like they love what they do and have fun. EVERYTHING HOMEMADE!!!! DO NOT MISS OUT ON THE TIRAMASU NO MATTER HOW FULL YOU ARE!
author: Hailey D.

description: I'm not a huge pasta/Italian food fan, but this place is great. You can buy some fresh homemade pastas uncooked, or you can buy cooked ones. You choose the pasta, and the sauce you want, and they cook it up right in front of you. It's really good.
author: Jeanette S.

description: The pasta here is fresh, but not well prepared. Every time I've come here I have left disappointed. Today I ordered cacio e Pepe and I basically got an overcooked fettuccine Alfredo. It had a cream sauce instead of simple Parmesan, the pasta was overcooked, and it was under salted. Other notes- the piadina is too thick. The ravioli sides are often too thick. You're probably better off purchasing the fresh pasta and preparing it at home.
author: Pria P.

description: I wish they just opened up a restaurant, those barstools are not comfy. Food was so good! Simple homemade pasta in really yummy sauces. All our favorites was the tagillatelle with the cream tomato sauce. The meatballs were a fail, we had two burnt balls, they were a bit tough too. I could pass on the squid ink pasta also, not alot of flavor. One of the best burratas I've had. I will be back for sure.
author: Karen T.

description: The lasagna was AMAZING!   Maybe the best meal I've ever had in over 50 years of eating. Luv that this place is all about the food.  GO IN you won't be disappointed.
author: Dave P.

description: Can you open one in san diego!?!?!? Sooo good. I will come back to san fran for this alone! I ordered the gnocci roll and meatballs... Amazing. Took the tiramisu togo.. Wish we hadn't. Only because it is so delicious. I debated on taking an uber back to get another haha I normally don't write reviews but this was so delicious i had too
author: Nicole D.

description: Wow! What an amazing experience. The food was so incredibly amazing, just as I remember it from Italy. The customer service is superb & the restaurant is very clean. If you're looking for "real"Italian food; no need to look any further. Very relaxed atmosphere.
author: William A.

description: I come to San Francisco sometimes looking for any excuse to justify coming up from the Peninsula for the Italian Homemade Company.  It is always on point and never disappoints.  The pasta is deliciously fresh and homemade tasting, the sauce is always a delightful compliment and comforting.  The casual vibe is lovely and such a pleasant contrast to so many other Italian places along the street in North Beach.  The Bolognese sauce with meatballs is always a winner paired with whatever pasta suites your fancy that day (they are all amazing, honestly).  Also tried the pesto and marinara to mix it up, and both were just as amazing.
author: Grace S.

description: Love this place! Thanks for the reviews....not sure what we wanted...first time in Little Italy  and looked into yelp and ate here delicious and people are friendly
author: Lupe Z.

description: There is no comparison to freshly made and hand crafted pasta. The gnocchi with pesto sauce melted in my mouth. This joint is a small mom and pop shop with simple dishes that will astonish your taste buds. I recommend this spot for small groups of 1-3.
author: Margie S.

description: Oh.my.goodness! What a delicious treat! I'm normally not a fan of lasagna, but their lasagna melts in your mouth! The bolognese sauce was so flavorful and not overpowering. My husband said it tasted just like his Italian great grandmother's cooking:
author: Christine Z.

description:
I used to love this place but they just lost a customer.

The food is good but I'm only writing this review to pass time. Been waiting 30 minutes for two sandwiches and there's hardly anyone here. The reason: they prioritized the online orders. No warning that it would take so long.
author: Ash S.

description:
Nothing less than 5 starsI

This place is a neighbor treasure.

Everything is handmade. The staff is extremely nice and friendly. The meat tortellini and the pappardelle are heavenly - haven't tried others. I always make orders by the number of people I will be cooking to, and they always give me the exact right amount. 

Also haven't tried to eat there yet. Which I'm sure will be a great experience as well.
author: Andressa G.

description:
What can I say?
I love this place! A corner of Romagna in SF
Two italian friends recommended it, so I had to go, despite North Beach is kind of out of the way for me.
Walking up Columbus, couldn't help but notice all of the italian-american restaurants filled with happy people eating their "fettuccini alfredo", their "chicken parm" and other wonders of the american cuisine. I was terrified.
Luckily, the Italian Homemade Company, is nothing like that. 
We got in and it felt like we were on a beach town in the Adriatic Coast. Ok, that's an exxageration, but pretty close! It helps that they have classic (cheesy) italian music from the 60's/70's/80's and all of the people working there are italians!
I was advised to try a "classic" piadina. It was like being back to my college years in Bologna. Soo good!
I definitely want to go back to try other things on their menu, like gnocchi, lasagne and tagliatelle.
You don't have to be italian to enjoy this place, and the very nice staff will help you navigate the menu!
author: Amira T.

description: This is a treasure of a cafe. We stopped in for a snack soon after arriving to town.  You order at the counter, but they will bring your food and bus your table - so it's definitely worth tipping healthily. The piadina sandwich makes for a good nosh.  I'd try the caprese next time. The veggie sandwich was fine, but I didn't really dig the spinach.  The atmosphere is excellent, with some interspersed Italian in the conversation, Italian songs in the background, and a lovely sidewalk patio.  It is located just far enough from the main drag that it's peaceful but not dead.  Highly recommend!
author: Haroun K.

description:
This is and has always been one of my favorite places in the neighborhood since they opened. Wonderful fast hearty food and they are always super friendly and accommodating.  You will not find a more affordable and tasty pasta option in North Beach.   I am also a huge fan of the Piadina and Cassoni (flatbread sandwiches).  All stuffed with wonderful top shelf Italian ingredients.  

I also often bring home fresh pasta and sauce to cook at home too.
author: Jeff C.

description:
This by far the best Italian food I've ever had.  Three friends went to Mass at St. Peter and Paul  Church and decided to look for a good Italian restaurant in the area.  We walked in and every small round table was full.  There was not a seat to be found.  We walked out yelped other restaurants.  As we turned we saw a large group leave and back we went.  Best decision ever.  We ordered gnocchi with Bolognese, meat lasagne and tagliatelle and marinara.  All were absolutely the best.  FRESH HOMEMADE pasta.  They have a large menu.  The aroma is enticing.
The tables are tiny and you sit on bar stools.  Don't let that deter you.  This is a neighborhood gem.
On a nice day you can sit outside. The restaurant is clean and the staff is friendly.  Definitely come for lunch or dinner.
author: Sandy P.

description: Holy F. This place has amazing GD lasagna. The meatballs are RIDICULOUS-ly good. If you don't eat here something is wrong with you.
author: Adam S.

description:
What is all the hype.  75 dollars to eat of off paper plates.  Lasagne was warm outside cold in the middle.  Flat bread no taste.  It was o.k.  not all the hype that is given.  

It is over priced for counter service.  I gave it a shot.  Hopefully the owner will take this as a constructive review and use this to make the establishment better for the future.

The tables, small round unstable, so are the chairs.  Grab some tools and tighten em up.

Although your lasagne is ok.  Work on the other issues to match your pricing with level of service.
author: J. L.

description:
I stopped in at the end of a long day trip in San Francisco. This food was DELICIOUS. I think this may be the best Italian food I've ever had in my life. 

I love how you can customize your dinner by choosing which pasta you want and pairing it with one of their amazing sauces. Everything is made right in front of you by some super cool, you guessed it, Italian guys. 

I highly recommend this quaint little joint and will definitely be returning next time I make it out to SF!
author: Brittney M.

description: They now have desserts!! Delicious fluffy bomboloni donuts stuffed with nutella. Amaziiiing and perfect after your piadinas. They continue to offer quality dishes and super friendly owners. Definitely going to be a regular here.
author: Angela L.

description: We come here every time we visit SF. The lasagna is amazing and everything is hand made. Legit Italian. Staff barely speaks English but crazy friendly and great service.
author: Peter H.

description: Love this restaurant. Great Italian pasta without a long wait. Also don't forget to buy some fresh pasta while you are there.
author: Jake D.

description:
I am afraid but unfortunately this place does not live up the hype. Food is only mediocre and still it's not cheap.

May only be a good alternative to a fast food chain.
author: Gokhan T.

description: This place has best lasagna and meatballs I have ever had. Good pricing, real deal Italian food! it's a must try in San Francisco
author: Jose R.

description: Like most businesses in San Francisco, you're going to have to try and find street parking for this place. There were a lot of people here which leads you to believe that the food is worth the wait. I'm not saying that I did not enjoy the food but seeing how the food was prepared, I was a little saddened. First of all, I ordered the lasagna which I saw was already baked(cooked?) and put in a warmer. By the looks of things, the lid was left off and the lasagna was just sitting there for who knows how long  That lasagna was then put into a pan and re-cooked/heated and put in my to-go box. There's nothing wrong with preparing food the way they do, but I am a stickler when it comes to Italian food which I believe should be freshly prepared; especially if the name of the place contains "homemade". I also ordered meatballs due to many of the rave reviews I read but there was nothing special about them unfortunately.
author: Victor G.

description:
Dear Readers,

Absolutely never go to any other place for fresh pasta, sauces, and pastries! I walked in here quite randomly one day and the food changed my life!

I ordered the ravioli with the fresh bolognese sauce to take home, and in store ate one of the cream filled fresh sugar donut balls. Literally, THE BEST EVER. My family was just as obsessed as I was when I brought the desserts and pasta home. It was so authentic and affordable! Plus, this place is true Italian. I loved hearing the staff speaking and joking together in Italian, I felt like I had taken a quick flight to Italy.

I wish I could eat here everyday, if only my hips would lie.
author: Corinna B.

description: Amazing food at an amazing price. I had the mountain of meatballs. Tough to finish between two people. Can't wait to try the pesto dishes.
author: Jonathan S.

description:
We had the tagliatelle with meat balls. Everything is great! Everything is made fresh from scratch here, and taste just that, fresh! 

The young Italian owners arrived here not long ago and set out for their dream in this small shop. It's such a breath of fresh air from all the "established" Italian restaurants in North Beach with non-Italian cooks.

Most definitely going back again! It doesn't hurt that they are only 3 blocks away. Grab it to-go, walk home, pour a of wine, and everything is still hot and tasty!
author: Will T.

description:
Not to much to look at on the outside but the food is amazing. Asked for the go to dish and was recommended and ate with a smile, tortellini. 

The cheese was fresh, the sauce was perfect and the chefs were so nice.
author: Meghan B.

description:
I was here with couple of friends and believe me I had the best ravioli of my life. I had the ravioli with the good ol' marinara sauce, it was simple but unbelievably tasty. I had tiramisu to top off the meal and it was excellent too.
I would definitely recommend this place to folks not only looking for good authentic Italian experience but also to anyone interested in amazing food, love it.
author: Ro P.

description: This place has great authentic homemade Italian food, by far the best in North Beach! The only con I can say is that their sit down service isn't superb, yet it suits them well, go and you will find out for yourself! Btw, order the lasagna!!! It never disappoints!
author: Connar B.

description:
Having just moved here from nyc, I was looking for some good Italian food in the city. I found Italian homemade on yelp and decided to try it out. 

The food was amazing, pasta was very fresh and portion sizes were large. I had the gnocchi bolognese which was delicious. I would want to try the ravioli next time as I had a bite and those were great as well.

Only reason for not adding a 5th star is the ambiance, there wasn't much seating and could be more intimate. The prices were also a bit more expensive then expected for a casual eatery although worth it for the great food.
author: Rachel C.

description:
Local Italian restaurant right in the heart of North Beach. It's definitely way better than a lot of the American Italian spots on the main strips in North Beach.

They are a local little shop and offer a true authentic taste. It's nice to be in a spot where they know the customers and can build something to almost any order.

It's a little expensive but the portions are massive and it's often hard to even finish!

The gnocchi and lasagna are fantastic and highly recommend them. 

Not a lot of space to sit down and it can get really busy on weekends which makes for a decent wait sometimes.

They offer both to go and eat in the restaurant orders.
author: Nick S.

description: Wonderful little Italian grocery and cafe. I bought authentic Italian marina sauce and they carry homemade pasta. Loved this little place!!
author: Julie C.

description: Absolutely worth the walk up Powell Street! Fabulous!! The people working are very friendly, the atmosphere is casual, warm and inviting..... And the food was phenomenal! I would absolutely come back here again any time I come to San Fransisco!
author: Deborah B.

description: We walked past here and the line was out the door. Came back the next night to no line and we had the best pasta we have ever had outside of Italy.
author: Joe M.

description: Best italian pastas ever! Tastes almost the same as what i have in Italy. I love squid ink pasta! They make it in front of you. Very fresh!
author: Jules L.

description: Yummmmmy!!  Ordered the Gnocchi with pesto and the tagliatelle with meatballs and bolognese sauce. Great food! This is our first time here. Passed it up as we were going to Rogue brewery. Decided to stop here after our drinks. This was a great decision!!
author: Rose B.

description: Best pasta I've had in all of SF.  Was so good we came back the next day for carry out!  Nice and friendly staff. Will be back to try the sandwiches.
author: Carlota N.

description: Quaint atmosphere. Friendly staff (I think. They were all speaking Italian so they could have been making fun of me and I would never know). Fantastic, homemade, authentic Italian cuisine. A new favorite in the city.
author: Aaron B.

description: Uncertain why this is rated highly.  Nothing special about the dish.  The lasagna was cold and the sandwich was basic. Disappointed
author: Monica Z.

description:
No-frills and very fresh Italian food in the heart of Little Italy. Yep, I am a fan. I've tried the bolognese sauce, meatballs, and lasagna so far. I'd say the lasagna has been my personal favorite and I think it's one of the most popular items there. Thankfully they cook everything very quickly and the wait is usually short.

I have only been here for dinner and it's clear that it's very busy. It's tricky to secure a table sometimes and it's definitely a casual, fast-paced environment where it's probably not the best idea to linger after you're done. There's always going to be a new crowd of hangry people looking for a table as well.
author: Elaine S.

description:
Loved our visit to the Italian Homemade Company! The menu is small but varied. I had a hard time deciding what to order, but we decided on the spinach ravioli with bolognese and a meatball cassoni. After we placed our order I noticed the special board on the back wall listed a squid ink pasta with bottarga!!! Next time. 

Our pasta had the perfect al dente texture, the sauce was tangy, and the cassoni crust was chewy in a good pizza crust kind of way. Service was excellent and I love that this place is run by real Italians and not hipsters who think they know Italian food. 

It's located on Columbus behind Victoria Pastry and is a short walk away from Washington Square Park, but there's plenty of tables and stools so you can definitely eat inside as well.
author: Bella L.

description: We had the lasagna,  it's  moist and flavorful. Exceeded our expectation. The mozzarella salad is good too. Nice staff friendly.... good service over all. Will recommend and definitely worth coming back.
author: Lorna O.

description:
I viewed the ratings and decided to go there for dinner with 4 friends.  We ordered 2 lasagna and ravioli and pasta.  Every dish taste like shit and stink like shit. We spent over 60 dollars and end up throwing it all away.  Do not ever go there unless you are willing to suffer.
But all said, maybe you should try it yourself and think otherwise.
author: Dr Tim C.

description: Oh My God! First of all (this may come across as snotty but it has to be said)... I've lived in Italy and this restaurant is the real deal. The employees are all really friendly and easy on the eyes too ;) but more importantly the food is incredible! The lasagne is to die for and you can understand why such a small sized place gets the amount of customers it has. It's very unique and true to Italian culture - even how you can buy fresh pasta by the pound and cook it at home. The tiramisu is no joke as well and the portions are an ideal size too. If you're near Russian hill then definitely check it out. Amazing! Grazie Mille!!!
author: Ana A.

description:
I've been here many times, and without a doubt this is some of the most authentic Italian food you can get in the city.

You'll leave the table feeling full from the generous portions. The Gnocchi Roll is absolutely amazing, wonderful texture, fully warm all throughout, and with a perfect ratio of gnocchi to ricotta / spinach that I have yet to have topped.

The second dish I would highly recommend is the Pasta Bolognese, once again another very authentic Italian dish that makes my mouth water every time I even think about it. The noodles are done the traditional Italian way, al dente, the sauce isn't overbearing or too much, and the meat blends in very well with the dish. It's perfect.

The restaurant itself feels like a deli or cafe, so it appears more traditional and it has limited seating, so prepare yourself if you're going to drop in. With the extremely warm owners, exceptional staff, and environment, I have to rate it as a 5 star restaurant.
author: Nijiko Y.

description: Simple menu but best taste! I was impressed by the huge and fresh meatball. You definitely have to try the tiramisu after meal.
author: 蕾蕾

description: I am Italian and I have been eating there at least once a week since they opened. I did not write a review sooner because I did not want too many people in my favorite place. But now I changed my mind because I want them to be more successful than McDonald's and open thousands of locations all over the world so I can always be close to a well done piadina or homemade pasta. I usually get piadina classica or vegetarian ravioli with bolognese.
author: luca d.

description:
Someone I was with said it best..."this place puts all of Little Italy to shame"...and I'm inclined to agree.

You're welcomed by the heavenly scents of Italian cuisine and a group of delightful Italian smiles. Already salivating, you examine the menu only to be overwhelmed by your desire to order everything, but you realize you don't know what half the menu means. You can order items you obviously were dead set on getting, but what if this Piadina/Cassoni thing is better and you just don't know!? You watch the cook douse a huge block of lasagna in a beautiful red sauce, then your eyes dart to the back kitchen where someone is actually rolling out pasta, then you see the trays of Cassonis and you're still just as undecisive as ever. A friendly voice chimes in like a lifeline as you struggle in well of gluttonous anxiety...he coolly answers all questions in a friggin cool accent and offers his recommendations...you're saved...

After chowing down on hearty portions of lasagna and stuffed gnocchi, I knew that I found my new go-to spot in North Beach. I'll be back for some Piadina and fresh pasta action soon...you can count on it!
author: Nick W.

description:
Great pasta. Homemade and cooked perfectly. Meatballs were spectacular. 
Ate on the sidewalk in fantastic weather. 
Wonderful experience.
author: Mike C.

description: We stopped by right before we left San Francisco and wish we would have gotten here sooner. The chef explained everything to us and what the different menu options were - it is clear that he loves his work! It took a bit to decide, but we went with a Cassone with sausage, cheese, and peppers, as well as an order of Meat Ravioli with Marinara sauce. We also had an order of flatbread to start. Absolutely the best Italian food I have ever had! Highly recommended.
author: Robin B.

description: I had the pappardelle with bolognese sauce and it was delicious. 12 dollars for fresh and home made pasta can t be beat . I wanted more of it!
author: Jason S.

description: I had a really bad experience with this place. We ordered over Uber eats and I got the gnocchi. I found a long black hair in my pasta. Just disgusting!
author: Mona U.

description:
Having just moved to the neighborhood recently, I have made it a personal mission to find the truly authentic and most delicious Italian restaurants in North Beach. There is a wide variety of high quality Italian food in this area of San Francisco, and each restaurant has its own signature menu item, dinner atmosphere and food serving style. It is truly one of the best parts of the city for this cuisine, and tonight I discovered one of my new favorite places for homemade Italian food.

When I had a good friend of mine from another part of the Bay Area come to visit me in this area tonight  I wanted to try a new place that serves tasty pasta with fast service and an authentic Italian feel. This is exactly what I experienced at The Italian Homemade Company. I had the Tagliatelle pasta with Bolognese cream sauce, a truly excellent and flavorful meal. The cooking staff had excellent, quick service with our pasta orders and the cashier was especially friendly. It had a nice relaxing atmosphere as well as authentic Italian pastas, sauces, oils, coffees and more items for sale to use for home cooking.

I definitely will come back again to try more of their tasty pasta combinations, as well as other enticing menu items.
author: Kellen W.

description:
Authentic pasta that is super fresh and DELISH. 

I ordered the prosciutto tortellini with bolognese sauce and the tortellini tasted like Italy. I was super impressed! 

I also ordered the meatballs and it came with bread. The meatballs were the best I've ever had. 

There is def a reason this is vying for #1 restaurant on Yelp in SF. Do yourself a HUUUGE favor and try some legit and authentic Italian food. Skip the touristy and overpriced places and get yourself a fresh, simple plate of pasta from The Italian Homemade Company. 

After, you can stop by Victoria Bakery for some sweets/dessert  :)
author: Alison N.

description:
If you work nearby, this is a good place for lunch with pasta made for you by adorable Italian guys in a low key/comfortable spot. They also have sandwiches, but I didn't have one
on this visit..am definitely going to try one next time. 

Not 5 stars because the sauces were fine but not amazing. The pasta is great though, so if you're good with sauces, get pasta to take home so you can add your own sauce. 

Maybe practice your Italian accent a little too for the complete experience?
author: El B.

description: So good! Delicious, inexpensive, fast and fresh. Had the Pappardelle with marinara sauce.  Yummy!
author: Tanja S.

description: Haven't had such great pasta since my grandma's. Few options but superlative execution. Simple and perfect.
author: Solo M.

description:
P times three.

Piadina: Flatbread sandwich featuring eggplant, green onions, tomatoes, peppers and spinach. So much flavor it was easily one of the best sandwiches of the year. $10.  

Pappardelle: Large noodles served with choice of sauce including marinara. Both pasta and sauce could be eaten solo they are that good. Together it's magic. Also $10.

Perfection: Two dishes above plus the incredibly enthusiastic and friendly Italian fluent staff, artisanal packaged goods available for sale and charming space.

Calculate five stars.
author: Jason B.

description:
Really good pasta and lasagna! The place smells delicious and gets you hungry as soon as you enter. The people are super friendly and helpful. Feels like you are in the kitchen of an Italian family.

I had the lasagna which was just perfectly cooked and tasted great. My friend ordered the gnocchi which is the most recommend dish on yelp and it totally lived up to the reputation. My friend also ordered this chocolate and coffee drink that he absolutely loved.
author: Karthik K.

description:
The place is so nice it's look like a place in Italy. People who are working here are amazing, so kind, and they take care of the food they cooked and served. They look like enjoying work at this place, and really friendly. 
I recommend a lot this place if you want eat good and fresh Italian food. And then prices are not expansive. 
I order a special pasta with speck and cheese and it was awesome so tasty. I was empty after this and feeling good. 
Thank you so much to make this kind of tasty food  it's really good. 
As we say in Italian: grazie!!
author: Paul E.

description: Great find if you don't have a lot of time.  Even though it was busy, by the time we entered and had food at our table it had only been 10 mins.  The Gnocchi Roll special with flat bread was amazing.
author: Jacob J.

description: I discovered this lovely place few months ago when my friends were in town. We were looking for a great and local Italian restaurant. We absolutely felt in love with the place, the home made pasta and the staff. They are real Italians and are very nice. The guy told me they had the best Tiramusu and he was right. Try it!
author: David P.

description: The gnocchi roll is so good! We tried it on the Taste Buds Tour, our first stop in North Beach. It was handmade and fresh with spinach, gooey mozzarella cheese, and tomato paste. My friends and I came back and got the meatball, ravioli with white sauce, and pesto pasta. They were all amazing.
author: Elise G.

description: Amazing food... we had the Veggie Lasgna... Vegetarian Sandwich and Spinach Ricotta Ravioli with Pesto sauce... mouth watering Crostata for dessert...
author: Srinidhi N.

description:
All the pasta is homemade and amazing.  One of the best lasagnas I've ever had, light, fluffy and melts in your mouth.  I was completely stuffed after dinner but was still craving more.  By the initial look of the lasagna, my husband wasn't all that impressed.  But the second he had his first bite, he didn't say a single word to me and kept eating faster and faster, don't think he wanted to share any of it.

There are a ton of Italian places in North Beach, most have terrible food.  This place is nothing fancy but has amazing food.  What a great addition to North Beach, so glad I live fairly close.  Perfect place for a quick, casual, delicious meal.
author: Shelly W.

description: This is the perfect place to eat for the most delicious authentic food combined w good company. The owners are an amazing couple from Rimini Italy, and make some seriously addicting cibo. They have the best lasagne I've ever had, the gnocchi is my favorite, and the cassone sandwiches are delightful. ITH has great food for great prices. I love the quaint relaxing feel of the place. I will be popping in and stuffing my face anytime I'm in north beach for sure. Love it!
author: Haley H.

description:
Really small place, but definitely delecious. The homemade pasta was so good. I had the gnocchi roll, and it was perfect. All the flavors were great. 
 Also tried the tortellini with pesto. It was a little too oily. But if you like a strong pesto flavor it was good. 
Everyone spoke Italian that worked there, I certainly got a home vibe from it. 
They don't have a lot of variety when it comes yo food, but what they do have is the best!
author: Valerie J.

description:
Possibly the best pasta I've ever had. The marinara is fantastic if you like fresh basil! 

And from a 4 yr old the review of fettuccine and white sauce is "mmmm MMM!"
author: Richard G.

description:
Food is great. Nice deli style Resturant with a fantastic staff. This is NOT a normal sit down style Resturant. They have ample seating, but don't expect candlelight and private booths. Great view looking out on the street
Pasta was not over cooked and was tender without being soggy or like chewing rubber
Had the lasagna and it is more than enough for 1 person.  Either go hungry or share, there is a good serving. 
Have to try the flat bread. It's fantastic. Add some prosciutto and mozzarella and it makes the bomb of a sandwich. 
Will definitely eat there again when back in the neighborhood.
author: David M.

description: Oh my lord! This pasta is soo good! Don't miss this place, it's so close to pasta I have eaten in italy.
author: My S.

description:
good food, simple presentation ("choose a pasta, choose a sauce.") Had pesto ravioli, which was tasty. I wasn't exactly blown away by the flavor profiles, but the restaurant definitely does nothing wrong. Everyone speaks Italian.

Pretty good italian classic pop, big band stuff, etc. on the radio. Stools and tables are quite wobbly.

Update: Returned, and tried the vegetable lasagna. It was the best lasagna of my life. Asparagus, zucchini, bell peppers were cooked just to perfection, and the creamy tomato sauce was so tastefully done. There's so much crap lasagna at Italian restaurants in America that this really stands out. Added a star for a perfect 5.
author: Bosie M.

description: Absolutely the best home made lasagna ever!!  Reasonably priced!  A must do restaurant when visiting San Francisco!
author: Sandy H.

description: This was a wonderful find. Visited for an early quick dinner our last night in town. Super casual, homemade pasta on a paper plate. We loved it - it was truly delicious! Hubby had lasagna and I had pesto & fettuccine. Definitely a great stop for an easy lunch or dinner - we were very pleased.
author: Sarah E.

description: It was just like eating in Italy. Had pesto ravioli and house special fettuccine. Panacota tasted very good. Would highly recommend this place. The place as such was crowded and seating was limited.
author: Vijay V.

description:
Buonissimo. 

I'm Italian, been living in San Francisco for 3+ year and this is by far the most authentic and delicious Italian restaurant you can find in the city. After trying it for the first time, it  became a tradition for me and my friends  to go there every Sunday to have lunch and taste those amazing fresh home made lasagna, gnocchi and cassone. 


Highly recommended, eccellente.
author: Alberto M.

description:
My friend Bessie and I were going to see our friend funny woman Carla Clay perform at Cobbs Comedy but before the show we wanted to grab a bite to eat. We walked up Columbus but to be honest I wasn't in the mood for a crowded, popular/trendy packed North Beach experience, I wanted something more relaxed, off the beaten path, authentic but good. I just happened to glance to the left and it was as if this small Italian restaurant  said, "Mangia!" A trio of Italian employees took out orders but only after giving us recommendations; try the Gnocchi roll!
Pasta made to order, eat in or take away and other items like sauces were for purchase. The tables seat two at the most both indoor & outdoor seating. Very simple but good, frequented by locals; shhhhh don't tell the tourists!
author: David P.

description: Everything is so delicious here! If you want no bullshit amazing Italian food don't waste your time anywhere else. Homemade & Fresh! The stuffed gnocchi was insanely good! Super casual deli style atmosphere and sweet Italian staff.
author: Rachel J.

description:
I love this little, homey neighborhood gem.  The food is wonderful.  The fresh, homemade pasta and sauces are incredible.  My favorite is the light and flavorful lasagna.  It isn't anything like the overly cheesy American version.  Everything here is delicious.  

The restaurant is small, with a few tables and stools.  A very unpretentious place that puts the emphasis on food and not decor.  Great Italian owners/staff.
author: Donna P.

description:
Absolutely wonderful.  The ravioli was cooked perfectly and the sauce selection is fantastic.  The flat bread is also worth a try (get the arugula and cheese).  

I usually don't crave Italian but this deli/restaurant will have me coming back once a week.
author: Dan N.

description: I'm no connoisseur, but this was probably the best pasta I've ever had. Low key place, order at the counter, choose your pasta and sauce. I had the fettucine, with meatballs. Amazing.
author: Peter C.

description:
When I was forced by coworkers to eat here, I released an audible groan but went anyway. 

I'm glad I did because I was pleasantly surprised. The food is very good. Four stars for that.

The ambience is comfortable and not too loud. 
There's a super friendly person in front that greats you and actually smiles. THERE WILL BE ROOM FOR YOU WHEN YOU'RE READY TO EAT wow super confident! This place is full of crowds and a long line of hungry people. HOW WILL THERE BE ROOM FOR ME??!? It was a Friday during Lent, so of course I ordered a meat sandwich. I wanted to ask the callous-looking chef to add blue cheese, but I was almost certain that the reply would have been... "NO"
The food looked great, so I was in a hurry to sit down. And guess what!? There were places to sit. HOW?!? I didn't understand. So I ate my food (it was delicious) and had some good conversation with coworkers.  Definitely would recommend. Fair prices and great food.
author: Dave F.

description: This is a neighborhood gem. I've been here twice and the food is yummy. Great service, fair prices and good vibes. You can taste the freshness of the pasta the moment you bite into it. I ordered the fettuccine with meatballs & tiramisu both times. It's hard to resist stopping by on my walk home. Keep up the fabulous work, The Italian Homemade!
author: Crystal K.

description: This place was a hidden and unexpected treasure! I ordered the fettuccine with meatballs and I was in love! Their fresh noodles and homemade meatballs were worth the trip there!
author: Jennifer H.

description:
This place rocks!
It's one of the few places authentically italian.
The owners are italian.
The food is italian.
The music is italian.
And when you hit Italy you know food is going to be awesome...and it's actually so tasty it seems unreal.
No doubts this is the best italian food you can get in the san francisco. Highly recommended.
author: Marco S.

description: The bacon, sausage Cassoni is fantastic. Highly recommended and quite unique. Staff is friendly and actually Italian.
author: Dan M.

description:
There are lots of Italian places on the North Beach section of Columbus Ave but this one I think really stands out. This small restaurant feel super authentic (probably because it is Italian owned and run). It's cute and casual, with a menu that changes depending on what they have. The place mainly serves hot and cold sandwiches, as well as a large selection of homemade pastas.  I stopped here for a light lunch, and split one of their Italian flatbread sandwiches with a friend. The bread was fresh, light, and crispy. The procuitto thinly sliced with the perfect amount of saltiness. Overall, a great sandwich. They also have a drinks fridge that serve of Italian sodas. There's both indoor and outdoor seating, so if its nice out you can enjoy the fresh air and dine al fresco. 

I can't wait to come back and try some of their pastas and lasagnas!
author: Ming L.

description: Looks sketchy from the street and even when you step in the door.  Don't be fooled by the small space and the lack of seating.  The food is THE BEST in SAN FRANCISCO!  I'm serious.  What do I need to say to convince you that you will ruin your trip if you don't visit this place.  My wife got the veggie lasagna, and I got the gnocchi special with Italian sausage and mushrooms.  I almost cried it was so good.  Can you imagine going to the same place twice on a weekend getaway with so many restaurants to choose from?  That's exactly what we're doing tomorrow.
author: Sterling P.

description: I live in SoCal and my BF and I traveled out here for vacation. He's Italian and super picky on the Italian food he eats. The three years we've been together we have never come to an agreement on an authentic Italian eatery. As soon as we walked into this cute shop my boyfriend was impressed. The smell is intoxicating. We ordered the gnocchi with white sauce and it was unbelievable. If I only had to eat at one place in San Francisco for the rest of our trip it would be here!
author: Emmanuel T.

description: Delicious! I had the tagliatelle with bolognese, and it tasted just like my favorite meal from my trip to Italy! I've also had the gnocchi. Yum! You can tell most people get takeout, since the shop is so small, but there is some space to eat there if you'd like. I'll be coming back!
author: Carolyn S.

description: The lasagna was delicious, but a little overcooked. It's a great hole in the wall in the heart of Little Italy.
author: M. G.

description: I love this place. The pasta is fresh and hearty, the people are sweet, the portions generous. Now a weekly staple!
author: Camellia D.

description: Oh wow so excited to find this place the pasta and sauce was so fresh being made right in front of us and you could taste the love in it! Desert was out of this world the pannna cotta just melted in your mouth! Can't wait to go back
author: Marissa C.

description:
Can't be beat for a great, Italian taste!

My husband and I were stopping by SF on our way home from Hawaii, and after having seafood for 2 weeks, I was sorely craving anything but.

My husband found this place on Yelp and we headed right over. 

The service was amazing. Everyone in the staff smiled and greeted us right away, and made sure to address any questions we had. We felt comfortable immediately and left our meal in their hands, telling them to decide for us. 

We got the ravioli and a cassone, and it definitely hit the spot. The cassone was my favorite; the dough was crisp and warm, and the combination of sauce and cheeses melted in just the right way. We took our meal outside where the weather was equally perfect and demolished every bite. 

I definitely recommend the cassone as my personal favorite, but I'm a huge bready/doughy fan and I felt that their dough was right on =)
author: Diana H.

description: We came here because it was close with great reviews. The food was terrific and the staff couldn't be nicer. We had the basic fettuccine with meatballs and bolognese which was delicious. My only gripe is that because it's a small place, they have wooden seated bar stools with small round tables which made dining kind of uncomfortable, but it didn't bother my teenager any. It's a cute family owned place
author: Brent G.

description:
I'm Italian and this place is awesome. All you have to know.

Gnocco ripieno and tagliatelle are highly recommended.
author: Valerio P.

description: Who knew cabbage would be so good. I had the jerk chicken unlike anything I have ever had. Great spice and a little heat. Coming back
author: J I.

description:
The best homemade Italian food in San Fran!! 
Bolognese pasta was delicious and the Bacon Sausage Casoni...Yum!!
My wife and I would give it more stars than five. Great customer service. Great pricing and Great portions, meaning just enough and not over done on the amount. God Bless the Italians
author: Adrien J.

description: Great piadino sausage sandwich. This place is about as authentic as it gets. The name gets it right.  Doesn't look like much on the inside but the food is great. Bar stools inside and 3 tables outside. I'll be back!
author: Tomas T.

description: Wonderfully simple and super fresh I had the Gnocchi with speck and white sauce. Devine
author: Kelly C.

description: Homemade pasta. Amazing sauce choices. Tiramisu was excellent. Not much seating; sidewalk tables were charming but a bit cold in September. Definitely recommend for a casual dining experience.
author: Matthew R.

description: Visiting from Los Angeles, I came with my brother to try some reasonably priced Italian food, and it was amazing! My brother had the lasagna with bolognese sauce, and I had the ravioli with bolognese sauce. The lasagna had a lot of good flavor, but the ravioli was not that great. Ravioli was a bit dry and lacked a bit of flavor. Customer service is great and the people that work there are actually from Italy. Next time I come I'll be going after the lasagna!
author: Franky H.

description:
the most authentic and delicious Italian place I ever been in San Francisco. I'm probably becoming a regular. 

I had the raviolis and it was great. Next time i will try the "cassone". You should definitely check it out if you live in San Francisco or passing by.
author: Rafael S.

description:
Ever since I arrived in North Beach from Trieste in 1952, when I was 15 years old, I have wished for an eating establishment that served truly authentically delicious Italian food. My wish is now fulfilled by this wonderful little spot that is operated by
a charming and dedicated young couple.
BRAVISSIMI, Alicia and Mattia!
author: Bruno V.

description:
Let me start saying that I am Italian and I have been living in California for more than 6 years now. Also let me say that I am very judgmental about Italian food and I don't give my approval lightly.

That said, I loved The Italian Homemade Company. I hear of it from a friend.. and I coudn't believe it: Piadina in San Francisco!?! I had to try! 

I lived in Bologna for 6 years before moving here and I had many trip to the Land of Piadina! And I have been missing it very much! 

So, last Sunday I BARTed over montgomery st from the Mission and walked through chinatown just to go and try a nice piadina: totaly worth! You must try it!!!

Piadina, Cassoni and freshly made pasta. If you are Italian you will love it. If you are not you will fall in love with it and you will understand what Italian food is all about!

Plus the two owners, Alice and Mattia, are very good hosts! You will definetely enjoy the food and the whole experience! 

Buonissimo!!!
author: Gianpiero N.

description:
This place is great!! Staff is awesome with fresh ideas and recommendations, the food is incredibly delicious and unpretentious, fast and affordable. What more could you ask for?
This is totally my go to spot for pasta in the city! Congrats, guys!!! You do an amazing job!
author: Cecilia S.

description: I love this place. It's right near Washington Square in North Beach. They recently opened end of August and I already have made multiple visits. I formed an addiction of their cassoni, ravioli, lasagne, piadina, and gnocchi...I can go on, basically everything they make, as it's freshly made and delicious. And if you never had a cassoni or piadina then you haven't lived!! You can order to eat there, takes like 5 minutes or quickly grab some fresh handmade pasta and sauces home to cook. The owners are an amazing couple and are passionate in what they do. When I'm looking for traditional italian food, this is the spot. Other restaurants over do it sometimes with too heavy oils or sauces but at the Italian Homemade Company they make it perfectly, just like when I was in Italy. 5- stars for sure!!! Oh yeah, also they sell tasty treats and chocolates from Italy. Buono!!!
author: Nicole B.

description: Amazing lasagna ! Best I've had ever. And I've had it all over the world. Absolutely incredible. I'm going to take a nap now.
author: Blake G.

description: Lucky people in SF! This place is fantastic! Not only is the pasta made from scratch, the sauces are amazing. Service is great with great street view. Husband had the gnocchi and pumpkins special and it was very good. We came from Houston TX and walked here for the food. So glad we climbed these streets to get here. We will be back when we return to SF.
author: Nikki G.

description: OMG! Best pasta I've ever had. I had the vegetarian ravioli with marinara. The portion seemed small but I think that's only because it was so yummy I could've eaten three plates!
author: Val W.

description: OMG this place is amazing! Everything I expected when looking for delicious and affordable Italian food in Little Italy. Went there with my wife and two kids and all our dishes were very very good. We all agreed that it's some of the best authentic Italian food we've ever had and reasonably priced. Will definitely return to this restaurant. =D
author: Eddie V.

description: the food is great...but it could be amazing!!! U have to buy extra sauce! No bread?  plastic forks and pasta is always a bad idea.....maybe take it to go would be a better idea.  The cashier wasn't aware of the specials and had to go check the board (above her head).  No wait staff, someone does bring it to ur limited seating, but they barely acknowledged us.  Again the food was great, but not enough of it and portion of sauce extremely small. Too many other choices in the area.....if we try it again..... we will do take out....
author: Donna A.

description:
They're open now!   Check it out and support a local business.

So glad to have a new italian delicatessen on this side of North Beach.  The owners built out the store themselves and the wife is the chef.  The menu was limited given it's their first weekend but what I got was delicious.

They have 'cassoni' sandwiches which are a lighter version of calzones.  They make the flatbread to order and you can choose your own fillings or order a pre-made one.  Yesterday, we tried one which had mozzarella , cherry tomatoes and arugula inside of it - delicious as the tomatoes were sweet, the cheese was warm and oozy and the bread slightly crispy.  Today we had mild italian sausage, stuffed peppers and mozzarella which was the perfect combination of salty, sweet and cheesy.  The other choices for filling was one that had meat inside and another that had potatoes and spinach.  They also had lasagne and stuffed veggies.

We also bought raw flatbread dough and my husband made delicious pizzas out of them tonight.

There's some seating - more like a sandwich counter.  You can also get dry goods from Italy - pasta, sauces, cookies, Baci.

The real attraction will likely be the fresh pasta they make every day.  There wasn't much left by the time we visited in late afternoon so we plan to try again another day.
author: Serena S.

description: Food was delicious and the service was great. I felt like I was on the streets in Venice again. A great little hidden gem.
author: Stuart L.

description:
I've been three times now and it's all great. My first time I had a ravioli with bolognese sauce. They went to great lengths to pack each separately so the heat of the sauce wouldn't ruin the ravioli till I was ready to cook at home. And when they found out I was biking they took the whole thing back and added extra protection so it wouldn't spill. 

The second time I had what they described as spaghetti sauce as a soup, with their homemade flat bread. I think that was my favorite. And just now I filled up on an delicious, giant slice of lasagna. 

Also the couple who run it are very kind and enthusiastic about their food, as well they should be.
author: Devin M.

description: Seriously, how can you give Italian Homemade good reviews?!! This place is awful.Don't be misled by some of the photos! We were looking forward to having lunch here. Never again. How can Italian Homemade even look people in the eye? Maybe the pasta is made there but mine was soggy. Had the tagliatelle pasta with marinara and husband had the meatball flatbread. Disappointed! The sauce is from a jar and tastes terrible. The gal at the counter seemed initially nice, but when I asked about the sauce, she sneered and said, "you are an american and this is how it's made in Italy... You are not used to good sauce and pasta in America."  Ok, I've been to Italy and the sauce/ pasta is fantastic. It is anything but what this place offers. My husband said his sandwich was "bleah." I did not finish, because it was inedible. One kid sitting near us kept telling his parents that his flatbread sandwich was awful. Parents did not look happy with their dishes either. Can someone please recommend a good, authentic, moderately priced Italian somewhere else in San Francisco, away from the tourist trap Italian eateries of North Beach? Oh yes, and that serves wine?
author: Shelley K.

description: Awesome. Hard to decide what to order all looked so good. Tortellini with pesto yummy. Worth the wait.
author: Rick G.

description: Had raviolis here last week.   Worst meal that I have ever had.  Pasta was raw.  Meat inside was like cat food, sauce was like canned tomato soup.  Yuck Yuck Yuck.  Horrible $14.00 plate of slop.  I can't believe it was sooo bad.  WHAT A S.F. ripoff! Nasty !!!Al dente think I will go here again.  There are some other older Italian restaurants in North Beach that are decent. These wantna be hip places are a joke.  Go ahead stand in line for a bad meal, if you like cat food ground beef.  Don't believe the great reviews,  people!  My two friends had sandwiches that were way under par.  Very little meat .  Just not exciting and over priced, in the name of hipness.  Fed up with the city!
author: Louise L.

description: Doesn't look like much from the outside, but great place to catch a friendly, fresh, home made Italian dinner.  Wife and I sat outside and enjoyed a well deserved meal after walking the Wharf all day.   Lasagna and meat rav were very good.
author: Craig T.

description: My family and I had lunch here and it was one of best Italian food we had in years.  I had Veggie Lasagna, my daughters had pasta and wife had ravioli.  My Lasagna was outstanding - pasta was soft, white sauce was amazing and veggies were delicious. My daughter gnocchi pasta with pesto was delicious and it just melted in your mouth. My wife had Ravioli with spinach and ricotta - it tested good and had a lot finely sliced spinach in it. I learned they make their own pasta everyday and it really shows.
author: Chintu P.

description: If you are looking for the REAL Italian place, this might be it. I am not local, but you know that the noodle is what really sets apart from the fake Italian restaurants. They make their own noodles at site. The portions are pretty big, so don't order too much.
author: In C.

description: Cute atmosphere. Nice tables to sit at, not a lot of space. Simple menu. Chefs making pasta right in front of you. Their Lasagna is SO GOOD!
author: Michelle M.

description: Excellent,  homemade pasta dishes at a very reasonable price. If you are debating if you should go here,  you will not be disappointed
author: Bill K.

description: Small little mom-and-pop place the food is outstanding leave room for the tiramisu!
author: Rick F.

description: Stupid good Italian for affordable prices? Yeah, just go. It's probably a good thing I don't live in San Francisco, as this place could be dangerous.
author: Mike T.

description: Excellent food. Ordered vegetarian ravioli and bufala salad and was delighted. A perfect Italian lunch.
author: Ayyappan V.

description: Delicious! I ordered through Caviar and everything was so fresh and tasty and full of flavor. LOVED the lasgana as it almost had a pink/ rose sauce which is my FAVE. It was absolutely fantastic. Also had papparadelle with bolgonese and a meatball and it was delish as well but do not miss the lasgana.
author: Sarah A.

description:
Great, comfortable, homey place. 
Quick low-key, but tremendous flavors. I had a special linguini putinesca, my wife had spinach ravioli. All ways made right within our sight. Highest recommendation!
author: Ben F.

description:
Absolutely delicious homemade-from-scratch, authentic Italian pasta and sandwiches. After reading the great reviews, we had to try it, and it IS as good as everyone says!
However, this is not a sit-down restaurant with table service.  It is extremely casual: order and pay at the counter, sit on stools at teeny tiny tables (only room for two or three plates). Tricky for our group of six. Even though the seating area is small, you'll find a place because the tables turn over quickly. Don't be put off by the eating area....The food is worth the trouble!
author: Lesley B.

description: Solid Italian eatery. We tried a pasta dish, the veggie ravioli with the sage and butter, canzone and salad and I wish we had gotten another pasta dish.  The pasta is incredible. We will be back.  With more folks too.  And next time I am getting the lasagna and meat sauce pasta.  Overall I was impressed with the food quality and reasonable cost.
author: Raj P.

description: Best gnocchi I have had in a while. They were light and fluffy. Great to eat there or to take fresh pasta to cook at home.
author: Tu T.

description: The only lasagna I've ever eaten better than what I make at home. Absolutely great. The meatballs were also fantastic. My wife had the fettuccini and loved it. Not a lot of seating but totally worth it.
author: Scott K.

description: Absolutely amazing. Great place for lunch, and I'm thrilled we ended up here. I had the meat ravioli with meatballs while my friend ordered the vegetarian lasagna. Both were delicious.
author: Alexandra H.

description: The 4-star is for the absence of their menu on Yelp as well as not having a website (i.e., ordering options, menu). The food is definitely 5-star, however, and there are multiple sandwich and plate options available. The staff is also very friendly, so no real complaints except to inform the owners PLEASE UPDATE YOUR MENU ON HERE! Most people I would imagine would like to skip the line inside and just pick up orders (especially since we all know there is zero parking in NB), and they would most likely like to see all your food options available. Thanks!
author: Karl A.

description: The lasagna, burrata salad, and service were excellent, but the regular salad was mostly a sad pile of iceberg. For the price, that was unexpected and disappointing, a departure from what should be a consistent level of quality.
author: David S.

description: Great spot for a casual lunch. The pasta is being made in the kitchen, visible from the counter. They have a variety of fresh pastas, sauces, salads, and flatbread sandwiches. Great Bolognese sauce. What could make it better? Beer & Wine
author: Lindsay G.

description: If you're looking for a nice cozy spot for some Italian food come to home made Italian. It has amazing food with great portion sizes for the cost. I highly recommend the lasagna!
author: Andy N.

description: Amazing!!! Fresh homemade pastas!! The lasagna was to die for, and you can even buy fresh pasta to go and freeze for later.
author: Mabel L.

description: Meatballs are the best! I had a sandwich it was pretty good but I could Probably just eat 100 meatballs. Cant wait to go back!
author: Nhela T.

description: Wowza.  Everything hand made and delicious.  An absolute gem.  Had delicious pasta and gnocchi and could not have been more happy for a quick lunch on the way to the pier.
author: Jordan K.

description: Stuffs are soooooooo nice and kind. Everything are so good and fresh. Price are reasonable and portion is just enough. I'm from Houston and if we have this restaurant I will eat it everyday. :)
author: Fang H.

description:
Excellent food, great service
I went  last Friday night with some friends. It was rather busy, but we sat in the open anyway and listened to this great piano player. I have been to Here many times and have to say its my fave restaurant in WC. Always consistently great food, great service, and they have one of the best wine lists around. We started out our eve by ordering some yummy appetizers - calamari, crisp, yet, tender, and the oysters. Both were great! For dinner, I had their signature waldorf salad...butter lettuce, apple slices, grapes, a little stilton cheese and ooh..those honey glazed walnuts! My main course was the filet mignon with potato gratin. Let me just say that their filet beats any steakhouse in the area! Cooked perfectly, and a decent portion! It didn't stop there...we all shared some desserts. They have this decadent chocolate creme brulee topped with thinly sliced bananas. Oh my word... delish! Everyone was happy, and I highly recommend Massimo and will definitely be back for more!j
author: Sammy K.

description: Great spot for a piadina and more!
author: Riccardo B.

description: Fresh Italian pasta made in front of you. Not the best I ever had but still ok. Very friendly guy behind the register, not really cheap but still reasonable.
author: Dan C.

description: I am originally from the east coast and have lived on the west coast for over a decade.  If you like your meatballs authentic and pasta al dente, you have to try this place.  And bonus, for pasta with bolognese and a meatball, $12!
author: Melissa M.

description: Got the Veggie Lasagna which wasn't warm enough, but it was also bland and mushy. This place may be conveniently located but that was the only positive thing I found during my last visit. I won't come back, next time I'll try another restaurant in the area.
author: Michelle O.

description: Will add more stars once I have tried their entire menu. Can't go wrong with fresh pasta right on the spot.
author: John C.

description: Super yummy, reasonably priced and authentic food! The whole set up is typically 'Italian' with pasta products surrounding the cafe and even soft drinks imported from Italy. The gnocchi roles were fantastic and the cassoni came with béchamel sauce. Definitely a place to go if you're craving some good quality Italian food!
author: Bex E.

description: I'm really sad to give this only 3 stars because the flavor deserves 5. But the serving sizes are totally dependent on who's serving you up. Of the three times I've been, I've walked away hungry twice because I felt like I was eating a child size meal (and it's not like I'm some big hungry guy, I'm a fairly small girl). One of the times we came with family and their portions were about twice that of ours, and we only ordered right after them. I just feel like for the amount of money I spend here, I shouldn't be leaving hungry most of the time.
author: Ashley E.

description:
How have I not reviewed this place? I literally eat here every week because it's the most delicious food ever. I have brought two full blooded italian friends here, and they say the pasta reminds them of their grandmothers'. The staff is nice and after awhile, they start to remember your quirks (cheese on the side!). 

The only downside is that when they're crowded, which is often on Friday nights, it can take like 20 or 30 minutes to get your food. That's nothing compared to most sf wait times, of course, but it can feel like an eternity if you're starving.
author: Natasha B.

description: I have never had a bad meal here. Lasagna melts in your mouth and meatballs are wonderful!
author: Gretchen L.

description: Food here was simple, fun and fantastic! We tried the Cassone, Gnocci roll, and Panna Cotta. I didn't really care for the Cassone as it was bland and kinda tasteless, and the creamy dip was awful. But Gnocci roll was uber good and Panna Cotta just melted my heart, seriously!
author: Rocking V.

description: Pretty decent simple italian food with good flavor and decently done. This would be a good take-out place for weekdays or lazy weekends. I thought the gnocchi was solid, and the creamy tomato sauce was probably my favorite.
author: Lindsay H.

description: Cute Italian waiters, cute setting and meat ravioli was pretty tasty. Just wish they would sell some garlic bread to go with the pasta.
author: Stephanie R.

description: This is hands down the best lasagna I've ever eaten. The people are from Italy and speak Italian to each other with eccentric spirit. The vibe is amazing and I'm definitely going back to this awesome food haven.
author: Rachel B.

description: Simply amazing. I love places like this. I had the Tagliettele Bolognese. They serve little reasonable sized pasta dishes and it was so good. Would eat here every day if I lived in the area.
author: greg s.

description: I live in North Beach and the Italian Homemade is one of my favorite neighborhood spots. The owners are so lovely and moved here from Italy last year to share their beautiful food with us. The piadinis are out of this world amazing- I could literally eat one every day if I could! The fresh pasta is also fantastic and you can even purchase your own pasta and sauce to make at home! This place is as authentic and fresh and they come. Simply the best.
author: Lauren D.

description: Little place with great food. The lasagna is a must! We went around 2pm on Saturday and the line was minimal.
author: Michelle Z.

description:
Really enjoyed this place, fast casual Italian.
Great prices for the quality, and nice people
author: Katie F.

description: Meh. Not impressed. Overpriced, bland food. No table service. Stools and small tables are very uncomfortable. Loud, obnoxious Italian punk rock blasting. A big dog in the restaurant. The digital cash register suggested a minimum 15 percent tip and there was no obvious option to select "none."
author: P S.

description:
What an incredible lunch spot! We were visiting from out of town and stumbled upon this gem. We had the vegetable lasagna and tortolenni and meat sauce. WOW!

Recommend them to everyone...

2 thumbs way up and they were super nice. Hidden treasure.
author: Jonathan M.

description: I loved it. Absoutly delicious!!!!! I was blown away. What a find! Can't wait to go back!
author: Kerstin C.

description: We are in LOVE with this little place! So unpretenious, so un-touristy. GREAT service...the adorable, friendly Italian girl at the counter, made us feel like we were in her family's small kitchen in Italy. My hubby devoured the meatballs, and the ravioli I ate was dripping with butter and herbs. Pane cotta for desert was warm and super fresh. This is the BEST Italian place we've eaten at the the Bay Area, since we visited Italy.
author: Michele K.

description: AWESOME!  Love these guys and everything I have had on the menu knocks it out of the park!
author: Brian T.

description: We were there again a few days ago (twice in a matter of a couple of days).  The food was not the same this time around.  I have to say we did notice a change in the food.  Don't know if there was a change in the recipe, personnel, quality of the ingredients, but it did not taste as good as when we were there a few months ago.  The meatballs were hard, not moist as they should be. The sauce on the pasta was scarce on both visits (this week) considering you pay extra for the sauce.  The quantity was not consistent, the number of ravioli was noticeably different.  We will return on our next visit to SF, but won't be having it more than once :(  .
author: Donatella P.

description: The pasta is to die for !  Will definitely return very quiet friendly staff !  Everything inside is homemade as name states if you blink you will miss it line wasn't bad when we went most importantly the smell of Italian food was obvious and was just as good as the food !   I don't live in San Fran just travel there a few times a year for my company this time was to purchase a vehicle but every time I try to stop in here for a bite !
author: Allen F.

description: Awesome pasta. Awesome sandwiches.  Fantastic in fact.  Owners are the best.  So friendly.  Love everything about this place.  Prices are good too.  Food is better....FML I need some now!
author: Jordan S.

description: Amazing fresh pasta. The pasticciata sauce is the BEST - meat sauce with white cream. Ravioli, tortellini, lasagna, oh my. There are so many choices. You can buy it warm to eat there or to go. Or you can buy it frozen to make it yourself at home.
author: Tina W.

description: I can't overemphasized how awesome the employees are at this location! They make the food even better because of the service. And yes, the food is amazing.
author: Lauren R.

description: The lasagna was the finger licking and the meat balls where huge and yummy. All home made italiano And would love to come back again.
author: Anderson C.

description: Small out of the way eatery that has a focused menu of made from scratch pasta items. We had the fettuccini with marinara and bolognese sauces. The pasta was fresh and the sauces were excellent. For desert the tiramisu was outstanding. This place has a very solid product and could easily take it to the next level if they wanted to have a full service place. Stop in for some awesome italian homestyle food. Cant go wrong here.
author: Ed V.

description: Gnocchi roll was TO DIE FOR! I got it with the bolgnese sauce and it was absolutely heavenly. The staff were very helpful in suggesting dishes. My friend got ravioli (I think), and we got meatballs on the side too. EVERYTHING was so so so so good. Believe the hype, wait in line if you have to. You will not regret it.
author: Miranda Z.

description:
Simple pasta dishes but the taste is great
Problem is there isn't much of a variety. No pizza!!!
author: Anas A.

description: They have no idea how they are so baffled by the modern telephone. Food is decent, but good luck calling in a to-go order.
author: Lloyed C.

description: Had lunch here. Food is fantastic! Seating is not so good, but it is worth it. Best pasta in the city.
author: Scott C.

description: Favorite new lunch place in SF!! A+ on food, service, prices and atmosphere! Authentic, delicious Italian food!!
author: Emily R.

description: Wow. I'm from ny. I know good Italian. This was special. Really delicious.
author: Dan P.

description: Best italian I've ever had in my entire life.
author: Daniel H.

description:
I want to love this place, but the price point is too much for me. 

I ordered their daily special of Tagliatelle Gorgonzola Arugula Speck pasta. The dish was $14.00 but after tax and tip, it was nearly $18.00. As good as the tagliatelle was, it's hard to justify spending that much on so little food. 

The good: fresh, delicious pasta.

The bad: small portion for the price.
author: s d.

description: Outstanding!! The most authentic experience I've had in the US. Simple and sensational!
author: Brittany M.

description: Really good food! I have had everything from the pasta menu and each of it is unbelievably amazing!! The pasta and the sauces are just too good!! It's like slow dancing in my mouth!!
author: Sindhu R.

description: Love the food and staff at this neighborhood spot! It's a must go for locals and people visiting for great service and authentic food!
author: Ali G.

description: My boyfriend has a rule that we are not allowed to eat at any place that does not have a score of 4 or above. This place does not disappoint! This place is kind of like a homey hole-in-the-wall. They even have a fridge/freezer in which you can buy fresh pasta and sauces. You can even see the freshness of the pasta in the back room where it is being rolled out. It is drool worthy! We ordered the gnocchi with sage butter sauce and also papardelle with  meat sauce. Both were divine! You can definitely taste the freshness of all the ingredients. I saw multiple people order the lasagna. The portions were huge! Good thing I don't live in the area...I would be there for every meal!
author: Jenny B.

description: Best authentic Italian food!  I love this place, you know it's good if most of the staff only speaks Italian!  And most of the customers only speak Italian!  The raviolis are the star, best in the city!
author: Peter M.

description: I had a great panini here and looking forward to trying the pasta next! This authentic, fresh Italian spot is similar to that of a deli, but more homey. It offers quick bites to take away, but has a decent amount of seating for those who have a bit more time. I've heard the lasagne is to die for. Check it out!
author: sarah m.

description: You life fresh pasta?!!!  Like...it still has lose flour all over it???!!!  Yeah. Me too. His place is amazing!  They have several options of fresh pasta and their sauces and combinations are perfect!  Fast service!  Love this place!
author: Daniel G.

description: Want to go to Italy but don't have the cash?  Go to this place for a meal as authentic meal as if you were sitting in Italy that very moment.  The food and service here is outstanding.  Some of the reviews said "they seem to be Italian".  Well that's what you get when the owners/chefs are from the Emilia Romagna area of italy.  Haven't heard of it you say? Well, have you heard of Ferrari, Lamborghini, Ducati and Bologna?  Now you know what you're in for.  The pastas are all homemade and are some of the best you will ever eat.  The lasagna is outstanding. The Ravioli's are soft, full of flavor and are definitely addictive.  I have been here around 5 times and never disappointed.  The place is casual but very nice.  The owners did most of the decorating themselves including building the dinning tables out of reclaimed wood.  A lot of love and care went into this place and you can see it.  Treat yourself.  Eat there and you'll want to return daily.  Salute!
author: Michael B.

description: The Gnocchi was delicious. You can choose what sauce you want on your pasta. Today I had Bolognese. I think next time I'll have the pesto. So much to try. I'm glad I work in the area so I have the opportunity to try the different selections. When you are in the North Beach area of San Francisco be sure to stop and eat here.
author: Kevin Q.

description: Absolutely delicious! This place is a must if you enjoy tasty, fresh pasta. The food is delicious and reasonably priced. The line out the door tells you that this place is worth going to! We will definitely be returning!
author: Stephanie M.

description: Amazing. I felt like I was back in Italy. Service and quality of food was excellent. Go here. Eat everything. You won't regret a single bite.
author: Lindsey P.

description: Delicious pasta. I can really see this place blowing up with business soon. I had the tagliatelle pasta with the bolognese meat sauce with meatballs. The meatballs were so tasty and tender, and went perfectly with the pasta, which comes out perfectly al dente. Love the set up of the restaurant! Service was friendly, sort of a wait for the food, but everyone knows delicious food comes with a price to pay. Will definitely be coming back soon to try the meat ravioli and lasagna. Lahvvvvv this place!
author: Elizabeth K.

description: This food was great and fast.  They don't have a lot of sitting for larger groups.  Defiantly a 2 or 4 person place.  They have pasta you can buy that the restaurant made.
author: Wanda M.

description: solid place for a quick pasta bite, where the pasta is fresh but the sauce is so-so. both the pesto and marinara were obviously fresh but very simply and blandly seasoned.  the butter sage sauce was delicious on the other hand, but wouldn't be my go to choice given its richness. our group all tried the gnocchi, which was perfect - as was the delicious mozzarella salad.  a great find! i am looking forward to picking up some fresh pasta next time i'm planning for a no holds barred pasta meal!
author: Archana P.

description: Great first meal at this place.  The ravioli and meatball combination worked.  Coming back again. Come early as it fills up quickly.
author: Ed John ..

description: Delicious, fresh pasta with warm service. This is my go-to for a quick, healthy meal in North Beach!
author: Deepak R.

description: Top top rate place. Italian tourists were there too. The fresh pasta was perfect.  The sandwiches also excellent.
author: Jason R.

description: My husband and I visited here on vacation. We looked at other reviews and thought we would give this place a shot. It was excellent! Quaint, cute, and friendly. A legitimate Italian meal for a reasonable price. I definitely recommend this place.
author: Kristen M.

description: By far the best Italian food I've ever had, and I'm quite the pasta connoisseur!! if I could give more than 5 stars I would!
author: Kalynn J.

description: Really good, simple Italian food. I got the ravioli with white sauce. Could have used some added freshness (a garnish, a vegetable, something) to cut some of the heaviness of the dish, but really no complaints here. Chefs were friendly. Wish I could have tried some other dishes.
author: Seth M.

description: I thought this was just another Italian restaurant in in North Beach, but I was wrong.  This little place has amazing to go Italian, so I can take it back to my house and pretend i made it myself!  They also have a fabulous lunch and gnocchi roll. Don't forget to order the bishop hats!
author: Natalee T.

description: In town for the Bay to Breakers -- best preface carb load in the city! This unassuming deli/kitchen is legit- worth every accolade here. The girls cooking speak Italian to each other & serve up past afresh, hot and quick! Absolutely hitting this again my next trip to SF.
author: Judy R.

description: Unbelievable!!! It's like anyone ever wishes for a home cooked meal while traveling!!!
author: Scott F.

description: Amazing! Their food is great, don't miss the pesto, the staff looks like they enjoy their jobs.... Basically a can't miss
author: Kristin D.

description: Wonderful food. Had the stuffed gnocchi and my husband had the meat ravioli. Soooo good. Small inside with limited seating. Grab a table then go get your menu from the counter. No wine, but great food
author: Karla B.

description: Small, very casual, quick Italian place. Fresh pasta made everyday. The bolognese sauce is the best I've ever had. Choose your pasta, choose your sauce, they cook it up in front of you. Very friendly fun staff. We loved it!
author: Angela F.

description: We had parpadelle with meatballs, gnocchi with pesto, and a side of grilled bread. Wish more noodles came with the meatballs. The ratio of meat to carbs was a little too high. Also, wish there was more tomato sauce. The gnocchi tasted like soft pillows and the bread (when it finally arrived 15 min after everything else), which was more like pita than bread, was good for sopping up pesto.
author: Monty B.

description: first off customer service was blah the food is 3 stars had the lasagna not bad could use a little sauce
author: Jorm K.

description: Great service, great food!  Loved how it was a no frills kinda place when you want a nice quick dish of pasta.  I'm definitely coming back here.
author: Leen B.

description: This is some of the best Italian food that I have eaten!  Small little spot with some seating inside, very rustic. Went there for dinner and ordered the lasagna and ravioli with meat sauce and they were delicious!!  The staff was very friendly and was able to help us out with our choices.  The serving sizes are good and priced reasonably for the quality that you get. We ended dinner with a tiramisu that was very good, had a lot of whipped cream, but was good nonetheless. I would definitely recommend coming here for some great quality Italian...I know I'm going back!
author: Alex S.

description: This is one of the best spots to have authentic Italian food in the city... I ordered the meatballs, They come with flat bread slices, It was about 11$. The amount was extremely generous, 6 huge meatballs with sauce and cheese plus the flat bread, The Flavor is even more surprising It was so Good... I will be coming back and back again for sure. I like North Beach more now after I visited this place.
author: Maher S.

description: Cool little shop with a couple spots to sit and enjoy some really good pasta. Had the fettuccine w/ pesto sauce and it was simple & amazing!
author: Connie A.

description: Great little find. Authentic Italian sandwiches. (Don't ask for mayo!) We will definitely be back.
author: Jennifer M.

description: Best Italian food everrrrr! ;) homemade Italian sauce , great service ! I'll be back at least once a month ! :) :)
author: Brittany V.

description: Small authentic great Italian food restaurant worth waiting for and trying. It was packed, so plan accordingly. Great people and service too.
author: Mark P.

description: We went here expecting amazing food and we were disappointed. It is basically a fast food Italian cafe. The spinach ravioli was very good but the lasagna was a tasteless pile of mush.
