The management was very efficient and nice but the place felt dirty. Maybe they just didn't have time to clean since there was a crowd and the restaurant is very small with few tables. In fact, the only sit down tables were outside on the sidewalk. The inside has a couple of tall tables with stools. Probably won't return.
author: RvChick R.

description: So far, one of the best places for pasta I've come across. Fresh homemade pasta and they even have squid ink pasta. There's limited seating and no alcohol but it's well worth the visit.
author: Brian J.

description: I get their delivery via the Eats24 app.  The 8/7/16 review from Jennifer is pretty accurate - their delivery pastas don't have a lot of sauce, so I'm pretty jealous of these pictures of dishes people had at the restaurant!  The pasta is really soft, so if you like al dente you may not like it.  Also, they don't include parmigiano cheese or red peppers with deliveries,  so don't be disappointed if you don't get any.  I do need to say this - the tiramisu is outstanding!  It's the highlight of the meal!  All in all, it's not bad and their prices are pretty great.
author: Dee D.

description: Amazing Italian sausage calzone-like sando called a Cassone. Super friendly staff. It might take a week to work this one off. Yum.
author: Peter S.

description: The spicy puttanesca with fettuccine was delicious,  so fresh and made to order.. very impressed!! Wonderful cooks amd staff..
author: Brett F.

description:
Fresh and flavorful food!

I had the gnocci - the best ever. Really.... They have a great selection of sauces too, you just need to go there and check them out. 

All of our picky eaters were happy, the dining is casual but the staff are very friendly. I plan to come back next time we visit SF.
author: Tricia N.

description: Very unassuming hole in the wall. But came anyway because of other yelpers reviews. Yum!! Had the meat ravioli with marinara! I would come back, probably over and over again.
author: C C.

description: The best decision that I've made that day!! I'm originally from Europe and often in Italy. Loving their food. Honestly, it tastes like in bella Italia. You have to experience it!!!
author: Matthias R.

description: Fantastic spot in North Beach.   Wanted to eat in but didn't want hotel food.   This was fantastic!   Had the pasta with meatballs.  So good!   Chef and staff were super friendly.     I will be coming back!
author: Mark M.

description: I was giving it a try, the Piadina Light flatbread sandwich with mortadella.  I couldn't believe it.  I was sure I was going to finish both off like it was nothing.  I could not get past the first sliced Nina sandwich.  The place is very small, everyone is cramped inside, you can see & hear everybody's conversation.  OMG, this is magnifico!
author: BanBan B.

description: Fantastic! Amazing bolognese sauce! We were heading home after a day on the bikes and had a craving for some good pasta so decided to check yelp. Based on the great Yelp reviews and the obvious tiny family vibe of the place we decided to sit down for dinner. We tried the gnocchi and the tagliatelle with bolognese sauce and meatballs...both dishes were just outstanding. Apparently you can buy the freshly made pasta directly and take it home as well. The atmosphere is very casual and there is not a ton of seating. They have a couple small tables outside and maybe 5-6 inside as well as a small bar in the window. Unfortunately they do not serve any beer or wine. If your in the mood for a casual atmosphere and fantastic fresh pasta and wonderful sauces look no further.
author: Shayne H.

description:
Came here on a Saturday night around 7:30 pm and found out they close at 8:00pm!
$50 for three plates of pasta and a simple salad. My husband got the ink pasta with seafood sauce. Definitely can't see or taste any seafood. A friend's pasta serving was very small and nothing special. My meatball pasta was fine. The whole experience was pretty disappointing.
Maybe at the end of the day is not the time to come.
author: Mary Y.

description:
I tried this place for the first time for a take-out dinner with two of my friends yesterday. One of them lives in the area and had eaten here several times before, so we took up his recommendation for a home style meal with some good comfort food. This place definitely didn't disappoint - it looks very unassuming from the outside, but the quality and taste of the food is up to par, very authentic, and you can tell that they put a lot of time and care into everything made there. The interior and set-up reminds me of something you would actually find in Europe - very homey, casual, and cozy. This is the type of place where you can grab a quick bite and eat at the small round tables they have set up inside with a small group of friends, or order there and take it to-go, like we did. They also have freshly made, frozen pasta that you can buy and make at home too.

I got the gnocchi roll, which was unique and like nothing I'd ever had or heard of before. It was denser than my friend's gnocchi (which was literally like eating a pillow - amazing!) and it was rolled in a pin wheel shape, stuffed with spinach and ricotta, and then cooked in marinara sauce. One of my friends got the gnocchi with pesto, and the other got the pappardelle special, which was essentially in a carbonara sauce. Everything was delicious, and was not overly heavy or salty, which is one of my biggest pet peeves with food in general. I'd much rather have something bland than overly salty any day. Italian food also usually leaves me feeling gross after, no matter how good it is, but I didn't get this with their food which was an unexpected plus. The service there is also prompt and friendly, and the cooks and workers seem to have a family-like feel. If you've never tried this place, I would definitely recommend trying it out!
author: Michelle K.

description: Been looking for real piadina in the states for years. This is the first place that delivered. If you're looking for delicious AUTHENTIC Italian homemade favorites, definitely visit this place.
author: Justin E.

description: Since Italian food is my favorite kind of food, specifically ravioli and tortellini, I consider myself somewhat of a connoisseur of pasta. This is LITERALLY the BEST ravioli I have ever eaten. Every birthday of my 32 year of life, every anniversary of my 10 years of marriage, and countless date nights have been spent at fancy Italian restaurants. They all pale in comparison to this tiny hole in the wall deli/kitchen and the amazingly fresh and authentic food. I had the vegetable ravioli with the meat and cream sauce, the mozzarella salad and the fresh bread- just amazing! These guys are the real deal down to the Italian they were speaking to each other and the music they were humming along with!
author: Austin L.

description: Living near North Beach, I never go to any of the Italian restaurants there because they are touristy and the food is crap.  Then I read the Yelp reviews on this little gem that recently opened, OK... let's go.  They were right!  The bolognese sauce is amazing and the best I've had here in the States.  I had it with the gnocchi, which is good but not as fluffy as I've had at some other places.  But the sauce is perfection and am eager to go back and sample their other goodies.
author: Nancy H.

description: The food was excellent. My friend and I split the Bufala mozzarella salad which was really tasty. The tomatoes were particularly juicy and flavorful.  I'm really glad we split it due to the large portion size. I also ordered the papardelle with meatball sauce which exceeded my expectations. The pasta was extremely fresh and the sauce was robust with flavor. Make sure you time your visit right and avoid the lunch rush or you will be searching for a place to sit! I will definitely be back!
author: Mary B.

description:
I hate this place. It has ruined Italian food for me by raising the bar so high I simply shake my head when I walk by an Olive Garden. The food is nothing short of perfection. I have been back a dozen time in three months and I don't even live in SF. (Yes I drove there specifically to pickup take out!) The people who run the place are fun and personable. You want them to succeed. Hell we NEED them to succeed. 

Get your culo in there before it goes to their heads. 

Recommendations:
Casoni - the sausage potato was excellent. Top it with marinara. (I'm drooling as I type.)
Gnocci - little pillows of love - I go pesto but that me. Killer.
Lasagne - brought two home - gone is 10 minutes - 'nuff said.
Fettucinni with pesto. My mother made this for me when I was five. I had forgotten the flavor/texture. Yes I've had it since but not like this. Its so "spot on" it triggered memories and a mid-life crisis. I immediately started pricing Alfa Romeo and Fiat convertibles. 

Mangia!
author: Dennis F.

description:
For the price I really wish it was a bigger portion size, but nonetheless, I will continue to eat here. 

The gnocchi with bolognese is the BEST! I can never get enough :) Seriously, I don't think it's quite easy to find gnocchi that has the texture and taste that this place presents. All the noodles here are homemade, and that is definitely a reason that I keep finding myself here. 
I've also had two different types of cassoni. One with sausage, and another with spinach. The sausage definitely tasted like a home made recipe, while the other one you could tell the spinach was extremely fresh! 

The guys here are super nice, and hey, they're italian. 

Overall, I highly recommend.
author: T K.

description: Fantastic fresh pasta, with delicious sauces! What more could you ask for? Well, if you said "how about burrata?" Then you're in luck! Because they have that too, and it's amazing. The service is also very nice and friendly! You do eat off of paper plates, but at least you get metal utensils. I'll definitely eat here again!
author: Ryan M.

description: So amazing!!! I'm a lover of gnocchi so I have had a lot and this place didn't even compare to anything else it was so delicious and so authentic tasting. My friend who has been to Italy agreed that this place is the place for Italian food. What made it better was everyone working there is so nice! 3 different people asked how we were doing through out our meal
author: Katie N.

description:
The homade ravioli are fantastic. 
Better than I can make at home. Not that that is a great standard:)

But this place is a welcome addition to the neighborhood. The food definitely can compete with local shops. 

I'm not abandoning tomassos or Mona Lisa, but for a quick lunch or Italian sandwich this is a great choice!
author: Mike D.

description: I had the tagliatelle with bolognese sauce. The pasta was nicely al dente, and the sauce was pretty good. Perhaps it's the price that I wasn't feeling (considering the portion), but I'll just assume that's the price of fresh pasta.
author: Maximillian M.

description: I'm baffled as to how this place got 4.5 stars on yelp. Having had amazing Italian food both in Italy and even here in the states, I couldn't be less impressed by what I ate here. This place is a-okay. Fine for grabbing a quick bite. Service is fast. The cooks/workers are friendly. The pasta though? Nothing but disappointing. The papardelle pasta itself tasted stale, but at least it was cooked al dente. The gnocchi, on the other hand, was mushy. Neither of us liked it, and my fiancee is not a picky eater. The bolognese was average - no flavors in the sauce grabbed my attention or made me want more. The meatballs were dry and dense. My fiancee lives around the area so we have been checking out the neighborhood spots, but this is one joint that I won't be frequenting.
author: Shirley H.

description: Parking was crazy on Saturday night but we managed to get a spot in the neighborhood. We came in and found a bunch of Italian travelers who tracked down their home country's food here. I had the stuffed gnocchi and the piña piadina which was amazing! Service was killer.
author: Dove N.

description: I had a flavorful mushroom ravioli with a pork cream sauce. It was a highlight of my edible journey through SF.
author: Jake G.

description: Oh my goodness!! This place has the BEST lasagna we have ever had!! & the mozzarella salad was also delicious! Wish they had one of these restaurants in Houston, TX!! The service was also great! If we could give them a ten star rating we would!!
author: Amy P.

description: Definitely the best Italian food in North Beach and possibly in the city.  Authentic and homemade.  A must try if you like Italian!!
author: Alexis D.

description: This is a great little moms and pops Italian restaurant  they have some really good pasta they have good prices and also friendly staff
author: Johnson Y.

description: I really like this place. Every time I am in the city and heading home, I make sure to stop and pick up takeout. Their lasagna is really good, and I love their meatballs w/ marinara sauce. I would highly recommend this place if you enjoy authentic italian food. It looks to be locally own by a real italian family.
author: Chris G.

description: Friendly people and good food. A little too al dente for my liking but good flavor and right-size portions.
author: jim l.

description: Well I have to say WOW. I went there not knowing what to expect.  It is absolutely authentic from the people that wait on you to the food. I had the gnocchi roll with meatballs and a Flatbread sandwich. The gnocchi roll with spinach was great with the homemade sauce and the meatballs were the perfect mix of spices, pork, and beef. I took the food back to the hotel were I enjoyed it oh so well. This place is for real, and I will be back.
author: Jim P.

description: Fantastic tasteful food in a diner setting. Friendly and positive staff. We had the lasagna and the tortellini pasta, both cooked to perfection. Inexpensive authentic Italian food.
author: San F.

description: I came here on a Tuesday for lunch. They were out of gnocchi, pesto and tiramisu, but how can you be mad at them when their food is so authentic Italian?! Best Italian food I've had in a US city. Will be back.
author: Kathrin S.

description: Omg! The food is the best in Northbeach. Haven't had down home cooking like this since the Ravioli Company was around. One thing is the music is a bit too loud. This place is a tiny hole in a wall, not some gaudy Steps of Rome. Lower the volume and bring that home feeling to this place.
author: Henry W.

description: The best pasta you will ever eat. Go with ravioli or tortellini and pesto, marinara, or bolognese.
author: H K.

description: Just ate at this amazing place! So authentic and delicious! The gnocchi were little pillows of heaven! The people working are so sweet and nice and you really feel like you are in Italy. I want to try everything on the menu!
author: Melissa M.

description: Are you people nuts???? Average at best!!!  Nothing special. Been wanting to try it for sometime because they make their own pasta. Well it doesnt taste all that fresh to me. I had the narrow noodles, sorry cant spell or pronounce it, with meat sauce. Look it was just ok. For $11 in my opinion way over priced for being served on paper plates. Much prefer Sodinis or Ideale.
author: fred h.

description: Sorry ragazzi, not that impressed.  Pasta gets cold REALLY fast on paper plates even with a plastic plate underneath, there is no table service, no beer/wine and no BYOB.  Seemed really overpriced for the size of the portion, and yeah it was ok, tasty enough but five stars on Yelp for this, I think pastas are at least $12?  I used to live in Italy speak fluent Italian etc and have lots of family there, eaten my way up and down the peninsula but I don't really get it with IHC......my pal and I went to Ideale two nights later and had a FAR better meal, for my money I'd rather be comfortable cozy warm at an actual table than sitting in the drafty storefront of IHC...I'll try the piadina.
author: Michael G.

description: This is some of the best Italian food I've ever had. We were visiting from Denver and just by chance walked by.  The people who run this shop are SO sweet and helpful.  I had the tortellini......awesome.  My son had the meatball Cassone...LOVE!!  We came back two days later before we headed back home.
author: Harmony N.

description: Definitely a wonderful find in the neighborhood.  Never had real gnocchi until I had them at this place.  It virtually dissolves in your mouth.
author: H M.

description: Found this place on YELP and loved it.  Kids loved the ravioli and they made plain pasta for the boy.  The gnocchi roll was amazing if you like gnocchi.
author: Joe R.

description: Everything here is ridiculously delicious. Only a few tables so you may have to do takeout, but Washington park is only one block away. A must try for everyone.
author: Eric F.

description: I didn't even consider giving this place a rating of less than 5 stars. I have happily paid twice as much for Italian food that was half as good. Everything is made by hand in the "Pasta Lab". The staff were all extremely Friendly. The prices were all around 10 dollars. The white sauce was amazing. The tortellini were great as were the ravioli both meat and spinach ricotta, the meatballs were heavenly, and the gnocchi rolls were almost mind altering. Portion sizes were perfect it didn't look like much, but I left feeling full and energetic. The selection of drinks left something to be desired, and I didn't spot the fresh breads until after I had finished my meal. There is a freezer full of freshly frozen everything so if you want to impress someone at home this is the place to start. I'm excited to try this place again, again, and again.
author: Zachary B.

description: The real deal! Came here on a week night and had no problem getting one of the bar tables. Had a simple salad, ravioli with meatballs, the flat bread and a drink (no booze here or no BYOB). The young Italian staff were a lot of fun, playing ital hip hop and let my friend and I use are broken Italian. Everything was excellent and inexpensive. I hope they get a liquor license because a glass of Chianti would of hit the spot.
author: Jeff D.

description:
The first time I went there was two month ago. I immediately noticed that the owner and the other guys working there are friendly and nice! I had lunch there with my gf. I had a 'cassone' with tomato and mozzarella and she had ravioli. They were amazing... and I'm italian, so I am usually pretty picky about italian food! After that time I went there many times trying many of their deli. 

Another good thing is that you can get food and sauces to take away. You can order 1 pound of pesto sauce (about $11) and have pasta at home with 4 friends. 
I like that place so much that I asked my company to order there for Friday tech talk. The food arrived in the office still hot and everybody loved it.
author: Giuseppe B.

description: I loved it. Authentic. The smells were fabulous. Portions just right. Tasted very good.  And the lady at the cash register with her lovely Italian accent really made the place. I liked all the different pastas and sauces. Italian sodas. Prices were right for everything you get. I'm definitely coming back.
author: sandra b.

description: It's very small and not much room to sit and eat but it had some of the best meatballs I have ever tasted.  I would love to go back and try more!
author: Tricia B.

description:
This place is amazing!!! They make fresh pasta and piadinas (like the Italian version of a tortilla) every day. It's super casual, and they just focus on really high quality food. 
My husband is from Italy and he gives his place his seal of approval. 
We had meat ravioli and tagliatelle impasticciate (with bolognese sauce and beschamel) and it was soooo good. 
Am definitely going back to try the piadinas.
(You can also buy the pasta and sauce to cook at home.)
Love it!
author: Ka F.

description: I've been coming to this place since they first opened when you would take the pasta home to cook yourself. Since then they've changed that part and cook pasta for you on the spot. This place has a perfect 5 stars for a reason, the food is excellent and the staff is really nice. It really is just a very special neighborhood treasure. It's the kind of place that makes you happy to support local business. The lasagna is amazing, the pesto is amazing and the sandwiches are amazing! I haven't tried anything bad yet. It can be a little pricey if you're not expecting it, but it's worth it.
author: Brandon L.

description: Premise: I am Italian born and raised, not just a self proclaimed one (don't trust people like " I am Italian because my grand grand grand father uncle was Italian"). I love this place. It has an authentic Italian regional menu that is simply amazing. Everything is cooked following the holy commandments of Italian tradition ( get the hell out of this place if you looking for fake Italian stuff like fettuccine Alfredo or other crappy non Italian dishes). The gnocco ripieno is amazing as well as the fresh pappardelle. They also have a good choice of Italian food to buy and cook at home. This is definitely my new safe spot for every week end brunch!
author: Alessio M.

description: Exquisite! that was my husband 's answer when someone asked him how was his papardelle with bolognese sauce.   If you are in San Francisco and want some good pastas then come here.
author: M N.

description: This place is fabulous and just what the neighborhood needed! Stopped in tonight for some takeout and was pleasantly surprised to see it was popping. My spaghetti and meatballs are the best. You can taste the difference with fresh pasta. I got extra meatballs so I may have to go back and get some more pasta. I keep forgetting about this place as it's not on a street I walk down a lot but I need to keep it on my short list. Great prices, great food and great vibe. They have a second location too in the marina, I will definitely give it a try.
author: Traci H.

description:
I was led here by my nose. It smells like italy with bolognese stewing on the stove. mmm.

Unfortunately the spinach ricotta ravioli in bolognese was a touch under cooked and slightly crunchy. I tend to be a person who like al dente too. 

The sauce was fragrant and perfectly seasoned. 

They don't have prices listed around, which was a little disconcerting while ordering. I ended up paying ~$13 pre tip for a small plate of ravioli. 

It's about $13-16 a lb for fresh pasta to take home.

The service was lovely. I adored the genuine warmth from the people in the store. It made me feel like I was part of their italian family. They felt the most authentic Italians in north beach.
author: Diana L.

description: small little place with great homemade pasta! I had a ravioli stuffed with pumpkin, pecorino and ricota which was amazing. my husband had a ravioli stuffed with spinach and ricota which was also delicious! the service is great, the owners were so friendly and ready to help and give insights to which sauce would best fit the pasta. it is a small place, but they have a couple of tables outside.
author: Ursula M.

description: This restaurant is great! I grew up eating recipes that have been passed down for four generations and this definitely blew my expectations away! The lasagna and the papardelle with the beefy and pork sauce were both great! If you want a good Italian restaurant this is definitely worth trying!
author: Felipe H.

description: We went to this restaurant again.  Great pasta & food.  The service is amazing.  The staff are very helpful & really want to make sure that you are enjoying your experience. True Italian food and you can tell it is owned by an Italian family.  Wish I could take this restaurant home with me!
author: Jacki C.

description: My son summed it up well -- They deserve 100 stars!!!!  Total hole in the wall - but simply the best pasta we've ever had.   Would eat here every meal if I wouldn't become morbidly obese!!!!!
author: Mike B.

description: Incredible cassone, meatballs and gnocchi. I am from Italy and this place makes me not miss home anymore.
author: S. V.

description: Excellent Italian food!! Having traveled extensively in italy and being Sicilian myself, I can tell you that you will not find better Italian food in San Francisco!! Really nice owners and staff that provide excellent service! This place is a must if you really  want the true taste of Italy! People who give this place 5 stars, congrats for having a fine palate and knowing what great Italian food should taste like. Bravo!!
author: Amanda O.

description: Stumble upon this place by accident this past December walking around San Francisco. Kind of a fast food, small, family business kind of place. They were all speaking Italian. The prices were way cheaper than any italian restaurant and the quality of the food was incredible. Had the gnocci roll and lasagna, both were to die for.
author: Lili M.

description: The food was amazing!!! We both had the lasagna and it was awesome. The restaurant is small but that's part of the charm to this find! There were multiple customers speaking Italian to the restaurant employees...so it seems to be where the Italians go! I definitely recommend this place. Italian food, Italian music, Italian owners, great experience!
author: Kelsey W.

description: I had their food delivered for lunch.  I ordered the tortellini with meatballs.  It was pretty bad.  Definitely will not be doing that again!
author: jonathon d.

description: Whoa!! Best lunch spot in North Beach. The homemade pasta is fresh with massive amounts of texture.
author: Josh S.

description: This is a small busy place where for sure I'd thought I'd  found Italian food heaven. I first ordered the Fettuccine  with white sauce. It was mediocre...not great but not bad. I would have liked some bread on the side or the option to add a piece of chicken to spice up the pasta. The second plate I tried was the spinach and ricotta ravioli. This was pretty good with plenty of cheese. My husband ordered the "calzone" with ricotta and marinara sauce filling. He really liked it. Overall I'm 50/50 for this place. It appears authentic enough; heck, even the cooks appear to be Italian.
author: Arturo T.

description: Extremely delicious pasta dishes.  Very friendly staff, real fresh pasta, and eating while enjoying the chefs cooking is a true experience.
author: Ck S.

description: Great quality and flavor in an informal place. I have liked everything I've tried, and my favorite has been the meat ravioli
author: Mili S.

description: Very good homemade pasta, although a bit too saturated in sauce for my taste.  Limited seating, but it's pretty fast.  Friendly staff and nice decor, a solid 4 star place at a very good price.
author: Vanessa N.

description: This place makes me want to move to San Francisco, just to eat here. Seriously some of the best Italian food I've ever had. Just go.
author: Laura L.

description: Amazing homemade pasta!  We came in from Phoenix and saw the reviews on yelp and let me tell you they are right!!  This place is real deal homemade Italian food!
author: Kathleen C.

description: Really really really good. Homemade doesn't even begin to describe how delicious the food is here. It's not fancy it's authentic. Food comes out in like 5 minutes. Wish they had wine.
author: Lindsay Q.

description: Tried Veg Ravioli with Mushroom sauce and Gnocchi roll. The hype had raised our expectations. Sadly, our experience turned out to be rather underwhelming. I have this irrational preference for food that's served hot. Ours was not. And if this Gnocchi was soft, I don't feel any appetite for the hard ones. Because the quantity turned out to be too much for two of us. This place is pricey, busy, and the food fails to make up.
author: Abhishek D.

description: Delicious! Homemade! On point! This place is pretty great!
author: Jeff B.

description: The food is amazing!!! I had the fettuccine with white sauce and marinara and meatballs on the side; my daughter had the lasagna... Most authentic and best tasting Italian food I have ever had in San Fransisco.... If you are in the mood for Italian food and you want something delicious and the best bang for your buck, go here! You will not be disappointed...
author: Brandy G.

description: Being Italian, I know this is authentic. The food (including the noodles) are 100% homemade, which you don't see often in Italian restaurants. I highly recommend the meatballs & flatbread.
author: Kim F.

description:
Wonderful vibe, as soon as you enter this place you feel in one of those small grocery stores in an Italian village. Bello!

Food is constantly fresh and I love the corner with specialty products imported from Italy, which can also become a nice gift idea for someone who appreciates authentic Italian goodies.

Very casual seating area but honestly I wouldn't want anything else in a place like this. 

Everything is perfect, including their staff!

Bravi ragazzi!
author: MT M.

description: Excellent Italian food and fun atmosphere and a quick in and out.  I had the lasagna and it was excellent.  Definitely recommend this restaurant.
author: Rich M.

description: I was walking by this new place the other day and tried a piadina sandwich with cheese, prosciutto and arugula: delicious and authentic. Especially the cheese tasted great, not to mention the prosciutto. My next try will be with their homemade pasta.
author: Marco P.

description: This is a great take-out or casual eat-in restaurant, however the number of tables is limited.  The lasagna, meatballs, and salad were all great.  The employees are friendly and helpful.  The prices are reasonable, especially compared to other Italian restaurants nearby.  Would definitely recommend.
author: Casey M.

description:
Found this place by chance, WOW ....FRESH AND TASTY..
7 of us ,all smiling as w finished the tiramisu 
Will definitely come back.
author: Jerry D.

description: Cozy place to share an Italian plate. My guess is their pasta is made fresh daily. Ordered linguine with Bolognese and parm on top. Sauce was rich with deep tomato flavor and meatiness only slow-cooking can bring out. Enjoyed the atmosphere and the Italian chatter between the chefs and staff!
author: Sergio R.

description: Absolutely the best meal I had in San Francisco! Great service, quick food and the most amazing pasta I've ever had. With I could go back for every meal.
author: Jon E.

description: Incredible lasagna! One of the best I've had in San Francisco. Highly recommend coming here for a taste of authentic Italian food. Kudos to the friendly and helpful staff too. I'll soon be coming back here....hungry for more!
author: Arthur M.

description: Cassoni was awesome!  Skip the touristy North Beach spots and find great food here. Very friendly and helpful staff too.
author: Aryal A.

description: Italian homemade pasta production, specialty grocery ! Eat in or take away ! Italian chef and management, simply awesome!!
author: Alice R.

description: The Cassone with bacon, potatoes, and cheese was just being made so got that. The dough they use is so good...you gotta try one. Ate on a bench table in the store and they have foreign music...probably Italian music.
author: Turtle W.

description: One of my favorite restaurants in the area. the quality of food is good & the service excellent. The value is pretty good too
author: Carmen A.

description: A nice small restaurant with homemade pastas. The tagliatelle noodles were fresh, but the sauce was not as flavorful as I wanted to give it a 5-star rating. Polite and friendly staff and a very affordable price.
author: Jordan W.

description:
I'm Italian and I can say that this place is very fantastic. All the pasta is homemade, we tried ravioli, tagliatelle and pappardelle, they were all incredibly perfect.
Major attraction as well as Golden Gate Bridge, Pier 39 and Treasure Island.
Funny place with authentic italian music.
The  staff is young, gracious and friendly.
author: Laurino S.

description: Finally stopped by this place to pick up some fresh homemade pasta and was not disappointed!  My very picky two year old LOVED the pasta bolognese.  We will definitely be back!
author: wingless g.

description: Amazing. Some of the best Italian food I've ever had. It was a bit difficult with out party of 9 people because it's small and not really designed for children. Definitely worth the seating issues for how good the food was. We will be going back.
author: Carrie V.

description: Great lunch restaurant. Large selection of fresh homemade pastas and sauces. The flat bread is fantastic. Really feels like it was plucked out of Italy.
author: Michael L.

description: My fiancé and I visited San Francisco and wanted to eat within the area of Washington Square. I found the Italian Homemade Company on yelp and we decided to walk in to see what it was about. We were welcomed with friendly smiles and thick Italian accents, so I knew we had to try their pasta. I had elk ravioli which was amazing and my fiancé loved her Bolognese pasta with meatballs. I think it is amazing that they make all of their pasta and you can see employees in the back working away. I will defiantly stop by again when I visit the city and will recommend them to all of my friends in Las Vegas if they head to San Francisco.
author: Joseph F.

description: The pasta was great.  Pasta was definitely fresh.  You can see them making it in the back. The tables and chairs were uncomfortable. There were 4 of us and couldn't get all our food on the table.  Not a place to sit down and enjoy a leisurely meal with friends.  The place is too crowded. Food was good and I would go back.  Might be more enjoyable if you get your food to go.
author: D W.

description: So good! Friendly service and amazing, fresh food! The gnocchi roll with meat sauce is where it's at.
author: Casey P.

description: We were walking the streets hangry after leaving an established food chain very unpleased. We came across this magnificent little Italian  joint. The staff was very friendly and very energetic. The food was out of this world. I ordered the lasagna and to my surprise it was the best lasagna I have ever ate. The portion sizes was ginormous barely finishing it. I wanted to stop my belly said stop but I couldn't resist. For desert we had the tiramasu,  just like the lasagna it was perfect. I highly recommend that you support this restaurant, for it was nothing short of perfect!!!!
author: Tyler D.

description: We were walking the streets looking for some good Italian in North Beach on Saturday night.  Unfortunately most all had nearly the same offerings, nothing overly exciting or too enticing that everyone would agree upon.  So, I opened up Yelp and found this place and am SO glad that we did.  The place was packed and happening.  There were a few specials this night... pumpkin ravioli, mushroom ravioli and one other.  We had the mushroom ravioli, lasagna, gnocchi with white sauce and meat tortellini with white sauce.  You can pick you pasta and choice of sauce with is really nice when you have picky eaters.  All were AWESOME!  Just might be one of the best lasagna I have ever had and the portion was gigantic.  So, so, so glad we tried this place.  Yes, the food is on paper plates but the prices are nearly half of what all of the other places offer and the food is GREAT.  Just wish they had a few other bread offerings, maybe a nice focaccia or something would be nice.  Nice job guys.
author: Joe T.

description: Great food and atmosphere. The seating is limited and it is not fast, but it is definitely worth it. Portion sizes are large, so sharing is encouraged.
author: Marshall F.

description: Great spot in the north beach area. It was the only place open and boy was it good. I ordered the flatbread since i wasn't that hungry but it was good. It was baked to perfection. Next time I am in the area I will order a full on meal.
author: Omar J.

description:
We were totally enthused when they opened. My wife, Mary Tolaro-Noyes, has written a book on Bologna, Italy, perhaps the only true guide to understanding the heart of this ancient city. So we know the food of Emilia-Romagna very well. We are so excited they have chosen our city to bring their wares. We have had a number of items from them and have promoted them to our neighbors, who seem to be enthusiastically supporting them. If you wish AUTHENTIC Italian pasta, this is your place in San Francisco!

We had Tagliatelle with ragu Bolognese tonight. My wife departs for Bologna tomorrow - and we felt at home already! The flour is imported - for the technical people out there do your research - it does make a difference!

You are missing one of the great opportuniies if yiou do NOT get pasta - and ragu - here.

The only word for what they produce is BRAVISIMII!!
author: Tom N.

description: Amazingly real italian food!!!Lasagne were a perfect combination of bolognese ragù and besciamella. Fettuccine were freshly made in the pasta lab part of the store. It would be six stars if possible! Eccellente, bravi, complimenti.
author: Nicola C.

description: Two meals, kid size for $28 bucks.  Food tasted OK my review is base on the hygiene of this place.  My son asks for some forks and since their fork bucket was empty. He got a bunch out and dropped some and put some of them in the container and give a couple to my son.  The lasagna that we got had a least five 1.5 to 2" strands of hair.  Wouldn't mind the price if they know at least to not give us forks that. Came from the ground.  Worst part is he looked to see if my son saw him picked it up from the floor. I was watching my son and him the whole time.  And well of course the hair.  That was pretty disgusting. When I cook at home and I find my own hair in our food I will get it from everybody.
author: Marie Erika E.

description: This place is BOMB. Nuff said. The service is terrific with fellas who have real italino accents. The ambiance is rustic and quaint. The lines can be ridic but the fresh, delicious, authentic food at a decent price is absolutely worth it! I'm a sucker for fresh noodles and I have to say this place totally delivered. I ordered a flat noodle with pesto and.. mama mia! belissimo!
author: Raj R.

description: We were visiting San Fransico and exited our tour bus in Little Italy.This place caught out eye with it's outdoor tables and a family of four enjoying lunch. Upon entering we realized this place was authentic, with freshly made pasta, and a small grocery section with everything your grandmother would need to make a Sunday dinner (if she were Italian). We tried the lasagna and meatballs, both were incredible, while being reasonably priced. The food, the small shop, the location, the soft music and italian-speakers in the background created a perfect experience. I highly recommend this place for anyone looking for authentic cuisine with fantastic service.
author: Phil M.

description: I posted early about the amount of salt in their Cassone which,  I honestly think and hope a cup of salt was accidentally knocked into this dish. Now, I want to add that my husband has so far been to the bathroom 3 times since we left the restaurant.  Maybe we came at a bad time; 30 minutes before closing because my review doesn't add up to what the other folks are saying. I'm really hoping, I'm wrong...
author: Theresa C.

description: Good food, reasonable price. Tasty sauce, the meatballs are large and hand made.
author: Don M.

description: We love to find new and unique places to eat in the city. We decided to try out The Italian Homemade Company for lunch on a Saturday afternoon. We took a walk through streets of little Italy to find this gem! It is not very spacious but perfect for us 3! We each ordered something different so we could all share and experience different items from the menu My son ordered the gnocchi with the white sauce, and a meat lasagna. My husband ordered the gnocchi roll with red sauce and I had a flat bread sandwich with prosciutto, cheese and arugula. They were all so very delicious. Nothing froze or artificial going on here! It was just like eating at our friends home (who are also Italian). I would highly recommend eating here if you are in the neighborhood! Can't wait to go back!
author: Karen J.

description: North beach is full of Italian food, so I wasn't too excited when another Italian place opened up but honestly, this place is better than 98% of the rest of north beach Italian. This little place blew my mind! I live a couple blocks away, so Italian Homemade Co. is very convenient (perhaps a little too convenient for my waistline...). The food is absolutely incredible and the staff is helpful and friendly. I'm especially fond of the gnocchi roll, and my boyfriend and friends have confirmed the lasagna is the best they have ever had. Keep in mind they close kind of early though (8 pm), so if you're a late eater like me, make a point to remember to go earlier.
author: Anna J.

description: The guys  behind the counter are super friendly and helpful. We just let them choose our food for us and it was amazing.
author: Walt P.

description: This is the most authentic italian lunch spot i have been to in the city! The food is absolutely delicious and the atmosphere is amazing. Everyone that worked there was extremely friendly and made me feel very welcome. I come from an italian family and this place felt as if it was in my grandmother's kitchen. I would highly recommend the Italian Homemade Company and now that i know it exists, I will be adding this to my top lunch spots! Can't wait to go back!
author: Little G.

description: I walked over from Lombard Street.  I was looking for a quick, yummy lunch and decided to try this place.  Created a signature piadina - grilled peppers, arugula and mozzarella. If this sounds good to you, then ask for the "Monica when you go there. :)  The owners are young Italians who are super friendly and excited about their fresh, delicious, authentic food.  I took mine to go and ate in the park nearby.  The shop is cute, but was too hot inside to stay and eat.
author: Monica R.

description: Lasagna was simply heavenly!!  Gnocchi was really good too.  The service was impeccable.  Thank you Yelpers!
author: S L.

description: Real Italian dishes no other place like this in San Francisco. Best lasagne and piadina. Great atmosphere and great service
author: Lorenzo L.

description: Hidden gem. 100% recommend. Lasagna was on par. Servings are huge. Price is cheap. You are messing out if you haven't gone.
author: Bryan W.

description: A great casual dinner. The restaurant is cute, but small. We had the Piata sandwich and the gnocchi roll, which is gnocchi dough rolled out and filled with spinach and ricotta. They were both delicious. For the good and a large San Peligrino, the tab was $30. The staff was very friendly and approachable.
author: Rachael W.

description: Unpretentious setting among a sea of North Beach tourist traps (who needs white table cloths?!?!). Fresh, tasty pasta at good price ($13 for fettuccine in bolognese w/two meatballs).
author: Value K.

description: The food here was sooooo amazing and very authentic...workers were very friendly and introduced the options to us.we live in San Jose and would drive all the way to SF again to eat here
author: Robin B.

description: Had a great dinner here this evening!  This is a small casual place with authentic Italian food. We had the tortellini with bolognese sauce, the ravioli with butter sage sauce, and fettuccini with pesto sauce as well as a house salad. All were very good and were generous portions. The women running the restaurant had it down and were very efficient in a small kitchen.
author: A D.

description: Oh gosh best Italian food I've ever eaten. Little hole in the wall but the service was so quick, the portions were so big, the price was not bad at all and the it has a cool family atmosphere. Parking can get crazy so you may drive around a bit for a spot but it is 100% worth it. Even getting it to go is a great option if you are a bit group as there are only a few tables in the place itself like much of little Italy has. But seriously.....best food
author: Dani K.

description: We spent the day in the city and hit long beach . We were so happy we found this place . We had the lasagna and pappardelle . It was so good . The pasta is very delicate and full of flavor . We left very happy . Next time we want to try the sandwiches . They looked yummy .
author: Melissa S.

description: Very good pastas.  There were 4 of us.  My fettuccine puttanesca was very good.  The 2 people who ordered Ravioli were less pleased, meat inside felt very dry.  The gnocchi and pesto looked amazing.  Casual atmosphere, limited and not very comfortable seating.  Good for a fast lunch.  If not for the ravioli's the food would have received 4 stars from our table
author: Dna h.

description: This is the best Italian food in San Francisco. I get take out from there at least twice a week. Great people are running this place. I recommend it highly!
author: Craig M.

description: Lasagna melts in your mouth...Amazing! It was exactly was I was craving and so much better than I could imagine! Fresh homemade pasta and friendly service.
author: E. C.

description: I am italian and I fortunately found this place. Great experience, nice guys, original italian food, fantastic restaurant. I'll be back there soon!!!
author: Emanuele S.

description: I went with the fettuccine with meatball sauce, like the texture of the noodle and the meatball is tasty and yet does feel heavy. Next time, I would also try the Bolognese sauce.
author: Ken T.

description: Nice folks, good price, wonderful location and good pasta and Bolognese sauce.  Quite nice to sit out and enjoy our North Beach vibe!
author: Kim S.

description: Their ego has outgrown their popularity. I have been a regular, local customer since they first opened. I was just refused service for pasta by the pound (all of 1 lb) because they are holding it for walk in customers for cooked food. It should be noted that it was 5:45pm, they had a fully stocked freezer and they were not busy. I had cash in hand and was refused service because their ego has outgrown their loyal, local customer base. I suppose it was only a matter of time. Such a shame I need to find a new place for fresh food.
author: rob h.

description: Delicious! I got the meat ravioli and my husband got the gnocchi we didn't leave a bite left! Was wonderful! We stopped in after our tour of Alcatraz it was well worth the 16 min walk on foot!
author: Cassie M.

description: Absolutely perfect gnocchi, cute little shop, and great customer service! The guys working by the counter were really friendly, and seemed to be having a great time at work, joking around and dancing to the radio while they prepared the food. A great atmosphere for a delicious meal.
author: Emily L.

description:
WONDERFUL! Beyond amazing. Very traditional the staff all speaks Italian. The meat ravioli and pappardelle with meatballs were exceptional. 

Cute atmosphere- if we lived here this would surely be a staple in our weekly meals.

The name on yelp is a bit confusing it's actually The Italian Homemade Company (not Chinese)
author: Mindy L.

description: This place is definitely worth the stop if you're in the mood for great Italian food. Super friendly staff and fresh pasta made in house rounds out a quick, reasonably priced meal in North Beach. We visited both nights while visiting the city and both times really enjoyed taking our meal to go so we could sit on our patio
author: Lauren B.

description: The food was very good. Incredibly fresh. We relied on the chef to pick out our meals and we weren't disappointed.
author: Bob S.

description: Very nice place. The lasagna was one of the best I have ever had. Quick service and attitudes by the staff. Would highly recommend a visit to this place.
author: Corey R.

description: No fancy tablecloths here but really awesome meatballs the size of a tennis ball! The red sauce is succulent & works perfectly with the homemade pappardelle pasta & meats. Outstanding value for it's deli prices!
author: devorah h.

description: Such a lovely place to visit for a quick bite and authentic Italian food. I've had the pasta as well as the sandwiches and they are fresh and delicious. Great place for both dinner and lunch.
author: Laura C.

description: The lasagna is really really good. A little bit pricey considering that there is no place to sit.
author: Pal T.

description: Very authentic Italian food. Not a wide selection on the menu but definitely good food l.
author: Kimmy S.

description: I love this place and the people working there. I real  taste of Italy in San Francisco.
author: Fabio P.

description: Great home made pasta for a reasonable price. The bolognese  fettuccine with meat balls was really good. The pasta was a little bit too al dente. The seating/tables/decor could be a little bit more comfortable.
author: Chris S.

description: We're tourists from out of town, and this place did not disappoint. Superb handmade pasta. The lasagna was perfect!!!
author: Phuong L.

description: A really nice Italian restaurant!  I had the meat lasagna and the flavors were excellent.  The sauce was very enjoyable, and the portions were plentiful.  Overall, the prices are quite reasonable.  My girlfriend enjoyed the gnocchi roles and she enjoyed those very much.  It was some of the best gnocchi we've had.
author: David B.

description: We walked by here and decided it would be a nice place to try. We ordered our food and loved it. The quality was amazing. We ordered pasta and salad, and both were delicious. The staff was very friendly. Definitely recommend.
author: Sonja T.

description: I honestly debated giving this place even two stars. I'm at a complete loss to understand all of the positive reviews on Yelp!....the short of it is me and my girlfriend waited 40 minutes to be served simply decent pasta on paper plates and were charged $15 for a very modest portion of pasta and meat sauce. The food was slightly better than good, but the wait and prices are ridiculous for a take out place.
author: Brian K.

description: I had the pappardelle with bolognese sauce and meatballs. This is the best sauce I've ever had and the pasta was homemade and equally fabulous. Wish I was staying longer so I could go back.
author: Susan S.

description: As though I stepped into the old world for a meal, this place is a true diamond in the rough. I found it via taste bud tours and had to immediately revisit it after the tour to order more to bring home. There truly aren't enough master chefs like this around anymore.
author: Geoffrey G.

description: Huz needed some Italian food tonight so checked Yelp and then headed over to Italian Homemade. Unpretentious, casual, happy service place with food that brought tears to the eyes of the Huz. Afterwards, he talked to the cooks and the owner taking orders to tell them that his granny was from Parma and he hadn't had food like that since she made it for him (God rest her soul). Turns out that the cooks are also from Parma! Just now, when I pulled up the restaurant to write this review, I discovered there's a second new one on Union St. I was so excited that I woke the Huz up to tell him. He went back to sleep with a huge smile on his face.
author: Cydney B.

description: Authentic Italian food and attentive staff with a more local crowd. Had a small delay in getting one of the orders, but the staff was very apologetic so we didn't mind. It's a fun, casual place to grab some great Italian. Highly recommend the lasagne and ravioli, but everything was wonderful!
author: Elyse R.

description: The lasagna was average but the homemade fettuccine with the meatballs was very good.
author: Laura H.

description: I ordered the fettuccine with pesto sauce. I wanted to add a meatball, but they were out. My dish was delicious! My dining companion ordered the tagliatelle with meatball sauce and I tried a bite--also delicious! I do wish they had wine to serve and better tables (stools don't offer a place to put your coat or purse). The tall young man, who seemed like a bus boy, was very attentive: he checked on us a few times and when he saw me get a plastic spoon he got us 2 metal spoons instead. Upgrade!
author: Lydia S.

description: The food is so good that I've been there twice in three days! My homesickness for Italy has just become a little easier to bear now that I've discovered The Italian Homemade Company. The gnocchi rolls are amazing! The cassoni are so good you want to keep coming back to try them all. The freshly made pastas and sauces remind me of the pastifici artigianali you find in Italy, where everything is made fresh daily by hand. The friendly and charming people who work there are all Italian, from Rimini and Parma, and it's the kind of neighborhood place where they get to know your name. I wish them much success with this wonderful little deli! It's the best new place to open in San Francisco in years!
author: Gina B.

description: It's a warm and cute place for lunch in North Beach. The servers and staff were dressed up for Christmas. I don't like overpaying for pasta but these were perfect portions for one person and you could get a couple to share with friends easily. Get here before 11:45am to avoid the lunch rush and to grab a seat. I would not re order the gnocchi roll again but it was nice trying it out.
author: Nancy Y.

description: Had the speck sandwich and the meatball casone and they were the best sandwiches ever!  Can't wait to go back and try the pasta.
author: Sara B.

description: We returned on a Thursday evening for dinner and were happy to see that the restaurant was doing well. We are vegetarians and got the tagliatelli with mushrooms sauteed in olive oil, spinach ravioli stuffed with ricotta in a marinara sauce and the feuttucine with pesto sauce. All pastas were made in house and were fresh, cooked al dente to perfection. We enjoyed the tagliatelli the most -- the definition of comfort food and fantastic tasting. The ravioli was nice and the marinara, while simple, was delicious. The pesto was not as bold in flavor as pestos we like in the city (like the arugula pesto at flour + water, etc) and we would probably skip this for a different one next time. Happy to see this place continuing to serve the best pasta in north beach.
author: T K.

description: A friend of mine just introduced me to this place, and I was blown away by the pasta -- all freshly made and at a reasonable price.  It's not fancy - everything is served on paper plates - you order at the counter and then (hopefully) find a table and they bring it to you (they also do a lot of carry out).  It's how I imagine things would taste at a high quality casual restaurant in Rome.  Everyone in the kitchen seemed to be young Italian cooks, and they clearly took pride in what they were serving.  Great stuff - I'll be back.
author: Ed K.

description: THE best Italian food I've had yet . This place is so amazing all around . The staff the atmosphere and of course the food ! The pesto sauce is to DIE for . Reminds me of the pesto sauce my Italian grandparents used to make . So authentic ! Will definitely be back!!
author: El B.

description: Don't be deceived by the appearance.  This place is inconspicuous, but you must go! The food is delicious! Simple, homemade, fresh ingredients at afford prices.  The gnocchi with marinara was executed perfectly.  My husband said his sandwich was one of the best he's ever had.  The staff was extremely kind. I'd love to return!
author: L R.

description: I always get their lasagna and with extra meatball. The spaghetti sauce is extra creamy and thick. And the flavor is just amazing.
author: Krystal S.

description: First they were great 5-star - the pasticiata was the best, but I dunno if it's there new location on Union taking staff away or what, but they've fallen off their horse a little...
author: Harry K.

description:
This is hands down one of the best restaurants I've ever been to. The service is excellent, the atmosphere inspiring, and the food unbelievingly delicious.

I stumbled upon this place with some friends with wandering San Francisco and was immediately hit with the charm and warmth of this place. We were welcomed warmly and choose our dishes. The employees' Italian accents were charming and it was easy to tell it was authentic from their conversations among themselves while cooking. Apparently that night they had a big take-out order so they apologized for "making us wait." In reality, the wait was less than most other restaurants I've been too (and the food was made totally fresh because we could see them cook it in front of us). The ambience is charming and the music great. When we got our food, we were all incredibly impressed. It was simple, but delicious and I could taste every scrumptiously fresh ingredient. When one of the cooks came to check on us, he noticed that my girlfriend had not eaten the bread on her sandwich. When he learned that she couldn't eat gluten, he immediately volunteered to make a batch of special gluten-free pasta that they had just made fresh the past week FOR FREE. He was incredibly sweet and just wanted to make everyone happy regardless of the extra work or cost for the restaurant. 

Overall, this was an incredible experience. We even came back the next day for lunch and it was just as good. Overwhelming recommend this gem. Don't miss it or you'll be missing one of the most extraordinary culinary secrets of San Francisco.
author: Ethan M.

description: Super casual (paper plates) delicious food.  Loved the lasagna served by attractive, friendly, helpful staff.  Pasta dishes looked amazing, too.  They do a lot of take out orders, and I would be a regular if I lived nearby.
author: S B.

description: Best pasta I've had in San Francisco. This place is authentic, delicious, and reasonably priced. It's more of a casual cafe/deli, so don't go here if you're looking for a drawn-out fine dining experience. The menu items are simple and wholesome, and prepared so well--that's what really makes this place stand out. They're not dousing anything in truffle oil or garlic like so many places in North Beach. I've tried just about everything on their menu now, and my favorite regular menu items are definitely the homemade gnocchi, ravioli, meatballs, and spinach/potato cassoni. The specials have been incredible too, and take advantage of seasonal ingredients. They have a nice little selection of Italian grocery items and cured meats as well. The owners/staff I've talked to are so kind and interesting--they recently moved from Italy and are always eager to share more information about their food and their city (Rimini). A delightful and delicious addition to North Beach!
author: Alison S.

description: Pasta is well made.  It is slightly on the expensive side,  but the pasta is fresh.  The sauces are well made.  We tried the pesto, bolognese, and lasagna.  Pesto and bolognese was on the lighter side.  Lasagna was to die for!!  We will definitely come back again.
author: Hanwook K.

description: we had a taste for italian and we are glad we came here. it's a small place and has limited seating but the food is awesome. we tried 4 different dishes and all were excellent. The place is not expensive either. if you are in the mood for italian in a casual place definitely vome here.
author: Perry S.

description: The first thing you'll notice about this cute little mom & pop shop is the hunger inducing smells wafting through the door. Once you approach the front door your nose will immediately draw you inside. Upon walking inside I heard customers and employees alike speaking Italian, for a moment I forgot I was in San Francisco. There were plenty of delicious menu options, but I tried the special tagliatelle with mushrooms & cream sauce covered with cheese and it was divine. The pasta is fresh and cooked al dente. My dad had the meatball cassoni which was also delicious. Easily my favorite food in this city.
author: Colleen C.

description: Some of the best, authentic Italian food in North Beach. Nothing fancy with a menu mostly consisting of homemade pasta dishes. My two favorites are the gnocchi roll and the pappardelle with bolognese but you really can't go wrong here. Not a large seating area and I'd recommend this place for lunch or a casual dinner. I've eaten my fair share of italian food in the north end in boston and now SF and their pasta dishes rank close to the top of my favorites.
author: John R.

description: I had the gnocchi roll covered with bolognese sauce and loved it. I finished it off with a delicious tiramisu and I was stuffed. I actually ate here two nights  in a row and enjoyed both times equally as much. The was quite impressive as well. She actually remembered what I ordered the previous night. She said it was just because it was a slow night, I think it is because I am such a handsome fellow from Wisconsin haha. Great food and great service. I will have another Gnocchi roll before I leave town.
author: Chad T.

description: I don't know how this place got 4.5 stars, but if you like gourmet delicious Italian food and just a pile if pasta with canned sour tomato sauce on a paper plate- do not waste your appetite, time and money.Sorry Italian Homemade Company.
author: Anulya S.

description: I had some pasta with bolegnese sauce and meatballs. Those meatballs were the best I've had, not that I've had a lot. The pasta and sauce were above average too. It took a little while to get your food but it was worth the wait. The pasta by itself is a little expensive, $11-$14 a pound fresh. The plates ran about $15 with tip. Its not too bad but it is just a deli. I dont like paying restaurant prices for a deli.
author: Eden R.

description: I'll never forget my lunch!!! Omg I love their pasta... I wish we had a place like this in Miami! :( I felt like eating in a fast food place but ate like a princess... The price is very reasonable too. Don't miss this place if you want to try Italian food.
author: karin c.

description: Amazing service and great food at an affordable price.  I had the ravioli with marinara sauce, and my boyfriend had the tagliatelle bolognese.  All was top notch....highly recommended.
author: Crystal T.

description: Love! We had some amazing spinach ravioli and meatballs for an easy, delicious dinner at home. Not only was it amazing homemade Italian food, but the store is owned by two of the nicest business owners you will ever meet. It felt great to support a locally owned business in San Francisco that is creating a great product.
author: Doug B.

description: So fresh and the flatbread sandwiches are fantastic.  Awesome addition to NB!
author: J P.

description: I was right!   I was supposed to be born in Italy!   This food just tastes so right and is so yummy!  This place is soooooo good!   When I come here it reminds me of Italy!   I wish I could come every day.  The pasta is fresh made in the back and just so delicious!  I love that this is more like a mom and pop place, but also that you can feel the love and passion that goes into the food.   The owners are a newlywed Italian couple who are very friendly and everything is so delicious.   So far I've had the Piadine yesterday and liked it so much I returned today to have a cassone.  My husband is having the Ravioli with bolognese tonight and had parpadelle with pesto yesterday.   I'm so excited because everything tastes sooooo good!  The owners even come out and check how you are doing and gave my husband more meatballs too.   So happy to have found this place!
author: Lily L.

description: new place in the neighborhood.  group of 3 authentic italians (1 guy and a couple) and a bunch of tasty italian freshness!  personally i like the piadina and the meatballs.  they're brining in some change in how north beach looks at italian and i love it!  they also have some interesting italian import groceries; i'm a fan of anchovies.  ;-)
author: May W.

description: Very friendly environment. Large portion sizes, was a great value. Gnocchi with bolognese was outstanding.
author: David D.

description: Very good restaurant!! We had cazzone, piadina and pastas; all of them were great! Good ingredients!
author: Emilia S.

description: Good place to get pastas and such for a casual lunch. The parpadelle with marinara sauce was very good. Also ordered a side of meatballs that were cold and not very good. Tagliatelle with bolognese sauec was okay.
author: A A.

description: Found this restaurant one day while in the city and tried it out.  Best thing I ever did!  Best pasta and sauce I had ever had!  We had the lasagna and raviolis!  Everything is so fresh and homemade!   It's a small place but they do have outside seating also!
author: Sue P.

description: Had lunch here. Everything was delicious. Burata salad, pesto pasta and ravioli were all great. Our kids loved the gnocchi also. All fresh and homemade, you  can tell the high quality. Gotta go back!
author: V D.

description: Just discovered this place today and extremely pleased that there is real authentic Italian food available here and not just the typical touristy mumbo jumbo. After living in Italy for a year I feel it's safe to say this is the real deal, made from scratch and delicious!
author: Rachel W.

description: loved their lasagna! good customer service.  definitely would go back when am in the area
author: Reyna B.

description: I've lived in North Beach over 20 years and this is the place that's been missing. Excellent, authentic, Italian food in a casual grab & go kind of format. I could eat here every day. A great addition to the neighborhood, instant classic.
author: T B.

description: Yea sure this place has that contrived Italian mom and pop local shop look and feel but that doesn't sway my opinion on the food. I ordered the fettachinni with pasta sauce and I felt the sauce was too salty and the pasta portions a bit skimpy. I also deducted points for the overly generous ratings all the family members and friends gave this place. No way is this a 5 star rated restaurant (5 star rating at the time if my review).  They also kept their silverware next to the ordering line where people are sneezing waiting to order their food. The kicker was seeing mama mia coming out if the kitchen with the canned 'al denti' tomatoes. Yea and this restaurant is called 'homemade', sure. Sorry no sympathy points for coming from Italy and opening a restaurant in America. Should have brought your 'A' game.
author: Moe H.

description: This gourmet deli opened finally last week. I had been waiting all summer and I remained patient. Since they have been open, I have tried everything: piadina, cassoni, lasagne, the stuffed veggies, but today was Meatball Tuesday...and I have to say their meatballs are hella good, like HELLA good! They make a sauce with peas and I never thought I liked peas until now. I had a gang of meatballs, sauce and piadina flat bread for 5 bucks. I felt like it was too good to be true. All of their ingredients and prepared food is overwhelmingly fresh. Do yourself a huge favor and enjoy their awesome food. This joint will get hipper by the day, so if you want to impress your friends, family and palate...get it while it's hottt! The lasagne is better than my mom's!!!*****
author: Paul S.

description: Friendly staff and wonderful food!  They have an Italian sandwich I'd never heard of (cassone), and it was awesome.
author: Joseph H.

description: Hearty Italian pasta dishes at a reasonable price.  Very informal, great service with fresh pasta dishes that as good as what you would get at most upscale restaurants.  I will try the lasagna next time.
author: Charles S.

description: My first and last visit there. The food was terrible. I ordered their prosciutto sandwich and it was too salty (and I talk salt on everything). My husband ordered the ravioli and it was bland. My kids ordered the cheese calzone and they didn't like it. I read all the great yelp reviews and thought the food was going to be really good and authentic but I don't know what they're talking about. The service was not the best either. While trying to order our food, the wife kept interrupting and talking to her husband (in Italian). He apologized but she continued to interrupt.
author: Maria S.

description: If you like authentic pasta, you're gonna love this. Great food, great hosts, great atmosphere.
author: Celine M.

description: I didn't like this place too much the first time but went back twice more and it has grown on me. It is good with the potential to be much more. Food is fast and fresh, staff friendly, and pasta was tasty. On the other hand I could do w/o the paper plates and I though portions just a bit small. But I would go back and as I said I can see it has the potential to he a hit.
author: Bill B.

description: Second time here in a week, had my first ever cossone  and couldn't stop thinking about it!  Lasagna was one of the best I've ever had, with perfectly textured pasta and well-balanced sauce.  Helpful people here as well, great service.  Easily my new go-to place for homemade pasta.
author: C Y.

description: OMG the pasta is awesome!!!! Also the price is really good for what you get! The pasta with pesto was my favorite!!! Also the owner is really friendly!
author: Meike W.

description: Food was delicious! I'd recommend the red sauce but any of them are tasty. So glad we tried it and it was well worth the wait.
author: Osvaldo G.

description: Had dinner in non-rush-hours. Enjoy every bite. Don't forget to have a piece of Tiramisu.
author: Kaiqing Y.

description: This place is awesome! A very welcome addition to North Beach. Must try the meatballs.
author: Laura G.

description: Great service. Great food. I had the Gnocchi Ripieni, which was delicious. I'm not Italian so I can't say whether it's authentic or not, but the Italians can.
author: Aaron H.

description: Gnocchi rolls were gooood. Lasagna and meatballs also good. Wish I could come here every day with a bottle of wine and just pass out in the park nearby. Looking forward to trying the sausage and peppers next time.
author: Michael B.

description: So far I have only bought the delicious, authentic ricchiarelli from them and their amazing homemade pasta. When I bought the pasta, the awesome lady (I think she's a co-owner) had a very serious discussion with me about the appropriate sauce for the pasta-- I appreciate a woman that takes her sauce seriously! Will be back to try their premade foods-- they smell amazing!
author: Katie N.

description: The best italian food I've ever had. Best lasagna I've ever had. Wonderful service too.
author: Leslie R.

description: Amazing!  So nice to have such good fresh food so close to home. The Meat lasagna was fantastic and very reasonably priced. I can't wait to go back for the meatballs and whatever else is fresh that day.  I wish these guys the best, they were so nice!!
author: derek t.

description: i bought the homemade pasta and the red sauce with meatballs and the tomato halves with breadcrumbs----all were delicious!!  I will definitely be a regular customer based on my purchases today!  Also, the couple are SO nice!!!  Just what the neighborhood needs!!
author: Pamela H.
